A man who speaks blasphemously of Saint Mary has his arms and legs cut off.

The inhabitants of Damot who would not observe the feast days of Saint Mary are punished by a storm that brings down a mighty tree.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
The Ethiopian pilgrim who was expelled from the Church (of the Resurrection) in Jerusalem during the Easter services.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The inhabitants of Damot who would not observe the feast days of Saint Mary are punished by a storm that brings down a mighty tree.
The European who tried to steal the icon of Saint Mary from Däbrä Sedeneya.
The girl who was going to be stoned after she was caught committing fornication.
The monastic community that was supplied with provisions by Saint Mary.
A hermit in Jerusalem is saved from the temptations of Satan.
The story of Pifamon, the martyr from Awsim.
The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
The Dormition and Transitus of Saint Mary.
The Annunciation.
Saint Mary is found to be pregnant.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The shepherds and the magi come to worship Christ.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The arrival of the Holy Family in Sāmǝnon.
Holy Family journey cycle: The king of Egypt asks Saint Mary to bless his land.
The dissolute youth from Ethiopia who was about to be killed by the magistrate.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወሬዛ፡ በሀገረ፡ ኢትዮጵያ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ወዐማፂ፡ በኵሉ፡ ፍናዊሁ፡ ወያምዕዖ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ አምላኩ። ወመጽአ፡ እምቤተ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወሖረ፡ ብሔረ፡ ባዕድ

Canonical Story Title: The ruined church of Saint Mary that was rebuilt.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘምዝብርት፡ ወይእቲሰ፡ ረዳኢቶሙ፡ ለእለ፡ ይትአምኑ፡ ኪያሃ፡ ወይገይሱ፡ ኀቤሃ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary asks bread from a poor widow during the flight from Herod.
The monastery near Alexandria whose trees were cut down by Jews.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ደብር፡ በሀገረ፡ እስክንድርያ፡ ዓይነ፡ ማይ፡ ዘይሰቅያ፡ ወአድባራት፡ ወዓውድዋ፡ አትክልታ፡ ወዘርኣ፡ ወአዕዋሚሃ

Canonical Story Title: The story of King Tarses of Fars, who loved to kill Christians.
Sabela, a nun of Caesarea, who had a vision of Saint Mary while sleeping.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ መበለት፡ በደወለ፡ ቂሳርያ፡ ዘስማ፡ ሳቤላ፡ ዘትፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወትገብር፡ በዓላ፡ ለለወርኁ፡ ወትሁብ፡ ጸሪቀ፡ እምዘባ

Canonical Story Title: The Jew from Rome who wanted to kill Christians, but was seized by the priests of the church of Saint Mary.
The bread and wine that came down from Heaven to Abbot Gabriel during Mass in the church of Saint Mary in Rome.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮም፡ ዘሕንጽት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይገብሩ፡ ባቲ፡ በዓለ፡ አስተርአዮ፡ ወይትጋብኡ፡ አሜሃ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ወኤጲስ፡ ቆጶሳት፡ ቀሳውስት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ ምስለ፡ ማዕጠንቶሙ፡ ወይመጽኡ፡ ኀበ፡ ይእቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ከመ፡ ይንሥኡ፡ ጸጋሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ለርእሶሙ፡ በዕለተ፡ በዓላ። ወበአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ጊዜ፡ ሀለዉ፡ በቅዳሴ፡ ርእየ፡ አባ፡ ገብርኤል፡ እንዘ፡ ይወርድ፡ እምሰማይ፡ ኅብስት፡ ምስለ፡ ደም

Canonical Story Title: Bishop Deraleyos in Däbrä Gass, who was a lazy monk.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ በደብረ፡ ገጽ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ድራልዮስ፡ ሐካይ፡ መነኮስ፡ ወኢይአምር፡ ዘምሮ፡ ዳዊት፡ ወአንብቦ፡ መጻሕፍት

Canonical Story Title: The European Archbishop Thaddeus, whom Saint Mary assisted at Mass.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ጳጳስ፡ በሀገረ፡ አፍርንጊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ታዴዎስ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ልቡ። ወበአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ እንዘ፡ ሀለወ፡ በተክህኖ፡ ወይቄድስ፡ ቅዳሴሃ፡ ለእመ፡ ብርሃን፡ አውረደት፡ ሎቱ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ኅብስተ፡ እምሰማይ፡ ወተራድአቶ

Canonical Story Title: The monk, Abiathar, in Nubia, who was led to repentance by a vision of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አብያተር፡ በሀገረ፡ ኖባ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወያሤኒ፡ መቅደሳ፡ ወይኰሰትር፡ እምዓፀዳ፡ ሣዕረ፡ ወዕፀ

Canonical Story Title: Eusebius, whom Saint Mary took to Heaven.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አውሳብዮስ፡ ወአስተርአየቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወአኃዘቶ፡ እዴሁ፡ ወአግሃሠቶ፡ እምኃውዘ፡ ዓለም፡ ወወስደቶ፡ ውስተ፡ መርሶ፡ ሕይወት

Canonical Story Title: The prophet, Jonah, who came from Egypt.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ነቢይ፡ በደወለ፡ ግብጽ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮናስ፡ ዘያፈቅሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ በኵሉ፡ ሃይሉ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወየአምን፡ ከመ፡ ይርአይ፡ መዋዕሎ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወወሀቦ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ክብረ፡ ወአልበሶ፡ ልብሰ፡ ጥበብ

Canonical Story Title: Matthias, a student from Bartos in Egypt, who was beaten and imprisoned for teaching about Christ.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ረድእ፡ ዘደወለ፡ ግብጽ፡ በሀገረ፡ ባርቶስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ማትያስ፡ ወኮነ፡ ያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይሰብክ፡ ወንጌለ፡ ጸጋሁ፡ ለኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወመሀሮሙ፡ ለሰብአ፡ ባርቶስ

Canonical Story Title: Emperor Honorius, who lived like a monk.
Saint Mary appears to Abba Besoy on the day of the Assumption.
Incipit: ወበዕለተ፡ ፍልሰተ፡ ሥጋሃ፡ አመ፡ ወርኃ፡ ነሐሴ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ለአባ፡ ብሶይ፡ ወአርአየቶ፡ ምቋመ፡ መላእክት፡ ግሩማን

Canonical Story Title: How the Egyptian youth, Besoy, who had destroyed churches and killed people, repented after killing a pregnant woman.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወሬዛ፡ በደወለ፡ ግብጽ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ብሶይ፡ ዘተደመረ፡ ምስለ፡ ፈያት፡ ወነበረ፡ ብዙኃ፡ መዋዕል፡ እንዘ፡ ያማስን፡ አብያተ፡ ክርስቲያናት፡ ወይቀትል፡ ነፍሰ

Canonical Story Title: Sara from Mesot, who became insane and went about naked.
Abba Paphnutius lives in the desert for thirty-three years, being nourished with bread from Heaven.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ገዳማዊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ በብኑዳ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወነበረ፡ እንዘ፡ ይትለአካ፡ በሰጊድ፡ ወያሠምራ፡ በጾም፡ ወበጸሎት

Canonical Story Title: Arkaledes from Qawep, who vowed not to look again at a woman, when his mother came to visit him, he died before seeing her.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወሬዛ፡ በሀገረ፡ ቃውሕ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አርከሌድስ፡ ዘኮነ፡ ሠናየ፡ በብዝኃ፡ ኂሩቱ፡ ወየኃድሩ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ እሙ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ነጋድያን፡ ዘይመጽኡ፡ ወይወርዱ፡ እምኢየሩሳሌም

Canonical Story Title: The vision granted to Archbishop Bartholomew in Jerusalem.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ጳጳስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ደብረ፡ መቅደሱ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ውስተ፡ ጎልጎታዊት፡ መካን፡ ወስሙ፡ በርተሎሜዎስ፡ ውጉዕ፡ በዘይተ፡ ፍቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይትሜነይ፡ ከመ፡ ይርአይ፡ ክዋኔ፡ ፀሐይ፡ መዓልተ፡ ወሌሊተ

Canonical Story Title: Four thieves break into the church of Saint Mary and steal vestments; they are brought back by lions.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘተሐንፀት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወመጽኡ፡ ፬፡ ሰረቅት፡ ወከረዩ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያና፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወቦኡ፡ ውስተ፡ መቅደስ፡ ወደፈሩ፡ ላዕለ፡ ንዋያ፡ ወነሥኡ፡ ፬፡ ቀጠንተ፡ አልባስ፡ ለለርእሶሙ

Canonical Story Title: A dragon that had swallowed up Efrem, a monk of Däbrä Timona, is compelled to vomit him up alive ten days later.
The thirty monks of Scete whom Satan inspired to beat each other.
Incipit: ወሀለዉ፡ ፴፡ መነኮሳት፡ በገዳመ፡ አስቄጥስ፡ ጽድቆሙ፡ ብዙኅ፡ ወሃይማኖቶሙ፡ ርትዕት፡ ወይፀልዑ፡ እከያተ፡ ወያፈቅሩ፡ ሠናያተ። ወሶበ፡ ርእየ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ጸላኤ፡ ሠናያት፡ ዘንተ፡ ተቃረኖሙ፡ ወአምጽአ፡ ላዕሌሆሙ፡ ጽልዓ

Canonical Story Title: Satan takes the form of a bird to deceive two monks who had lived together in harmony for fifteen years.
Incipit: ወሀለዉ፡ ፪፡ መነኮሳት፡ በገዳመ፡ አስቄጥስ፡ መስተጋድላን፡ በጾም፡ ወበጸሎት፡ ወነበሩ፡ ፲ወ፭፡ ዓመተ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐዱ፡ ፆማዕት፡ በፍቅር፡ ወበሰላም

Canonical Story Title: The clergy wish to receive Communion on the feast of Easter from Archbishop Maximus in Jerusalem.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ጳጳስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ መክሲሞስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ማእምር፡ ወለባዊ፡ ጻድቅ፡ ወአረጋዊ። ወስዕነ፡ ቀዊመ፡ ወደክመ፡ ኃይሉ፡ ወኢክህለ፡ ቀድሶ፡ ቍርባን

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary assists Abba Daniel in the desert and gives him a lion to ride on.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮም፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዳንኤል፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወእምብዝኃ፡ አፍቅሮቱ፡ ኪያሃ፡ ወጽአ፡ ገዳመ፡ ወአኃዞ፡ ድካመ፡ ፍኖት

Canonical Story Title: The European monk, Zena Krəstos, who was a herder and whose beasts were attacked by a lion.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ በደወለ፡ አፍርንጊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዜና፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወኢየአምር፡ ካልአ፡ ጸሎተ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ሰላመ፡ መልአክ፡ ወኢያበጥል፡ ግሙራ፡ እምአፉሁ፡ ዘክሮተ፡ ስማ፡ ውእቱሰ፡ ይርኢ፡ እንስሳ፡ ደብር

Canonical Story Title: Saints Michael and Gabriel appear while Abbot Eliab is teaching his monks, who are given bread from Heaven.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ አበ፡ ምኔት፡ ዘስሙ፡ እልያብ፡ ወእንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ በገዳመ፡ አስቄጥስ፡ ተራከቦሙ፡ ለ፷፡ ገዳማውያን፡ ወተዚያነዎሙ፡ ነገረ፡ እግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary heals the wounds of Ermeyis of Sidon with a drop of her milk.
Homily of Saint John the Evangelist on the greatness of Saint Mary, which he had seen in a vision.
Incipit: ወበእንተ፡ ዕበያ፡ ወክብራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ነገረ፡ በእንቲአሃ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ፡ ነጕድጓድ፡ እንዘ፡ ይብል፡ ርኢኩ፡ ብእሲተ፡ እንተ፡ ትትዓፀፍ፡ ፀሐየ። ወእንዘ፡ ሀሎኩ፡ በደሴተ፡ ፍጥሞ፡ መጽአ፡ ላዕሌየ፡ መንፈስ፡ በዕለተ፡ እኁድ፡ ወሰማዕኩ፡ ቃለ፡ በድኅሬየ፡ ከመ፡ ቃለ፡ ቀርን

Canonical Story Title: The Christian villagers in Armenia who had to buy their water from Jews.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘሕንጽት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በሀገረ፡ አርማንያ፡ ወአልቦ፡ ማይ፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ወባሕቱ፡ ያምጽኡ፡ ማየ፡ እምርኁቅ

Canonical Story Title: Pelagia, a nun from Caesarea, whom Satan afflicted with leprosy.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ መበለት፡ በሀገረ፡ ቂሳርያ፡ ዘስማ፡ ጲላግያ፡ ዘትፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወትገብር፡ በዓላ፡ ለለ፡ ኵሉ፡ አውራኅ፡ ወታበውእ፡ ለቤተ፡ ክርስቲያና፡ ንስቲተ፡ ፀሪቀ፡ እምዘባ፡ ወጊዜ፡ መንፈቀ፡ ሌሊት፡ ትወፅእ፡ ባሕቲታ፡ ወትሰግድ፡ ፶፡ ስግደተ፡ ወ፪፻፡ ሰላመ፡ መልአክ

Canonical Story Title: Aqlemeya, a poor woman from Rome, who was tied to a tree by brigands for five days and nights.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮም፡ ዘስማ፡ አቅሌምያ፡ ወአልባቲ፡ ውሉድ፡ ወኢንዋይ፡ ወጥሪት፡ ወነዳዪት፡ ይእቲ፡ ወባሕቱ፡ ትሰፊ፡ ሙዳየ፡ ለዕጣን

Canonical Story Title: The man who suspected a former wife of having burned down his house.
The man who borrowed for a wedding a silken garment from the church of Saint Mary.
The man who out of jealousy burned down the house of a former wife who had abandoned him.
The pious monk who drowned while crossing a river on his way to a feast that was being given by a rich man in honor of the Assumption.
Saint Mary cuts short her visit to a pious monk when she hears her name invoked according to the horologium of Abba Giyorgis.
The abbot who rejected the horologium and other works of Abba Giyorgis.
Saint Alexius lives for fifteen years near a church of Saint Mary in Armenia.
The monasteries summon King (Dawit) of Ethiopia to abdicate.
The pilgrim who was journeying to Jerusalem through Hamda.
The icon of Saint Mary in a church of Alexandria that some Europeans tried to steal.
The punishment of a custodian of a church who did not obey the bishop.
The Annunciation.
Incipit: ወበአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ አመ፡ ፳ወ፱፡ ለወርኃ፡ መጋቢት፡ ዘውእቱ፡ እኁድ፡ ሰንበት፡ እንዘ፡ ትጼሊ፡ ጸሎተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. አስተርአያ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፡ በዓቢይ፡ ግርማ፡ ወዜነዋ፡ ትፍሥሕተ። ወሶበ፡ ርእየቶ፡ ደንገፀት

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family uses stones instead of a boat to cross the Nile.
The milk of Saint Mary that was poured on the ground in Egypt.
Saint Mary turns water over which her anaphora was recited by Abba Samuˀel of Wali into miraculous bread.
Saint Mary is symbolized in Scripture as a dove.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ ካዕበ፡ ኦሕዝበ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘሀለወት፡ እምቅድመ፡ ሰማያት፡ ወምድር፡ በሕሊና፡ አምላክ። ርግብ፡ ዘአምጽአት፡ ብስራተ፡ ለኖኅ

Canonical Story Title: Christ gives Saint Mary the Pact of Mercy.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ ኦሕዝበ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘከመ፡ ወሀባ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ምሕረት፡ ፍሬ፡ ማኅፀና፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ለዘይጸውዕ፡ ስማ። አመ፡ በዓታ፡ ውስተ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ሰማያዊት፡ ወርእየቶ፡ ለአብ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወለወልድ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወለመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ። ወእምዝ፡ አርአያ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ምስጢራተ፡ ኅቡዐቲሁ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Abuna Madganina Egziˀ and Abba Samuˀel of Wali.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ወዜነወቶ፡ ምስጢረ፡ መንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ለአቡነ፡ መድኃኒነ፡ እግዚእ፡ ምስለ፡ ወልዱ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘዋሊ፡ እንዘ፡ ይትናገሩ፡ ዕበያቲሁ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወባሕረ፡ ንጽሕናሃ፡ ለንጽሐተ፡ ንጹሓን፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወበእንተ፡ አፍቀሩ፡ ኪያሃ፡ መጽአት፡ ኀቤሆሙ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፡ ወትቤሎሙ፡ መንክራ፡ መዓዛ፡ አፉሃ፡ ሰላም፡ ለክሙ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Abba Samuˀel of Wali and promises blessings to those who drink the water over which they read her anaphora.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ስምዑ፡ ዘገብረት፡ ሎቱ፡ ለሳሙኤል፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወበተፍጻሚተ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ እንዘ፡ ያነብብ፡ ወትረ፡ ጸሎተ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ዲበ፡ ማይ፡ ወበላዕሌሁ፡ ያነብብ፡ ቅዳሴሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በእንተ፡ ፍቅረ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ወእምድኅረ፡ ፈጸመ፡ ይሰቲ፡ እምውእቱ፡ ማይ፡ ወይሁቦሙ፡ ለደቂቁ፡ ወይብሎሙ፡ ዑቁ፡ ወኢትክዓው፡ ዘንተ፡ ማየ፡ ውስተ፡ ምድር

Canonical Story Title: The cross at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam that used to bless when the priest saying Mass blessed.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ መስቀል፡ ውስተ፡ ደብረ፡ ቍስቋም፡ ዘስቁል፡ ውስተ፡ ቀመረ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወሶበ፡ ይቄድስ፡ ቍርባነ፡ ለእመ፡ ኮነ፡ ካህነ፡ ንጹሐ፡ ሶበ፡ ይብል፡ ፈኑ፡ ጸጋ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ላዕሌነ፡ ይባርክ፡ ውእቱ፡ መስቀል፡ ላዕለ፡ ኅብስት፡ በከመ፡ ልማድ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary brings gifts to Abba Samuˀel of Wali.
The Jewish magistrate who believed in Christ when he saw Saint Mary's miracles.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ ዘፈነውዎ፡ ረባናተ፡ አይሁድ፡ ወሊቃናተ፡ ካህናት፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወሖረ፡ ምስለ፡ ወዓልያኒሁ

Canonical Story Title: Saints Mary and Gabriel visit an Ethiopian named Gabra Maryam and heal him.
The Transitus of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ናሁ፡ እዜንወክሙ፡ ዕበያ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እምአመ፡ ዕረፍታ፡ እስከ፡ ፍልሰተ፡ ሥጋሃ፡ በ፪፻ወ፮፡ ዕለታት፡ ወረደ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወተክህነ፡ ላዕለ፡ በድና፡ ለእሙ፡ ወኢኀደጋ፡ ትኑም፡ ከመ፡ ባዕዳን፡ ሰብእ

Canonical Story Title: The Jewish magistrate who believed in Christ when he saw Saint Mary's miracles.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ ዘፈነውዎ፡ ረባናተ፡ አይሁድ፡ ወሊቃናተ፡ ካህናት፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወሖረ፡ ምስለ፡ ወዓልያኒሁ

Canonical Story Title: The Egyptian woman who lost a silver plate while bathing in a miraculous spring.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በብሔረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ወበአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ እምበዐላተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ሖረት፡ ኀበ፡ ነቅዐ፡ ማይ፡ ዘይሰቅዩ፡ እምኔሁ፡ በለሳነ፡ ወተጠምቀት፡ ወተሐጽበት፡ ምስለ፡ ደቂቃ

Canonical Story Title: The story of Awr, the son of the princess and the magician, Abrasit.
Paraleya from Iyyoram, who was beaten by her husband because she was childless.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በሀገረ፡ ኢዮራም፡ ዘስማ፡ ጰራልያ፡ ብእሲተ፡ ዓሣ፡ መርዐተ፡ ኢዩ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ወነበረት፡ በትካዝ፡ እንዘ፡ የሐምም፡ ልባ፡ በእንተ፡ ዘአልባ፡ ውሉደ

Canonical Story Title: The dogs of the hunter praise Saint Mary.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob is given a sign of Badlay's fall.
Saint Mary appears to the gabaz of her church in Waybela and tells him about the fall of Badlay.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ኮነ፡ በውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ይጸንሕ፡ ፍኖተ፡ ወያፈርህ፡ ለኵሉ፡ ለእለ፡ የሐውሩ፡ በፍኖት

Canonical Story Title: The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዐቢይ፡ ወክቡር፡ ፈድፋደ፡ ወኀያል፡ በግርማሁ፡ ወነግሠ፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵሉ፡ ምድር፡ ወተቀንዩ፡ ሎቱ፡ ኵሉ፡ ሰብእ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መስተጽዕነ፡ ፈረስ፡ ኃጥእ፡ በኵሉ፡ ፍናዊሁ፡ ዓለማዊት፡ ወባሕቱ፡ በጸጋ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወበስእለታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. መርሐቶ፡ ኀበ፡ መድኀኒተ፡ ነፍሱ

Canonical Story Title: The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ውኁደ፡ ሠናያት፡ ዘኢየአምሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወኢያስተሰሪ፡ በእንተ፡ ኀጢአቱ

Canonical Story Title: The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ኄር፡ በኵሉ፡ ግብሩ፡ ወኢያደሉ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ ሢመቱ

Canonical Story Title: The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ግብር፡ ሠናይ፡ ግዕዙ፡ ወመሥመሬ፡ አኃው፡ ውእቱ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ረከቦ፡ ድቀተ፡ ሥጋ፡ ዘአምጽአ፡ ሎቱ፡ ጸላኢ፡ ርእዮ፡ ትግሀታቲሁ

Canonical Story Title: The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The knight who wanted to seduce the daughter of the cobbler.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
Incipit: ይቤ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ ብሎስ፡ ሕፃን፡ እምውስተ፡ አይሁድ፡ እንዘ፡ ይትናገር፡ ምስለ፡ ውሉደ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወኀበ፡ አሐዱ፡ መምህር

Canonical Story Title: The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ባሕር፡ ዘታዐዱ፡ ኵሎ፡ ዓለመ፡ ወበውስተ፡ ጽንፈ፡ ለይእቲ፡ ባሕር፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ሕንጽት፡ በስመ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ሊቀ፡ መላእክት

Canonical Story Title: The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
Incipit: ወኮነት፡ እንከ፡ ብእሲት፡ ነዳይት፡ ወባቲ፡ አሐደ፡ ወልደ፡ ወኮነት፡ ይእቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ትበውእ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወትበውእ፡ ኀበ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም

Canonical Story Title: The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ደብር፡ ዘመነኮሳት፡ ኀበ፡ ጽንፈ፡ ባሕር፡ ወሀሎ፡ ውስቴቱ፡ አሐዱ፡ እኅው፡ ዘመንኰሰ፡ እምንእሱ፡ ወውእቱሰ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሠናይ፡ ውእቱ

Canonical Story Title: The shepherd near the church of Saint Paul in Rome who was possessed by a demon.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ በእንተ፡ አኃው፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እንዘ፡ የሐውሩ፡ ኀበ፡ ሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ ወረከቡ፡ በህየ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ በስሙ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ ጳውሎስ፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ በስመ፡ ዚአሁ

Canonical Story Title: The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ እምሰብአ፡ አፍራስ፡ እስመ፡ ውእቱ፡ ኮነ፡ ፈረሳዊ፡ ጽኑዕ፡ በውርዙቱ፡ ወይዜሀር፡ በብዝኀ፡ ጥሪቱ። ወኮነ፡ ያፈቅራ፡ ለአሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ላሕይት፡ ዘትነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ወወሀባ፡ ንዋየ፡ ብዙኀ፡ ወኢተክህሎ፡ ከመ፡ ይትራከብ፡ ምስሌሃ

Canonical Story Title: The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The bankrupt merchant to whom Satan offered two pearls if he would deny Christ and Saint Mary.
The robber whom a bishop was commanded to bury after he was executed.
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ግብር፡ ሠናይ፡ ግዕዙ፡ ወመሥመሬ፡ አኃው፡ ውእቱ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ረከቦ፡ ድቀተ፡ ሥጋ፡ ዘአምጽአ፡ ሎቱ፡ ጸላኢ፡ ርእዮ፡ ትግሀታቲሁ

Canonical Story Title: The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The healing of the Egyptian King Soforon (or Safron).
Saint Mary turns water over which her anaphora was recited by Abba Samuˀel of Wali into miraculous bread.
The story of Dilasor, brother of Emperor Theodosius, who was Abba Kiros.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ እኅወ፡ ቴዎዶስዮስ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዲላሶር፡ ወአስተርአዮ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘለዘክሮቱ፡ ይደሉ፡ ስግደት፡ ወለጣዕመ፡ ስሙ፡ አኰቴት፡ ሌሊተ፡ በሕልም፡ ወይቤሎ፡ ሑር፡ ውስተ፡ ደብረ፡ ባሳን

Canonical Story Title: Christ orders Abba Samu'el of Wali to celebrate Mass for the feast of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘገዳመ፡ ዋሊ፡ ወመጽአ፡ ኀቤሁ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ በዐቢይ፡ ስብሐት፡ ወይቤሎ፡ ሰላም፡ ለከ፡ ኦኅሩይየ፡ ሳሙኤል

Canonical Story Title: Abba Samuˀel of Wali is lifted up while reciting the Wəddase Maryam.
Incipit: ወእንዘ፡ ይጼሊ፡ ካዕበ፡ ዝንቱ፡ አቡነ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ወወጠነ፡ አንብቦ፡ ውዳሴሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወአንቀልቀለ፡ ምድር፡ እምመሰረቱ፡ ወይነብር፡ ውስቴቱ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ወተለዓለ፡ እምምድር፡ መጠነ፡ እመት

Canonical Story Title: The priest from Nārdin who was accused because he kept a nun in his house.
The wife of a pagan official who wished to pray at the Holy Sepulcher is prevented until she is baptized.
The abbot who did not allow the Miracles of Mary to be read in his monastery.
Emperor Honorius, who lived like a monk.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ንጉሥ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮም፡ ዘስሙ፡ አኖሬዎስ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ፈድፋደ። ወነበረ፡ አኖሬዎስ፡ በመንግሥቱ፡ እንዘ፡ ይኰንን፡ በጽድቅ፡ ሠራዊቱ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Conception of cycle: The conception and nativity of Saint Mary.
Mary, Conception of cycle: The conception and nativity of Saint Mary.
Mary, Childhood of cycle: When she is three years old, Saint Mary is taken to the Temple.
Oz, the Byzantine monk, is shown a vision of Hell by Saint Urael.
Mary, Engagement of cycle: Saint Mary is espoused to Saint Joseph.
A hermit in Jerusalem is saved from the temptations of Satan.
Salome's hands are burned when she tries to verify Saint Mary's virginity, but they are healed when she takes the Christ Child into her arms.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family returns from Egypt.
The Jews plot to burn the body of Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: When Tafoneya lays hands on the bier of Saint Mary, an angel cuts his arms off.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays to be taken from this life.
The Apostles gather for the funeral of Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees Christ kissing Saint Mary's burial cloth.
Holy Family journey cycle: The rich Egyptian woman who refused to give water to the Holy Family.
A monk, Abraham, drinks poisonous water while on a journey to visit the patriarch and dies, but is then raised from the dead.
The miraculous spring of Mehzab.
The apparitions of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq.
King Bartaqu of Greece, who became a monk.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ንጉሥ፡ በደወለ፡ ፅርዕ፡ ዘስሙ፡ በርጠቁ፡ ወልደ፡ ኤጴሜን፡ ኃያል፡ በመንግሥቱ፡ ወጽኑዕ፡ ከመ፡ ዓምደ፡ ሐፂን

Canonical Story Title: Abba Mardari, who overheard twelve angels talking about going to Constantinople to hear Saint John Chrysostom praise Saint Mary.
A dragon that had swallowed up Efrem, a monk of Däbrä Timona, is compelled to vomit him up alive ten days later.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ በደብረ፡ ጢሞና፡ ዘስሙ፡ ኤፍሬም፡ ዐሥጋሬ፡ ዓሣ፡ ለመነኮሳተ፡ ደብር፡ ወይገብር፡ በዓለ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ዘነሥአት፡ ኪዳነ፡ ምሕረት፡ እምኀበ፡ ወልዳ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወለለ፡ ዓመት፡ በዕለተ፡ በዓላ፡ ያጸግቦሙ፡ ለኵሎሙ፡ ሰብአ፡ ደብር

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ, together with Saint Mary and the angels, appears to the Apostles and asks them to build churches in his name and hers throughout the world.
Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon instructs his disciples on his deathbed.
Homily of Emperor Zärˀa Yaˁəqob on Saint Mary as the hope of salvation.
Incipit: ድርሳን፡ ዘደረሰ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ርቱዓ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይምሐሮ፡ በጸሎታ፡…. ይቤ፡ ከመዝ፡ ስምዑኬ፡ ኦምእምናን፡ ኦክርስቶሳውያን፡ ደቂቀ፡ ወንጌል፡ አልብነ፡ ተስፋ፡ ወኢድሂን፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ማርያም፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The story of Saint Alexius [Abdo l a-Masih], son of Emperor Theodosius.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob and the invasion of Badlay.
Saint Mary heals in Bethlehem a large multitude of sick people who had sought her in the Temple.
Incipit: ወእምዝ፡ ተጋብኡ፡ ብዙኃን፡ ሕዝብ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ፡ ወብዙኃን፡ ድውያን፡ መጽኡ፡ ወይቤሉ፡ አይቴ፡ ሀለወት፡ ቡርክት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወአውሥኡ፡ ወይቤልዎሙ፡ ኢሀለወት፡ ዝየ፡ ይእቲሰ፡ ቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ ትነብር

Canonical Story Title: The Stephanites in Egypt and Palestine.
Saint Mary heals a servant girl from a magic spell.
A dragon that had swallowed up Efrem, a monk of Däbrä Timona, is compelled to vomit him up alive ten days later.
Saint Mary asks Christ to bless those who honor her and pray for her help.
Synaxary entry for the 16th of Yakkatit: Saint Mary receives the Pact of Mercy (kidan mehret).
The three monks who attempted to say Mass in a mosque.
A Christian from Bethlehem is restored to his community after being sold into slavery by the Turks and beaten and slain by his master.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እንዘ፡ የሐውር፡ በሐመር፡ ምስለ፡ ንዋዩ፡ ወመጽኡ፡ ትርኵ፡ ወአኃዝዎ፡ ወወሰድዎ፡ ወሤጥዎ፡ ውስተ፡ ካልእ፡ ሀገር

Canonical Story Title: The king who invited Abba Abreham to come and discuss spiritual matters.
A bishop asks a man for the prayer that saved him from Satan.
The apparitions of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq (continued)
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): Satan appears to King Herod and advises him to kill the Innocents.
Incipit: ወበይእቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ሞተ፡ ስምዖን፡ ካህን፡ አረጋዊ። ወነበረ፡ ሄሮድስ፡ ፪፡ ዓመተ፡ እንዘ፡ ይጸንሖሙ፡ ለሰብአ፡ ሰገል

Canonical Story Title: Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The arrival of the Holy Family in Sāmǝnon.
Incipit: ወእምዝ፡ በጽሐ፡ ሀገረ፡ ሳምኖን፡ ውስተ፡ ቀዳሚ፡ አንቀጽ፡ ማኅፈድ፡ በ፬፡ መዓዝኒሁ፡ ወይትሌዓል፡ እምኵሉ፡ ሀገር

Canonical Story Title: Christ, Nativity of cycle: The shepherds and the magi come to worship Christ.
Holy Family journey cycle: The king of Egypt asks Saint Mary to bless his land.
When Pariqos of Fesa confesses his sins to the bishop, the latter, refusing him absolution, tells him to go to Abba Yaceqob (Santiago).
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
A Muslim herder starts to build a shrine to Saint Mary on good land; when he dies, she saves his soul from the angels of darkness.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ አረማዊ፡ ኖላዌ፡ አልሕምት፡ ወሶበ፡ ወፈረ፡ ወሖረ፡ ውስተ፡ ገዳም፡ ምስለ፡ አልሕምት፡ ወረከበ፡ ምድረ፡ ሠናየ፡ ዘያስተፌሥሕ፡ ልበ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወይቤ፡ ምስጋዶሙ፡ ለክርስቲያን፡ በውእቱ፡ መካን፡ ይሤኒ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary brings gifts to Abba Samuˀel of Wali.
A Christian retainer escapes unharmed when his king is defeated by the Muslims.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘእምወዓልያኒሁ፡ ለንጉሥ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወያነብብ፡ ውዳሴያቲሃ፡ ወዕበያቲሃ፡ ኵሎ፡ አሚረ፡ ወይትመሐፀን፡ ባቲ። ወበአሐዱ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ ሖረ፡ ምስለ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ውስተ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወውስተ፡ ብሔረ፡ አረሚ

Canonical Story Title: The woman who was crossing a river on a raft [mezlal].
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ዘታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወትትመሐፀን፡ ኀቤሃ፡ ወታነብብ፡ ሰላመ፡ መልአክ፡ ረሰያ፡ ልማዳ፡ ከመ፡ ትትባላሕ፡ እምመናግንተ፡ ሰይጣን፡ በኅቡዕ፡ ወበገሃድ

Canonical Story Title: The dogs of the hunter praise Saint Mary.
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
The church of Saint Mary that moved by itself to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea.
The pious abbot who was falsely accused by his monks of sinning with a woman.
The fisherman who was eaten up by a dragon but was found alive when the dragon's belly was cut open.
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
Saint Mary gives a thirsty dog water to drink from her shoe.
The poor man from Aragon [Spain] who was buried alive in a gold mine.
The husband who denied Christ when he became poor.
A sinner is saved from damnation because he had built a shrine in the name of Saint Mary.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: A soldier redeems the Child Jesus from another soldier who was thinking of handing him over to King Herod.
Saint Mary appears to a monk and saves him from being deceived by Satan.
The nominal Christian from Sidon who encountered a dragon.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
Alexander, a Jew from Jerusalem, is delivered three days after he was swallowed up by a dragon.
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The virgin who sinned with many lovers.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
The man who was possessed by a spirit of epilepsy [nagargar] for 47 years.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
The bankrupt merchant to whom Satan offered two pearls if he would deny Christ and Saint Mary.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The mighty Goliath threatens to destroy the monastery of Saint Mary.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
A child and his mother see the icon of Saint Mary weeping for the sins of the world.
Mary, Conception of cycle: The conception and nativity of Saint Mary.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: The birth of Saint Mary on the first of Genbot.
Incipit: ንግባእኬ፡ ሀበ፡ ጥንተ፡ ነገር። ወሶበ፡ ተፈጸመ፡ መዋዕለ፡ ፅንሳ፡ ወለደት፡ ወለተ፡ አመ፡ ፩፡ ለግንቦት፡ እንዘ፡ ትበርህ፡ እምነ፡ ፀሐይ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Childhood of cycle: Saint Mary stays in the Temple.
Saint Mary helps a poor man become wealthy.
The temptations that Akroseya, the wife of Qawestos, overcame.
Saint Mary heals the wounds of Ermeyis of Sidon with a drop of her milk.
Saint Mary prays to Christ on the 16th of Yakkatit.
Incipit: አመ፡ ፲ወ፮፡ ለወርኃ፡ የካቲት፡ እንዘ፡ ትጼሊ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ውስተ፡ መቃብረ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ መጽአ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ወይቤለ፡ ሰላም፡ ለኪ፡ ኦእምየ፡ ምንተ፡ ተኃሥሢ

Canonical Story Title: The people of Febor sacrifice pigs at the gate of their city so as to prevent the Holy Family from entering; they themselves are changed into pigs.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ ኵልክሙ፡ ፍቁራኒሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ በጊዜ፡ ልደታ። ሶበ፡ በጽሐት፡ ሀገረ፡ ፌቦር፡ ርእይዋ፡ እምርኁቅ፡ እነ፡ ትመጽእ፡ ኀቤሆሙ፡ ተባሀሉ፡ በበይናቲሆሙ፡ ዛቲኬ፡ ብእሲት፡ እንተ፡ ሰማዕነ፡ በእንቲአሃ፡ ትሤርያ፡ ለኵላ፡ ሀገር

Canonical Story Title: Emperor Zärˀa Yaˁəqob kills Badlay and dimembers his body.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ ዘገብረት፡ ሎቱ፡ ኃይለ፡ ወተአምረ፡ ለንጉሥነ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ወበጸጋ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘተሰምየ፡ ቍስጠንጢኖስ፡ ወለኵሉ፡ አበዊሁ፡ ወአኃዊሁ፡ እለ፡ ነግሡ፡ እምቅድሜሁ፡ ገብረት፡ ኃይለ፡ ተአምር፡ በእንተ፡ ኪዳና፡ ዘአልቦ፡ ኍልቍ፡ ቀተሎ፡ ለንጉሠ፡ ሰብአ፡ አደል፡ ዘስሙ፡ በድላይ

Canonical Story Title: Emperor Zärˀa Yaˁəqob writes the Book of the Miracles of Mary.
Incipit: ወእምቅድመ፡ ይሑር፡ ውስተ፡ ፀብዕ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ቅቡዕ፡ ጸሐፈ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወአዘዘ፡ ለኵሎሙ፡ ሰብአ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ያክብርዋ፡ በበዓለ፡ ኪዳና

Canonical Story Title: Emperor Zärˀa Yaˁəqob, returning victorious, builds a church in the name of Saint Mary and commands the observance of her feast.
Incipit: ወእምዝ፡ አቲዎ፡ እምፀብዕ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ በፍሥሐ፡ ወበሐሤት፡ ምስለ፡ ብዙኅ፡ ዕልገቱ፡ ወሰከ፡ አክብሮታ፡ ወአፍቅሮታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም

Canonical Story Title: Emperor Zärˀa Yaˁəqob composes chants in honor of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወበእንተዝ፡ ሰብሓ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ወአልዓላ፡ አድመፀ፡ ማኅሌተ፡ ቅኔ፡ በበዓላ

Canonical Story Title: Emperor Zärˀa Yaˁəqob establishes the cult of the Trinity throughout his empire.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ገብረት፡ ሎቱ፡ ለዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመድምመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በእንተ፡ ኪዳና፡ ዳግመ፡ በፍቅረ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ወቆመ፡ ወአቅነተቶ፡ ኃይለ፡ ከመ፡ ኢይኩን፡ ድኩመ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary helps Emperor Na'od humble the Jews.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ስምዑ፡ አኃዊነ፡ ዘኮነ፡ በመዋዕሊነ፡ ሶበ፡ አንሥኦ፡ ፀረ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ከመ፡ ይፅባዕ፡ ቅዱሳነ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary assists the emperors of Ethiopia.
Incipit: ለነገሥትኒ፡ እለ፡ ነግሡ፡ በአፍቅሮታ፡ ወጳጳሳትኒ፡ እለ፡ ሰበኩ፡ ነገረ፡ ኪዳና

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary stops a pestilence.
An unbaptized Jewess attempts to enter the house of Saint Mary, who prevents her and tells her to seek baptism.
The priest from Cyprus who brought a particle of the Eucharist to a Jew.
A child whom his mother had vowed to Saint Mary is rescued from drowning.
Saint Mary incenses Thecla (continuation).
The man who accepted fine clothes as a bribe for future favors.
A plague in a monastery is halted at the prayer of a monk.
The monk who saved the church of Saint Mary in Atrib by his prayers when its destruction had been ordered by the Caliph.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
Bishop Hildephonsus sees the icon of Saint Mary sweating; she asks him to raise a girl from the dead.
Saint Mary comes to a church in the form of a white dove to heal from smallpox a man whose only good work was celebrating her commemoration.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይገብር፡ ተዝካራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ወካልዕሰ፡ አልቦቱ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ አሚነ፡ ወልዳ። ወአሐዞ፡ ሕማመ፡ ፈጸንት፡ ለውእቱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአጽዓቆ፡ ወቀርበ፡ ለመዊት

Canonical Story Title: Sara from Mesot, who became insane and went about naked.
The three monks who attempted to say Mass in a mosque.
The woman whose baby daughter was carried off by a hyena.
A dragon that had swallowed up Efrem, a monk of Däbrä Timona, is compelled to vomit him up alive ten days later.
An official who used to rob the poor is converted when a monk reveals that Satan was acting as his counsellor.
Saint Mary helps a poor man become wealthy.
Saint Mary stops a pestilence.
An unbaptized Jewess attempts to enter the house of Saint Mary, who prevents her and tells her to seek baptism.
A thief is hanged upside down with the objects he stole from the church of Saint Mary in Sebkahad.
The Muslims who spent the night at the ruins of Däbrä Metmaq.
Incipit: ነገር፡ ዘከመ፡ ዜነወ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘተብህለት፡ ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ በደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ድኅረ፡ አንሐልዋ፡ ተንበላት፡ ለቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን። ወእንዘ፡ የሐውሩ፡ ተንበላት፡ ፱፡ ወ፪፡ ደቂቆሙ፡ ንዑሳን፡ ኀበ፡ ነጊድ፡ ወአግማለ፡ ወአዕዱገ፡ ፅዒኖሙ፡ ወበጽሑ፡ ኀበ፡ ደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ወይእቲ፡ ዕለት፡ በዓላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to return from the mountains of Lebanon to Bethlehem.
Holy Family journey cycle: An angel tells Saint Joseph to take Saint Mary and her child to Egypt.
Some officials visit the icon of Saint Mary at Däbrä Sedeneya.
Incipit: ይቤ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ተስእልክዎ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ ግብጻዊ፡ አረጋዊ፡ ፈራሃ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዜናሃ፡ ለሥዕል፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ፄዴንያ፡ ወዘከመ፡ ያስተርኢ፡ ተአምራት፡ ወመንክራት፡ እምኔሃ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይጸግወነ፡ በረካታ፡ አሜን። ወአውሥአኒ፡ ወይቤለኒ፡ ስማዕ፡ እንግርከ፡ ኦወልድየ

Canonical Story Title: Tekta, who is childless, has a dream about ten generations ending with the moon and the sun.
The European who tried to steal the icon of Saint Mary from Däbrä Sedeneya.
Christ gives Ethiopia as tithes to Saint Mary.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: The Jews plot to kill Saint Mary because of the miracles she was working while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Saint Mary leaves the Temple and enters the home of Saint Joseph.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The adoration of the shepherds and the Magi.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The Circumcision.
Holy Family journey cycle: Herod orders the slaughter of the Innocents; a hunter with his dogs finds the Holy Family in flight from the king.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family hides from thieves in a sycamore tree at Däbrä Metmaq.
Holy Family journey cycle: The rich Egyptian woman who refused to give water to the Holy Family.
Holy Family journey cycle: The people of an Egyptian town set fierce dogs on the Holy Family.
Holy Family journey cycle: The inhabitants of an Egyptian town who plot to hand Jesus over to King Herod are turned into animals.
Holy Family journey cycle: The king of Egypt asks Saint Mary to bless his land.
Incipit: ወእንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ውስተ፡ ምድረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ወሰሚዖ፡ ንጉሥ፡ እምርኁቅ፡ ዜናሃ፡ ለአከ፡ ኀቤሃ

Canonical Story Title: The wrath of Saint Mary against the prefect of a church who tried to stop the priests from making a procession while singing hymns to her.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob and the invasion of Badlay.
Abba Mardari, who overheard twelve angels talking about going to Constantinople to hear Saint John Chrysostom praise Saint Mary.
The story of Awr, the son of the princess and the magician, Abrasit.
Saint Mary cures the son of a Roman official in Bethlehem.
Saint Mary heals a woman possessed by evil spirits.
An Egyptian woman comes to Saint Mary in Bethlehem and is healed of her fever.
A woman whose right eye had been blinded by a demon is healed by Saint Mary.
Saint Mary appears to Timothy, Patriarch of Alexandria, in the church of Saint Pachomius in Alexandria.
Saint Mary appears to Anthony, a monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The life of Saint Mary to the birth of Christ.
Abba Behor has a vision of Saint Mary.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family returns from Egypt.
The monks of Däbrä Qaləmon who were despoiled by Berbers.
ʾƎmma Yoḥannǝs and the Ethiopian monk who was on pilgrimage to Jerusalem.
The conversion of the Muslim, Rewh, who is renamed Entons Haddis.
Saint Mary blesses Scete, which Saint Macarius chooses for his monastery.
Saint Mary appears to Yohannes Kama.
An Arab steals the scissors of the tailor of Däbrä Qaləmon.
The European who wanted to steal the bars of the door to the Manger at Bethlehem.
Nəkʷal, the deacon from Margawkim, who spent his master’s money on the poor.
The Frenchman whose wife was unable to have children.
The woman from Cairo who lived by the river and whose daughter became blind.
The son of a rich official of Cappadocia is raised from the dead.
When Pariqos of Fesa confesses his sins to the bishop, the latter, refusing him absolution, tells him to go to Abba Yaceqob (Santiago).
The election of Patriarch Matthew I.
The story of Saint Alexius [Abdo l a-Masih], son of Emperor Theodosius.
Holy Family journey cycle: The places in Egypt visited by the Holy Family.
Holy Family journey cycle: All Israel is upset by the coming of the Magi; Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to flee to the mountains of Lebanon.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Magi find the Holy Family and depart; Saint Mary flees to Tiberias and from there to the mountains of Lebanon.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family stays in Dirde.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Mary's prayer while in the wilderness of Edomeyas.
Oz, the Byzantine monk, is shown a vision of Hell by Saint Urael.
A child and his mother see the icon of Saint Mary weeping for the sins of the world.
Abba Mardari, who overheard twelve angels talking about going to Constantinople to hear Saint John Chrysostom praise Saint Mary.
Saint Mary incenses Thecla (continuation).
Saint Paul is taken to the third heaven and there sees Saint Mary.
Abba Behor has a vision of Saint Mary.
The vision of Gregory the Seer [ra'eya hebu'at].
Saint Mary appears to Sawla, the wife of the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis.
The history ot Däbrä Mahew near Jerusalem and its miraculous spring.
The story of Awr, the son of the princess and the magician, Abrasit.
Saint Mary cures the son of a Roman official in Bethlehem.
Saint Mary heals a woman possessed by evil spirits.
Saint Mary appears to Timothy, Patriarch of Alexandria, in the church of Saint Pachomius in Alexandria.
Saint Mary appears to Anthony, a monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Saint Mary appears to Anthony of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam (continued).
Saint Mary anoints sick animals and heals them at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Message of Saint Mary to Anthony, monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Anthony, the monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam, asks about the anointing of the animals.
The blessing given to the animals at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam by the anointing of Saint Mary.
The priest who left the keys of the church locked up inside.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The life of Saint Mary to the birth of Christ.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The flight into Egypt.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family receives hospitality from a shepherd.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family crosses the Nile at Asmunayn.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ወተናገረቶ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት። ጸሎታ፡…. ወእምድኅረ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ኃለፍነ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገር፡ ካልእት፡ ወኢኃደገነ፡ ፍርሃት

Canonical Story Title: The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Christ Child grants Saint Mary a vision of his future glory.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): Ahrufas, the guardian angel of Egypt, comes to the Holy Family.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The experience of the Holy Family in the district of Asmunayn.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family encounters thieves.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family arrives at Däbrä QWesqWam.
Saint Peter gives Saint John Chrysostom the keys of the kingdom and Saint John the Evangelist gives him the Gospels; then Saint Mary appears to him.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews try to burn down the house where Saint Mary is staying but are burned up instead.
The Holy Spirit recounts the salvific events that have occurred on Sunday.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays with the disciples.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays with the disciples (continuation).
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays for the release of the souls in judgment.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees a vision of Saint Mary in glory.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ celebrates Mass for Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary asks Christ that the disciples preach her Transitus and Assumption.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays to be taken from this life.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews go to Bethlehem to seize Saint Mary but are blinded.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ, together with Saint Mary and the angels, appears to the Apostles and asks them to build churches in his name and hers throughout the world.
Christ makes Saint Peter head of the Church.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary, together with Saints Irene and Sophia, appears to Saint Basil and tells him where her icon is buried.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary asks Christ that the disciples preach her Transitus and Assumption.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary asks that Saint John be allowed to visit her dwelling place.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Prochorus reports Saint John's visit to Saint Mary's dwelling place.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays to be taken from this life.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary, together with Saints Irene and Sophia, appears to Saint Basil and tells him where her icon is buried.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil finds the buried icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary tells Saint Basil to take two pillars from a pagan temple.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary sets up the pillars in the church and makes a miraculous spring flow out at their base.
Salome's hands are burned when she tries to verify Saint Mary's virginity, but they are healed when she takes the Christ Child into her arms.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees Christ kissing Saint Mary's burial cloth.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary's soul descends from heaven in a tent of light.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Three virgins come to serve Saint Mary as she is about to give birth.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ተስእላ፡ ሠለስቱ፡ ደናግል፡ ዘከመ፡ ወለደት፡ አምላከ። ወእምዝ፡ መጽኣ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ ፫፡ ደናግል፡ እለ፡ ይትቀነያ፡ ላቲ፡ ወይቤላሃ፡ ኢትኅዝኒ፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ ነሕነሰ፡ ንመጽእ፡ ምስሌኪ

Canonical Story Title: Saint John Chrysostom defends a woman whom Nestorius had told the people to spit upon.
A woman who had poisoned her sister and married her husband is swallowed up by the earth when she anoints herself with the oil that flowed from Saint Mary's icon.
Saint Mary rescues the ship in which Mar Barsuma is travelling.
Saint Mary appears to the disciples of Mar Barsuma in the form of a dove.
Saint Mary appears to Saints Atrasis and Yona, virgins and martyrs.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Sarabamon, the future bishop of Nikiou and martyr.
The events that occurred during the captivity of Abbots Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon and John of Scete.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Nicholas and gives him priestly vestments.
Saint Mary appears to the brother of Saint Basil, Saint Gregory, bishop of "the Islands" (i.e. of Nyassa).
Saint Mary appears to Saint Paphnutius.
Saint Mary raises Andrew, a disciple of Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon, from the dead.
Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon instructs his disciples on his deathbed.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Theodore the Anatolian.
The fate of the monk, Giyorgis, who followed the teachings of Za-Mika'el.
The vision of a certain saint about the fate of a priest who swore falsely.
Abbas sees a vision of Saint Mary blessing the monks who were chanting the Psalms.
The inhabitants of Damot who would not observe the feast days of Saint Mary are punished by a storm that brings down a mighty tree.
The judgment of the court of Zärˀa Yaˁəqob against the Stephanites.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Synaxary entry for 16 Nahase: The Apostles visit Saint Mary in heaven.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Anonymous homily against the report that the Apostles abandoned the body of Saint Mary when they were attacked by the Jews during her funeral procession.
A Christian community is attacked by a neighboring Muslim community.
A renegade monk who had become a Jew is hunted down by the troops of the king.
A Jew is led to baptism by a dream about a lion and a monk; afterwards he curses a Jew at the latter's request.
The Magicians who tried to cast a spell on the Epiphany water.
The birth of the prince, Batergela Maryam.
Batergela Maryam is accused of treason and is imprisoned.
Batergela Maryam is protected from the plague; his calumniator is punished by the king.
When the destruction of Däbrä Metmaq is reported in Ethiopia, the king orders the construction of a new monastery to take its place.
When Satan destroys the oven of a monastery, he is compelled to serve the monks for twelve years in punishment.
Saint Mary shows those assembled at Däbrä Metmaq a vision of Mohammad in Hell.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): Satan urges Herod to pursue the Holy Family.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family returns from Egypt.
The Frenchman whose wife was unable to have children.
The monks of Däbrä Qaləmon who were despoiled by Berbers.
An Arab steals the scissors of the tailor of Däbrä Qaləmon.
An Arab who has contempt for Saint Mary’s icon at Däbrä Qaləmon is punished.
The composition of the Maṣḥafa ḥawi by Patriarch Gabriel Ibn Tarīk.
Amnut, the custodian of a church in Egypt, quarrels with his bishop.
Nəkʷal, the deacon from Margawkim, who spent his master’s money on the poor.
The priest from Nārdin who was accused because he kept a nun in his house.
The Arab woman who suffered from an issue of blood for many years.
Yoḥannǝs finds a copy of the acts of Saints Juliana and Barbara that he had lost.
ʾƎmma Yoḥannǝs and the Ethiopian monk who was on pilgrimage to Jerusalem.
The European who wanted to steal the bars of the door to the Manger at Bethlehem.
The lamp of the Christian from Mǝneta Diyāqon that was blown out by the wind.
The wife of Joseph from Mǝneta Diyāqon, who had no male children.
The poor man from Aragon [Spain] who was buried alive in a gold mine.
The husband who denied Christ when he became poor.
The devout Muslim who became a Christian when Saint Mary appeared to him.
The apparitions of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq.
The untrustworthy camel driver of Däbrä Metmaq.
Yeshaq, prior of Däbrä Metmaq, who fled to Scete, Egypt, to escape the burden of his office.
Eulogius, the stonemason of Scete, Egypt, who used to give hospitality to strangers.
The miraculous spring of Mehzab.
Incipit: ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘገብረቶ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ አመ፡ ፰፡ ለወርኀ፡ ሰኔ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ምሕፃብ፡ ዘዕውቅት፡ ኀበ፡ መቅዐ፡ ማይ፡ ቡሩክ፡ ዘነቅዓ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ

Canonical Story Title: The old woman from Sembat who gave the offering for Saint Mary to Saint George.
The conversion of a Muslim merchant who had been imprisoned in Naples.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Three virgins come to serve Saint Mary as she is about to give birth.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ተስእላ፡ ሠለስቱ፡ ደናግል፡ ዘከመ፡ ወለደት፡ አምላከ። ወእምዝ፡ መጽኣ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ ፫፡ ደናግል፡ እለ፡ ይትቀነያ፡ ላቲ፡ ወይቤላሃ፡ ኢትኅዝኒ፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ ነሕነሰ፡ ንመጽእ፡ ምስሌኪ

Canonical Story Title: Bishop Michael sends Deacon John to help the monks of Däbrä Metmaq celebrate Passion Week.
The story of the martyr, Saint Victor, and his mother, Martha.
The abbot who did not allow the Miracles of Mary to be read in his monastery.
A man killed during the construction of the church of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam is raised from the dead.
The story of the sorcerers Taludar, who was possessed by a demon.
The vinedresser of Manfalut who gave his earnings to the builders of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
The infidel who stole the lumber from the church at Däbrä QwesqWam.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: Saint Mary heals the daughter of Arsaban while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Mary, Conception of cycle: The descent of the holy seed from Adam to Saint Mary.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: God sends Saint Gabriel to Saint Mary for the Annunciation.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: The Jews plot to kill Saint Mary because of the miracles she was working while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Entawos, a pagan from Qarays, becomes a Christian after being struck by miraculous arrows.
A man who speaks blasphemously of Saint Mary has his arms and legs cut off.
The wife of a pagan official who wished to pray at the Holy Sepulcher is prevented until she is baptized.
The son of Emperor Tiberius is raised from the dead.
John the Evangelist paints an icon of the Crucifixion for Emperor Tiberius.
Petros Bawares has a vision of the Trinity.
The conversion of the Muslim, Rewh, who is renamed Entons Haddis.
Petros Bawares has a vision of the Trinity.
The wife of Mark, a priest from Mallawi, is cured of her leprosy.
The monks of Saint Anthony celebrate Holy Week at Däbrä QWesqWam.
A Muslim, Katib, tries to extort money from the monks of Saint Anthony.
Homily of John Chrysostom on the visit of Saint Mary and her Son to John the Baptist.
The story of John, the martyr from Senhut.
The Jews plot to burn the body of Saint Mary.
A Roman official is prevented from approaching the Holy Sepulcher.
Emperor Zeno builds churches in Scete.
Saint Mary blesses Scete, which Saint Macarius chooses for his monastery.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Saint Mary leaves the Temple and enters the home of Saint Joseph.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The adoration of the shepherds and the Magi.
The story of Michael, the scribe who converted to Islam when he was beaten.
The story of the Muslim who lived near the churches of Saints Mark and Shenute.
A hermit in Jerusalem is saved from the temptations of Satan.
A monk, Abraham, drinks poisonous water while on a journey to visit the patriarch and dies, but is then raised from the dead.
The story of Absadi, gardener of the monastery of St. Shenute, who used to give away vegetables from the garden.
The wrath of Saint Mary against the prefect of a church who tried to stop the priests from making a procession while singing hymns to her.
Homily on the miracles of Saint Mary.
The persecution of the Christians during the patriarchate of Cosmas II.
The withered olive tree at the gate of the church in Endules.
The story of the penitent harlot, Mary of Egypt.
Patriarch Abraham and the interpretation of the parable of the mustard seed.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The Circumcision.
Holy Family journey cycle: Herod orders the slaughter of the Innocents; a hunter with his dogs finds the Holy Family in flight from the king.
Holy Family journey cycle: The hunter reports to King Demateyanos, who comes to visit the Holy Family.
Emperor Arcadius and the golden statue of Saint Mary; he asks Saint John Chrysostom to expound on Matthew 1: 25.
The woman from Cairo who lived by the river and whose daughter became blind.
The beggar at the church of Qirqos in Amhara from whose head a horn grew.
The Apostles gather for the funeral of Saint Mary.
The merchant from Senfewat who struck the icon of Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: When Tafoneya lays hands on the bier of Saint Mary, an angel cuts his arms off.
The healing of the Egyptian King Soforon (or Safron).
The miracle concerning the golden ink during the reign of King Dawit.
The chastisement of the heretic, Nestorius.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the rich man who refused to give him a tablet [saleda] for an icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the Jewish merchant of Caesarea who stole a golden plate from the church, but later became a Christian.
The miraculous spring of Mehzab.
Incipit: ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘገብረቶ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ አመ፡ ፰፡ ለወርኀ፡ ሰኔ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ምሕፃብ፡ ዘዕውቅት፡ ኀበ፡ መቅዐ፡ ማይ፡ ቡሩክ፡ ዘነቅዓ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ

Canonical Story Title: The story of Saint Menas and his brother.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to return from the mountains of Lebanon to Bethlehem.
Holy Family journey cycle: An angel tells Saint Joseph to take Saint Mary and her child to Egypt.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
The reopening of the church in Harat Zuwayla.
The nominal Christian from Sidon who encountered a dragon.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
The composition of the Wǝddāse Maryam by the Syrian potter.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ celebrates Mass for Saint Mary.
The church of Saint Mary in Spain to which she used to bring Christian captives.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዐባይ፡ ጥቀ፡ ዘሀገረ፡ አስፓንያ፡ ዘሕንጽት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘትትሌዐል፡ እምኵሎን፡ አብያተ፡ ክርስቲያናት፡ ወዘልፈ፡ ታስተርኢ፡ ውስቴታ፡ ዐቢየ፡ ተአምረ፡ ሶበ፡ ጼወውዎሙ፡ ተንበላት፡ ለክርስቲያን፡ ዘይእቲ፡ ሀገር

Canonical Story Title: The Christians gathered for a feast of Saint Mary are saved from the Arabs.
The priest, Rizqallah, recovers things stolen from pilgrims.
Bishop Michael sends Deacon John to help the monks of Däbrä Metmaq celebrate Passion Week.
The cistern at Däbrä Metmaq is filled miraculously.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): Satan urges Herod to pursue the Holy Family.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family returns from Egypt.
The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
Bishop Mercurius, whom the patriarch wanted to remove because of leprosy.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
The inhabitants of Damot who would not observe the feast days of Saint Mary are punished by a storm that brings down a mighty tree.
The judgment of the court of Zärˀa Yaˁəqob against the Stephanites.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Synaxary entry for 16 Nahase: The Apostles visit Saint Mary in heaven.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.

Saint Mary appears to Yohannes Kama.
During the famine of 1120 MM [likely 1404 CE], the Arabs try to plunder the monasteries of Egypt.

The church of Saint Mary that moved by itself to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea.

The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.

The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The church built on the tomb of Saint Mary that will turn into a ship.

Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
An Arab who has contempt for Saint Mary’s icon at Däbrä Qaləmon is punished.
The devout Muslim who became a Christian when Saint Mary appeared to him.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The Arab woman who suffered from an issue of blood for many years.
The lamp before the icon of Saint Mary that the priest tipped over.
The two blessed monks, Sadaqā and ʾƎstifānos, from the monastery of Saint Victor.
The story of Pifamon, the martyr from Awsim.
Thecla is taken to Alexandria to see her brother, Abba Esi, in a boat guided by the Archangels Gabriel and Sureyal.
Saint Mary incenses Thecla (continuation).
Abba Esi and Thecla are saved from the torture ordered by the judge (continuation of the preceding).
The wealthy man to whom Saint Mary appeared in the form of a bird to save the countryside from pestilence.
The man who accepted fine clothes as a bribe for future favors.

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary stops a pestilence.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ዐባይ፡ ወብዙኃን፡ ሰብእ፡ ይነብሩ፡ ውስቴታ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ወኤጲስ፡ ቆጶሳት፡ ቀሳውስት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ ወመነኮሳት፡ ወሕዝብ፡ ዘኢይትኈለቍ። ወቦአ፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ሞተ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወቀተለ፡ ብዙኃነ፡ ሰብአ፡ እደ፡ ወአንስተ

Canonical Story Title: A plague in a monastery is halted at the prayer of a monk.

Canonical Story Title: A stream runs uphill after his neighbor had diverted it.

Canonical Story Title: A priest becomes insane after his entire family dies of the plague.
The cupbearer of the king of France.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.

The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.

Incipit: ዘገብረት፡ ይእዜ፡ በደብረ፡ ቍስቋም፡ በዘመነ፡  ስልጣነ፡ ምስር፡ ቃይታባይ። ወበአሐቲ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ ወፅአ፡ መኰንን፡ ዘእምታሕቴሁ፡ ለንጉሥ፡ ከመ፡ ይዑድ፡ በሀገረ፡ ፅዒድ፡ ያስተገብእ፡ ጸብሐተ፡ ለንጉሥ
