Yeshaq, prior of Däbrä Metmaq, who fled to Scete, Egypt, to escape the burden of his office.
The priest from Cyprus who brought a particle of the Eucharist to a Jew.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ነዳይ፡ ቀሲስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ቆጵሮስ፡ ወአልቦቱ፡ ምንተኒ፡ እምሲሳየ፡ ዕለት። ወሶበ፡ ጸንዐ፡ ላዕሌሁ፡ ንዲት፡ ወረኅብ፡ ሖረ፡ ኀበ፡ አሐዱ፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ ወተለቅሐ፡ እምኔሁ፡ ሠለስተ፡ ምእተ፡ ዲናረ

Canonical Story Title: Thieves try to steal from a church of Saint Mary in Syria but are unable to bring what they have stolen out of the church.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በሀገረ፡ ሻም፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወባቲ፡ ንዋይ፡ ብዙኃ። ወበአሐቲ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ ተማከሩ፡ ፈያት፡ ከመ፡ ይሥርቁ፡ ንዋየ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን

Canonical Story Title: A child whom his mother had vowed to Saint Mary is rescued from drowning.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በሀገረ፡ ወርወራ፡ እምአድያመ፡ ግብጽ፡ በጽንፈ፡ ባሕር፡ ወባቲ፡ ህየ፡ መዕዳወ፡ ከመ፡ የዓድው፡ ባቲ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወእንስሳ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary shows those assembled at Däbrä Metmaq a vision of Mohammad in Hell.
Some Christians held captive by a Muslim are freed by an angel and are brought to Cyprus.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ እስላም፡ በምድረ፡ ምዕራብ፡ ርኁቅ፡ እምሀገረ፡ ቆጵሮስ፡ መጠነ፡ ዕስራ፡ ዕለት፡ ወሖረ፡ ከመ፡ ይጸብዖሙ፡ ለክርስቲያን፡ በከመ፡ ልማዱ

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The rich Egyptian woman who refused to give water to the Holy Family.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ነገር፡ እምድኅረ፡ ወለደቶ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወአዘዘ፡ ሄሮድስ፡ ከመ፡ ይቅትሉ፡ ሕፃናተ፡ ዘክልኤ፡ ዓማት። ወሰሚዓ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ አጐየየቶ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ውስተ፡ ምድረ፡ ግብጽ። ወእንዘ፡ ትትጐየይ፡ ወአብጽሐቶ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ኃምስ፡ ወአኃዞ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ጽምዓ፡ ማይ፡ እስመ፡ ጊዜ፡ ቀትር፡ ውእቱ። ወቦአት፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ከመ፡ ትስእል፡ ማየ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ዘውእቱ፡ ወሀቤ፡ ዝናማት፡ ወይእቲሰ፡ ብእሲት፡ ባዕልት፡ ጥቀ፡ እምንዋየ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ዓለም፡ ወበምግባረ፡ ኀጢአት፡ ወነዳይት፡ ይእቲ፡ በምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወድርክት፡ ይእቲ፡ ካልእታ፡ ለኤልዛቤል

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The inhabitants of an Egyptian town who plot to hand Jesus over to King Herod are turned into animals.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ celebrates Mass for Saint Mary.
The church of Saint Mary in Spain to which she used to bring Christian captives.
The woman from Cairo whose children all died.
The hungry man whom Saint Mary used to feed.
The nominal Christian from Sidon who encountered a dragon.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The two brothers from Rome, Peter, a deacon, and Stephen, an avaricious magistrate.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The avaricious priest who visited a dying man who loved bribes.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
The church of Saint Mary that moved by itself to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea.
The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
The rich man from Colosse who was wounded in the eye while fighting the Qwez.
Elizabeth, the blind daughter of Abraham and Gera Anest of Baderman.
The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
The two brothers who copied the Miracles of Mary and fell into the doing of a sin.
Saint Mary appears to the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis, in prison.
Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
Bishop Mercurius, whom the patriarch wanted to remove because of leprosy.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The monk of Däbrä Qaləmon who did not fast.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The virgin who sinned with many lovers.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The shepherd near the church of Saint Paul in Rome who was possessed by a demon.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
Mary, Childhood of cycle: Saint Mary stays in the Temple.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The five sorrows of Saint Mary.
The reopening of the church in Harat Zuwayla.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
The monk of Däbrä Qaləmon who did not fast.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family hides from thieves in a sycamore tree at Däbrä Metmaq.
Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon intercedes for an angel who had disobeyed the command of God.
Holy Family journey cycle: The rich Egyptian woman who refused to give water to the Holy Family.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ነገር፡ እምድኅረ፡ ወለደቶ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወአዘዘ፡ ሄሮድስ፡ ከመ፡ ይቅትሉ፡ ሕፃናተ፡ ዘክልኤ፡ ዓማት። ወሰሚዓ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ አጐየየቶ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ውስተ፡ ምድረ፡ ግብጽ። ወእንዘ፡ ትትጐየይ፡ ወአብጽሐቶ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ኃምስ፡ ወአኃዞ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ጽምዓ፡ ማይ፡ እስመ፡ ጊዜ፡ ቀትር፡ ውእቱ። ወቦአት፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ከመ፡ ትስእል፡ ማየ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ዘውእቱ፡ ወሀቤ፡ ዝናማት፡ ወይእቲሰ፡ ብእሲት፡ ባዕልት፡ ጥቀ፡ እምንዋየ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ዓለም፡ ወበምግባረ፡ ኀጢአት፡ ወነዳይት፡ ይእቲ፡ በምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወድርክት፡ ይእቲ፡ ካልእታ፡ ለኤልዛቤል

Canonical Story Title: The composition of the Wǝddāse Maryam by the Syrian potter.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
The faded icon of Saint Mary that the mother-in-law wanted to discard.
The son of a rich official of Cappadocia is raised from the dead.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The lamp before the icon of Saint Mary that the priest tipped over.
The monk who saved the church of Saint Mary in Atrib by his prayers when its destruction had been ordered by the Caliph.
The Christians gathered for a feast of Saint Mary are saved from the Arabs.
The priest, Rizqallah, recovers things stolen from pilgrims.
Saint Mary appears during Mass in the church at Meneta Sard.
The story of the martyr, Saint Victor, and his mother, Martha.
The Arab woman who entrusted her jewels to a Christian for safekeeping.
A hermit in Jerusalem is saved from the temptations of Satan.
Thecla is taken to Alexandria to see her brother, Abba Esi, in a boat guided by the Archangels Gabriel and Sureyal.
The son of the Muslim ruler of Egypt blasphemes the icon of Saint Mary.
Mareqos, King of Romeya, abandons his throne secretly to become a monk.
The people of Romeya appeal to Patriarch Dionysius to find King Mareqos.
When Sefengeya, wife of King Masfeyanos of Romeya, prays to have a child before the icon of Saint Mary, the icon inclines its head; Sefengeya then conceives Yeshaq (Abba Garima).
During the famine of 1120 MM [likely 1404 CE], the Arabs try to plunder the monasteries of Egypt.
Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
The daughter of the rich man from Caesarea who could not deliver her baby.
Holy Family journey cycle: The people of an Egyptian town set fierce dogs on the Holy Family.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: Saint Mary heals the daughter of Arsaban while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
A container of oil remains suspended in mid air in a church of Saint Mary when the cord by which it was suspended breaks.
A Christian retainer escapes unharmed when his king is defeated by the Muslims.
The woman who was crossing a river on a raft [mezlal].
The milk of Saint Mary that was poured on the ground in Egypt.
Saint Mary makes a covenant with King Dawit of Ethiopia.
The general of King (Dawit) of Ethiopia who defected to the enemy.
The man who lost a slave that he was about to sell in Barara.
The carpenter who asked for a copy of the Gadla samaˁtat as a reward for his services in building a church.
The icon of Saint Mary in a church of Alexandria that some Europeans tried to steal.
The abbot who rejected the horologium and other works of Abba Giyorgis.
Saint Mary cuts short her visit to a pious monk when she hears her name invoked according to the horologium of Abba Giyorgis.
The monk who was expelled from school when he could not pay his teacher.
The new tabot of Saint Mary that was found outside the box in which it had been placed.
A monk, while guarding a church, has a nocturnal emission and finds himself suddenly outside the courtyard of the church.
The thieves who stole the furnishings of a church of Saint Mary and refused to restore them when she appeared to them.
A young monk is horrified when he has a sexual dream.
Saint Mary visits Calvary.
Homily on the greatness of Saint Mary.
Christ gives Ethiopia as tithes to Saint Mary.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Mary is welcomed when she returns to Galilee.
A container of oil remains suspended in mid air in a church of Saint Mary when the cord by which it was suspended breaks.
The man who wanted to give a banquet on Saint Mary's feast but was unable because of a famine.
Synaxary entry for the 16th of Yakkatit: Saint Mary receives the Pact of Mercy (kidan mehret).
Synaxary entry for the 16th of Yakkatit: Saint Mary receives the Pact of Mercy (kidan mehret).
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob and the invasion of Badlay.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob is given a sign of Badlay's fall.
The beggar at the church of Qirqos in Amhara from whose head a horn grew.
Saint Mary appears to the gabaz of her church in Waybela and tells him about the fall of Badlay.
The miracle concerning the golden ink during the reign of King Dawit.
Saints Mary and Gabriel visit an Ethiopian named Gabra Maryam and heal him.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በብሔረ፡ ኢትዮጵያ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ወዓማፂ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ገብረ፡ ማርያም፡ ወባሕቱ፡ ኮነ፡ ያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይገብር፡ ተዝካራ፡ ወካልዕሰ፡ አልቦቱ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ አሚነ፡ ወልዳ፡ ወአፍቅሮ፡ ዚአሃ። ወኮነ፡ በአሐዱ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ በሰንበተ፡ እኁድ፡ ኃደረ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያና፡ እንዘ፡ ይዌድሳ፡ ወይጼብሓ፡ ወይገኒ፡ ለነግሣ

Canonical Story Title: Sara from Mesot, who became insane and went about naked.
Archbishop Tilas, who was seized by Jews while carrying a golden chalice.
Elias from Elkesus, who was falsely accused and was suspended by the abbot.
The story of Dilasor, brother of Emperor Theodosius, who was Abba Kiros.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: The birth of Saint Mary on the first of Genbot.
Saint Mary is found to be pregnant.
The Annunciation.
Christ orders Abba Samu'el of Wali to celebrate Mass for the feast of Saint Mary.
Abraham, a relative of Saint Stephen, becomes a Christian.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ቅዱስ፡ እምዘመዱ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ እስጢፋኖስ፡ እምነገደ፡ ሌዊ፡ እምኢየሩሳሌም፡ ወኮነ፡ ስሙ፡ ለአቡሁ፡ አብርሃም፡ ወልደ፡ ሌዊ፡ ወልደ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ እኁሁ፡ ለስምዖን፡ እኁሁ፡ ለእመ፡ እስጢፋኖስ፡ ወበጊዜ፡ ልደቱ፡ ሰመይዎ፡ ስመ፡ አቡሁ

Canonical Story Title: Abba Samuˀel of Wali is lifted up while reciting the Wəddase Maryam.
The Jew from Rome who wanted to kill Christians, but was seized by the priests of the church of Saint Mary.
King Yasay of Egypt, who became a monk in Däbrä Rom.
Patriarch Tewoqritos of Jerusalem rebukes King Akratis of Egypt for not fasting or praying.
Deganna, the church builder, who was asked by King Aktab to build a temple for his pagan gods.
The story of Astaqaˀos, the European potter who was buried alive.
Emperor Honorius, who lived like a monk.
At the commemoration of Abba Samuˀel of Wali a blind man recovers his sight.
Incipit: ወእምድኅረ፡ ዕረፍቱ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ በ፵፡ ዕለት፡ ተጋብኡ፡ ሕዝብ፡ ከመ፡ ይግበሩ፡ ተዝካሮ፡ ኀበ፡ መቃብሪሁ፡ ዘምስለ፡ ቀሳውስት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ ወመነኮሳት፡ ወመኳንንት፡ እድ፡ ወአንስት፡ እስከ፡ ይከይዱ፡ ቢጾሙ

Canonical Story Title: A blind woman is brought by her son to the tomb of Abba Samuˀel of Wali.
Incipit: ወመጽአት፡ ብእሲት፡ ዕውርት፡ እምርሑቅ፡ ብሔር፡ እንዘ፡ ይመርሓ፡ ወልዳ፡ ወበጽሐት፡ ኀበ፡ ምኔተ፡ ብፁዓዊ፡ ዕንቈ፡ ጾም፡ አቡነ፡ ሳሙኤል

Canonical Story Title: Paraleya from Iyyoram, who was beaten by her husband because she was childless.
The blind woman from Zarafta who was unable to come to the tomb of Abba Samuˀel of Wali.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ ካዕበ፡ ዕውርት፡ ክልኤሆን፡ አዕይንቲሃ፡ በምድረ፡ ዘረፍታ፡ ወሶበ፡ ስእነት፡ ዘያበጽሐ፡ ኀበ፡ መቃብሪሁ፡ ለብፁዓዊ፡ አቡነ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ እስመ፡ ነዳይት፡ ጥቀ፡ ወአልባቲ፡ ቢጽ፡ ዘይረድአ

Canonical Story Title: Daniel from Constantinople, who wanted to go to church to receive Communion even when there was fighting in the streets.
Qawestos, the husband of Akroseya, becomes a disciple of Saint Clement.
The story of Abadir, a district governor of Egypt.
The story of King Tarses of Fars, who loved to kill Christians.
The temptations that Akroseya, the wife of Qawestos, overcame.
The soul of Christina, the wife of Aaron, an Egyptian official, goes to Heaven.
Saint Mary and her Son appear to Patriarch Bartholomew while saying Mass.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ በሀገረ፡ እስክንድርያ፡ ዘስሙ፡ በርተሎሜዎስ፡ ወያሠምሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወእስከ፡ ለሞት፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወበአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ አጽሐብዎ፡ ካህናት፡ ከመ፡ ይልበስ፡ ተክህኖ፡ አመ፡ ወርኃ፡ ሐምሌ፡ በሠርቀ፡ በዓላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: When the Holy Family encounters brigands during their return journey from Egypt, Christ repairs the broken sword of Tetos.
Incipit: ወእምድኅረዝ፡ አስተርአዮ፡ መልአከ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ለዮሴፍ፡ በግብጽ፡ ወይቤሎ፡ ተንሥእ፡ ወንሣእ፡ ሕፃነ፡ ወእሞ፡ ወተመየጥ፡ ምድረ፡ ፍልስጥኤም

Canonical Story Title: Satan comes to some monks and entrusts a child to them; the monks eat the child.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ደብር፡ ዘመነኮሳት፡ ሠናያን፡ እሙንቱ። ወቀንዓ፡ ላዕሌሆሙ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ወመጽአ፡ ተመሲሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ሕፃን፡ ወአሐዱ፡ አረጋዊ፡ ወይቤሎሙ፡ ለመነኮሳት፡ አንብሩ፡ ሊተ፡ ወልድየ

Canonical Story Title: The story of the sorcerers Taludar, who was possessed by a demon.
A monk heals two blind hyena cubs with an icon of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ በእንተ፡ ዝዕብ፡ ዘወለደት፡ ክልኤተ፡ ውሉደ፡ ወዖሩ፡ አዕይንቲሆሙ፡ ለዝዕብ፡ እጓላ። ወነበረ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ መንገለ፡ ሐቅል፡ ምስለ፡ አራዊት

Canonical Story Title: Qawestos, the husband of Akroseya, becomes a disciple of Saint Clement.
The priest who left the keys of the church locked up inside.
A child whom his mother had vowed to Saint Mary is rescued from drowning.
When a couple tries to marry their son whom they had dedicated to Saint Mary, he falls sick to the point of death.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: How the Virgin Mary gave birth (see no. 299)
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The shepherds and the magi come to worship Christ.
The composition of the Maṣḥafa ḥawi by Patriarch Gabriel Ibn Tarīk.
Ark of Zion cycle: When Israel Sins against the Law, the Philistines defeat them and carry off the Ark of Zion, which then chastizes them.
Ark of Zion cycle: The Philistines bring the Ark of Zion to Azotus and put it into the temple of Dagon.
Incipit: ሕዝበ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ንንግርክሙ፡ ዜናሃ፡ ለታቦተ፡ ሕጉ፡ ለልዑል፡ ዘተረክበ፡ እምመጽሐፈ፡ ነገሥት። ወነሥእዋ፡ ኤሎፍሊ፡ ለታቦተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ጽዮን፡ እምአቤኔዜር፡ ወወሰድዋ፡ ውስተ፡ አዛጦን

Canonical Story Title: Ark of Zion cycle: The havoc wrought among the Philistines by the Ark of Zion.
Ark of Zion cycle: King David and all Israel bring back the Ark of Zion.
Saint Mary heals a servant girl from a magic spell.
Bishop Hildephonsus sees the icon of Saint Mary sweating; she asks him to raise a girl from the dead.
An official who used to rob the poor is converted when a monk reveals that Satan was acting as his counsellor.
The three monks who attempted to say Mass in a mosque.
The monk, Paul, who was attacked by brigands.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጳውሎስ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ አሐቲ፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡…. ብድው፡ ይእቲ፡ ወብእሲት፡ አረጋዊት፡ ዘትገብር፡ ሲሲቱ፡ ለውእቱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ወዘእንበሌሁሰ፡ አልቦ፡ ባዕድ፡ እመሂ፡ ዓቢይ፡ አው፡ ንዑስ

Canonical Story Title: The pious deacon who was seized to avenge a homicide committed by his brother.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይትአመና፡ በጥቡዕ፡ ልብ፡ ወኢያጸርዕ፡ ዘክሮተ፡ ሰማ፡ መዓልተ፡ ወሌሊተ፡ ወኢያበጥል፡ አንብቦ፡ ውዳሴሃ፡ ለለዕለቱ፡ እስመ፡ ዲያቆን፡ ውእቱ። ወሀሎ፡ እኁሁ፡ ዕቡይ፡ ወቀታሌ፡ ነፍስ

Canonical Story Title: The wife of Joseph from Mǝneta Diyāqon, who had no male children.
Amnut, the custodian of a church in Egypt, quarrels with his bishop.
The story of the sorcerers Taludar, who was possessed by a demon.
The infidel who stole the lumber from the church at Däbrä QwesqWam.
The story of John, the martyr from Senhut.
Emperor Zeno builds churches in Scete.
The story of Michael, the scribe who converted to Islam when he was beaten.
A monk, Abraham, drinks poisonous water while on a journey to visit the patriarch and dies, but is then raised from the dead.
Homily on the miracles of Saint Mary.
The persecution of the Christians during the patriarchate of Cosmas II.
Emperor Arcadius and the golden statue of Saint Mary; he asks Saint John Chrysostom to expound on Matthew 1: 25.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the Jewish merchant of Caesarea who stole a golden plate from the church, but later became a Christian.
The election of Patriarch Matthew I.
Holy Family journey cycle: The places in Egypt visited by the Holy Family.
The prodigal son of a man who used, when he was alive, to feed two persons; Saint Mary promises him riches, but he finds only two grains of gold.
King Bartaqu of Greece, who became a monk.
A dragon that had swallowed up Efrem, a monk of Däbrä Timona, is compelled to vomit him up alive ten days later.
The woman whose baby daughter was carried off by a hyena.
The woman who was falsely accused of killing the child she was nursing and was condemned to death.
Barnabas from Sandafa, who used to venerate Saint Mary's icon.
A barren woman conceives and bears salda Masqal.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ መካን፡ ወይዘነጕጓ፡ ብእሲሃ፡ ወይጸርፋ፡ ብዙኃ፡ ጊዜያት። ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በጥቃ፡ ቤታ፡ ወትገይስ፡ በሌሊት፡ ከመ፡ ኢያእምራ፡ ብእሲሃ፡ ወትስእላ፡ በብካይ

Canonical Story Title: The girl who was going to be stoned after she was caught committing fornication.
Saint Mary heals a poor man from skin disease whom people had refused to carry to church.
The pious priest to whom Satan came for confession.
The king's washerman who was attacked by a lion.
A young man whom his mother had vowed to the service of Saint Mary becomes impotent when his parents try to wed him.
The couple that were guided by the wife's dream to find buried money with which to build a shrine to Saint Mary.
The man who would not eat before receiving Holy Communion.
The monk whose only good work was observing the fast of Saint Mary.
A sinner is saved from damnation because he had built a shrine in the name of Saint Mary.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The nativity of Christ
The milk of Saint Mary that was poured on the ground in Egypt.
The pilgrim who was journeying to Jerusalem through Hamda.
Holy Family journey cycle: The hunter who discovered the Holy Family in flight is turned into a dog when he violates his oath not to reveal them.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family visits the king of the Semites.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family uses stones instead of a boat to cross the Nile.
The three pious priests and monks who wore fine clothes.
The Muslims who stole the furnishings of a church of Saint Mary located near the western boundary of Ethiopia and were struck by lightning.
The punishment of an Ethiopian woman who swore falsely that she had not committed adultery with another woman's husband.
The pilgrim who was journeying to Jerusalem through Hamda.
The icon of Saint Mary in a church of Alexandria that some Europeans tried to steal.
The punishment of a custodian of a church who did not obey the bishop.
The icon of Saint Mary that did not burn when the rest of the house was destroyed.
The pious monk who drowned while crossing a river on his way to a feast that was being given by a rich man in honor of the Assumption.
The blind teacher whom his pupils wanted to push over a cliff while they were on their way to a feast being given in honor of the Assumption.
Saint Alexius lives for fifteen years near a church of Saint Mary in Armenia.
Saint Mary cuts short her visit to a pious monk when she hears her name invoked according to the horologium of Abba Giyorgis.
An angel drives away the custodian of a church of Saint Mary when he was about to enter after sinning with a woman.
The Ethiopian general who went off to fight the Muslims without the consent of the king.
Tiras, who did not observe holy days, becomes deaf and dumb, but he is healed when his master prays to Saint Mary.
Saint Mary makes a covenant with King Dawit of Ethiopia.
The general of King (Dawit) of Ethiopia who defected to the enemy.
Thieves try to steal from a church of Saint Mary in Syria but are unable to bring what they have stolen out of the church.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: A soldier redeems the Child Jesus from another soldier who was thinking of handing him over to King Herod.
The two brothers from Rome, Peter, a deacon, and Stephen, an avaricious magistrate.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a rich sinner who had repented and was planning to build a monastery and become a monk.
The avaricious priest who visited a dying man who loved bribes.
The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
Mary, Conception of cycle: The conception and nativity of Saint Mary.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The robber whom a bishop was commanded to bury after he was executed.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
The man who was possessed by a spirit of epilepsy [nagargar] for 47 years.
Incipit: ወመጽአ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘአኃዞ፡ ጋኔን፡ ወነገርጋር፡ ፵ወ፯፡ ዓመተ

Canonical Story Title: The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
A knight tries to seduce the wife of a friend, but she is saved by a vision.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The pious rich man whom Satan served in hopes of destroying him.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
Mary, Childhood of cycle: Saint Mary stays in the Temple.
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
Mary, Engagement of cycle: Saint Mary is espoused to Saint Joseph.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ንነግረክሙ፡ አኀዊነ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ውሉደ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዝናሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ሚመጠነ፡ ሐዘን፡ ዘበጽሐ፡ ላዕሌሃ፡ እምደቂቀ፡ እስራኤል፡ እስከ፡ በጽሐ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፡ ወዜነዋ፡ ትፍሥሕተ

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The rich Egyptian woman who refused to give water to the Holy Family.
Holy Family journey cycle: The people of an Egyptian town set fierce dogs on the Holy Family.
Incipit: ወእንዘ፡ ተሐውር፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. እምሀገር፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገር፡ ጐዪያ፡ እምነ፡ መዓቱ፡ ለሄሮድስ፡ ርጉም፡ ወበጽሐት፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአድያማተ፡ ግብጽ፡ ወሰብአ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እኩያን፡ እሙንቱ

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The hunter who discovered the Holy Family in flight is turned into a dog when he violates his oath not to reveal them.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ እንከ፡ በእንተ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘመሐለ፡ በሐሰት፡ ወበእንተ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ ዐቢይ፡ ዘየፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወእንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ውስተ፡ ሐቅለ፡ ገዳም፡ ዘቈላተ፡ ዮሰፍጥ፡ ጐዪየ፡ እምነ፡ ሕምዘ፡ መዐቱ፡ ለአርዌ

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family visits the king of the Semites.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ እምደቂቀ፡ ሴም፡ ዘሠናይ፡ ግዕዙ፡ ወርቱዕ፡ ልቡ

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family hides from thieves in a sycamore tree at Däbrä Metmaq.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ በእንተ፡ እለ፡ መጽኡ፡ እኩያን፡ ፈያት፡ ከመ፡ ይንሥኡ፡ ንዋያ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወበእንተ፡ ኦመ፡ ሰግላ፡ ክልኤ፡ ክፍለ። ወእንዘ፡ ትጐይይ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘምስለ፡ ሕፃና፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ ወሰሎሜ፡ ምስሌሃ፡ እምነ፡ መዐቱ፡ ለሄሮድስ፡ ዕልው፡ ወእንዘ፡ ትፈልስ፡ እምሀገር፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገር፡ ሶበ፡ ብጽሐት፡ ውስተ፡ አድያማተ፡ ደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ወአድግኒ፡ አሐዱ፡ ጽዑን፡ ስንቀ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ወነጸርዋ፡ እኩያን፡ ፈያት

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family uses stones instead of a boat to cross the Nile.
Incipit: በእንተ፡ ዘከመ፡ ከልአ፡ ባዕለ፡ ሐመር፡ ዐዲወ፡ ውስተ፡ ባሕረ፡ ተከዜ፡ ወአዕደውዋ፡ አእባን፡ ከመ፡ እንተ፡ ሐመር። ወአመ፡ ግብአታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እምኀበ፡ ጐየት፡ እምምድረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ወደብረ፡ ቍስቋም፡ ሶበ፡ ሞቱ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ እለ፡ የኀሥሥዎ፡ ለሕፃና፡ ከመ፡ ይቅትልዎ፡ በትእዛዙ፡ ወበቃሉ፡ ለአምላከ፡ አማልክት፡ ወእንዘ፡ ትትመየጥ፡ በፍሥሓ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ አቡሃ፡ ዳዊት፡ ወበጽሐት፡ ኀበ፡ ባሕረ፡ ተከዜ፡ እንዘ፡ ትፈቅድ፡ ዐዲወ

Canonical Story Title: The three pious priests and monks who wore fine clothes.
Incipit: ወሀለዉ፡ በአሐዱ፡ ደብር፡ ፫፡ ካህናት፡ ኄራን፡ ወሠናያን፡ ወማእምራነ፡ ቃለ፡ መጻሕፍት፡ ዘብሉይ፡ ወዘሐዲስ፡ ወያፈቅሩ፡ ተሠርግዎተ፡ በአልባስ፡ ቀጠንት

Canonical Story Title: The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
The pious abbot who was falsely accused by his monks of sinning with a woman.
Incipit: ዝንቱ፡ ተአምር፡ በእንተ፡ አሐዱ፡ መምህረ፡ ደብር፡ ከመ፡ ውእቱ፡ ኮነ፡ ኄረ፡ በኵሉ፡ ምግባሩ፡ ወሠናይ፡ በግዕዙ፡ ወርቱዕ፡ በሃይማኖቱ፡ ወይጌስጾሙ፡ ለደቂቁ፡ ሠርከ፡ ወነግሀ፡ እንበይነ፡ ዐቂበ፡ ሥርዓተ፡ ምንኵስና፡ ወበሕገ፡ ቀኖና፡ ዘሐዋርያት፡ ወዘሊቃውንት። ወሶበ፡ አንወዮሙ፡ በጽኑዕ፡ ግብር፡ በእንተ፡ ዐቂበ፡ ሕግ፡ ኀብሩ፡ ቦቱ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ደቂቁ፡ በእኩይ፡ ግብር

Canonical Story Title: The Muslims who stole the furnishings of a church of Saint Mary located near the western boundary of Ethiopia and were struck by lightning.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ ኦደቂቀ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ክርስቶሳውያን፡ ዕበየ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ። ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እንተ፡ መንገለ፡ ዐረቢሃ፡ ለብሔረ፡ አግዓዚ፡ ዘሕንጽት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The monk who was expelled from school when he could not pay his teacher.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ደብር፡ እምአድባራተ፡ ምድረ፡ አግዓዚ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ሕሊናሁ፡ ወእንዘ፡ ሀለወ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ ንእሱ፡ ተምህረ፡ መዝሙረ፡ ዳዊት፡ ኀበ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መንፈሳዊ

Canonical Story Title: The new tabot of Saint Mary that was found outside the box in which it had been placed.
Incipit: ዛቲ፡ ተአምር፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ፍቁረ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ወፍቁረ፡ ወልዳ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ። ወሀለወት፡ ውስተ፡ ጽርሐ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ አሐቲ፡ ታቦት፡ ዘግልፍት፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: A monk, while guarding a church, has a nocturnal emission and finds himself suddenly outside the courtyard of the church.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ መንክረ፡ ወመድምመ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘተገብረ፡ በመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ፍቁረ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ወፍቁረ፡ ወልዳ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ። ወውእቱሰ፡ ንጉሥ፡ እምብዝኀ፡ አፍቅሮተ፡ ኪያሃ፡ ሐነጸ፡ ላቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በስማ፡ ለቡርክት፡ ወንጽሕት፡ ማርያም

Canonical Story Title: An angel drives away the custodian of a church of Saint Mary when he was about to enter after sinning with a woman.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እንተ፡ ተሐንጸት፡ በስማ፡ ለማርያም፡ ወብዙኃ፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ይትገበር፡ በውስቴታ። ወሀሎ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዐቃቤ፡ ዐንቀጸ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ መዐልተ፡ ወሌሊተ፡ ውእቱ፡ ይጠቅዕ፡ መጥቅዐ፡ በኵሉ፡ ጊዜ

Canonical Story Title: The Ethiopian general who went off to fight the Muslims without the consent of the king.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ መልአከ፡ ኀይሉ፡ ለንጉሥ፡ ወሖረ፡ ውስተ፡ ጸብዐ፡ ዕልዋን፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ሥምረተ፡ ሕሊናሁ፡ ለንጉሥ

Canonical Story Title: The two retainers of a pious ruler who swore not to fight with one another.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ሕሊናሁ፡ ወሀለዉ፡ እምታሕቴሁ፡ ሠየምተ፡ ምድር፡ ብዙኃን፡ ወእምኔሆሙ፡ ሀለዉ፡ ፪፡ ሠየምት፡ እለ፡ ይትበአሱ፡ ወትረ፡ ወይትቃተሉ፡ በጽኑዕ፡ ቀትል

Canonical Story Title: A monk obtains from Saint Mary food for a visitor.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወይትለአካ፡ በኵሉ፡ ኀይሉ፡ ወአልቦቱ፡ ካልአ፡ ትካዘ፡ ኢለመፍቀደ፡ ሲሳዩ፡ ወኢለዐራዙ፡ ወባሕቱ፡ ገብረ፡ ጥሪቶ፡ ወመዝገቦ፡ ጾመ፡ ወጸሎተ

Canonical Story Title: The king who ordered his retainers to bury him in the church of Saint Mary that he had built.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ክቡር፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ፈድፋደ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወይትለአካ፡ በኵሉ፡ ኃይሉ፡ ወሐነጸ፡ ላቲ፡ ሐዋዘ፡ መቅደስ፡ በስመ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ወአሠርገዋ፡ በወርቅ፡ ወበብሩር

Canonical Story Title: The man who out of jealousy burned down the house of a former wife who had abandoned him.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘሖረ፡ ኀበ፡ ብእሲተ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘማዊት፡ ኀዲጎ፡ ብእሲቶ፡ ወአውሰበ፡ ኪያሃ። ወኀደገቶ፡ ይእቲኒ፡ ወዘመወት፡ ኀበ፡ ካልእ፡ ብእሲ። ወእምዝ፡ ቦአ፡ ውስተ፡ ልቡ፡ ቅንአተ፡ ዐቢየ፡ ወጽኑዓ፡ ወነሥአ፡ እሳተ፡ ወተንሥአ፡ ወሖረ፡ ወአውዓየ፡ ቤተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ብእሲት

Canonical Story Title: The man who suspected a former wife of having burned down his house.
Incipit: ወሀለወ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘኃደጋ፡ ለብእሲቱ፡ ወእምብዝኀ፡ ቍትዓሁ፡ ተኀጥአቶ፡ ብእሲቱ። ወእምዝ፡ ተንሥአት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ጎረ፡ ቤቱ፡ ወአውዓየት፡ ቤቶ፡ በእሳት

Canonical Story Title: A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The virgin who sinned with many lovers.
The thieves who stole the furnishings of a church of Saint Mary and refused to restore them when she appeared to them.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እንተ፡ ተሐንጸት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወበአሐቲ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ በሌሊተ፡ እሑድ፡ ቦኡ፡ ሰረቅት፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲየና፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወሰበሩ፡ ዐናቅጺሃ፡ ወነሥኡ፡ ኵሎ፡ ንዋየ፡ ቅድሳት

Canonical Story Title: The man who borrowed for a wedding a silken garment from the church of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ። መጽአ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወተሐወጸ፡ ልብሰ፡ ሐሪር፡ ወሖረ፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ መርዐ

Canonical Story Title: The Muslim who was unable to open the church he was intending to plunder.
Incipit: ርእዩኬ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያና። ወበአሐዱ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ መጽአ፡ ዓረሚ፡ ምስለ፡ ሠራዊቱ፡ ዘያመዘብር፡ ኵሎ፡ አብያተ፡ ክርስቲያናተ። ወሶበ፡ አልጸቀ፡ ወበጽሐ፡ ኀበ፡ ይእቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ አጐየዩ፡ ካህናት፡ ታቦተ፡ ወለንዋየ፡ ቅድሳትሰ፡ ኀደጉ

Canonical Story Title: A goat comes miraculously to be slaughtered.
Incipit: ወእምዝ፡ ንነግር፡ ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በላዕለ፡ ዝኩ፡ ዓረሚ። ወጠኑ፡ ሰብአ፡ ሀገር፡ ይኅርዱ፡ በግዓ፡ ለለ፡ ዕለተ። ወበአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ኀጥኡ፡ በግዓ፡ ወተከዙ፡ ዐቢየ፡ ትካዝ

Canonical Story Title: The robbers who took from a monk his clothes and the cover of an icon of Saint Mary that he was carrying.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ፈድፋደ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ነፍሱ፡ ወይጸውር፡ ሥዕለ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ኵሎ፡ ዕለታተ፡ ወኵሎ፡ ጊዜያተ

Canonical Story Title: Alexander, a Jew from Jerusalem, is delivered three days after he was swallowed up by a dragon.
The nominal Christian from Sidon who encountered a dragon.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The nativity of Christ
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ ኵልክሙ፡ ደቂቀ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዜናሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘከመ፡ ገብረት፡ ኀይለ፡ ወተአምረ፡ በዕለተ፡ ወለደቶ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ በቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ ዘይሁዳ፡ እስመ፡ ከማሁ፡ ጽሑፍ፡ በነቢይ

Canonical Story Title: A priest becomes insane after his entire family dies of the plague.
The milk of Saint Mary that was poured on the ground in Egypt.
Incipit: ወእምዝ፡ ንጽሕፍ፡ ኀይለ፡ ወተአምረ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በደወለ፡ ግብጽ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ እንዘ፡ ተሐውር፡ በውስተ፡ ፍኖት፡ መልአ፡ ፈድፋደ፡ ሐሊብ፡ በውስተ፡ አጥባቲሃ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to an official who kidnapped a girl that had made a vow of virginity.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
The monk of Däbrä Qaləmon who did not fast.
The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
The composition of the Wǝddāse Maryam by the Syrian potter.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The Ethiopian pilgrim who was expelled from the Church (of the Resurrection) in Jerusalem during the Easter services.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ መንክረ፡ ወመድምመ፡ ኀይለ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ በኢየሩሳሌም፡ ቅድስት፡ ሀገረ፡ እግዚአብሔር። ወበውእቱ፡ መዋዕል፡ ሶበ፡ ገብሩ፡ ሁከከ፡ ወቀትለ፡ በላዕለ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ተፀርዓ፡ ፍኖተ፡ ነጋድያን፡ እምጸብዓ፡ ፈያት፡ እኩያን

Canonical Story Title: The icon of Saint Mary in the church of the "Romans" that rebuked the Ethiopians for approaching with their shoes on.
Incipit: ኀይል፡ ወተአምር፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በኢየሩሳሌም፡ ቅድስት፡ ሀገሩ፡ ለንጉሥ፡ ዐቢይ። ወሀሎ፡ ሥዕለ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ በውስተ፡ ምስጋዶሙ፡ ለሰብአ፡ ሮም፡ ወኵሎሙ፡ ሰብአ፡ ግብጽ፡ ወአፍርንግ፡ ወእስክንድርያ፡ ወሶርያ፡ ወገላትያ፡ ይበውኡ፡ ኀበ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሥዕል

Canonical Story Title: The rich man who left the church because the priest was saying the Anaphora of Saint Mary, Gwasca, on a big feast day.
Incipit: ኀይል፡ ወተአምር፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ወሀለወ፡ ህየ፡ አሐዱ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ኃይሉ፡ ወኢይቄድስ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ቅዳሴሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም

Canonical Story Title: The rich persons who stored their wealth in a church.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እንተ፡ ተሐንጸት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወብዙኃን፡ አብዕልት፡ ወበዓልታተ፡ ቤት፡ ይነብሩ፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ወበዑላን፡ ጥቀ፡ በንዋየ፡ ወርቅ፡ ወብሩር፡ ወበአልባሰ፡ ሠርጕ፡ ክቡር

Canonical Story Title: The man who lost a slave that he was about to sell in Barara.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ነጋዲ፡ በደወለ፡ አግዓዚ፡ ዘይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ፈድፋደ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ተሠየጠ፡ ገብረ፡ እምምሥያተ፡ ዳሞት፡ ወሖረ፡ ለአርብሖ፡ ውስተ፡ ምሥያተ፡ በራራ

Canonical Story Title: The shepherd near the church of Saint Paul in Rome who was possessed by a demon.
The monasteries summon King (Dawit) of Ethiopia to abdicate.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ ኵልክሙ፡ ማኅበረ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዐቢየ፡ ኀይለ፡ ወዕፁበ፡ ተአምረ፡ በላዕለ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ፍቁረ፡ ወልዳ፡ ወላእከ፡ ዚአሃ። እምዘገብረት፡ ሎቱ፡ ብዙኃተ፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክራተ፡ ዕፁባተ፡ ወመድምማተ፡ ዘያስተፌሥሕ፡ ልበ፡ ሰማዕያን፡ ወዘይትነከር፡ በዐውደ፡ ጉቡኣን፡ ዝንቱ፡ ውእቱ፡ ቀዳሜ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘገብረት፡ ሎቱ፡ ለውእቱ፡ ንጉሥ። ወአመ፡ አንበሮ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በመንበረ፡ አበዊሁ፡ ዳዊት፡ ወሰሎሞን፡ ሶቤሃ፡ ፈነወ፡ ላእካነ፡ ውስተ፡ ኵሉ፡ አህጉረ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ኀበ፡ ሀለዉ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ እለ፡ በአድባራት፡ ወገዳማት

Canonical Story Title: The carpenter who asked for a copy of the Gadla samaˁtat as a reward for his services in building a church.
Incipit: ወሶበ፡ አኃዙ፡ የሐንጹ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ እለ፡ ደብረ፡ ማርያም፡ አስተጋብኡ፡ ብዙኃነ፡ ጸረብተ፡ ዕፀው፡ ወአእባን። ወሐነጹ፡ በዐቢይ፡ ትጋህ፡ ስሳ፡ መነኮሳት፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ይደምሩ፡ አሐደ፡ እምሰብአ፡ ዓለም፡ ዳእሙ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ መነኮሳት፡ ልቡሳነ፡ አስኬማ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to a priest of Däbrä Maryam in Sire.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በማዕዶተ፡ ተከዜ፡ በምድረ፡ ሲሬ፡ እንተ፡ ትሰመይ፡ ደብረ፡ ማርያም፡ ወአመ፡ ፳፡ ወ፩፡ ለወርኃ፡ ጥር፡ ይትጋብኡ፡ ብዙኃን፡ ሕዝብ፡ ለገቢረ፡ በዓለ፡ ዕረፍታ፡ ለማርያም፡ ወለተዝካረ፡ መምህራንሂ፡ አባ፡ ቶማስ፡ ወአባ፡ ፊቅጦር

Canonical Story Title: The pilgrim who was journeying to Jerusalem through Hamda.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ በእንተ፡ አሐዱ፡ ነጋዲ፡ ወእንዘ፡ የሐውር፡ ውስተ፡ ፍኖተ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ሶበ፡ በጽሐ፡ ኀበ፡ ምድረ፡ በድው፡ እንተ፡ ትሰመይ፡ ሐምዳ፡ ወመዋዕሊሁኒ፡ መዋዕለ፡ ሃጋይ፡ አመ፡ ፲፡ ወ፮፡ ለየካቲት፡ በዕለተ፡ በዐል፡ ዐቢይ፡ በዘነሥአት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ኪዳነ፡ ምሕረት፡ እምኀበ፡ ወልዳ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ

Canonical Story Title: The icon of Saint Mary in a church of Alexandria that some Europeans tried to steal.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በደወለ፡ ግብጽ፡ በምኵናነ፡ ምስር፡ በሀገረ፡ ዐባይ፡ እለ፡ ስክንድርያ፡ በመንበረ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ወንጌላዊ፡ ወሕንጽት፡ ይእቲ፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘሥዑል፡ በወርቅ

Canonical Story Title: The punishment of a custodian of a church who did not obey the bishop.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እንተ፡ ተሐንጸት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወብዙኃን፡ ሕዝብ፡ ወካህናት፡ ይነብሩ፡ ውስቴታ። ወዐቃቢሃ፡ ለይእቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዕቡይ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወዝኁር፡ ወኢይትለአክ፡ በንጹሕ

Canonical Story Title: The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
The icon of Saint Mary that did not burn when the rest of the house was destroyed.
Incipit: ኀይለ፡ ወተአምረ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በላዕለ፡ ሥዕላ። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ነዳይ፡ ዘያፈቅሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ልዑል፡ በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ኀይሉ፡ ወይጸውር፡ ሥዕለ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ለማርያም፡ በንጹሕ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ርስሐት

Canonical Story Title: The pious monk who drowned while crossing a river on his way to a feast that was being given by a rich man in honor of the Assumption.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘያፈቅሮ፡ ለአግዚአብሔር፡ ልዑል፡ ወይትለአካ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ሕሊናሁ፡ ወያነብብ፡ ወትረ፡ ውዳሴያቲሃ፡ ወሰላማቲሃ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ አፅርዖ። ወእንዘ፡ ሀለወ፡ በዘከመዝ፡ ግብር፡ ውእቱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ጸውዖ፡ አሐዱ፡ ባዕል፡ ለገቢረ፡ በዓለ፡ ፍልሰታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The blind teacher whom his pupils wanted to push over a cliff while they were on their way to a feast being given in honor of the Assumption.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ እንተ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ መንክረ፡ ወመድምመ፡ ወዕፁበ፡ ኀይለ፡ ተአምር፡ በላዕለ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ፍቁረ፡ ዚአሃ። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ባዕል፡ ዘይገብር፡ በዓለ፡ ፍልሰታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በአምሳለ፡ ትንሣእሁ፡ ለወልዳ፡ በአፅግቦ፡ ርኁባን፡ ወበአርውዮ፡ ጽሙዓን፡ ወበአልብሶ፡ ዕሩያን

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Theocleia and prepares her for martyrdom.
Incipit: ኀይለ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘገብረት፡ ላዕለ፡ ብፅዕት፡ ወኅሪት፡ ታውክልያ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ወብእሲተ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ዮስጦስ፡ ወእመ፡ አቦሊ፡ ሰማዕት። ወእንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ ታውክልያ፡ ቀዲማ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ጸሎት

Canonical Story Title: Mareqos, King of Romeya, abandons his throne secretly to become a monk.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The people of Romeya appeal to Patriarch Dionysius to find King Mareqos.
The abbot who rejected the horologium and other works of Abba Giyorgis.
Incipit: ጸጋ፡ ወኃይለ፡ ዘመንክር፡ ወመድምም፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መምህረ፡ ደብር፡ ዘፍጹም፡ በኵሉ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወበሃይማኖት፡ ባሕቱ፡ ይጸልእ፡ ወይሜንን፡ ማኅሌተ፡ አቡነ፡ ጊዮርጊስ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary cuts short her visit to a pious monk when she hears her name invoked according to the horologium of Abba Giyorgis.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ ኦደቂቀ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ኀይለ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ዘከመ፡ ገብረት፡ ሎሙ፡ ለእለ፡ ይጸመድዋ፡ ወይትለአክዋ፡ በኵሉ፡ ልቦሙ፡ ወይትቀነዩ፡ ሰዓታተ፡ ፍቁራ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ መዓልተ፡ ወሌሊተ። ወሀለወ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘያፈቅሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ልዑል፡ በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ኀይሉ፡ ወወትረ፡ ትሔውፆ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በእንተ፡ ቅድስናሁ፡ ወበእንተ፡ ንጽሐ፡ ሕሊናሁ

Canonical Story Title: The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
A young monk is horrified when he has a sexual dream.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ በእንተ፡ አሐዲ፡ ብእሲ፡ ኄር፡ ወፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወፍጹም፡ ውእቱ፡ በምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወበሃይማኖት። ወእንዘ፡ ሀለወ፡ በንእሱ፡ ነሥአ፡ አስኬማ፡ መላእክት፡ በንጽሕ፡ ወበቅድስና። ወእምአመ፡ ለብሰ፡ ልብሰ፡ ምንኵስና፡ ወሶበ፡ ኮኖ፡ ፬፡ ዓመተ፡ አእመረ፡ ሕልመ፡ ሌሊት

Canonical Story Title: When a couple tries to marry their son whom they had dedicated to Saint Mary, he falls sick to the point of death.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዲ፡ ብእሲ፡ ኄር፡ ወፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ፈድፋደ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወባዕል፡ ውእቱ፡ ጥቀ፡ ወብእሲቱኒ፡ ኄርት፡ ይእቲ፡ ወፍጽምት፡ በምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወበሃይማኖት። ወባሕቱ፡ ብዙኃ፡ ይቴክዙ፡ ወየሐዝኑ፡ በእንተ፡ ሀጢአ፡ ውሉድ

Canonical Story Title: The monk from a monstery on an island who could not find his boat when he wanted to return.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በደሴተ፡ ባሕር፡ እንተ፡ ተሐንጸት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወብዙኃ፡ ተአምራተ፡ ወመንክራተ፡ ይትገበር፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወመቃብሪሁ፡ ይእቲ፡ ለብፁዕ፡ ጌርሎስ፡ ሰማዕተ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘፈጸመ፡ ስምዖ፡ በእደ፡ ቆዝሞስ፡ ዕልው፡ ዘምስለ፡ ፵፡ ወ፬፡ ሰማዕታት። ወበህየ፡ ሀለዉ፡ ክልኤት፡ አኃው፡ ጽሙዳን፡ ወትረ፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ደሴት፡ በጾም፡ ወበጸሎት፡ ወበጸማ፡ ዐቢይ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Alexius lives for fifteen years near a church of Saint Mary in Armenia.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ኀይለ፡ ወተአምረ፡ በላዕለ፡ ብፁዕ፡ ገብረ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወልደ፡ ቴዎዶስዮስ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ቍስጥንጥንያ። ወእምአመ፡ ወፅአ፡ እምቤተ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወእሙ፡ መኒኖ፡ መንግሥተ፡ ወኀዲጎ፡ መርዓተ፡ ኀበ፡ ነገደ፡ ርሑቀ፡ መጠነ፡ አሐቲ፡ ዓመት፡ ወበጽሐ፡ ሀገረ፡ እንተ፡ ስማ፡ አርማንያ

Canonical Story Title: The history of Abba Bula/Abib.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ እምነ፡ በሐውርተ፡ ሉፊ፡ ወእምጸዓዳ፡ ወስሙ፡ ለውእቱ፡ ብእሲ፡ አብርሃም፡ ወስመ፡ ብእሲቱኒ፡ ሀሪክ፡ መሃይምናን፡ በክርስቶስ፡ ወንጹሓን፡ እሙንቱ፡ ወአልቦሙ፡ ውሉደ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary gives a thirsty dog water to drink from her shoe.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The paralytic who was healed on the 16th of Nahase.
A stream runs uphill after his neighbor had diverted it.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The woman from Cairo whose children all died.
The faded icon of Saint Mary that the mother-in-law wanted to discard.
Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.
Some of the deceased great Fathers of the Desert appear to the monks of Scete.
The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
The cupbearer of the king of France.
Tiras, who did not observe holy days, becomes deaf and dumb, but he is healed when his master prays to Saint Mary.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…፡ ደቂቀ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወእግዚአብሔር፡ ያርኁ፡ አናቅጸ፡ ልብክሙ፡ ለሰሚዓ፡ ተአምሪሃ። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘይሰመይ፡ ጢራስ፡ ወሖረ፡ ምስለ፡ እግዚኡ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ልዑል፡ ወመፍቀሬ፡ እሙ፡ ድንግል

Canonical Story Title: The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
The knight who wanted to seduce the daughter of the cobbler.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ሐመር፡ ዐባይ፡ በውስተ፡ ባሕር፡ ወምሉኣን፡ ሰብእ፡ ውስቴታ፡ ወባዕዳንሰ፡ ነጋድያን፡ ወሊቃውንት፡ እለ፡ ውስተ፡ ሐመር፡ ወምስሌሆሙ፡ ሀለወ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
Saint Mary makes a covenant with King Dawit of Ethiopia.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ክርስቲያናዊ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወርቱዕ፡ ሃይማኖቱ፡ ወሠናይ፡ ግዕዙ፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወእምብዝኃ፡ አፍቅሮቱ፡ ዚአሃ፡ አግበረ፡ ሥዕለ፡ በአምሳሊሃ

Canonical Story Title: The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
The general of King (Dawit) of Ethiopia who defected to the enemy.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ክርስቲያናዊ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ልዑል፡ ወመፍቀሬ፡ እሙ፡ ድንግል፡ ወጽኑዕ፡ ሃይማኖቱ፡ ወሠናይ፡ ምግባሩ። ወቦቱ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ዘሥዑል፡ በወርቅ፡ ወወትረ፡ ይጼሊ፡ ኀበ፡ ውእቱ፡ ሥዕል፡ በጊዜ፡ ረከቦ፡ ሐዘን፡ ወትካዝ። ወመልአከ፡ ኃይሉ፡ ለንጉሥ፡ ዐለዎ

Canonical Story Title: The brigands who killed each other at the miraculous spring.
The mighty Goliath threatens to destroy the monastery of Saint Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The young man who was ready to serve Satan, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
The bankrupt merchant to whom Satan offered two pearls if he would deny Christ and Saint Mary.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The Jewish cowherd who was baptized by his Christian companions.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ በውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘጥልጥልያ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ደቅስዮስ፡ ወኮነ፡ ብእሴ፡ ቡሩከ፡ ወኄረ፡ ወፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The church of Saint Mary that moved by itself to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea.
Some of the deceased great Fathers of the Desert appear to the monks of Scete.
The man who would not eat before receiving Holy Communion.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘያፈቅር፡ ቍርባነ፡ ወኢይጥዕም፡ እክለ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ይንሣእ፡ ቍርባነ

Canonical Story Title: The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The church built on the tomb of Saint Mary that will turn into a ship.
A priest is warned by an angel not to rush when incensing the icon of Saint Mary.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.

The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.

The story of Abadir, a district governor of Egypt.

The temptations that Akroseya, the wife of Qawestos, overcame.

When a couple tries to marry their son whom they had dedicated to Saint Mary, he falls sick to the point of death.

The history of Abba Bula/Abib.

Saint Mary helps a poor man become wealthy.
Tiras, who did not observe holy days, becomes deaf and dumb, but he is healed when his master prays to Saint Mary.
Saint Mary appears to a monk and saves him from being deceived by Satan.
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The miraculous spring of Mehzab.
The story of Julius Aqfahasi.
The story of Abadir, a district governor of Egypt.
The story of King Tarses of Fars, who loved to kill Christians.
King Yasay of Egypt, who became a monk in Däbrä Rom.
The Jew from Rome who wanted to kill Christians, but was seized by the priests of the church of Saint Mary.
Saint Mary heals the wounds of Ermeyis of Sidon with a drop of her milk.
Patriarch Tewoqritos of Jerusalem rebukes King Akratis of Egypt for not fasting or praying.
The story of Astaqaˀos, the European potter who was buried alive.
The temptations that Akroseya, the wife of Qawestos, overcame.
The story of Saint Menas and his brother.

The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
The monk of Däbrä Qaləmon who did not fast.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መነኮስ፡ በደብረ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘቀልሞን፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወያነብብ፡ ወትረ፡ ተአምኆተ፡ መልአክ፡ ሌሊተ፡ ወመዐልተ። ወዝንቱሰ፡ ብእሲ፡ ኢይጸውም፡ ወኢይጼሊ፡ ወይትሜሰል፡ ከመ፡ አብድ፡ ወእንቡዝ

Canonical Story Title: The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.
Elizabeth, the blind daughter of Abraham and Gera Anest of Baderman.
The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.

A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The composition of the Wǝddāse Maryam by the Syrian potter.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The son of a rich official of Cappadocia is raised from the dead.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.

When Sefengeya, wife of King Masfeyanos of Romeya, prays to have a child before the icon of Saint Mary, the icon inclines its head; Sefengeya then conceives Yeshaq (Abba Garima).
Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon intercedes for an angel who had disobeyed the command of God.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.

Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ፩ብእሲ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ባዕል፡ ጥቀ፡ በወርቅ፡ ወበብሩር፡ ወበንዋያተ፡ ዝ፡ ዓለም፡ ዘሠናይ፡ ግዕዙ፡ ወኄር፡ በኵሉ፡ ግብሩ፡ ኮነ፡ ይሴስዮሙ፡ ዘልፈ፡ ለ፪ዕደው

Canonical Story Title: The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
Synaxary entry for the 16th of Yakkatit: Saint Mary receives the Pact of Mercy (kidan mehret).
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ እምድኅረ፡ ዓርገ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ውስተ፡ ሰማይ፡ ነሢኦ፡ ሥጋሃ፡ ንጹሐ፡ ወነበረ፡ በየማነ፡ አቡሁ፡ ፈጺሞ፡ ኵሎ፡ ሕገ፡ ትስብእት፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ኀጢአት፡ ባሕቲታ፡ ወሰሊጦ፡ ሕማማተ፡ መስቀል፡ በሥጋ፡ በሥምረቱ፡ ወበፈቃዱ፡ ዘገብሮ፡ በእንተ፡ መድኃኒትነ፡ ኃደጋ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ረድኡ

Canonical Story Title: The annual apparition of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ወይትጋብኡ፡ ባቲ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ሕዝበ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ አመ፡ ፳፡ ወ፩፡ ለወርኃ፡ ግንቦት፡ ወይገብሩ፡ በዓለ፡ ዐቢየ፡ በእንተ፡ አስተርእዮተ፡ ገጻ፡ ገሃደ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡….

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family hides from thieves in a sycamore tree at Däbrä Metmaq.
The paralytic who was healed on the 16th of Nahase.
When Sefengeya, wife of King Masfeyanos of Romeya, prays to have a child before the icon of Saint Mary, the icon inclines its head; Sefengeya then conceives Yeshaq (Abba Garima).
The church built on the tomb of Saint Mary that will turn into a ship.
A priest is warned by an angel not to rush when incensing the icon of Saint Mary.
An Egyptian woman comes to Saint Mary in Bethlehem and is healed of her fever.
A woman whose right eye had been blinded by a demon is healed by Saint Mary.
The wealthy man to whom Saint Mary appeared in the form of a bird to save the countryside from pestilence.
The cistern at Däbrä Metmaq is filled miraculously.
Saint Mary appears to Yohannes Kama.
Saint Mary restores his eye to a thief from Saf who had been deprived of it by order of the judge.

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears as a winged maiden to John, a monk of Saint Macarius.
The icon of Saint Mary in the church of the "Romans" that rebuked the Ethiopians for approaching with their shoes on.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Prochorus reports Saint John's visit to Saint Mary's dwelling place.
Saint Mary heals a poor man from skin disease whom people had refused to carry to church.
The monk whose only good work was observing the fast of Saint Mary.
Saint Mary heals a poor man from skin disease whom people had refused to carry to church.
The pious priest to whom Satan came for confession.
The king's washerman who was attacked by a lion.
A young man whom his mother had vowed to the service of Saint Mary becomes impotent when his parents try to wed him.
The couple that were guided by the wife's dream to find buried money with which to build a shrine to Saint Mary.
The thief who was caught stealing from the church of Saint Mary and was released by his captors when he prayed to her.
The magistrate whom the king accused of embezzlement.
The fisherman who was eaten up by a dragon but was found alive when the dragon's belly was cut open.
The couple that were guided by the wife's dream to find buried money with which to build a shrine to Saint Mary.

Saint Mary brings gifts to Abba Samuˀel of Wali.

The story of Abadir, a district governor of Egypt.
The old woman from Sembat who gave the offering for Saint Mary to Saint George.

Saint Mary is found to be pregnant.

When Sefengeya, wife of King Masfeyanos of Romeya, prays to have a child before the icon of Saint Mary, the icon inclines its head; Sefengeya then conceives Yeshaq (Abba Garima).
During the famine of 1120 MM [likely 1404 CE], the Arabs try to plunder the monasteries of Egypt.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.

The daughter of the rich man from Caesarea who could not deliver her baby.

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ celebrates Mass for Saint Mary.
The church of Saint Mary in Spain to which she used to bring Christian captives.
The woman from Cairo whose children all died.
The hungry man whom Saint Mary used to feed.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The five sorrows of Saint Mary.
The reopening of the church in Harat Zuwayla.
The nominal Christian from Sidon who encountered a dragon.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
The monk of Däbrä Qaləmon who did not fast.

The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.

The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.

Saint Mary appears to the brother of Saint Basil, Saint Gregory, bishop of "the Islands" (i.e. of Nyassa).
The king who invited Abba Abreham to come and discuss spiritual matters.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አብርሃም፡ ዘያፈቅሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይትጋነይ፡ መዓልተ፡ ወሌሊተ፡ በጾም፡ ወበጸሎት፡ በሰጊድ፡ በባሕር፡ ወበግበብ፡ ወበጽሙድ፡ በፍቅረ፡ አምላኩ፡ ውስተ፡ ልቡ፡ ወውስተ፡ አባሉ፡ እንዘ፡ ይነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገሩ

Canonical Story Title: A bishop asks a man for the prayer that saved him from Satan.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ዘይቤሎ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ንግረኒ፡ ጸሎተ፡ ዘያድኅንከ፡ እምሰይጣን፡ እኩይ

Canonical Story Title: The dogs of the hunter praise Saint Mary.
The three monks who attempted to say Mass in a mosque.
Saint Mary brings gifts to Abba Samuˀel of Wali.
The reopening of the church in Harat Zuwayla.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family hides from thieves in a sycamore tree at Däbrä Metmaq.
The pious abbot who was falsely accused by his monks of sinning with a woman.
The thief who was caught stealing from the church of Saint Mary and was released by his captors when he prayed to her.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family hides from thieves in a sycamore tree at Däbrä Metmaq.
Holy Family journey cycle: The rich Egyptian woman who refused to give water to the Holy Family.
The girl who was going to be stoned after she was caught committing fornication.
Saint Mary appears to a monk and saves him from being deceived by Satan.
Saint Mary gives a garment to a poor monk.
Saint Mary heals a poor man from skin disease whom people had refused to carry to church.
The pious priest to whom Satan came for confession.
The king's washerman who was attacked by a lion.
A young man whom his mother had vowed to the service of Saint Mary becomes impotent when his parents try to wed him.
The magistrate whom the king accused of embezzlement.
The couple that were guided by the wife's dream to find buried money with which to build a shrine to Saint Mary.
The hunter who caught a gassa kalb in his net.
The man who wanted to give a banquet on Saint Mary's feast but was unable because of a famine.
The sinner whom Saint Mary healed after his relatives had spent all his money on physicians.
The pious abbot who was falsely accused by his monks of sinning with a woman.
The thief who was caught stealing from the church of Saint Mary and was released by his captors when he prayed to her.
Abba Behor has a vision of Saint Mary.
The hungry man whom Saint Mary used to feed.
Saint Mary gives a garment to a poor monk.
An abbot in Scete sees first a multitude of demons, then a multitude of saints.
A priest is warned by an angel not to rush when incensing the icon of Saint Mary.
An Egyptian woman comes to Saint Mary in Bethlehem and is healed of her fever.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አብሰራ፡ መልአክ፡ እንዘ፡ ተሐውር፡ ኀበ፡ ማይ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ተንሥአት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወሖረት፡ ትቅዳሕ፡ ማየ፡ ወታምጽእ፡ እምውስተ፡ ዐዘቅት፡ በናዝሬት፡ ሀገረ፡ ዳዊት

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Saint Sarabamon, the future bishop of Nikiou and martyr.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Three virgins come to serve Saint Mary as she is about to give birth.
A woman who had poisoned her sister and married her husband is swallowed up by the earth when she anoints herself with the oil that flowed from Saint Mary's icon.
Saint Mary rescues the ship in which Mar Barsuma is travelling.
Saint Mary appears to the disciples of Mar Barsuma in the form of a dove.
Saint Mary appears to the brother of Saint Basil, Saint Gregory, bishop of "the Islands" (i.e. of Nyassa).
The chastisement of the heretic, Nestorius.
Saint Mary gives a cup of the water of life to an Ethiopian monk in Jerusalem.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መነኮስ፡ ወይቤ፡ ርኢክዎ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መስተጋድል፡ ወጽሙድ፡ ወተሐየሰ፡ ምስለ፡ ካልኡ፡ ገብረ፡ እግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Annunciation of cycle: On the conception of Christ.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ ንንግርክሙ፡ ዕበያ፡ ወክብራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ዘአመ፡ ኮነ፡ ፶፭፻፡ እምፍጥረተ፡ ዓለም፡ ወሠምረ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ከመ፡ ይሐውጽ፡ ግብረ፡ እደዊሁ፡ ወያግብኦሙ፡ እምግብርናት፡ መሪር

Canonical Story Title: The woman whose baby daughter was carried off by a hyena.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ወታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወወለደት፡ ይእቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ አሐተ፡ ወለተ፡ ወመሰጣ፡ ዝእብ፡ ለይእቲ፡ ወለት

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays to be taken from this life.
The wife of a pagan official who wished to pray at the Holy Sepulcher is prevented until she is baptized.
Christ makes Saint Peter head of the Church.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews go to Bethlehem to seize Saint Mary but are blinded.
The monastic community that was supplied with provisions by Saint Mary.
A child and his mother see the icon of Saint Mary weeping for the sins of the world.
Bishop Hildephonsus sees the icon of Saint Mary sweating; she asks him to raise a girl from the dead.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ደቅስዮስ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ዘጥልጥልያ፡ ወእንዘ፡ ሀለወ፡ ቀዊሞ፡ በቅዳሴ፡ ርእየ፡ ሥዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እንዘ፡ ይውኅዝ፡ ኃፍ

Canonical Story Title: The woman whose baby daughter was carried off by a hyena.
The woman who was falsely accused of killing the child she was nursing and was condemned to death.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ዘታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወትፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወምታሰ፡ እኩይ፡ ጥቀ፡ ወነዳይት፡ ይእቲ፡ በእሲት። ወሶበ፡ አጽንዓታ፡ ንዴት፡ ቦአት፡ ውስተ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ ወኮነት፡ ሐፃኒተ

Canonical Story Title: An official who used to rob the poor is converted when a monk reveals that Satan was acting as his counsellor.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይጼሊ፡ ወትረ፡ ሰላመ፡ መልአክ፡ ወኢየአምር፡ ጸሎተ፡ ካልአ፡ ዘእንበሌሁ። ወውእቱ፡ ይትዔገል፡ ነዳያነ፡ ወየኃይድ፡ ንዋዮሙ

Canonical Story Title: The three monks who attempted to say Mass in a mosque.
Incipit: ወሀለዉ፡ ፫፡ መነኮሳት፡ ቀሳውስት፡ በሀገረ፡ ጥልጥልያ፡ ዘያፈቅርዋ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወሖሩ፡ እምይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ መጠነ፡ ፲፡ ምህዋረ፡ ዕለት፡ ወረከቡ፡ ምስጋዶሙ፡ ለአረሚ

Canonical Story Title: An Arab steals the scissors of the tailor of Däbrä Qaləmon.
Archbishop Tilas, who was seized by Jews while carrying a golden chalice.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ጳጳስ፡ በደወለ፡ አፍርንጊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጢላስ፡ ዘይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወያከብራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀለወ፡ በንዋሙ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በእንተ፡ ጽዋዕ፡ ዘቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን

Canonical Story Title: Elias from Elkesus, who was falsely accused and was suspended by the abbot.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ እልክሱስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ኤልያስ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ለለ፡ ተጸውዓ፡ ስመ፡ በዓላ፡ ይለብስ፡ አልባሰ፡ ተክህኖ፡ ወይቄድስ፡ ቅዳሴሃ፡ ለእመ፡ ብርሃን። ወሐመይዎ፡ ካህናተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን

Canonical Story Title: King Bartaqu of Greece, who became a monk.
The European who wanted to steal the bars of the door to the Manger at Bethlehem.
Qommos Raphael from Däbrä ʾƎnṣǝnā and the sacrament of confession.
Saint Mary anoints sick animals and heals them at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Message of Saint Mary to Anthony, monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Anthony, the monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam, asks about the anointing of the animals.
The story of Saint Alexius [Abdo l a-Masih], son of Emperor Theodosius.
The church of Saint Mary in Spain to which she used to bring Christian captives.
Some Christians held captive by a Muslim are freed by an angel and are brought to Cyprus.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
The apparitions of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq.
The untrustworthy camel driver of Däbrä Metmaq.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ celebrates Mass for Saint Mary.
When the destruction of Däbrä Metmaq is reported in Ethiopia, the king orders the construction of a new monastery to take its place.
The Muslims who spent the night at the ruins of Däbrä Metmaq.
Saint Mary shows those assembled at Däbrä Metmaq a vision of Mohammad in Hell.
The poor man from Aragon [Spain] who was buried alive in a gold mine.
Patriarch Abraham and the interpretation of the parable of the mustard seed.
The lamp of the Christian from Mǝneta Diyāqon that was blown out by the wind.
The Frenchman whose wife was unable to have children.
The European who wanted to steal the bars of the door to the Manger at Bethlehem.
The husband who denied Christ when he became poor.
Thieves try to steal from a church of Saint Mary in Syria but are unable to bring what they have stolen out of the church.
The priest Thomas sees Saint Mary inscribing the names of those who praise her on the fiery chariot of gold.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ደብር፡ ዘመነኮሳት፡ ወያፈቅርዋ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ጥቀ፡ ፈድፋደ፡ ወይገብሩ፡ ተዝካራ፡ በዐቢይ፡ ተጠንቅቆ፡ አመ፡ ፳፡ ወ፩፡ ለወርኃ፡ ጥር

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Nativity of cycle: Saint Mary heals the daughter of Arsaban while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Qommos Raphael from Däbrä ʾƎnṣǝnā and the sacrament of confession.
The girl who was going to be stoned after she was caught committing fornication.
Saint Mary heals a poor man from skin disease whom people had refused to carry to church.
The pious priest to whom Satan came for confession.
The king's washerman who was attacked by a lion.
A young man whom his mother had vowed to the service of Saint Mary becomes impotent when his parents try to wed him.
The man who would not eat before receiving Holy Communion.
The couple that were guided by the wife's dream to find buried money with which to build a shrine to Saint Mary.
The monk whose only good work was observing the fast of Saint Mary.
A sinner is saved from damnation because he had built a shrine in the name of Saint Mary.
Saint Mary gives a garment to a poor monk.
The monastic community that was supplied with provisions by Saint Mary.
The judgment of the court of Zärˀa Yaˁəqob against the Stephanites.
The monk whose only good work was observing the fast of Saint Mary.
The wife of Mark, a priest from Mallawi, is cured of her leprosy.
The husband who denied Christ when he became poor.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the rich man who refused to give him a tablet [saleda] for an icon of Saint Mary.
The healing of the Egyptian King Soforon (or Safron).
The priest, Zacharias, who was about to hang himself so as not to see his son die.
Saint Mary turns water over which her anaphora was recited by Abba Samuˀel of Wali into miraculous bread.
Saint Mary brings gifts to Abba Samuˀel of Wali.
Satan tries to prevent Abba Samuˀel of Wali from praying by seizing his prayer book.
Praise of Saint Mary's greatness.
Mary, Conception of cycle: The descent of the holy seed from Adam to Saint Mary.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: God sends Saint Gabriel to Saint Mary for the Annunciation.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: The Jews plot to kill Saint Mary because of the miracles she was working while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Saint Mary leaves the Temple and enters the home of Saint Joseph.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The adoration of the shepherds and the Magi.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The Circumcision.
Holy Family journey cycle: Herod orders the slaughter of the Innocents; a hunter with his dogs finds the Holy Family in flight from the king.
Holy Family journey cycle: The hunter reports to King Demateyanos, who comes to visit the Holy Family.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to return from the mountains of Lebanon to Bethlehem.
Holy Family journey cycle: An angel tells Saint Joseph to take Saint Mary and her child to Egypt.
Holy Family journey cycle: All Israel is upset by the coming of the Magi; Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to flee to the mountains of Lebanon.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Magi find the Holy Family and depart; Saint Mary flees to Tiberias and from there to the mountains of Lebanon.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family stays in Dirde.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Mary's prayer while in the wilderness of Edomeyas.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family returns from Egypt by way of Gaza.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Mary is welcomed when she returns to Galilee.
A container of oil remains suspended in mid air in a church of Saint Mary when the cord by which it was suspended breaks.
The pious priest to whom Satan came for confession.
The couple that were guided by the wife's dream to find buried money with which to build a shrine to Saint Mary.
The man who wanted to give a banquet on Saint Mary's feast but was unable because of a famine.
Christ gives Ethiopia as tithes to Saint Mary.
A man killed during the construction of the church of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam is raised from the dead.
The Egyptian woman who lost a silver plate while bathing in a miraculous spring.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees a vision of Saint Mary in glory.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ celebrates Mass for Saint Mary.
The son of Emperor Tiberius is raised from the dead.
John the Evangelist paints an icon of the Crucifixion for Emperor Tiberius.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: A soldier redeems the Child Jesus from another soldier who was thinking of handing him over to King Herod.
The story of Julius Aqfahasi.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ አቅፋሐሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮልዮስ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይጼሊ፡ ወትረ፡ ቅድመ፡ ሥዕላ። ወአስተርአየቶ፡ ከመ፡ ይቅብር፡ ሥጋሆሙ፡ ለሰማዕታት

Canonical Story Title: The story of Abadir, a district governor of Egypt.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ በደወለ፡ ግብጽ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አባዲር፡ ዘይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይጼሊ፡ ወትረ፡ ሰላማ፡ በጥቡዕ፡ ህሊና፡ ከመ፡ ታድሕኖ፡ እምእኩይ

Canonical Story Title: The story of King Tarses of Fars, who loved to kill Christians.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ በሀገረ፡ ፋርስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጠርስስ፡ ዘፍካሬሁ፡ ቀታሊ፡ ወኢይምሕክ፡ ዕደወ፡ ወአንስተ፡ ወኢየአምር፡ ለእግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: King Yasay of Egypt, who became a monk in Däbrä Rom.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ በደወለ፡ ግብጽ፡ ዘስሙ፡ የሳይ፡ ወእንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ በመንግሥቱ፡ ወኮነ፡ ያፈቅሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወያስብራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይኩን፡ በጽድቅ

Canonical Story Title: The Jew from Rome who wanted to kill Christians, but was seized by the priests of the church of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወበጽንፈ፡ ሀገራ፡ ይነብር፡ አሐዱ፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ ዘይመሰጥ፡ ኵሎ፡ ዘረከበ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ መጽአ፡ እንዘ፡ የኀብዕ፡ ሰይፎ፡ ውስተ፡ ሕጽኑ፡ ከመ፡ ይቅትል፡ ክርስቲያነ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary heals the wounds of Ermeyis of Sidon with a drop of her milk.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወሬዛ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሲዶና፡ ዘስሙ፡ ኤርምያስ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይገብር፡ በዐላ፡ በተአምኖ። ወበአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ወፅአ፡ ውስተ፡ ፀብዕ፡ ወአኃዝዎ፡ ማእከለ፡ ቀትል

Canonical Story Title: Patriarch Tewoqritos of Jerusalem rebukes King Akratis of Egypt for not fasting or praying.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ በሀገረ፡ ኢየራሳሌም፡ ቴዎቅሪጦስ፡ ስሙ፡ ዘሠናይ፡ ግዕዙ፡ ወርቱዕ፡ ሃይማኖቱ፡ ወኮነ፡ ይጼሊ፡ ወይገይስ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወይመጽውት፡ ለነዳያን፡ ወለምስኪናን

Canonical Story Title: The story of Astaqaˀos, the European potter who was buried alive.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ለብሐዊ፡ በደወለ፡ አፍርንጂ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አስታቀኦስ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይገብር፡ በዓላ፡ በተአምኖ፡ ወይሁብ፡ ምጽወተ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያና፡ ለነዳያን፡ ወለምስኪናን

Canonical Story Title: The temptations that Akroseya, the wife of Qawestos, overcame.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በሀገረ፡ ቃህራ፡ ዘስማ፡ አክሮስያ፡ ብእሲተ፡ ቀውስጦስ፡ ዘትገብር፡ በዓለ፡ ኪዳና፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወዘረወት፡ ንዋየ፡ ለነዳያን፡ ወለምስኪናን፡ ምስለ፡ ቀውስጦስ፡ ብእሲሃ

Canonical Story Title: The story of Saint Menas and his brother.
The soul of Christina, the wife of Aaron, an Egyptian official, goes to Heaven.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በደወለ፡ ግብጽ፡ ዘስማ፡ ቅርስጢና፡ ብእሲተ፡ አሮን፡ መኰንን፡ ዘትፈርፎ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ መፍርህ፡ በነበልባሉ፡ ወታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወትገብር፡ በዓላ፡ በክብር

Canonical Story Title: The sinner whom Saint Mary healed after his relatives had spent all his money on physicians.
The pious abbot who was falsely accused by his monks of sinning with a woman.
The thief who was caught stealing from the church of Saint Mary and was released by his captors when he prayed to her.
The fisherman who was eaten up by a dragon but was found alive when the dragon's belly was cut open.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: A soldier redeems the Child Jesus from another soldier who was thinking of handing him over to King Herod.
The man who would not eat before receiving Holy Communion.
The couple that were guided by the wife's dream to find buried money with which to build a shrine to Saint Mary.
A man killed during the construction of the church of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam is raised from the dead.
Thieves try to steal from a church of Saint Mary in Syria but are unable to bring what they have stolen out of the church.
The priest Thomas sees Saint Mary inscribing the names of those who praise her on the fiery chariot of gold.
When Satan destroys the oven of a monastery, he is compelled to serve the monks for twelve years in punishment.
The Egyptian woman who lost a silver plate while bathing in a miraculous spring.
The apparitions of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq.
The untrustworthy camel driver of Däbrä Metmaq.
When the destruction of Däbrä Metmaq is reported in Ethiopia, the king orders the construction of a new monastery to take its place.
The Muslims who spent the night at the ruins of Däbrä Metmaq.
Patriarch Abraham and the interpretation of the parable of the mustard seed.
The lamp of the Christian from Mǝneta Diyāqon that was blown out by the wind.
The European who wanted to steal the bars of the door to the Manger at Bethlehem.
A Roman official is prevented from approaching the Holy Sepulcher.
The story of the Muslim who lived near the churches of Saints Mark and Shenute.
The story of Absadi, gardener of the monastery of St. Shenute, who used to give away vegetables from the garden.
ʾƎmma Yoḥannǝs and the Ethiopian monk who was on pilgrimage to Jerusalem.
Petros Bawares has a vision of the Trinity.
A Muslim, Katib, tries to extort money from the monks of Saint Anthony.
The king's washerman who was attacked by a lion.
A young man whom his mother had vowed to the service of Saint Mary becomes impotent when his parents try to wed him.
The magistrate whom the king accused of embezzlement.
The hunter who caught a gassa kalb in his net.
The man who wanted to give a banquet on Saint Mary's feast but was unable because of a famine.
The sinner whom Saint Mary healed after his relatives had spent all his money on physicians.
A man who speaks blasphemously of Saint Mary has his arms and legs cut off.
An unbaptized Jewess attempts to enter the house of Saint Mary, who prevents her and tells her to seek baptism.
Saint Mary gives a cup of the water of life to an Ethiopian monk in Jerusalem.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Prochorus reports Saint John's visit to Saint Mary's dwelling place.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews go to Bethlehem to seize Saint Mary but are blinded.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary, together with Saints Irene and Sophia, appears to Saint Basil and tells him where her icon is buried.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil finds the buried icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary tells Saint Basil to take two pillars from a pagan temple.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary sets up the pillars in the church and makes a miraculous spring flow out at their base.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary's soul descends from heaven in a tent of light.
A woman who had poisoned her sister and married her husband is swallowed up by the earth when she anoints herself with the oil that flowed from Saint Mary's icon.
Saint Mary rescues the ship in which Mar Barsuma is travelling.
Saint Mary appears to the disciples of Mar Barsuma in the form of a dove.
Saint Mary appears to Saints Atrasis and Yona, virgins and martyrs.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Sarabamon, the future bishop of Nikiou and martyr.
The events that occurred during the captivity of Abbots Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon and John of Scete.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Nicholas and gives him priestly vestments.
Saint Mary appears to the brother of Saint Basil, Saint Gregory, bishop of "the Islands" (i.e. of Nyassa).
Saint Mary appears to Saint Paphnutius.
Saint Mary raises Andrew, a disciple of Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon, from the dead.
Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon instructs his disciples on his deathbed.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Theodore the Anatolian.
The fate of the monk, Giyorgis, who followed the teachings of Za-Mika'el.
The vision of a certain saint about the fate of a priest who swore falsely.
Abbas sees a vision of Saint Mary blessing the monks who were chanting the Psalms.
The inhabitants of Damot who would not observe the feast days of Saint Mary are punished by a storm that brings down a mighty tree.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Synaxary entry for 16 Nahase: The Apostles visit Saint Mary in heaven.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Anonymous homily against the report that the Apostles abandoned the body of Saint Mary when they were attacked by the Jews during her funeral procession.
A Christian community is attacked by a neighboring Muslim community.
A renegade monk who had become a Jew is hunted down by the troops of the king.
The Magicians who tried to cast a spell on the Epiphany water.
Batergela Maryam is accused of treason and is imprisoned.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: God sends Saint Gabriel to Saint Mary for the Annunciation.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Three virgins come to serve Saint Mary as she is about to give birth.
Saint Paul is taken to the third heaven and there sees Saint Mary.
Saint Mary appears to Anthony of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam (continued).
Message of Saint Mary to Anthony, monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family receives hospitality from a shepherd.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: The Jews plot to kill Saint Mary because of the miracles she was working while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family crosses the Nile at Asmunayn.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Christ Child grants Saint Mary a vision of his future glory.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): Ahrufas, the guardian angel of Egypt, comes to the Holy Family.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The experience of the Holy Family in the district of Asmunayn.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family encounters thieves.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family arrives at Däbrä QWesqWam.
Saint Peter gives Saint John Chrysostom the keys of the kingdom and Saint John the Evangelist gives him the Gospels; then Saint Mary appears to him.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews try to burn down the house where Saint Mary is staying but are burned up instead.
The Holy Spirit recounts the salvific events that have occurred on Sunday.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays with the disciples.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays with the disciples (continuation).
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays for the release of the souls in judgment.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees a vision of Saint Mary in glory.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary asks Christ that the disciples preach her Transitus and Assumption.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary asks that Saint John be allowed to visit her dwelling place.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Saint Mary leaves the Temple and enters the home of Saint Joseph.
Saint Mary helps a poor man become wealthy.
The withered olive tree at the gate of the church in Endules.
The dogs of the hunter praise Saint Mary.
Incipit: እንዘ፡ ትወርድ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ውስተ፡ ምድረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ኀበ፡ ኃደረት፡ ገዳመ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ምስለ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ ወሰሎሜ፡ መጽአ፡ ነአዌ፡ ዓረዊት፡ ምስለ፡ አክልብቲሁ፡ ወመጽኡ፡ አክልብት፡ እንዘ፡ ይሴብሕዋ፡ ወይብልዋ፡ ስብሐት፡ ለኪ፡ እመ፡ እግዚአ፡ ኵሉ፡ ፍጥረት

Canonical Story Title: Christ, Nativity of cycle: The adoration of the shepherds and the Magi.
Holy Family journey cycle: Herod orders the slaughter of the Innocents; a hunter with his dogs finds the Holy Family in flight from the king.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to return from the mountains of Lebanon to Bethlehem.
