Holy Family journey cycle: An angel tells Saint Joseph to take Saint Mary and her child to Egypt.
Holy Family journey cycle: All Israel is upset by the coming of the Magi; Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to flee to the mountains of Lebanon.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Magi find the Holy Family and depart; Saint Mary flees to Tiberias and from there to the mountains of Lebanon.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family stays in Dirde.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Mary's prayer while in the wilderness of Edomeyas.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family returns from Egypt by way of Gaza.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Mary is welcomed when she returns to Galilee.
A container of oil remains suspended in mid air in a church of Saint Mary when the cord by which it was suspended breaks.
Christ gives Ethiopia as tithes to Saint Mary.
The lamp of the Christian from Mǝneta Diyāqon that was blown out by the wind.
The blessing given to the animals at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam by the anointing of Saint Mary.
The European who tried to steal the icon of Saint Mary from Däbrä Sedeneya.
Saint Mary stops a pestilence.
Holy Family journey cycle: The hunter reports to King Demateyanos, who comes to visit the Holy Family.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria.
The monks of Däbrä Qaləmon who were despoiled by Berbers.
Nəkʷal, the deacon from Margawkim, who spent his master’s money on the poor.
The vinedresser of Manfalut who gave his earnings to the builders of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Entawos, a pagan from Qarays, becomes a Christian after being struck by miraculous arrows.
A sinner is saved from damnation because he had built a shrine in the name of Saint Mary.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: A soldier redeems the Child Jesus from another soldier who was thinking of handing him over to King Herod.
The man who would not eat before receiving Holy Communion.
The wife of a pagan official who wished to pray at the Holy Sepulcher is prevented until she is baptized.
A man who speaks blasphemously of Saint Mary has his arms and legs cut off.
An unbaptized Jewess attempts to enter the house of Saint Mary, who prevents her and tells her to seek baptism.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ አይሁዳዊት፡ ዘቦአት፡ ውስተ፡ ቤታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ጥምቀት፡ ወከልአታ፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary gives a cup of the water of life to an Ethiopian monk in Jerusalem.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Prochorus reports Saint John's visit to Saint Mary's dwelling place.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays to be taken from this life.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews go to Bethlehem to seize Saint Mary but are blinded.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ, together with Saint Mary and the angels, appears to the Apostles and asks them to build churches in his name and hers throughout the world.
Christ makes Saint Peter head of the Church.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary, together with Saints Irene and Sophia, appears to Saint Basil and tells him where her icon is buried.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil finds the buried icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary tells Saint Basil to take two pillars from a pagan temple.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary sets up the pillars in the church and makes a miraculous spring flow out at their base.
Salome's hands are burned when she tries to verify Saint Mary's virginity, but they are healed when she takes the Christ Child into her arms.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees Christ kissing Saint Mary's burial cloth.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary's soul descends from heaven in a tent of light.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Three virgins come to serve Saint Mary as she is about to give birth.
Saint John Chrysostom defends a woman whom Nestorius had told the people to spit upon.
A woman who had poisoned her sister and married her husband is swallowed up by the earth when she anoints herself with the oil that flowed from Saint Mary's icon.
Saint Mary rescues the ship in which Mar Barsuma is travelling.
Saint Mary appears to the disciples of Mar Barsuma in the form of a dove.
Saint Mary appears to Saints Atrasis and Yona, virgins and martyrs.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Sarabamon, the future bishop of Nikiou and martyr.
The events that occurred during the captivity of Abbots Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon and John of Scete.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Nicholas and gives him priestly vestments.
Saint Mary appears to the brother of Saint Basil, Saint Gregory, bishop of "the Islands" (i.e. of Nyassa).
Saint Mary appears to Saint Paphnutius.
Saint Mary raises Andrew, a disciple of Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon, from the dead.
Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon instructs his disciples on his deathbed.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Theodore the Anatolian.
The fate of the monk, Giyorgis, who followed the teachings of Za-Mika'el.
The vision of a certain saint about the fate of a priest who swore falsely.
Abbas sees a vision of Saint Mary blessing the monks who were chanting the Psalms.
The inhabitants of Damot who would not observe the feast days of Saint Mary are punished by a storm that brings down a mighty tree.
The judgment of the court of Zärˀa Yaˁəqob against the Stephanites.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Synaxary entry for 16 Nahase: The Apostles visit Saint Mary in heaven.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Anonymous homily against the report that the Apostles abandoned the body of Saint Mary when they were attacked by the Jews during her funeral procession.
A Christian community is attacked by a neighboring Muslim community.
A renegade monk who had become a Jew is hunted down by the troops of the king.
Incipit: ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ድንግል፡ በክልኤ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ፀባኦት፡ ወላዲተ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ስብሐት፡ ፀንሰቶ፡ በድንግልና፡ ሕሊና፡ ወበድንግልና፡ ሥጋ፡ ወወለደቶ፡ እንዘ፡ ድንግል፡ በሕሊናሃ፡ ወእንዘ፡ ድንግል፡ በሥጋሃ፡ ወአርአየ፡ ተአምራቲሃ፡ ወምንክራቲሃ፡ ወገብረ፡ ኃይለ፡ ዐቢየ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ እግዚእነ፡ በእንቲአሃ፡ ላዕለ፡ አሐዱ፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ ቀዲሙሰ፡ ነበረ፡ ክርስቲያናዊ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ሀገረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወነገሥታቲሃኒ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ይነብሩ፡ ምስለ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ወኤጲስ፡ ቆጶሳት፡ ቀሳውስት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ ወመነኮሳት፡ ብዙኃን፡ ይነብሩ፡ በይእቲ፡ ሀገር። ወተንሥአ፡ አሐዱ፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ እምነ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ ካህናት

Canonical Story Title: A Jew is led to baptism by a dream about a lion and a monk; afterwards he curses a Jew at the latter's request.
The Magicians who tried to cast a spell on the Epiphany water.
Batergela Maryam is accused of treason and is imprisoned.
When Satan destroys the oven of a monastery, he is compelled to serve the monks for twelve years in punishment.
Saint Mary shows those assembled at Däbrä Metmaq a vision of Mohammad in Hell.
The lamp of the Christian from Mǝneta Diyāqon that was blown out by the wind.
The devout Muslim who became a Christian when Saint Mary appeared to him.
Yeshaq, prior of Däbrä Metmaq, who fled to Scete, Egypt, to escape the burden of his office.
The miraculous spring of Mehzab.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Three virgins come to serve Saint Mary as she is about to give birth.
Bishop Michael sends Deacon John to help the monks of Däbrä Metmaq celebrate Passion Week.
The cistern at Däbrä Metmaq is filled miraculously.
Abba Mardari, who overheard twelve angels talking about going to Constantinople to hear Saint John Chrysostom praise Saint Mary.
Saint Paul is taken to the third heaven and there sees Saint Mary.
Abba Behor has a vision of Saint Mary.
Saint Mary appears to Sawla, the wife of the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis.
The history ot Däbrä Mahew near Jerusalem and its miraculous spring.
A woman whose right eye had been blinded by a demon is healed by Saint Mary.
Saint Mary appears to Timothy, Patriarch of Alexandria, in the church of Saint Pachomius in Alexandria.
Saint Mary appears to Anthony, a monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Saint Mary appears to Anthony of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam (continued).
Saint Mary anoints sick animals and heals them at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Message of Saint Mary to Anthony, monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Anthony, the monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam, asks about the anointing of the animals.
The blessing given to the animals at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam by the anointing of Saint Mary.
The priest who left the keys of the church locked up inside.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family receives hospitality from a shepherd.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family crosses the Nile at Asmunayn.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Christ Child grants Saint Mary a vision of his future glory.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): Ahrufas, the guardian angel of Egypt, comes to the Holy Family.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The experience of the Holy Family in the district of Asmunayn.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family encounters thieves.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family arrives at Däbrä QWesqWam.
Saint Peter gives Saint John Chrysostom the keys of the kingdom and Saint John the Evangelist gives him the Gospels; then Saint Mary appears to him.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews try to burn down the house where Saint Mary is staying but are burned up instead.
The Holy Spirit recounts the salvific events that have occurred on Sunday.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays with the disciples.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays with the disciples (continuation).
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays for the release of the souls in judgment.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees a vision of Saint Mary in glory.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ celebrates Mass for Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary asks Christ that the disciples preach her Transitus and Assumption.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary asks that Saint John be allowed to visit her dwelling place.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: Saint Mary heals the daughter of Arsaban while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ነበረት፡ ሐና፡ ብፅዕት፡ ብእሲተ፡ ኢያቄም፡ በብዙኅ፡ ጸሎት፡ ወወሀባ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘርአ፡ ቡርክተ። ወእምድኅረ፡ ፯፡ አውራኅ፡ ተዓውቀ፡ ጽንሳ፡ ለሐና፡ ወሰምዑ፡ አዝማዲሃ፡ ወአዝማደ፡ ምታ፡ ወመጽኡ፡ ወይቤልዋ፡ ምንትኑ፡ ዝነገር፡ ዘመጽአ፡ ኀቤኪ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Conception of cycle: The descent of the holy seed from Adam to Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወእንዘ፡ ትትፋለስ፡ እምአዳም፡ ውስተ፡ ከርሡ፡ ለሴት፡ ወሄኖክ፡ ወቀይናን፡….

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Annunciation of cycle: God sends Saint Gabriel to Saint Mary for the Annunciation.
Incipit: ወይቤሎ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ለገብርኤል፡ ወበላ፡ ለወለተ፡ ጽዮን፡ ወልደ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይመጽእ፡ ላዕሌኪ፡ ወኃይለ፡ ልዑል፡ ይጸልለኪ፡ ወዝኒ፡ ይትወለድ፡ እምኔኪ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Nativity of cycle: The Jews plot to kill Saint Mary because of the miracles she was working while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Incipit: ከመ፡ ታእምሩ፡ ልደታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ወጥቀ፡ ትከብር፡ እምአዝማዲሃ፡ ወእምነ፡ ኵሉ፡ ዓለም። ወሕዝበ፡ እስራኤልሰ፡ ቦዐ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ውስተ፡ አልባቢሆሙ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
Incipit: ወበዕለተ፡ እሑድ፡ ጊዜ፡ ፫፡ ሰዓት፡ መጽአ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፡ ግብተ፡ እንዘ፡ ትፈትል፡ ወርቀ፡ ወሜላተ፡ ለመንጦላዕተ፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Saint Mary leaves the Temple and enters the home of Saint Joseph.
Incipit: ወሶበ፡ ፈጸመ፡ አዝማነ፡ ንብረታ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ፡ ወሖሩ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ ካህናት፡ ወሊቃነ፡ ካህናት፡ ወሌዋውያን፡ በኅብረቶሙ፡ ወይቤልዋ፡ ንዒ፡ ፃዒ

Canonical Story Title: Christ, Nativity of cycle: The adoration of the shepherds and the Magi.
Incipit: ወነበሩ፡ ኅቡረ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ ምስለ፡ ማርያም፡ እንዘ፡ ይባርክዎ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር። ወእምድኅረ፡ ፱፡ አውራኅ፡ ተወልደ፡ ሕፃን፡ በቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ ዘይሁዳ፡ በበዐት

Canonical Story Title: Christ, Nativity of cycle: The Circumcision.
Incipit: ወፅኡ፡ እምውስተ፡ በዐት፡ ዮሴፍ፡ ወማርያም፡ ወዐተዉ፡ ቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ ወቤተ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ ፀራቢ

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: Herod orders the slaughter of the Innocents; a hunter with his dogs finds the Holy Family in flight from the king.
Incipit: ወሤመ፡ ሄሮድስ፡ አግብርቲሁ፡ ወሰብአ፡ ቤቱ፡ ወሕጽዋኒሁ፡ መኳንንተ፡ ወመሳፍንተ፡ ወረባናተ፡ ላዕለ፡ አህጉር

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The hunter reports to King Demateyanos, who comes to visit the Holy Family.
Incipit: ወእምዝ፡ አመ፡ ሳብዕት፡ ዕለት፡ ሖረ፡ ውእቱ፡ ነዓዌ፡ አራዊት፡ ኀበ፡ ድማትያኖስ፡ ወነገሮ፡ ኵሎ፡ ዘርእየ

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to return from the mountains of Lebanon to Bethlehem.
Incipit: ወወረደ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፡ ሀገረ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ ኀበ፡ ማርያም፡ ወይቤላ፡ ሰላም፡ ለኪ፡ ኦወለተ፡ ዳዊት

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: An angel tells Saint Joseph to take Saint Mary and her child to Egypt.
Incipit: ወጊዜ፡ መንፈቀ፡ ሌሊት፡ አስተርአዮ፡ መልአከ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ለዮሴፍ፡ በሕልም

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: All Israel is upset by the coming of the Magi; Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to flee to the mountains of Lebanon.
Incipit: ወበውእቱ፡ መዋዕል፡ ኮነ፡ ዐቢይ፡ ትምክህት፡ ላዕለ፡ እስራኤል፡ ወላዕለ፡ ኵሉ፡ አህጉር፡ ወበሓውርት

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The Magi find the Holy Family and depart; Saint Mary flees to Tiberias and from there to the mountains of Lebanon.
Incipit: ሚመጠነ፡ እነግር፡ ሊተሰ፡ የዓፅበኒ፡ ሕሊናየ። ወወረደ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ቃል፡ ሥጋ፡ ኮነ፡ ወተወልደ፡ እምማርያም

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family stays in Dirde.
Incipit: ወእምድኅረ፡ ነበረት፡ ውስተ፡ በዐት፡ ወወፅአት፡ እምህየ፡ ወበጽሐት፡ ዲርዴ

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Mary's prayer while in the wilderness of Edomeyas.
Incipit: ጸሎት፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘጸለየት፡ እንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ በገዳመ፡ ኤዶምያስ፡ አመ፡ ጐየት፡ እምሄሮድስ፡ ራስዕ። ትቤ፡ እግዚኦ፡ አምላከ፡ እስራኤል፡ አድኅነኒ፡ እምመዊት

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family hides from thieves in a sycamore tree at Däbrä Metmaq.
Holy Family journey cycle: The rich Egyptian woman who refused to give water to the Holy Family.
Christ gives Ethiopia as tithes to Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወእምድኅረ፡ ነበረት፡ ማርያም፡ ፮፡ አውራኃ፡ ዘውስተ፡ ብሔረ፡ አግዓዚ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ኢትዮጵያ፡ እስመ፡ ይእቲ፡ ምድር፡ ክብርት፡ እምኵሉ፡ ምድር፡ ዘታሕተ፡ ሰማይ

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family returns from Egypt by way of Gaza.
Incipit: ወጊዜ፡ መንፈቀ፡ ሌሊት፡ አስተርአዮ፡ መልአከ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ለዮሴፍ፡ እንዘ፡ ይብል፡ ተንሢአከ፡ እምንዋምከ፡ ንሣእ፡ ሕፃነ፡ ወእሞ፡ ወግባዕ፡ ምድረ፡ እስራኤል

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Mary is welcomed when she returns to Galilee.
Incipit: ወተንሥአት፡ ማርያም፡ ወኃለፈት፡ እምህየ፡ ወበጽሐት፡ ምድረ፡ ዘታሕተ፡ ገሊላ። ወተቀበልዋ፡ እድ፡ ወአዕሩግ፡ ወሕፃናት፡ ምስለ፡ አንስት

Canonical Story Title: A container of oil remains suspended in mid air in a church of Saint Mary when the cord by which it was suspended breaks.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ደብር፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡…. ወሙዳየ፡ ቅብዕኒ፡ ሀሎ፡ በቤተ፡ መቅደስ፡ ስቁል፡ ወተመትረ፡ ህብላ፡ ለይእቲ፡ ቅብዕ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: When Tafoneya lays hands on the bier of Saint Mary, an angel cuts his arms off.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: A soldier redeems the Child Jesus from another soldier who was thinking of handing him over to King Herod.
Saint Mary helps a poor man become wealthy.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ አበዊነ፡ ወአኃዊነ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ለአሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ እንዘ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወእሙ፡ ጽኑሳን፡ ወአልቦሙ፡ ንዋይ፡ እስመ፡ ጽኑሳን፡ እሙንቱ፡ ወውሉዶሙ፡ ሠናይ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወይዜከር፡ ስማ፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ። ወኮነ፡ ውእቱ፡ ይስእል፡ ወትረ፡ ወይሁብ፡ ላቲ፡ አምኃ፡ ዕጣነ፡ ሴጠ፡ ላቲ፡ ዶርሆ፡ ንስቲተ፡ በአምጣነ፡ ይክል

Canonical Story Title: The story of the penitent harlot, Mary of Egypt.
The withered olive tree at the gate of the church in Endules.
Saint Mary appears to Yohannes Kama.
A hermit in Jerusalem is saved from the temptations of Satan.
The blessing given to the animals at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam by the anointing of Saint Mary.
The miraculous spring of Mehzab.
A child and his mother see the icon of Saint Mary weeping for the sins of the world.
The European who tried to steal the icon of Saint Mary from Däbrä Sedeneya.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ ተአምረ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እምሥዕል፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ነጋዲ፡ ብእሲ፡ እምብሔረ፡ አፍርንጊያ፡ ወባዕል፡ ጥቀ፡ በወርቅ፡ ወበብሩር፡ ወበአልባስ፡ ክቡር። ወውእቱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሶበ፡ ሰምዓ፡ ዜናሃ፡ ለሥዕል፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡…. ተፈሥሐ

Canonical Story Title: The girl who was going to be stoned after she was caught committing fornication.
The monastic community that was supplied with provisions by Saint Mary.
Saint Mary appears to a monk and saves him from being deceived by Satan.
Saint Mary gives a garment to a poor monk.
Saint Mary heals a poor man from skin disease whom people had refused to carry to church.
The pious priest to whom Satan came for confession.
The Arab woman who suffered from an issue of blood for many years.
The story of Pifamon, the martyr from Awsim.
Abba Esi and Thecla are saved from the torture ordered by the judge (continuation of the preceding).
The wealthy man to whom Saint Mary appeared in the form of a bird to save the countryside from pestilence.
Saint Mary stops a pestilence.
An Arab who has contempt for Saint Mary’s icon at Däbrä Qaləmon is punished.
The devout Muslim who became a Christian when Saint Mary appeared to him.
Saint John Chrysostom defends a woman whom Nestorius had told the people to spit upon.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria.
During the famine of 1120 MM [likely 1404 CE], the Arabs try to plunder the monasteries of Egypt.
The monks of Däbrä Qaləmon who were despoiled by Berbers.
An Arab steals the scissors of the tailor of Däbrä Qaləmon.
Nəkʷal, the deacon from Margawkim, who spent his master’s money on the poor.
The Arab woman who suffered from an issue of blood for many years.
The Arab woman who entrusted her jewels to a Christian for safekeeping.
The vinedresser of Manfalut who gave his earnings to the builders of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Entawos, a pagan from Qarays, becomes a Christian after being struck by miraculous arrows.
The wife of Mark, a priest from Mallawi, is cured of her leprosy.
The Jews plot to burn the body of Saint Mary.
A Roman official is prevented from approaching the Holy Sepulcher.
The story of the Muslim who lived near the churches of Saints Mark and Shenute.
A hermit in Jerusalem is saved from the temptations of Satan.
The story of Absadi, gardener of the monastery of St. Shenute, who used to give away vegetables from the garden.
ʾƎmma Yoḥannǝs and the Ethiopian monk who was on pilgrimage to Jerusalem.
The wife of a pagan official who wished to pray at the Holy Sepulcher is prevented until she is baptized.
Petros Bawares has a vision of the Trinity.
The monks of Saint Anthony celebrate Holy Week at Däbrä QWesqWam.
A Muslim, Katib, tries to extort money from the monks of Saint Anthony.
The king's washerman who was attacked by a lion.
A young man whom his mother had vowed to the service of Saint Mary becomes impotent when his parents try to wed him.
The magistrate whom the king accused of embezzlement.
The couple that were guided by the wife's dream to find buried money with which to build a shrine to Saint Mary.
The hunter who caught a gassa kalb in his net.
The man who wanted to give a banquet on Saint Mary's feast but was unable because of a famine.
The sinner whom Saint Mary healed after his relatives had spent all his money on physicians.
The pious abbot who was falsely accused by his monks of sinning with a woman.
The thief who was caught stealing from the church of Saint Mary and was released by his captors when he prayed to her.
The fisherman who was eaten up by a dragon but was found alive when the dragon's belly was cut open.
Synaxary entry for the 16th of Yakkatit: Saint Mary receives the Pact of Mercy (kidan mehret).
The European who tried to steal the icon of Saint Mary from Däbrä Sedeneya.
The Muslims who spent the night at the ruins of Däbrä Metmaq.
Thieves try to steal from a church of Saint Mary in Syria but are unable to bring what they have stolen out of the church.
The woman from Cairo who lived by the river and whose daughter became blind.
A young servant of a monk gets lost among Muslims but is restored safe and sound when the monk cries to Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ በውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ደብር፡ ወጠፍአ፡ ገብሩ፡ ንዑስ፡ ወልድ፡ ውስተ፡ ብሔረ፡ ተንባሊት። ወሶበ፡ አእመረ፡ ውእቱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ከልሐ፡ ኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወኀበ፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The election of Patriarch Matthew I.
The woman whose baby daughter was carried off by a hyena.
A plague in a monastery is halted at the prayer of a monk.
A child whom his mother had vowed to Saint Mary is rescued from drowning.
Doyq, the son of Taliq, is raised from the dead by Saint Mary while she was still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Incipit: ተአምር፡ ዘገብረቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ እንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ ውስተ፡ ማኅፀና፡ ለሐና፡ ቅድስት። ወሖረት፡ ሐና፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ ዶይቅ፡ ወልደ፡ ጣሊቅ፡ እስመ፡ እኅወ፡ አቡሃ፡ ውእቱ። ወሞተ፡ ዶይቅ፡ ወልደ፡ ጣሊቅ፡ በውእቱ፡ አዝማን

Canonical Story Title: The story of Abadir, a district governor of Egypt.
Saint Mary asks bread from a poor widow during the flight from Herod.
Saint Mary asks bread from a poor widow during the flight from Herod.
Certain ones raised from the dead relate to Saint Mary their sufferings in the fires of Gehenna.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ትቤሎሙ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ለእለ፡ ተንሥኡ፡ እምምውታን፡ እፎ፡ ነበርክሙ፡ ውስተ፡ ገሃነም

Canonical Story Title: Some Christians held captive by a Muslim are freed by an angel and are brought to Cyprus.
Saladdin and his men try to force their way into the house where Saint Mary was born.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ እምልደተ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ በ፮፻፳፡ ወ፯፡ ዓመት፡ በመዋዕለ፡ ሰላዲኖስ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ምስር፡ እስላም፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤት፡ ዘናሕስ፡ ግምብ፡ ዘተወልደት፡ ባቲ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ለውእቱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ሐራሁ፡ አምጽኡ፡ አፍራስ፡/አፍራሰ፡ ወይቤሉ፡ ናበውእ፡ ውስተ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ቤት

Canonical Story Title: Deganna, the church builder, who was asked by King Aktab to build a temple for his pagan gods.
Saint Mary appears to Abba Besoy on the day of the Assumption.
How the Egyptian youth, Besoy, who had destroyed churches and killed people, repented after killing a pregnant woman.
The Christian villagers in Armenia who had to buy their water from Jews.
Qawestos, the husband of Akroseya, becomes a disciple of Saint Clement.
The story of Julius Aqfahasi.
Zakkareyas from Rafa, whom the custodian of the church locked out of the place where his food was kept.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ቀሲስ፡ በደወለ፡ ራፋ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዘካርያስ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወኢይወፅእ፡ እምቤተ፡ ክርስቲያና፡ መዓልተ፡ ወሌሊተ፡ ወየዓጥን፡ ፯፡ ጊዜያተ። ወውእቱሂ፡ አረጋዊ፡ ወነዳይ

Canonical Story Title: Abbot Lebdeyos speaks to the people on the feast of Saint Mary when they ask him to distribute Communion.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ አበ፡ ምኔት፡ በደወለ፡ አፍርንጊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ልብድዮስ፡ ብእሲ፡ ጻቅድ፡ ወየዋህ፡ እስመ፡ ውእቱ፡ አረጋዊ፡ በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ኃይሉ፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: A dragon that had swallowed up Efrem, a monk of Däbrä Timona, is compelled to vomit him up alive ten days later.
The thirty monks of Scete whom Satan inspired to beat each other.
Satan takes the form of a bird to deceive two monks who had lived together in harmony for fifteen years.
The clergy wish to receive Communion on the feast of Easter from Archbishop Maximus in Jerusalem.
Patriarch Mekmeyanos, whom the clergy and people threatened to depose when he fell sick.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ በእስክንድርያ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ምክምያኖስ፡ ኄር፡ ውእቱ፡ ወፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወአኀዞ፡ ደዌ፡ ዕፁብ፡ ወመጽኡ፡ እድ፡ ወአንስት፡ ለተአምኆቱ፡ ወካህናትኒ፡ ተባረኩ፡ እምኔሁ፡ ወሰዓሙ፡ እዴሁ

Canonical Story Title: Daniel from Constantinople, who wanted to go to church to receive Communion even when there was fighting in the streets.
Bishop Bakkimos of Constantinople, to whom Saint Mary appeared concerning Lebaneya, who was sterile.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ቍስጥንጥንያ፡ ዘስሙ፡ በኪሞስ፡ ወይገብር፡ በዓሎ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይትአመና፡ በኵሉ፡ መዋዕለ፡ ሕይወቱ፡ ወኢያፀርዕ፡ ዘክሮተ፡ ስማ፡ ወተዓውቀ፡ ዜና፡ ጽድቁ፡ በኵሉ፡ ደወለ፡ ቍስጥንጥንያ። ወሰምዓት፡ ልባንያ፡ ብእሲተ፡ መኪዶር፡ መኰንን

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary assists Abba Daniel in the desert and gives him a lion to ride on.
The European monk, Zena Krəstos, who was a herder and whose beasts were attacked by a lion.
Saints Michael and Gabriel appear while Abbot Eliab is teaching his monks, who are given bread from Heaven.
Homily of Saint John the Evangelist on the greatness of Saint Mary, which he had seen in a vision.
Pelagia, a nun from Caesarea, whom Satan afflicted with leprosy.
The monastery near Alexandria whose trees were cut down by Jews.
Aqlemeya, a poor woman from Rome, who was tied to a tree by brigands for five days and nights.
Sabela, a nun of Caesarea, who had a vision of Saint Mary while sleeping.
The bread and wine that came down from Heaven to Abbot Gabriel during Mass in the church of Saint Mary in Rome.
Bishop Deraleyos in Däbrä Gass, who was a lazy monk.
The European Archbishop Thaddeus, whom Saint Mary assisted at Mass.
The monk, Abiathar, in Nubia, who was led to repentance by a vision of Saint Mary.
Eusebius, whom Saint Mary took to Heaven.
The story of the martyr, Saint Romanus.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ሮማኖስ፡ በደወለ፡ ግብጽ፡ አዳም፡ ስነ፡ ራእዩ፡ ወመንክር፡ ኂሩታቲሁ፡ ወሠናይ፡ በኵሉ፡ ግዕዙ፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወበአሐዱ፡ ዕለት፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ በውስተ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ አኃዞ፡ ደቃስ፡ ወመጽአት፡ ኀቤሁ፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The prophet, Jonah, who came from Egypt.
Matthias, a student from Bartos in Egypt, who was beaten and imprisoned for teaching about Christ.
How the angels worship the Eucharist, the Cross and Saint Mary.
Incipit: ከመ፡ ይትአኰት፡ ወይሴባሕ፡ ስማ፡ በአፈ፡ መላእክት፡ ወሰብእ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወእምድኅረ፡ ተወልደ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ እምማርያም፡…. በደሙ፡ ቀደሳ፡ ለቅድስት፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወበዕፀ፡ መስቀሉ፡ ዓታባ፡ ከመ፡ ይትቀደስ፡ ስመ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡….

Canonical Story Title: Sara from Mesot, who became insane and went about naked.
Arkaledes from Qawep, who vowed not to look again at a woman, when his mother came to visit him, he died before seeing her.
The vision granted to Archbishop Bartholomew in Jerusalem.
Four thieves break into the church of Saint Mary and steal vestments; they are brought back by lions.
Abbot Tasfa Mahebar from Caesarea, who was given a cloud as a chariot and went to visit Abba Zakkareyas in Scete.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ አበ፡ ምኔት፡ በሀገረ፡ ቂሳርያ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ተስፋ፡ ማኅበር፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይዌድሶ፡ ፍጹመ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር። ወወሀበቶ፡ ደመና፡ ከመ፡ ይኵኖ፡ ሠረገላ፡ ወከመ፡ ይሑር፡ ኀበ፡ ፈቀደ

Canonical Story Title: The soul of Christina, the wife of Aaron, an Egyptian official, goes to Heaven.
When a couple tries to marry their son whom they had dedicated to Saint Mary, he falls sick to the point of death.
When Pariqos of Fesa confesses his sins to the bishop, the latter, refusing him absolution, tells him to go to Abba Yaceqob (Santiago).
Bishop Hildephonsus sees the icon of Saint Mary sweating; she asks him to raise a girl from the dead.
Saint Mary teaches a man who had been refused instruction how to write.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘፈቀደ፡ ይትመሐር፡ ጽሒፈ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ወአበዮ፡ ወኢተከሠተ፡ ሎቱ። ወነበረ፡ ብዙኀ፡ መዋዕለ፡ እንዘ፡ የኃዝን

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The king of Egypt asks Saint Mary to bless his land.
A column falls and breaks the leg of the son of an official when Muslims destroy a church of Saint Mary in Homs.
A thief is hanged upside down with the objects he stole from the church of Saint Mary in Sebkahad.
Yoḥannǝs finds a copy of the acts of Saints Juliana and Barbara that he had lost.
The wife of Joseph from Mǝneta Diyāqon, who had no male children.
Eulogius, the stonemason of Scete, Egypt, who used to give hospitality to strangers.
The old woman from Sembat who gave the offering for Saint Mary to Saint George.
The conversion of a Muslim merchant who had been imprisoned in Naples.
The story of the sorcerers Taludar, who was possessed by a demon.
The infidel who stole the lumber from the church at Däbrä QwesqWam.
The conversion of the Muslim, Rewh, who is renamed Entons Haddis.
Homily of John Chrysostom on the visit of Saint Mary and her Son to John the Baptist.
The story of John, the martyr from Senhut.
Saint Mary blesses Scete, which Saint Macarius chooses for his monastery.
The story of Michael, the scribe who converted to Islam when he was beaten.
A monk, Abraham, drinks poisonous water while on a journey to visit the patriarch and dies, but is then raised from the dead.
The wrath of Saint Mary against the prefect of a church who tried to stop the priests from making a procession while singing hymns to her.
Homily on the miracles of Saint Mary.
The persecution of the Christians during the patriarchate of Cosmas II.
Emperor Arcadius and the golden statue of Saint Mary; he asks Saint John Chrysostom to expound on Matthew 1: 25.
The beggar at the church of Qirqos in Amhara from whose head a horn grew.
The merchant from Senfewat who struck the icon of Saint Mary.
The miracle concerning the golden ink during the reign of King Dawit.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the Jewish merchant of Caesarea who stole a golden plate from the church, but later became a Christian.
The election of Patriarch Matthew I.
Holy Family journey cycle: The places in Egypt visited by the Holy Family.
Abba Samuˀel of Wali is lifted up while reciting the Wəddase Maryam.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: How the Virgin Mary gave birth (see no. 299)
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob is given a sign of Badlay's fall.
Mary, Engagement of cycle: Saint Mary is espoused to Saint Joseph.
Saint Mary is found to be pregnant.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: How the Virgin Mary gave birth (see no. 299)
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The magi and their chief, Balaam, see the star of Christ's birth.
Saint Mary comes to a church in the form of a white dove to heal from smallpox a man whose only good work was celebrating her commemoration.
Synaxary entry for the 16th of Yakkatit: Saint Mary receives the Pact of Mercy (kidan mehret).
Mary, Childhood of cycle: When she is three years old, Saint Mary is taken to the Temple.
Incipit: ወነበሩ፡ ኢያቄም፡ ወሐና፡ እንዘ፡ የሐፅኑ፡ ወለቶሙ፡ ማርያም፡ ፫፡ ዓመተ፡ እንዘ፡ ይሴብሕዎ፡ ወየአኵትዎ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: The Dormition and Assumption of Saint Mary's body into Heaven.
Incipit: ወአመ፡ ዕረፍታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ተጋብኡ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ እለ፡ ተዘርዉ፡ ውስተ፡ ኵሉ፡ በሐውርት፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ቶማስ፡ ባሕቲቱ፡ ወእለኒ፡ እምሐዋርያት፡ ዘሞቱ፡ ተንሥኡ፡ ወመጽኡ፡ ወአኮ፡ በሥምረተ፡ ርእሶሙ፡ ዘተጋብኡ፡ አላ፡ ሶበ፡ ፈቀደት፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The church of Saint Mary in Spain to which she used to bring Christian captives.
Abba Samuˀel of Wali is lifted up while reciting the Wəddase Maryam.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
The composition of the Maṣḥafa ḥawi by Patriarch Gabriel Ibn Tarīk.
Amnut, the custodian of a church in Egypt, quarrels with his bishop.
The priest from Nārdin who was accused because he kept a nun in his house.
Saint Mary heals two women whom a demon had made ill.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ መጽኣ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ ፪፡ አንስት፡ እለ፡ አድወዮን፡ ጋኔን፡ ወአውየዋ፡ ወይቤላ፡ ተሣሃልነ፡ ወፈውስነ፡ እምደዌነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡…. ወሶቤሃ፡ ጸለየት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወባረከት፡ ላዕሌሆን

Canonical Story Title: Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the Jewish merchant of Caesarea who stole a golden plate from the church, but later became a Christian.
The conversion of a Muslim merchant who had been imprisoned in Naples.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
Saint Mary turns water over which her anaphora was recited by Abba Samuˀel of Wali into miraculous bread.
The story of Dilasor, brother of Emperor Theodosius, who was Abba Kiros.
Christ orders Abba Samu'el of Wali to celebrate Mass for the feast of Saint Mary.
Abba Samuˀel of Wali is lifted up while reciting the Wəddase Maryam.
The priest from Nārdin who was accused because he kept a nun in his house.
The wrath of Saint Mary against the prefect of a church who tried to stop the priests from making a procession while singing hymns to her.
The abbot who did not allow the Miracles of Mary to be read in his monastery.
Emperor Honorius, who lived like a monk.
Mary, Conception of cycle: The conception and nativity of Saint Mary.
Mary, Childhood of cycle: Saint Mary stays in the Temple.
Oz, the Byzantine monk, is shown a vision of Hell by Saint Urael.
Mary, Engagement of cycle: Saint Mary is espoused to Saint Joseph.
Salome's hands are burned when she tries to verify Saint Mary's virginity, but they are healed when she takes the Christ Child into her arms.
The Jews plot to burn the body of Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees Christ kissing Saint Mary's burial cloth.
A monk, Abraham, drinks poisonous water while on a journey to visit the patriarch and dies, but is then raised from the dead.
King Bartaqu of Greece, who became a monk.
Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon instructs his disciples on his deathbed.
The story of Saint Alexius [Abdo l a-Masih], son of Emperor Theodosius.
The healing of the Egyptian King Soforon (or Safron).
Saint Mary heals a woman possessed by evil spirits.
Oz, the Byzantine monk, is shown a vision of Hell by Saint Urael.
A knight tries to seduce the wife of a friend, but she is saved by a vision.
The pious rich man whom Satan served in hopes of destroying him.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The virgin who sinned with many lovers.
The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
The man who was possessed by a spirit of epilepsy [nagargar] for 47 years.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The knight who wanted to seduce the daughter of the cobbler.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The two brothers from Rome, Peter, a deacon, and Stephen, an avaricious magistrate.
The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a rich sinner who had repented and was planning to build a monastery and become a monk.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The avaricious priest who visited a dying man who loved bribes.
The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
The shepherd near the church of Saint Paul in Rome who was possessed by a demon.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
The bankrupt merchant to whom Satan offered two pearls if he would deny Christ and Saint Mary.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The robber whom a bishop was commanded to bury after he was executed.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The Jewish cowherd who was baptized by his Christian companions.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
The mighty Goliath threatens to destroy the monastery of Saint Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The young man who was ready to serve Satan, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: God sends Saint Gabriel to Saint Mary for the Annunciation.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: The Jews plot to kill Saint Mary because of the miracles she was working while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Saint Mary leaves the Temple and enters the home of Saint Joseph.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The adoration of the shepherds and the Magi.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ celebrates Mass for Saint Mary.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The Circumcision.
Holy Family journey cycle: Herod orders the slaughter of the Innocents; a hunter with his dogs finds the Holy Family in flight from the king.
Holy Family journey cycle: The hunter reports to King Demateyanos, who comes to visit the Holy Family.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to return from the mountains of Lebanon to Bethlehem.
Holy Family journey cycle: An angel tells Saint Joseph to take Saint Mary and her child to Egypt.
Holy Family journey cycle: All Israel is upset by the coming of the Magi; Saint Gabriel tells Saint Mary to flee to the mountains of Lebanon.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Magi find the Holy Family and depart; Saint Mary flees to Tiberias and from there to the mountains of Lebanon.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family stays in Dirde.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Mary's prayer while in the wilderness of Edomeyas.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family returns from Egypt by way of Gaza.
Holy Family journey cycle: Saint Mary is welcomed when she returns to Galilee.
A container of oil remains suspended in mid air in a church of Saint Mary when the cord by which it was suspended breaks.
Christ gives Ethiopia as tithes to Saint Mary.
The couple that were guided by the wife's dream to find buried money with which to build a shrine to Saint Mary.
The Egyptian woman who lost a silver plate while bathing in a miraculous spring.
The story of Julius Aqfahasi.
The story of Abadir, a district governor of Egypt.
The story of King Tarses of Fars, who loved to kill Christians.
King Yasay of Egypt, who became a monk in Däbrä Rom.
The Jew from Rome who wanted to kill Christians, but was seized by the priests of the church of Saint Mary.
Saint Mary heals the wounds of Ermeyis of Sidon with a drop of her milk.
Patriarch Tewoqritos of Jerusalem rebukes King Akratis of Egypt for not fasting or praying.
The story of Astaqaˀos, the European potter who was buried alive.
The temptations that Akroseya, the wife of Qawestos, overcame.
The soul of Christina, the wife of Aaron, an Egyptian official, goes to Heaven.
The sinner whom Saint Mary healed after his relatives had spent all his money on physicians.
The pious abbot who was falsely accused by his monks of sinning with a woman.
The fisherman who was eaten up by a dragon but was found alive when the dragon's belly was cut open.
A container of oil remains suspended in mid air in a church of Saint Mary when the cord by which it was suspended breaks.
The couple that were guided by the wife's dream to find buried money with which to build a shrine to Saint Mary.
The man who wanted to give a banquet on Saint Mary's feast but was unable because of a famine.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The magi and their chief, Balaam, see the star of Christ's birth.
Mary, Childhood of cycle: When she is three years old, Saint Mary is taken to the Temple.
The Dormition and Assumption of Saint Mary's body into Heaven.
Saint Mary appears to the gabaz of her church in Waybela and tells him about the fall of Badlay.
Saladdin and his men try to force their way into the house where Saint Mary was born.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘሥዩም፡ ውስተ፡ ደብር፡ ጥቀ፡ ፈለግ፡ ውእቱ፡ ደብር፡ ወዓቃቢሃ፡ ወመጋቢሃ፡ ውእቱ፡ ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወኮነ፡ ሶበ፡ ይበውእ፡ ቅድመ፡ ሥዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ይብል፡ ሰላማ፡ ዘውእቱ፡ ሰላመ፡ መልአክ፡ ላዕሌሃ። ኮነ፡ ውእቱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ያፈቅራ፡ ለአሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ወይእቲ፡ ትነብር፡ ማዕዶተ፡ ፈለግ

Canonical Story Title: The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ መበለት፡ ውስተ፡ ደብር፡ ወትትለአካ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወታከብራ፡ ወታፈቅራ፡ በኵሉ፡ ልባ። ወኮነት፡ ይእቲ፡ መበለት፡ የዋሂተ፡ ወትጸውም፡ ወትጼሊ፡ ወበተፍጻሚተ፡ ጸሎታ፡ ትጼሊ፡ ጸሎተ፡ ምውታን

Canonical Story Title: The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ መበለት፡ ውስተ፡ ደብር፡ ዘኮነት፡ ትትለአክ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወፈድፋደ፡ ታከብራ፡ ወታበዝኅ፡ ሰላማ፡ ወተኄውጽ፡ አብያተ፡ ክርስቲያናት፡ ዘእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The monk who saved the church of Saint Mary in Atrib by his prayers when its destruction had been ordered by the Caliph.
Incipit: ንወጥን፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወበአኰቴተ፡ ስብሐቲሁ፡ ወንዜንወክሙ፡ ኦአኃው፡ ፍቁራን፡ ሕዝበ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘንተ፡ ዐቢየ፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በሀገረ፡ አትሪብ ። ወሀሎ፡ ንጉሥ፡ በውእቱ፡ መዋዕል፡ ዘስሙ፡ ከሊፋ፡ ወዝብሂል፡ ዘነግሠ፡ እምድኅረ፡ አቡሁ፡ ረስዲድ፡ ወትርጓሜሁ፡ ድሩክ፡ ብእሲ፡ ብሂል። ወኮነ፡ እምቅድመ፡ ይትወፈይ፡ መንግሥተ፡ ይትቃወሞሙ፡ ለክርስቲያን፡ ወይሰድዶሙ፡ ወይደቢ፡ አብያተ፡ ክርስቲያናት

Canonical Story Title: Abba Mardari, who overheard twelve angels talking about going to Constantinople to hear Saint John Chrysostom praise Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ አብ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አባ፡ ማርዳሪ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ክቡር፡ በኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ ደብሩ፡ በዕለተ፡ እሑድ፡ በጊዜ፡ ጽባሕ፡ እንዘ፡ ይጼሊ፡ ሰምዓ፡ ድምፀ፡ ፲፡ ወ፪፡ መላእክት፡ እንዘ፡ ይወርዱ፡ በጽባሕ

Canonical Story Title: The wealthy man to whom Saint Mary appeared in the form of a bird to save the countryside from pestilence.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ወውእቱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ባዕል፡ ውእቱ፡ ፈድፋደ፡ እምኵሎሙ፡ ሰብአ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ወቦቱ፡ ወርቀ፡ ወብሩረ፡ ወአልባሰ፡ ክቡረ፡…. ወብዙኅ፡ ግበሪሁ፡ ጥቀ። ወእምዝ፡ መጽአ፡ ሞት፡ ዐቢይ፡ ወአጋታ፡ ለሀገሩ

Canonical Story Title: Thecla is taken to Alexandria to see her brother, Abba Esi, in a boat guided by the Archangels Gabriel and Sureyal.
Incipit: ተአምሪሃ፡…. ዘገብረት፡ እንዘ፡ ተሐውር፡ ኀበ፡ ከብካበ፡ መርዓ፡ ስምዖሙ፡ ለአባ፡ ኤሲ፡ ወለቴክላ፡ እኅቱ፡ ኀበ፡ ሀገረ፡ እስክንድርያ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አባ፡ ኤሲ፡ ወቴክላ፡ እኅቱ፡ እምሰብአ፡ ቡጺር፡ እምአድያመ፡ ግብጽ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary incenses Thecla (continuation).
Incipit: ወእንዘ፡ ተሐውር፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ኀበ፡ ከብካበ፡ መርዓሆሙ፡ ወስምዖሙ፡ ለአባ፡ ኤሲ፡ ወቴክላ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ መልዕልተ፡ ባሕር፡ ምስለ፡ መላእክት

Canonical Story Title: The daughter of the rich man from Caesarea who could not deliver her baby.
Emperor Arcadius and the golden statue of Saint Mary; he asks Saint John Chrysostom to expound on Matthew 1: 25.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ኄር፡ መፍቀሬ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አርቃድዮስ፡ ወበመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለአብ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ አባ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ዐባይ፡ ቍስጥንጥንያ

Canonical Story Title: Abba Esi and Thecla are saved from the torture ordered by the judge (continuation of the preceding).
Incipit: ወእምዝ፡ አዘዘ፡ መኰንን፡ ከሐዲ፡ ከመ፡ ያንብርዎሙ፡ ዲበ፡ መናብርተ፡ ኃፂን

Canonical Story Title: Saint Paul is taken to the third heaven and there sees Saint Mary.
Incipit: ይቤ፡ ጳውሎስ፡ ዘይነግር፡ ስብሐቲሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘርእየ፡ በሰማይ፡ አመ፡ መሰጥዎ፡ ውስተ፡ ሰማይ፡ በከመ፡ ይቤ፡ ለሊሁ

Canonical Story Title: Abba Behor has a vision of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ ሎቱ፡ ለአባ፡ አሞኒ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ረድአ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አባ፡ ብሖር

Canonical Story Title: The vision of Gregory the Seer [ra'eya hebu'at].
Incipit: ይቤ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ፡ ራእየ፡ ኅቡኣት፡ እንዘ፡ ያይድዕ፡ ስብሐቲሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘርእየ፡ በሰማይ።

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Sawla, the wife of the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ቅድስት፡ ብእሲተ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ሐዲስ፡ መዋኢ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ ሰውላ

Canonical Story Title: The history ot Däbrä Mahew near Jerusalem and its miraculous spring.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ በሀገረ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ መንገለ፡ ሄኖን፡ በቅሩበ፡ ሳሌም፡ በማዕዶተ፡ ዮርዳኖስ

Canonical Story Title: The story of Awr, the son of the princess and the magician, Abrasit.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገር፡ ዘይብልዎ፡ ሙፃአ፡ ፀሐይ፡ ወሎቱ፡ ሀሎ፡ ዐቢይ፡ ብእሲ፡ መሠርይ፡ ጥቀ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አብራሲት

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary cures the son of a Roman official in Bethlehem.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ ዘይደዊ፡ ወልዱ። ወእንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ ወጐድጐደ፡ ኆኅተ፡ ቤታ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary heals a woman possessed by evil spirits.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ እንተ፡ ያጽሕብዋ፡ ብዙኃን፡ አጋንንት፡ ወመጽአት፡ ኀበ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወጸርሐት፡ በዐቢይ፡ ቃል

Canonical Story Title: An Egyptian woman comes to Saint Mary in Bethlehem and is healed of her fever.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ፈወሰታ፡ ለአሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ እምነ፡ ፈጸንታ። ወመጽአት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ እምምድረ፡ ግብጽ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ እንዘ፡ ትፈጽን፡ ዐቢየ፡ ፈጸንተ

Canonical Story Title: A woman whose right eye had been blinded by a demon is healed by Saint Mary.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አሕየወት፡ ዓይና፡ ለብእሲት። ጸሎታ፡…. ወእንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ መጽአት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ እንተ፡ አዖራ፡ ጋኔን፡ ዓይና፡ ዘየማን

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Timothy, Patriarch of Alexandria, in the church of Saint Pachomius in Alexandria.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘእለስክንድርያ፡ በውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያኑ፡ ለአባ፡ ጳኵሚስ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወሀለዉ፡ ብዙኃን፡ መነኮሳት፡ እምነ፡ ደቂቁ፡ ለአባ፡ ጳኵሚስ፡ ወእሙንቱ፡ በአምሳለ፡ መላእክት

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Anthony, a monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Incipit: ዘአስተርአየቶ፡ ለእንጦንስ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ቍስቋም። ጸሎታ፡…. አነ፡ እንጦንስ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ቍስቋም፡ ሖርኩ፡ ወሰብኩ፡ ወኖምኩ፡ ንስቲተ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Anthony of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam (continued).
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ እምንኡሳን፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ምስለ፡ አባ፡ ጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘእለስክንድርያ። ጸሎታ፡…. ይቤ፡ ውእቱ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዘርእየ፡ ራእየ፡ ወርኢክዋ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይእቲ፡ ተአወድ፡ አውዳ፡ ለሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary anoints sick animals and heals them at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ቀብአት፡ እገሪሆሙ፡ በቅብአ፡ በረከት፡ ወፈወሰቶሙ፡ ለእንስሳ። ጸሎታ፡…. ይቤ፡ እንጦንስ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ቍስቋም፡ እሙነ፡ እነግር፡ አነ፡ ከመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ህየ

Canonical Story Title: Message of Saint Mary to Anthony, monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Incipit: ወውእቱሰ፡ ይቤ፡ አንሰ፡ ርኢክዋ፡ ካዕበ፡ ለቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ በዛቲ፡ ሌሊት፡ ወይእቲ፡ ትቤለኒ፡ እስመ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ወልድየ፡ ፍቁር፡ ኅቡዕ

Canonical Story Title: Anthony, the monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam, asks about the anointing of the animals.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለእንጦንስ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ቍስቋም፡ ዘከመ፡ ትስእላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ በእንተ፡ ቅብአተ፡ እገሪሆሙ፡ ለእንስሳ፡ ለእሉ፡ ይመጽኡ፡ ኀበ፡ ደብረ፡ ቍስቋም። ጸሎታ፡…. ይቤ፡ እንጦንስ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ቍስቋም፡ ወተስእልክዋ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እንዘ፡ እብል፡ በእንተ፡ ምንት፡ ቀበእኪዮሙ፡ ለእገሪሆሙ፡ ለእንስሳ፡ በቅብእ፡ እምቅድመ፡ ሰብእ

Canonical Story Title: The blessing given to the animals at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam by the anointing of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለእንጦንስ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ቍስቋም፡ ወዘከመ፡ ርእየ፡ ውስተ፡ እዴሃ፡ ቢረሌ፡ ቅብእ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወአስተርአየተኒ፡ እግዝእትየ፡…. ጊዜ፡ ሰርክ፡ ውስተ፡ እዴሃ፡ ቢረሌ፡ ቅብእ

Canonical Story Title: The priest who left the keys of the church locked up inside.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ አበውየ፡ ወአኃውየ፡ ዘንተ፡ ተአምረ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ መካን፡ በዕለተ፡ በዓላ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ውስተ፡ ውእቱ፡ መካን፡ ዘይእኅዝ፡ መራኁተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን

Canonical Story Title: The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The life of Saint Mary to the birth of Christ.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ወነገረቶ፡ ሑረያቲሁ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ወምስለ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ ወምስለ፡ ሰሎሜ። ጸሎታ፡…. ይቤ፡ ጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ አንሰ፡ ርኢክዋ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ናሁ፡ ወረደት፡ እምሰማይ

Canonical Story Title: The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The flight into Egypt.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ወተናገረቶ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት። ጸሎታ፡…. ወናሁ፡ አስተርአዮ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፡ ለዮሴፍ፡ እንዘ፡ ይብል፡ ተንሥእ፡ ወንሣእ፡ ሕፃነ፡ ወእሞ፡ ወሑር፡ እምድረ፡ ግብጽ

Canonical Story Title: The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family receives hospitality from a shepherd.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ወተናገረቶ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት። ጸሎታ፡…. ወሶበ፡ ዐደውነ፡ ወኃለፍናሃ፡ ለእንትኩ፡ መከራት፡ ኵላ፡ ዘውስተ፡ እንታክቲ፡ ፍናዊት

Canonical Story Title: The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family crosses the Nile at Asmunayn.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Christ Child grants Saint Mary a vision of his future glory.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ወተናገረቶ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት። ጸሎታ፡…. ወይቤለኒ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልድየ፡ እንዘ፡ ይብል፡ ኦወለዲትየ፡ ርእዪ፡ ኀበ፡ መትሕት

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary gives a thirsty dog water to drink from her shoe.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተየቶ፡ ለከልብ፡ ጽሙእ፡ በአሣዕና። ጸሎታ፡…. ወሀለወት፡ አንስት፡ ምስለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወመጽአ፡ ከልብ፡ ወሰደዳሁ፡ ውእቶን፡ አንስት

Canonical Story Title: The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): Ahrufas, the guardian angel of Egypt, comes to the Holy Family.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ወተናገረቶ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት። ጸሎታ፡…. ወመጽአ፡ ኀቤነ፡ አኅሩፋስ፡ መልአክ፡ ዘየዓቅባለ፡ ምድረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ወሰገደ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልድየ፡ ከመ፡ ሕዙን

Canonical Story Title: The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The experience of the Holy Family in the district of Asmunayn.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ወተናገረቶ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት። ጸሎታ፡…. ወኮነ፡ ብነ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ አስሞኒን፡ እምድንጋፄ፡ ወፍርሃት፡ ወሐዘን

Canonical Story Title: The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family encounters thieves.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ወተናገረቶ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት። ጸሎታ፡…. ወኮነ፡ እምድኅረ፡ በአትነ፡ እምዝንቱ፡ መካን፡ ፍርሃት፡ ብዙኅ። ወወፅኡ፡ ላዕሌነ፡ ፈያት፡ ወአፍርሁነ፡ ጥቀ

Canonical Story Title: The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family arrives at Däbrä QWesqWam.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ወተናገረቶ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት። ጸሎታ፡…. ወሶበ፡ በጻሕነ፡ ኀቤሁ፡ ናንሶሱ፡ ዝየ፡ ወዝየ፡ ዮጊ፡ ለእመ፡ ንረክብ፡ መካነ፡ ሠናየ፡ ከመ፡ ንንበር፡ ውስቴቱ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Peter gives Saint John Chrysostom the keys of the kingdom and Saint John the Evangelist gives him the Gospels; then Saint Mary appears to him.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ አፈ፡ ወርቅ፡ በአልባስ፡ ጸዓዳ፡ ከመ፡ ዘበረድ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ቍስጥንጥንያ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አፈ፡ ወርቅ፡ ወእንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ውእቱ፡ እምቅድመ፡ ይንሣእ፡ ሢመተ፡ ቅስና

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews try to burn down the house where Saint Mary is staying but are burned up instead.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ወፅአት፡ እሳት፡ ወአውዓዮሙ፡ ለአይሁድ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወእምድኅረ፡ ኃምስ፡ መዋዕል፡ እንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ አእመረ፡ መኰንን፡ ወሊቃነ፡ ካህናት፡ ከመ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤታ

Canonical Story Title: The Holy Spirit recounts the salvific events that have occurred on Sunday.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ተናገረ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ክብራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ጸሎታ፡…. ወእምዝ፡ እምድኅረ፡ አስተርአየ፡ ዝተአምር፡ ላዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዕለ፡ አርድእት፡ ዘተናገረ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወይቤ፡ አእምሩኬ፡ ከመ፡ በዕለተ፡ እሑድ፡ አብሰራ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፡ ለማርያም፡ ቅድስት

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays with the disciples.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ጸለየት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ጸሎታ፡…. ወጸለየት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወትቤ፡ እግዚእየ፡ ወአምላኪየ፡ ስፋሕ፡ እዴከ፡ ወባርክ፡ ላዕሌየ

Canonical Story Title: The woman from Cairo who lived by the river and whose daughter became blind.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ምስለ፡ ሐማታ፡ በደወለ፡ ቃሕራ፡ ወቤታኒ፡ በጽንፈ፡ ባሕር፡ ወመዋግዲሁ፡ ይበጽሕ፡ ውስተ፡ አረፍታ

Canonical Story Title: A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በሀገረ፡ ሐርተልሮም፡ ወሥዕል፡ ዘሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወሰመይዋ፡ ስማ፡ ረዳኢት

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays with the disciples (continuation).
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ጸለየት፡ ካዕበ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ጸሎታ፡…. ወካዕበ፡ ጸለየት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ኦእግዚእየ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወልደ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ልዑል፡ ዘይገብር፡ ኵሎ፡ ዘፈቀደ፡ በሰማይ፡ ወበምድር

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays for the release of the souls in judgment.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አውፅአት፡ ነፍሳተ፡ እለ፡ እምውስተ፡ ደይን። ጸሎታ፡…. እፈቅድኬ፡ ዮም፡ ከመ፡ ትፈጽም፡ ሊተ፡ ኀሢሦትየ፡ ወታዕርግ፡ ኵሎ፡ ነፍሳተ፡ ዘውስተ፡ ኵነኔ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees a vision of Saint Mary in glory.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ርእያ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ፡ ነጕድጓድ፡ በዕለተ፡ ፍልሰታ፡ በከመ፡ ተስእለ፡ በእንቲአሃ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወአንሰ፡ እቤ፡ ኦእግዚእየ፡ ውስተ፡ አይኑ፡ መካናት፡ ሀለወት፡ ወላዲትከ፡ ድንግል

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ celebrates Mass for Saint Mary.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ተክህነ፡ እግዚእነ፡ በዕለተ፡ ፍልሰታ፡ ለወላዲቱ፡ ዘከመ፡ አቅረቦሙ፡ ለአርድእቱ፡ ወለኵሉ፡ ጉባኤ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወእምድኅረ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ኮነ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ካህነ፡ ለሥጋ፡ ወላዲቱ፡ ቅድስት

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary asks Christ that the disciples preach her Transitus and Assumption.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ተስእለቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ለወልዳ፡ ከመ፡ ይስብኩ፡ ፍልሰታ፡ ወዕርገታ። ጸሎታ፡…. በሊ፡ ለአርድእት፡ ከመ፡ በዝንቱ፡ ይስብኩ፡ ቍርባነ፡ ዘዮም

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary asks that Saint John be allowed to visit her dwelling place.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ሰአለቶ፡ ለወልዳ፡ ከመ፡ ያምጽኦ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ ወትርአዮ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወጸለየት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ እንዘ፡ ትብል፡ ኦእግዚእየ፡ ወአምላኪየ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘኀረያ፡ ለአመቱ፡ ድሉተ፡ ለተስብኦቱ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Prochorus reports Saint John's visit to Saint Mary's dwelling place.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ርእየ፡ ማኅደራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ፡ ንጕድጓድ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወይቤለኒ፡ አቡየ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ሊተ፡ ለአብሮኮሮስ፡ ወለመስተጋብኣን፡ ሰላም፡ ለክሙ። ወኢኃደገ፡ እንዘ፡ ይምዕዶሙ፡ ለጉቡኣን፡ እስከ፡ ጌሰም

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays to be taken from this life.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ጸሎታ፡…. ወትቤ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ እንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ በቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ ኦእግዚእየ፡ ሊቅ፡ ኄር፡ ፈኑ፡ ወንሥአኒ፡ እምዝዓለም፡ ዘምሉእ፡ ሐዘናት፡ ወሁከታት

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews go to Bethlehem to seize Saint Mary but are blinded.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ዖርያ፡ አዕይንቲሆሙ፡ ለአይሁድ፡  ወተጸለታ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወሶበ፡ ርእዩ፡ ተአምራተ፡ ወመንክራተ፡ ዘይገብር፡ ክርስቶስ፡ በቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ በእንተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ወኵሎሙ፡ እለ፡ ቦሙ፡ ደዌ፡ ወሕማመ፡ ይመጽኡ፡ ኀበ፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ, together with Saint Mary and the angels, appears to the Apostles and asks them to build churches in his name and hers throughout the world.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶሙ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ለሐዋርያት፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ምስለ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወገብርኤል። ጸሎታ፡…. ወናሁ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ አስተርአየ፡ ማእከሌነ፡ እንዘ፡ ይነብር፡ ዲበ፡ አክናፈ፡ ኪሩቤል

Canonical Story Title: Christ makes Saint Peter head of the Church.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶሙ፡ ማርያም፡ ለሐዋርያት። ጸሎታ፡…. ወእንዘ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ይምሕርዎሙ፡ ለሰብአ፡ ሀገር፡ ወነዋ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወረደ፡ እምሰማይ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary, together with Saints Irene and Sophia, appears to Saint Basil and tells him where her icon is buried.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለባስልዮስ፡ ምስለ፡ ክልኤ፡ አዋልድ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወእንዘ፡ አነ፡ እነውም፡ ነጸርኩ፡ ራእየ፡ ወነዋ፡ እሬኢ፡ ብእሲተ፡ ወይእቲ፡ ታበርህ፡ ኵለንታሃ፡ ከመ፡ ፀሐይ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil finds the buried icon of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ለባስልዮስ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ዘቂሳርያ፡ ወአእመረቶ፡ ሥዕለ፡ ዚአሃ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወሶበ፡ ተንሣእኩ፡ በጽባሕ፡ ለአኩ፡ ኀበ፡ ሠዓሊ፡ ወነሣእኩ፡ እምኔሁ፡ ሰሌዳ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary tells Saint Basil to take two pillars from a pagan temple.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለባስልዮስ። አኮኑ፡ እንዘ፡ እነውም፡ አስተርአየኒ፡ ከመ፡ ቀዳሚ፡ ጊዜ፡ ወትቤለኒ፡ እፎ፡ አንተ፡ ጽሩዕ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary sets up the pillars in the church and makes a miraculous spring flow out at their base.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለባስልዮስ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወእንዘ፡ አነ፡ እቀውም፡ ወእጼሊ፡ ረከበኒ፡ ድቃስ፡ ንስቲት፡ ወርኢኩ፡ ከመ፡ ብእሲት፡ ብርህት

Canonical Story Title: Salome's hands are burned when she tries to verify Saint Mary's virginity, but they are healed when she takes the Christ Child into her arms.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ውዕየ፡ እዴሃ፡ ለሰሎሜ፡ በገሲሰ፡ ሥጋሃ፡ ለማርያም፡ ወዘከመ፡ ሕይወ፡ በጸዊረ፡ ወልዳ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወእምዝ፡ አንሥአ፡ አዕይንቲሁ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ መንገለ፡ አድባር፡ ዘቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ ወናሁ፡ ርእየ፡ ብእሲተ፡ እንዘ፡ ትመጽእ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees Christ kissing Saint Mary's burial cloth.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ዜነዋ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ፡ ነጕድጓድ፡ እንዘ፡ ይኤምኅ፡ መግነዘ፡ እንተ፡ ላዕሌሃ። ጸሎታ፡…. አንሰ፡ ርኢክዎ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ እንዘ፡ ይኤምኅ፡ ለመግነዝ፡ እንተ፡ ላዕሌሃ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary's soul descends from heaven in a tent of light.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ መጽአት፡ ነፍሰ፡ ድንግል፡ በውስተ፡ ደብተራ፡ ብርሃን። ወካዕበ፡ አዘዘ፡ ውእተ፡ ደብተራ፡ ዐባየ፡ መጽአት፡ እምሰማይ፡ ወነፍሰ፡ ድንግል፡ ውስቴታ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Three virgins come to serve Saint Mary as she is about to give birth.
Saint John Chrysostom defends a woman whom Nestorius had told the people to spit upon.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ሰመየቶ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ አፈ፡ ወርቅ፡ ቅድመ፡ እንበለ፡ ይሠመይ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ እንዘ፡ ትብል፡ አፈ፡ ወርቅ፡ አመ፡ ሰዓመ፡ ኃፍረታ፡ ለብእሲት፡ በእንተ፡ ክብራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ወበአሐዱ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ ኮነ፡ ጉባኤ፡ ለመሃይምናን፡ ከመ፡ ይንሥኡ፡ ቍርባነ

Canonical Story Title: A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በሀገረ፡ ሐርተልሮም፡ ወሥዕል፡ ዘሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወሰመይዋ፡ ስማ፡ ረዳኢት

Canonical Story Title: The virgin who sinned with many lovers.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ድንግል፡ ምስለ፡ እማ፡ ወመጽአ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወሬዛ፡ ወአማሰነ፡ ድንግልናሃ። ወእምዝ፡ መጽኡ፡ ብዙኃን፡ ወራዙት፡ ወረኰሰት፡ ምስሌሆሙ

Canonical Story Title: A woman who had poisoned her sister and married her husband is swallowed up by the earth when she anoints herself with the oil that flowed from Saint Mary's icon.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ውኅጠተታ፡ ምድር፡ ለብእሲት፡ ሶበ፡ ተቀብአት፡ ቅብአ፡ ዘይት፡ ዘውሕዘ፡ እምነ፡ ሥዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ጸሎታ፡…. ወነዋ፡ ብእሲት፡ ቦአት፡ ዘባቲ፡ ውስተ፡ ሥጋሃ፡ ኀጢአት

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary rescues the ship in which Mar Barsuma is travelling.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ባልሐቶ፡ እምነ፡ መዋግደ፡ ባሕር፡ ለአባ፡ በርሱማ። ወኮነ፡ በአሐዱ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ ዓርገ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ማሪ፡ በርሱማ፡ ውስተ፡ ሐመር፡ ወይፈቅድ፡ ውእቱ፡ ሐዊረ፡ ምድረ፡ ቆጵሮስ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to the disciples of Mar Barsuma in the form of a dove.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶሙ፡ ለአርድእተ፡ አባ፡ በርሱማ፡ በአምሳለ፡ ርግብ፡ ጸዓዳ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወኮነ፡ ሶበ፡ አልጸቀ፡ ጊዜ፡ ጽባሕ፡ ወቆመ፡ ለጸሎት፡ ወጸለየ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ማሪ፡ በርሱማ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Saints Atrasis and Yona, virgins and martyrs.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶን፡ ለአጥራሲስ፡ ወለዮና፡ ሰማዕታት፡ ደናግል፡ ወዘከመ፡ ነሥአቶን፡ ወዘከመ፡ አቅረበቶን፡ ኀበ፡ ወልዳ፡ ወባረከ፡ ላዕሌሆን ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወዛቲ፡ አጥራሲስ፡ ወለቱ፡ ይእቲ፡ ለንጉሥ፡ እንድርያኖስ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Saint Sarabamon, the future bishop of Nikiou and martyr.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለሰረባሞን፡ ሰማዕት፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ነቂዮስ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ንኡሰ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እንዘ፡ ኢይጠመቅ፡ ወዘከመ፡ መርሐቶ፡ ኀበ፡ ጥምቀተ፡ ክርስትና። ጸሎታ፡…. ዝንቱ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ኮነ፡ እምዘመዱ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ እስጢፋኖስ

Canonical Story Title: The events that occurred during the captivity of Abbots Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon and John of Scete.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለአባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘደብረ፡ ቀልሞን፡ አመ፡ ወሰድዎ፡ በርባር፡ ወተመይጠ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወእምዝ፡ ወሰድዎ፡ ሰብኣ፡ በርባር፡ ለአባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘቀልሞን፡ ኀበ፡ ሀገሮሙ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Saint Nicholas and gives him priestly vestments.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ወሀበቶ፡ ብብሰ፡ ክህነት፡ ለአባ፡ ኒቃላዎስ፡ ዘሀሎ፡ ባሕቱ፡ ውእቱ፡ ብእሲ። ወተንሥአ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ኒቃላዎስ፡ በሌሊት፡ ወነሥአ፡ ፻፡ ዲናረ፡ እምንዋየ፡ አቡሁ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to the brother of Saint Basil, Saint Gregory, bishop of "the Islands" (i.e. of Nyassa).
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለጎርጎርዮስ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ዘደሰያት። ጸሎታ፡…. ዝንቱ፡ ብፁዕ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ፡ ዘተሠይመ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ላዕለ፡ ሀገረ፡ ደሴት

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Saint Paphnutius.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለአባ፡ በብኑዳ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ርእሰ፡ ባሕታውያን። ጸሎታ፡…. ወበፈቃደ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ፡ በጽሐ፡ አባ፡ በብኑዳ፡ ኀበ፡ ሀገር፡ ወአንሶሰወ፡ ኀበ፡ መርህባ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary raises Andrew, a disciple of Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon, from the dead.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ተናገረቶ፡ ወአስተርአየቶ፡ ለአባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘደብረ፡ ቀልሞን፡ ወዘከመ፡ አንሥአቶ፡ ለረድኡ፡ እንድርያስ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወሀለዉ፡ ክልኤቱ፡ አኃው፡ ኀበ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘደብረ፡ ቀልሞን፡ ወስሙ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወለካልኡ፡ እንድርያስ

Canonical Story Title: Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon instructs his disciples on his deathbed.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ወአስተፍሥሐቶ፡ አመ፡ ዕለተ፡ ዕረፍቱ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወደወየ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ወይቤልዎ፡ አእሩግ፡ ንግረነ፡ በዘነሐዩ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Saint Theodore the Anatolian.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለቴዎድሮስ፡ ምሥራቃዊ፡ ምስለ፡ ወልዳ፡ መድኃኔ፡ ዓለም። ወይመጽኡ፡ ኀቤሁ፡ መላእክት፡ በኵሉ፡ ጊዜ፡ ለቴዎድሮስ፡ ዘእምሠራዊት

Canonical Story Title: A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
Incipit: ወአመ፡ ቀዳሚ፡ መዋዕል፡ ሶበ፡ መበለት፡ ስሕተት፡ በዕልወተ፡ ንግሥት፡ ርኩስት፡ ሀለወት፡ መበለት፡ ዘትነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ምኔት፡ ወይእቲ፡ ቅድስት፡ ወጸጋ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ላዕሌሃ፡ ወኵሉ፡ ሰብእ፡ ይመጽኡ፡ ኃቤሃ፡ ከመ፡ ይነሥኡ፡ በረከተ

Canonical Story Title: The fate of the monk, Giyorgis, who followed the teachings of Za-Mika'el.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ አበውየ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ አኃው፡ ኄራን፡ እለ፡ ሀለውክሙ፡ በርትዕት፡ ሃይማኖት፡ በትምህርተ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ንጹሓን፡ ነገረ፡ ተአምር፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘከሠተት፡ ወበእንተ፡ እለ፡ ያስትቱ፡ ደብረ፡ ጽዮን፡ ወበእንተ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ እምውሉደ፡ ዕልወ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወዘሚካኤል

Canonical Story Title: The vision of a certain saint about the fate of a priest who swore falsely.
Incipit: ዘአስተርአየቶ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ወመንክራቲሃ፡ ዘገብረት፡ ላዕለ፡ ካህን፡ መሐሊ፡ በሐሰት፡ አርአየቶ፡ እምቅዱሳን

Canonical Story Title: Abbas sees a vision of Saint Mary blessing the monks who were chanting the Psalms.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ አባስ፡ ዘይዜምር፡ ወትረ፡ በመዝሙረ፡ ዳዊት። ይቤ፡ ለሊሁ፡ እንዘ፡ እጼሊ፡ ጸሎተ፡ በውስተ፡ ጾማዕትየ፡ ርኢኩ፡ ራእየ፡ ግሩመ

Canonical Story Title: The inhabitants of Damot who would not observe the feast days of Saint Mary are punished by a storm that brings down a mighty tree.
Incipit: ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘገብረቶ፡ በምድረ፡ ዳሞት፡ ዘይሰመይ፡ አንስላል፡ ዘኢሰማዕነ፡ ወዘኢርኢነ፡ ወኢነገሩነ፡ አበዊነ፡ ዘኢተገብረ፡ በምልአ፡ ኢትዮጵያ፡ ከመ፡ አውደቀት፡ ኦመ፡ ዐቢየ

Canonical Story Title: The brigands who killed each other at the miraculous spring.
Incipit: ወእምድኅረ፡ ዕርገቱ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ መጽአ፡ ካልእ፡ ፈያታይ፡ ወዘቀተሎ፡ ለፈያታይ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ንዉም፡ በውስተ፡ ማያ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The son of a rich official of Cappadocia is raised from the dead.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ኮነ፡ ብእሲ፡ ባዕል፡ በሀገረ፡ ቀጰዶቅያ፡ ወኮነ፡ ሎቱ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወልደ፡ አዚዝ፡ በኀቤሁ፡ እስመ፡ ብዙኅ፡ ያፈቅሮ

Canonical Story Title: The judgment of the court of Zärˀa Yaˁəqob against the Stephanites.
Incipit: ተአምረ፡ መስቀሉ፡ ለወልዳ፡ ዘገብሮ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ በእንተ፡ እሙ፡ ማርያም፡…. በእንተ፡ መስቀሉ። ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ዐባይ፡ በብሔረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወነገሥታቲሃ፡ ወጳጳሳቲሃ፡ ወኵሎሙ፡ እለ፡ ይነብሩ፡ ውስቴታ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እሙንቱ፡ ወይገብሩ፡ በዓላቲሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Synaxary entry for 16 Nahase: The Apostles visit Saint Mary in heaven.
Incipit: ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በከመ፡ ተረክበ፡ በመጸሕፍተ፡ ስንክሳር፡ አመ፡ ፲ወ፮፡ ለነሐሴ። በዛቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ኮነት፡ ዕርገተ፡ ሥጋሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ኀበ፡ ሰማይ። እስመ፡ እምድኅረ፡ ዕረፍታ፡ ነበሩ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ እንዘ፡ የሐዝኑ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Anonymous homily against the report that the Apostles abandoned the body of Saint Mary when they were attacked by the Jews during her funeral procession.
Incipit: ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘይትነበብ፡ አመ፡ ፳ወ፩፡ ለወርኃ፡ ጥር፡ ወአመ፡ ፲ወ፮፡ ለወርኃ፡ ነሐሴ። ይቤ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሐለይኩ፡ ከመ፡ እትቀነይ፡ ማኅሌታ፡ ለማርያም፡…. በበዓለ፡ ፍልሰተ፡ ሥጋሃ፡ አመ፡ ፲ወ፮፡ ለነሐሴ፡ ወረከብኩ፡ በውስተ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ፍልሰታ፡ ዘይብል፡ ገደፉ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ በድና፡ ለማርያም

Canonical Story Title: A Christian community is attacked by a neighboring Muslim community.
Incipit: ዘገብረት፡ መንክረ፡ ወመድምመ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገረ፡ ክርስቲያን። ወበህየ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ደብር፡ ወነዋኅቆማ፡ ወበሉዓሌሃ፡ ስፍሕት፡ በአምጣን፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በስመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ

Canonical Story Title: A renegade monk who had become a Jew is hunted down by the troops of the king.
A Jew is led to baptism by a dream about a lion and a monk; afterwards he curses a Jew at the latter's request.
Incipit: ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ንስቲት፡ ደወል፡ ወይነብሩ፡ ውስቴታ፡ መብዝኅቶሙ፡ አይሁድ፡ ወይነብሩ፡ ህየ፡ ውሑዳን፡ ክርስቲያን። ወሶበ፡ ሰምዓ፡ እምኔሆሙ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወልድ፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ ትምህርተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወነበረ፡ እንዘ፡ ይብል፡ እሙንኑ፡ ሃይማኖተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወሚመ፡ ሃይማኖተ፡ አይሁድኑ፡ እሙን

Canonical Story Title: The beggar at the church of Qirqos in Amhara from whose head a horn grew.
Incipit: በ፮፻፡ ወ፱፻፡ ወ፴፡ ወ፬፡ ዓመት፡ እምዓለም፡ በመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ወስመ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ቈስጠንጢኖስ፡ ወልደ፡ ዳዊት

Canonical Story Title: A huge tree needed for the construction of Hagara Maryam that they were unable to cut down falls down for them during the night.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ በአሐዱ፡ ዘመን፡ ይኃሥሡ፡ ላቲ፡ ጐንደ፡ ዕፀው፡ ገዚፈ፡ ለምግባረ፡ ድፍነት

Canonical Story Title: Stone needed for the construction of Hagara Maryam is found by the help of a vislon.
Incipit: አጽምኡ፡ ሕዝብየ፡ ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ አመ፡ ትትኃነጽ፡ ሀገረ፡ ማርያም፡ እንዘ፡ ይቴከዙ፡ ለኃሢሠ፡ እብን፡ በብዙኅ፡ ፍና

Canonical Story Title: A tree intended for a pillar for Hagara Maryam falls over a cliff, when they cut it down, but it is recovered undamaged.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ ምእመናን፡ ዘአርአየት፡ ዕፁበ፡ በውስተ፡ ባዕድ፡ ሀገር። ወተንሥአ፡ ስምዖን፡ ፍቁራ፡ ለኃሢሠ፡ ዓምደ፡ ጽሕድ፡ ከመ፡ ይግበር፡ ሰዊቀ፡ ስቅላሃ፡ ለሀገረ፡ ማርያም

Canonical Story Title: The Magicians who tried to cast a spell on the Epiphany water.
Incipit: ንጽሕፍ፡ ተአምረ፡ ልደቱ፡ ለወልደ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ክቡር፡ ውእቱ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ። መቅድመ፡ ቃል፡ ዘሰመዮ፡ ሄኖክ፡ ዘዓርገ፡ በነኰርኳረ፡ ነፋስ

Canonical Story Title: The birth of the prince, Batergela Maryam.
Incipit: ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ለአሐቲ፡ ብእሲተ፡ መስፍን፡ በኃይለ፡ ወልዳ፡ ፍቁር። ጸሎታ፡…. ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መስፍን፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ዐባይ፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወቦቱ፡ ብእሲተ፡ እምዘመደ፡ ኄራን፡ ወስፉቀ፡ ፍቅረ፡ ያፈቅራ

Canonical Story Title: Batergela Maryam is accused of treason and is imprisoned.
Incipit: ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ለዝኩ፡ ወልድ፡ በተርጌላ፡ ማርያም። ጸሎታ፡…. ወኮነ፡ ሶበ፡ ልህቀ፡ ዝኩ፡ ሕፃን፡ በቴርጌላ፡ ማርያም፡ ይጸመድ፡ ወትረ፡ በዴዴ፡ መስፍን

Canonical Story Title: Batergela Maryam is protected from the plague; his calumniator is punished by the king.
Incipit: ዘገብረት፡ ሎቱ፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ለገብረ፡ ዚአሃ፡ በቴርጌላ፡ ማርያም። ጸሎታ፡…. ወኮነ፡ ሶበ፡ በዝኃ፡ ሕማመ፡ ብድብድ፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵሉ፡ ምድር፡ በዴዴ፡ መስፍን፡ አዘዞሙ፡ መስፍን፡ ለወልዱ፡ ወለአዋልዲሁ፡ ወለኵሉ፡ ዕድ፡ ወአንስት፡ አዘዞሙ፡ ይትማህለሉ፡ ኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ልዑል፡ ወኀበ፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: When the destruction of Däbrä Metmaq is reported in Ethiopia, the king orders the construction of a new monastery to take its place.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለአስራፍ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ምስር፡ ከሐዲ፡ ኮነ፡ ስደት፡ ዐቢይ፡ ላዕለ፡ አብያተ፡ ክርስቲያናት፡ በመዋዕለ፡ ሢመቱ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘሀገረ፡ እለ፡ ስክንድርያ፡ አባ፡ ዮሐንስ። ወአሜሃ፡ ተጋብኡ፡ ተንበላት፡ እለ፡ ሀለዉ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ ስንደፋ፡ ወእልማሓሉ፡ ወደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ወበምክረ፡ ሰይጣን፡ አቡሆሙ፡ ተማከረ፡ ምክረ፡ እኩየ

Canonical Story Title: When Satan destroys the oven of a monastery, he is compelled to serve the monks for twelve years in punishment.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአድያመ፡ ግብጽ፡ ወውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ሀለወት፡ ደብር፡ ዘመነኮሳት፡ ወሶበ፡ አመከሮሙ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ለእሙንቱ፡ መነኮሳት፡ ነጺሮ፡ ትጋሆሙ፡ በነሲተ፡ እቶኖሙ፡ እንዘ፡ ይመልእ፡ መሬተ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary shows those assembled at Däbrä Metmaq a vision of Mohammad in Hell.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ ኦሕዝበ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ከመ፡ ናይድዕክሙ፡ ዘንተ፡ ተአምረ፡ ዐቢየ፡ ወመድምመ፡ ዘተገብረ፡ በቤተ፡ ክርስቲያና፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ። ወበአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ እንዘ፡ ጉቡኣን፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ይገብሩ፡ በዓላ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ንጉሠ፡ አፍርንጊ፡ ወንጉሠ፡ ሮም፡ ወሶርያ፡ ወማሮን፡ በከመ፡ ልማዶሙ

Canonical Story Title: The Apostles gather for the funeral of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ እምድኅረ፡ ተጋብኡ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ለግንዘተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡… ቦ፡ እለ፡ ተንሥኡ፡ እምመቃብሪሆሙ፡ ወቦ፡ እለ፡ መጽኡ፡ በደመና

Canonical Story Title: The merchant from Senfewat who struck the icon of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ንነግረክሙ፡ መንክረ፡ ዘጸሐፋ፡ አባ፡ ቶማስ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ላዕለ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ቤት

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: When Tafoneya lays hands on the bier of Saint Mary, an angel cuts his arms off.
Incipit: ወሶበ፡ ተጋብኡ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ለግንዘተ፡ እሙ፡ ወረከብዋ፡ ለማርያም፡ በክብር፡ ወበዐቢይ፡ ስብሐት

Canonical Story Title: The reopening of the church in Harat Zuwayla.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ስልጣን፡ በምሥር፡ ተንበላታይ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወይቤሎሙ፡ ለክርስቲያን፡ ዕፅዉ፡ ለአብያተ፡ ክርስቲያኒክሙ

Canonical Story Title: The healing of the Egyptian King Soforon (or Safron).
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ግብጽ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ሶፎሮን። ወናሁ፡ መጽአ፡ ሶፎሮን፡ ኀበ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ዘአኃዞ፡ አንበሳ፡ ድማሖ

Canonical Story Title: The recovery of the icons stolen from Hagara Maryam.
Incipit: ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እጽሕፍ፡ ለክሙ፡ መሃይምናን፡ እንተ፡ ትትዌከሉ፡ በኃይለ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ እጽሕፍ፡ ለክሙ፡ ካህናት፡ እንተ፡ ትጸውዱ፡ ለስብሐቲሃ

Canonical Story Title: The miracle concerning the golden ink during the reign of King Dawit.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ እንከ፡ ንንግርክሙ፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ዘገብረት፡ ሎቱ፡ ለንጉሥ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዳዊት፡ ዘተሰምየ፡ ቈስጠንጢኖስ፡ በጸሎተ፡ እግዝእቱ

Canonical Story Title: The chastisement of the heretic, Nestorius.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ ቀሰፈቶ፡ ለንስጡር፡ ኑፉቅ፡ ዘጸረፈ፡ ላዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወኮነ፡ ትሐዘብዎ፡ ለንስጡር፡ ከመ፡ ገብአ፡ ውእቱ፡ እምስሕተቱ፡ ዘስሕተ፡ ውእቱ፡ ውስቴቱ፡ ወኢኃደገ፡ ተባዳሬ፡ ውስተ፡ ስሕተቱ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the rich man who refused to give him a tablet [saleda] for an icon of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘስሙ፡ ባስልዮስ፡ ወውእቱ፡ ይጌሥጾሙ፡ ለአብዕልት፡ ወይቤሎሙ፡ ሀቡ፡ እምንዋይክሙ፡ ለነዳያን

Canonical Story Title: The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ቅምር፡ ክቡረ፡ ዘመድ፡ በስምሰ፡ ክርስቲያናዊ፡ ወኀጢአቱ፡ ዐቢይ፡ እምኀጢአተ፡ ኵሉ፡ ሰብእ

Canonical Story Title: The man who was possessed by a spirit of epilepsy [nagargar] for 47 years.
Incipit: ወነበርኪ፡ ፲ወ፪፡ ዓመተ፡ እንዘ፡ ትትናዘዚ፡ እምመላእክት፡ ወያመጽኡ፡ ወትረ፡ ሲሳየኪ፡ ወስቴኪኒ፡ ስቴ፡ ሰማይ፡ ዘእምሰማይ፡ ዘተቀድሐ፡…. ወመጽአ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘአኃዞ፡ ነገርጋር፡ እምብዙኅ፡ ዓመታት፡ ወኍልቈ፡ ዓመታቲሁ፡ ፵ወ፯፡ ዓመት

Canonical Story Title: Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the Jewish merchant of Caesarea who stole a golden plate from the church, but later became a Christian.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ኮነ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ነጋዲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ቂሳርያ፡ ወዝንቱ፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ ኮነ፡ መሃሬ፡ ለኵሉ፡ ሰብእ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወይሐውር፡ በሕገ፡ ሙሴ

Canonical Story Title: The miraculous spring of Mehzab.
The story of Saint Menas and his brother.
The election of Patriarch Matthew I.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘስሙ፡ አባ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ዘእለስክንድርያ። ወበውእቱ፡ መዋዕል፡ ነበረ፡ አሐዱ፡ ካህን፡ ዘስሙ፡ ማቴዎስ

Canonical Story Title: The story of Saint Alexius [Abdo l a-Masih], son of Emperor Theodosius.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ በብሔረ፡ ቍስጥንጥንያ፡ ወብእሲቱኒ፡ ሠናይት፡ ወፈራሂተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወክልኤሆሙ፡ ጻድቃን፡ እሙንቱ፡ ዘይገብሩ፡ ሥምረቶ፡ ለልዑል

Canonical Story Title: The faded icon of Saint Mary that the mother-in-law wanted to discard.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ምስለ፡ ሐማታ፡ ዘታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወሥዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ሀሎ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ ወትትአመን፡ ባ

Canonical Story Title: The woman from Cairo whose children all died.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በደወለ፡ ቃሕራ፡ ወወለደት፡ ፱፡ ውሉደ፡ ወሞቱ፡ ኵሎሙ

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The places in Egypt visited by the Holy Family.
Incipit: ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ። ወኀበ፡ ሀሎ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ህየ፡ ሀለወት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወኀበ፡ ሀለወት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ህየ፡ ሀሎ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ

Canonical Story Title: The nominal Christian from Sidon who encountered a dragon.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሲዶና፡ ወልደ፡ ክቡራን፡ እምዘመደ፡ መንግሥት፡ በስምሰ፡ ክርስቲያናዊ፡ ወይገብር፡ ብዙኃ፡ ኀጢአተ

Canonical Story Title: The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ ጠርሲስ፡ ዘቂልቂያ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሐራዊ፡ መስፍን፡ ዘንጉሥ፡ ወይገብር፡ ዐቢየ፡ ኀጢአተ፡ ወርኩሰ፡ ውእቱ፡ ዘበስምሰ፡ ዲያቆን

Canonical Story Title: The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
Incipit: ወነበረ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ገላትያ፡ ፈያታዊ፡ ቅታሌ፡ ነፍስ፡ ወይሐውር፡ እምገዳም፡ ውስተ፡ ገዳም፡ ወእምአድባር፡ ውስተ፡ አድባር፡ ወይቀትል፡ ኵሎ፡ ዘረከበ

Canonical Story Title: The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ ዘቍስጥንጥንያ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አብሪሳርዮን፡ ዘበዕብራይስጢ፡ ወበትርጓሜሁ፡ ግሩም፡ ንጉሥ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
Incipit: ወነበረ፡ አሐዱ፡ ዲያቆን፡ ውስተ፡ ደሴት፡ ዘውስተ፡ ባሕረ፡ ኢያሪኮ፡ መንገለ፡ ቀርሜሎስ፡ እስመ፡ ዘማዊ፡ ውእቱ፡ ዘይገብር፡ ብዙኃ፡ ኃጣውኣ፡ ወፍዱል፡ እምኃጣውአ፡ ሰብእ፡ ከመ፡ ሰዶም፡ ወገሞራ

Canonical Story Title: The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ሐራዊ፡ ዘንጉሥ፡ እስመ፡ ፈረሳዊ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወይገብር፡ ብዙኃ፡ ኀጣውአ፡ ዘአልቦ፡ ኍልቈ፡ ወኢመስፈርተ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ኒቆዲሞስ፡ ወያፈደፍድ፡ ቀሪበ፡ አንስት፡ በዝሙት፡ ዘአልቦ፡ ኍልቈ፡ ወይሐውር፡ በኵሉ፡ ፍናወ፡ ዓለም። ወባሕቱ፡ ጸጋ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወስእለተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ኃወጸቶ

Canonical Story Title: The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ፊንቄ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ባሮክ፡ ጠዋይ፡ ዘአልቦቱ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ዘያሠምሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ከመ፡ ይስረይ፡ ኃጣውኢሁ

Canonical Story Title: The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ስዒድ፡ ዘላዕላይ፡ ግብጽ፡ ኅሩይ፡ በኵሉ፡ ግዕዙ፡ ወሠናይ፡ ምግባሩ፡ ወርቱዕ፡ ፍናዊሁ፡ በሃይማኖተ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወኢያደሉ፡ ለገጸ፡ ሰብእ፡ በውስተ፡ ፍትሕ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ ሢመቱ

Canonical Story Title: The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
Incipit: ፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይገይስ፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ያቄርብ፡ ላቲ፡ አጰርጌ፡ ንጹሐ፡ ዘምስለ፡ ጸሎት፡ እንዘ፡ ይሴብሕ፡ ወድሶታ፡ ለማርያም

Canonical Story Title: Alexander, a Jew from Jerusalem, is delivered three days after he was swallowed up by a dragon.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዕብራዊ፡ እምዘመደ፡ ክቡራን፡ በሀገረ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ዘስሙ፡ እለስክንድሮስ፡ ወይሐውር፡ በግዕዘ፡ አይሁድ፡ ወይገብር፡ ኃጣውአ፡ ብዙኃ፡ ዘያምዕዖ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ በርድዮስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ባኖስ፡ ወእንዘ፡ ሀለወ፡ ውስተ፡ ዓለም፡ ነበረ፡ ይሐውር፡ ኀበ፡ አባ፡ ያዕቆብ

Canonical Story Title: The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The knight who wanted to seduce the daughter of the cobbler.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ደማስቆ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ኤጲፋንዮስ፡ ሰፋዬ፡ አሣዕን፡ ወሀለወቶ፡ ወለት፡ ሠናይት፡ ስነ፡ ላሕያ፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ኪያሃ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወልድ፡ ወሬዛ፡ ንኡሰ፡ ዓመታት፡ እምደቂቀ፡ እስራኤል፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ በሀገረ፡ ጢሮስ፡ ወኮነ፡ ይሜህር፡ መዝሙረ፡ ዳዊት

Canonical Story Title: The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ዘውስቴታ፡ ሕኑጽ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ በስሙ፡ ለሊቀ፡ መላእክት፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወብዙኅ፡ ሰብእ፡ ብፁዓዊያን፡ ኢያነትጉ፡ ገይሰ፡ አመ፡ በዓሉ፡ ለሊቀ፡ መላእክት፡ ሚካኤል፡ ለለኵሉ፡ ዓመት፡ አመ፡ ፲ወ፪፡ ለወርኃ፡ ኅዳር። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ሶበ፡ ሀለዉ፡ የሐውሩ፡ ውስተ፡ ፍኖት፡ ለበጺሕ፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወናሁ፡ መጽአ፡ ድምፀ፡ ማይ፡ እምባሕር

Canonical Story Title: A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ኃመር፡ ዐባይ፡ እንዘ፡ ትመጽእ፡ እምመስዕ፡ ለዓረብ፡ በዲበ፡ ባሕረ፡ ኤርትራ፡ ወሀለዉ፡ ብዙኅ፡ ሰብእ፡ ውስቴታ፡ የሐውሩ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ምስለ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጎርጎርዮስ

Canonical Story Title: The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ፍልስጥኤም፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮናስ፡ ዘኃደገ፡ ብእሲቶ፡ ወአውሰበ፡ ካልእተ። ወሶበ፡ አእመረት፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ግብረ፡ ምታ፡ ተከዘት፡ ጥቀ፡ ወሐዘነት፡ ፈድፋደ

Canonical Story Title: The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ ልማዶሙ፡ ለሰብአ፡ ሮሜ፡ አመ፡ በዓለ፡ ዕረፍታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ይመጽኡ፡ እምለፌ፡ ወእምለፌ፡ እምምሥራቅ፡ ወእምምዕራብ፡ ወይትጋብኡ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም

Canonical Story Title: The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በሀገረ፡ ሳምር፡ ዘስማ፡ አፎምያ፡ ወእቤር፡ ይእቲ፡ ወፅንስት፡ በንዴት፡ ወሀለዋ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወልድ፡ ወአልባቲ፡ ካልአ፡ ኢወልደ፡ ወኢወለተ፡ ዘእንበሌሁ

Canonical Story Title: The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወሬዛ፡ ዘሠናይ፡ ስነ፡ ላሕዩ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዘካርያስ፡ ዘውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ እምዘመደ፡ ነገሥት። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ቦአ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ከመ፡ ይጼሊ፡ ወነጸረ፡ ሥዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
Incipit: ወሀለዋ፡ ክልኤ፡ አንስት፡ አእማተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ እምአዋልደ፡ ይሁዳ፡ ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ እንዘ፡ የሐውራ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ይሰግዳ፡ ለበዓለ፡ ፍልሰተ፡ ሥጋሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
Incipit: ወአስተርአየ፡ ዐቢይ፡ ተአምር፡ ዘገብሮ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ በእደ፡ እሙ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ለቈስጠንጢኖስ፡ ወእሙ፡ እሌኒ፡ ንግሥት። ወከማሁ፡ ኮነ፡ ወሀለወት፡ እኅቱ፡ ለቈስጠንጢኖስ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዘስማ፡ ታውዶስያ

Canonical Story Title: The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወልድ/ወሬዛ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ቆዝሞስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ባርቶስ፡ ወግዕዙ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወንጹሕ፡ በምግባረ፡ ጽድቅ፡ ወበሃይማኖት፡ ርትዕት፡ እስመ፡ ያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወይትቀነይ፡ ላቲ፡ በጥቡዕ፡ ልብ፡ ወይትለአክ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያና፡ በኵሉ፡ ኀይሉ። ወካዕበ፡ ዐርገ፡ ዲበ፡ ደብረ፡ ዘይት፡ ኀበ፡ ሀሎ፡ ምኔት፡ ዘመነኮሳት፡ ከመ፡ ይትመከር፡ በህየ

Canonical Story Title: Homily on the miracles of Saint Mary.
Bishop Mercurius, whom the patriarch wanted to remove because of leprosy.
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ በሀገረ፡ ኤፌሶን፡ ዘስሙ፡ አርማትያስ፡ እስመ፡ ሠናይ፡ ብእሲሁ፡ ወፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ውእቱ፡ ወፈድፋደሰ፡ ያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወይትቀነይ፡ ላቲ፡ በኵሉ፡ ኃይሉ። ወሀሎ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በረከቶ፡ ይመልእ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤቱ፡ ወይዌስክ፡ ሲሳየ፡ በዲበ፡ ሲሳዩ

Canonical Story Title: The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
Incipit: ወነበረት፡ አሐቲ፡ እመ፡ ምኔት፡ በደብረ፡ ቀርሜሎስ፡ ዘስማ፡ ሶፍያ፡ ብእሲት፡ ኅሪት፡ ጽሕቅት፡ ለምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወጸልዮ፡ ወትትለአክ፡ ለቤተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ በብዙኅ፡ ፃማ፡ ወበዐቢይ፡ ቅኔ

Canonical Story Title: A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሀያብ፡ መዓር፡ ዘይለምድ፡ ንህበ፡ ብዙኃ፡ ረከቦ፡ ፈድፋደ፡ እምኵሉ፡ ሰብእ። ወእምዝ፡ ኄጦ፡ ሰይጣን፡ በምክረ፡ እኩይ፡ ወረሰዮ፡ ይሑር፡ ኀበ፡ ብእሲት፡ አሐቲ፡ መሠሪት

Canonical Story Title: The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዕብራዊ፡ ይነብር፡ በሀገረ፡ አክሚም፡ እስመ፡ ፈድፋደ፡ ያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እምስርወ፡ ልቡ፡ በፍርሃት፡ ወበረዓድ፡ ወኢይጸርዕ፡ እምአፉሁ፡ ዝክረ፡ ስማ፡ ዘምስለ፡ ሰጊድ፡ ወግናይ

Canonical Story Title: The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ድምያኖስ፡ ዘይነብር፡ በሀገረ፡ ፊልጵስዩስ፡ ዲበ፡ ደብር፡ ነዋኅ፡ ዘውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እስመ፡ ውእቱ፡ ያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እምማዕምቀ፡ ልቡ፡ ወይትቀነይ፡ ላቲ፡ በመልእክቱ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ኀይሉ፡ ወይተግህ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያና፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በውስተ፡ መጻሕፍት፡ ኵሉ፡ ዘሀሎ

Canonical Story Title: The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘይብልዎ፡ አባስ፡ እምጳጳሳተ፡ ሮሜ፡ ብእሲ፡ ኄር፡ ወቅዱስ፡ ወንዑድ፡ በክህነቱ፡ ወይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወየዓቅብ፡ ነፍሶ፡ በንጽሕ፡ እምዝሙተ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወርኵስ፡ ወእምሑከተ፡ ሕሊና

Canonical Story Title: A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
Incipit: ወአመ፡ ቀዳሚ፡ መዋዕል፡ ሶበ፡ መበለት፡ ስሕተት፡ በዕልወተ፡ ንግሥት፡ ርኩስት፡ ሀለወት፡ መበለት፡ ዘትነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ምኔት፡ ወይእቲ፡ ቅድስት፡ ወጸጋ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ላዕሌሃ፡ ወኵሉ፡ ሰብእ፡ ይመጽኡ፡ ኃቤሃ፡ ከመ፡ ይነሥኡ፡ በረከተ

Canonical Story Title: The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ኃጥእት፡ ዘገብረት፡ ኀጣውኣ፡ ዐበይተ፡ ወእምኵሉ፡ ዘየዐቢ፡ ጌጋያ፡ ትኔሥሕ፡ ወተመዪጣ፡ ትገብእ፡ ኀበ፡ ዘቀዳሚ፡ ምግባራ

Canonical Story Title: The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ጠቢብ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ሲላን፡ በደብረ፡ ኢቆንዮን፡ ወመንኰሰ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ደብር። ወሶበ፡ ርእየ፡ ሲሳዮሙ፡ ለቅዱሳን፡ ዘይበልዑ፡ ሐለየ፡ በልቡ

Canonical Story Title: The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ በቤተ፡ ሶፍያ፡ ዘስማ፡ እንባምሬና፡ ዘደወየት፡ በሕማመ፡ ዓይን

Canonical Story Title: The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ዘስማ፡ ሶፍያ፡ ክብርት፡ ዘትነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ደሴት፡ ማእከለ፡ ባሕር፡ ዘሰመናዊ፡ ወይእቲ፡ እምዐበይተ፡ ሀገር፡ ወለተ፡ ክቡራነ፡ ዘመድ፡ እምድቂቀ፡ እስራኤል፡ አቡሃ፡ ወእማ፡ እምቤተ፡ አሮን

Canonical Story Title: The persecution of the Christians during the patriarchate of Cosmas II.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
Incipit: ወነበረ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ ቍስጥንጥንያ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አቦሊ፡ እስመ፡ ባዕል፡ ወነጋዲ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወጥቀ፡ ሀለዎ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወዓርክ፡ ምእመን፡ እምሰብአ፡ ሮሜ፡ እምዘመደ፡ መንግሥት፡ ብእሲሁ፡ ዘስሙ፡ በጊዶ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጢሞቴዎስ፡ መጋቤ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያና፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ተንባሊተ፡ ምሕረት። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ሰትየ፡ ወይነ፡ ወሰክረ፡ እምጻዕፈ፡ ወይን

Canonical Story Title: The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
Incipit: ወነበረ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ክቡር፡ ወቡሩክ፡ ዘይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ዘስሙ፡ ሰርጊዮስ፡ ወሀለወት፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ቡርክት፡ ወቅድስት፡ ዘስማ፡ አብርስቂላ። ወተካየዱ፡ ክልኤሆሙ፡ ብእሲ፡ ምስለ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ወበጽኡ፡ ርእሶሙ፡ ከመ፡ ይንበሩ፡ በንጽሕ

Canonical Story Title: The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
Incipit: ወነበረ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ባዕል፡ ወነጋዲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ፊልጶስ፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ኒቆንያ፡ ወቦቱ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወይምሕክ፡ ነዳያነ፡ በውሂበ፡ ምጽዋት፡ ብዙኅ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ሐለየ፡ በልቡ፡ እንዘ፡ ይብል፡ እስመ፡ ሊተ፡ ብዙኅ፡ ንዋይ፡ ወብየ፡ ብዙኅ፡ ወርቅ፡ ወብሩር፡ ወእፈቅድ፡ አሃብ፡ ለነዳያን፡ ወለምስኪናን፡ እምቅድመ፡ እሙት

Canonical Story Title: The two brothers from Rome, Peter, a deacon, and Stephen, an avaricious magistrate.
Incipit: ወሀለዉ፡ አኃው፡ ፪፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ ስሙ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወለካልኡ፡ እስጢፋኖስ፡ ወጴጥሮስ፡ ዲያቆን፡ ውእቱ፡ ለቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary saves the soul of a rich sinner who had repented and was planning to build a monastery and become a monk.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ፈረሳዊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ማልኮስ፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ንሒሳ፡ ወክቡር፡ ውእቱ፡ ወባዕል፡ ጥቀ፡ ወብዙኅ፡ ንዋዩ፡ ወገራውኢሁ፡ እስመ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ወጊጉይ፡ ውእቱ፡ ፈረሳዊ፡ ማልኮስ፡ ወኢይዜከሮ፡ ለሞት

Canonical Story Title: Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
Incipit: ወነበረ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዲበ፡ መንበረ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ፓኵሚስ፡ እስመ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ንዋይ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወይነሥእ፡ ንዋየ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ለመፍቅዱ፡ ወለጻሕቁ፡ ወእምብዝኃ፡ ድፍረቱ፡ ነሥአ፡ ሜሮነ፡ እምቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወሤጦ፡ ለንዋይ

Canonical Story Title: The avaricious priest who visited a dying man who loved bribes.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምብሔረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ዘያፈቅር፡ ንዋየ። ወሀሎ፡ ካዕበ፡ ካልእ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘያፈቅር፡ ሕልያነ፡ ሐመ፡ ዐቢየ፡ ሕማመ

Canonical Story Title: The withered olive tree at the gate of the church in Endules.
