Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘሀገረ፡ እለ፡ እስክንድርያ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ገብረ፡ ክርስቶስ። ወውእቱ፡ አብ፡ ቅዱስ፡ እምኍልቆሙ፡ ለአበው፡ ሊቃነ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ፷ወ፯። ወኮነ፡ በመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለዝንቱ፡ አብ፡ ተአምራት፡ ወመንክራት፡ ብዙኃት። ወናሁ፡ ውእቱ፡ ሰምዐ፡ በእንተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወተሐንጸት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በብሔረ፡ እንዱልስ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ ዕፀ፡ ዘይት፡ ይብስት፡ ኀበ፡ አንቀጸ፡ ይእቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን

Canonical Story Title: The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ይነብር፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ዘስማ፡ ደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ወትነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ደብር፡ አሐቲ፡ መበለት፡ ንእስት፡ ዘሠናይ፡ ሥነ፡ ላሕያ። ወኮነት፡ ይእቲ፡ መበለት፡ ታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ መዝገበ፡ ምሕረት፡ ወሣህል፡ ወትትፌሣሕ፡ በበዐላቲሃ፡ ለለኵሉ፡ አውራኅ፡ ወታስተፌሥሖሙ፡ ለነዳያን፡ ወለምስኪናን። ወሶበ፡ ርእየ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ግዕዛ፡ ሠናየ፡ ቀንዓ፡ ላዕሌሃ፡ ወቦአ፡ ውስተ፡ ልበ፡ አሐዱ፡ ፈረሳዊ

Canonical Story Title: The shepherd near the church of Saint Paul in Rome who was possessed by a demon.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ አመ፡ መዋዕለ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ሳባ፡ ፈተዉ፡ ውሑዳን፡ ሰብእ፡ ይሖሩ፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያና፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ከመ፡ ይግነዩ፡ ወይስግዱ፡ ውስቴታ። ወእንዘ፡ የሐውሩ፡ በፍኖት፡ ሃደሩ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ በስመ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ ጳውሎስ

Canonical Story Title: The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ማእከለ፡ ባሕረ፡ ጤግሮስ፡ ደሴት፡ ዘይሰመይ፡ ደብረ፡ ኤፍሬም፡ ወይነብሩ፡ ውስቴታ፡ ብዙኃን፡ መነኮሳት፡ ወእም፡ ውስቴቶሙ፡ ሀሎ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘመንኰሰ፡ እምንእሱ፡ ወይትለአክ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ በሠናይ፡ አምልኮ፡ በፍቅረ፡ ዚአሃ

Canonical Story Title: The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ፈረሳዊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ኒፎን፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ገለአድ፡ ዝሁር፡ ውእቱ፡ ወሬዛ፡ ወይትሜካሕ፡ በብዙኅ፡ ብዕሉ፡ ወይሰረገው፡ በአልባሰ፡ ወርቅ፡ ወይትአጸፍ፡ ሜላተ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ እንዘ፡ ያንሶሱ፡ ማእከለ፡ ምሥያጣት፡ ወውስተ፡ መራኅብት፡ ነጸረ፡ ለአሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በዐይነ፡ ፍትወት

Canonical Story Title: The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ናታን፡ በደብረ፡ ሰራብዮን፡ ኀበ፡ መነኮሳት፡ ዘይእቲ፡ ደብር፡ ወውእቱ፡ መጋቢ፡ ዘየዐቅብ፡ መዛግብተ፡ ዘቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወውእቱ፡ ዘይጠቅዕ፡ መጥቅዓ፡ በጊዜ፡ ጸሎት፡ ዘሰዓታት

Canonical Story Title: The bankrupt merchant to whom Satan offered two pearls if he would deny Christ and Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ነጋዲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጥብርያኖስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ቅፍጥ፡ እስመ፡ ባዕል፡ ጥቀ፡ በአግብርት፡ ወበአእማት፡ በወርቅ፡ ወበብሩር፡ ወአልሕምት፡ ወአግማል፡ ወዘይነግድ፡ ዲበ፡ የብስ፡ ወባሕር ። ወተወለጠ፡ ላዕሌሁ፡ መዋዕል፡ ወአዝማን፡ ወኃልቀ፡ ኵሉ፡ ንዋዩ

Canonical Story Title: A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ኖላዊ፡ ዘይሬኢ፡ አልህምተ፡ ወእንስሳ፡ ወኮነ፡ ብእሲ፡ የዋህ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በልቡ፡ ወኮነ፡ ይትለአክ፡ ወይቀውም፡ ቅድሜሃ፡ ውስተ፡ ኵሉ፡ መካን፡ ወኢያጸርዕ፡ ሰላመ፡ መልአክ፡ ዛቲ፡ ወኮነ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ሰላም፡ ውስተ፡ አፉሁ፡ መዐልተ፡ ወሌሊተ፡ በሑረቱ፡ ወበግብአቱ፡ በንብረቱ፡ ወበተንሥኦቱ። ወአመ፡ በዐላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ተንሥአ፡ አውሎ፡ ወበረድ፡ በይእቲ፡ ሌሊት፡ ወሐለየ፡ ውእቱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ከመ፡ ይመውቱ፡ እንስሳሁ፡ በይእቲ፡ ሌሊት

Canonical Story Title: The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወሬዛ፡ ዘይነብር፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ወሠናይ፡ ውእቱ፡ እምወራዙት፡ ወኄር፡ በፍኖቱ፡ ወንጹሕ፡ ወጽሩይ፡ ወፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘያፈቅር፡ ሠናያተ፡ ወይጸልእ፡ እኩያተ፡ እምንእሱ። ወነዳይ፡ ውእቱ፡ ይበልዕ፡ እምፍሬ፡ ጻማሁ፡ ወኮነ፡ ኵሎ፡ ዕለተ፡ የሐውር፡ ውስተ፡ ገዳም፡ ወይሴጽር፡ ዕፀወ፡ አው፡ የዓጽድ፡ ሣዕረ፡ ወይሠይጦ፡ ውስተ፡ ምሥያት

Canonical Story Title: The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ሶበ፡ ፈቀዱ፡ አኃው፡ ከመ፡ ይትጋብኡ፡ ውስተ፡ መንበሊስ፡ ተንሥኡ፡ እምአብርፊስ፡ ኀበ፡ መንበሊስ፡ ወሖረት፡ ምስሌሆሙ፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ዐባይ፡ ወክብርት

Canonical Story Title: The robber whom a bishop was commanded to bury after he was executed.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሠራቂ፡ ዘይሴሰይ፡ በሠሪቅ፡ ወባሕቱ፡ ይሁብ፡ ሰላማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…፡ ብዙኃ፡ ጊዜያት፡ በልብ፡ ንጹሕ፡ ወበትሕትና፡ ወበየውሃት፡ ወሶበ፡ ኮነ፡ ይዜክር፡ ስማ፡ ይትሀወክ፡ እስመ፡ ፍቅራ፡ ውስተ፡ ልቡ

Canonical Story Title: The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘይብልዎ፡ አባስ፡ እምጳጳሳተ፡ ሮሜ፡ ብእሲ፡ ኄር፡ ወቅዱስ፡ ወንዑድ፡ በክህነቱ፡ ወይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወየዓቅብ፡ ነፍሶ፡ በንጽሕ፡ እምዝሙተ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወርኵስ፡ ወእምሑከተ፡ ሕሊና

Canonical Story Title: The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ገባራዊ፡ ዘኮነ፡ ያወትር፡ ኵሎ፡ ዕለተ፡ ሰላማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ሰርከ፡ ወነግሃ፡ ወመንፈቀ፡ መዓልት፡ ወነበረ፡ ከመዝ፡ ብዙኃ፡ መዋዕለ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ይቤላ፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ መስተሣህልት፡ እስመ፡ አንሰ፡ ወትረ፡ ከመዝ፡ እሁብ፡ ሰላመኪ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ኃፍረት፡ ወአንቲኒ፡ ለምንት፡ ዘኢታገብኢ፡ ሊተ፡ ሰላምየ

Canonical Story Title: The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
The story of the penitent harlot, Mary of Egypt.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ግብጻዊት፡ ዘስማ፡ ማርያም። ዛቲ፡ ቅድስት፡ ኮነት፡ እምሀገረ፡ እለ፡ እስክንድርያ፡ ወኮኑ፡ አበዊሁ፡ ክርስቲያነ

Canonical Story Title: The Jewish cowherd who was baptized by his Christian companions.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ ዘቦቱ፡ መራዕየ፡ አልህምት፡ ወቦቱ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወልደ፡ ዘይሬኢ፡ አልህምተ፡ አቡሁ፡ አፍአ፡ እምሀገር፡ ምስለ፡ ደቂቀ፡ ክርስቲያን። ወበአሐቲ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ ተጋብኡ፡ እሉ፡ ኖሎት፡ ከመ፡ ይብልዑ፡ ኅብስተ

Canonical Story Title: The mighty Goliath threatens to destroy the monastery of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዕቡይ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጎልያድ፡ ወኃያል፡ ከመ፡ አንበሳ፡ ወሐያዲ፡ ውስተ፡ ዓለም፡ ወኢይፈርህ፡ እምደኃሪት። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ እንዘ፡ የሐውር፡ ኀበ፡ ግብሩ፡ በጽሐ፡ ኀበ፡ ደብረ፡ መነኮሳት፡ ዘእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ አረማዊ፡ እምደቂቀ፡ ይስማዔል፡ ወረከበ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤቱ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወኢያእመረ፡ እምኀበ፡ መጽአት፡ ይእቲ፡ ሥዕል

Canonical Story Title: The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዘይነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ባሕር፡ ዘክቡር፡ እምነገሥት፡ ወአልቦ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ አሐዱ፡ ውሉድ፡ ወቡሩክ፡ ወሠናይ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልድ፡ ወፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: The young man who was ready to serve Satan, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወሬዛ፡ ሠናይ፡ ዘይነብር፡ ማእከለ፡ ባሕር፡ እምክቡራነ፡ ዘመድ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወኮነ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወሬዛ፡ ያፈቅር፡ በሊዐ፡ ወሰቲየ፡ ወፈግዓ። ወእምድኅረ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ኃልቀ፡ ንዋዩ፡ ወጸልእዎ፡ ፍቁራኒሁ

Canonical Story Title: A knight tries to seduce the wife of a friend, but she is saved by a vision.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ባዕል፡ ጥቀ፡ ወቦቱ፡ ብእሲተ፡ ሠናየ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ላሕያ፡ ወወሀባ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ስነ፡ ወላሕየ፡ ወሞገሰ፡ ወጣዕመ፡ ቃል፡ ዘአልቦ፡ ዘይመስላ፡ በውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር

Canonical Story Title: The pious rich man whom Satan served in hopes of destroying him.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሊቅ፡ ወባዕል፡ ጥቀ፡ ወብዙኅ፡ ንዋዩ፡ ወእክሉ፡ ወጥሪቱ፡ ወኮነ፡ ኄረ፡ ወፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወይገብር፡ ሠናየ፡ ለኵሉ፡ ዘርሑቅ፡ ወዘቅሩብ፡ ወይመጸውት፡ ብዙኃ፡ ለነግድ፡ ወለፈላስያን። ወሐለየ፡ በልቡ፡ በዘያሠምሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወገብረ፡ ማኅደረ፡ ለሕሙማን

Canonical Story Title: The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ገብር፡ ባዕል፡ ውእቱ፡ በንዋይ፡ ወባሕቱ፡ ብዕሉሰ፡ ኮነ፡ እምንዋየ፡ ዓመፃ፡ እስመ፡ ኮነ፡ የሃይድ፡ ንዋየ፡ አግዋሪሁ

Canonical Story Title: The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ አሐዱ፡ ደብር፡ ዘመነኮሳት፡ ውስተ፡ ውእቱ፡ ደብር፡ ሊቅ፡ ዘእኩይ፡ ግብሩ፡ ወያፈቅር፡ ነገረ፡ ከንቶ፡ ወይትፈጋዕ፡ በሠናይ፡ መባልዕት፡ ወኵሉ፡ ዘርእዮ፡ የአምር፡ እምአርአያሁ፡ ከመ፡ እኩይ፡ ብእሲ፡ ውእቱ

Canonical Story Title: Patriarch Abraham and the interpretation of the parable of the mustard seed.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ አብ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አባ፡ አብርሃም፡ ሶርያዊ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘሀገረ፡ እለ፡ ስክንድርያ፡ ወውእቱ፡ እምኍልቆሙ፡ ለአበው፡ ሊቃነ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ፷ወ፪። ዝንቱ፡ አብ፡ ኮነ፡ እምነ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘብሔረ፡ ምሥራቅ፡ ወኮነ፡ ነጋዴ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary reveals where the furnishings stolen from the church of Hagara Maryam are located.
Incipit: ወሶበ፡ ተጽሕፈ፡ ዝተአምሪሃ፡ ዘገብረት፡ በፀራ፡ መቅሠፍተ፡ ወበፍቁራኒሃ፡ ትፍሥሕተ፡ በበአሐዱ፡ እምኔሆሙ፡ አኅበርክዎ፡ በአሐዱ፡ ርእሰ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ወበዋሕድ፡ ተፍጻሚተ፡ ምዕራፍ፡ በእንተ፡ ፍቅረ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ጸሎታ፡….

Canonical Story Title: A leopard carries off a goat that a poor man had bought in the market for the commemorative feast of Saint Mary at the church of Hagara Maryam.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ መሃይምናን፡ ተአምራቲሃ፡ ወመንክራቲሃ፡ ንግሩ፡ ለእጓለ፡ እመሕያው። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መሃይምን፡ ዘትረ፡ ይስሕቅ፡ ለገቢረ፡ ተዝካራ፡ እምዘቦ፡ ጥሪተ፡ ወይሁብ፡ ለቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ አምጣነ፡ ተክህሎ

Canonical Story Title: The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ በውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ ቍስጥንጥንያ፡ ሀገረ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ወቦቱ፡ ፍቁረ፡ ብእሲ፡ ክርስቲያናዊ፡ ወያፈቅሮ፡ ፈድፋደ። ወኮነ፡ ውእቱ፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ ይጸልእ፡ ሃይማኖተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወይጸርፍ፡ ላዕሌሆሙ፡ በነገረ፡ እኩይ

Canonical Story Title: The man who used to steal his food from the fields and would not admit it when questioned at the church of Hagara Maryam.
Incipit: ወነበረ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሰራቂ፡ ዘወትረ፡ የሃይድ፡ እክለ፡ እምገራህት፡ ወሶበ፡ ኀተትዎ፡ ዓመፃሁ፡ ይከሕድ፡ ወኢይአምን፡ ኃጣውኢሁ

Canonical Story Title: The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
Incipit: ይቤ፡ ወሀለወ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ ብእሲ፡ ክቡር፡ ዘቦቱ፡ ብእሲተ፡ ክብርተ፡ ብዑላን፡ ውእቶሙ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ ወአልቦሙ፡ ውሉደ፡ ወእምብዝኃ፡ አፍቅሮቶሙ፡ ለውሉድ፡ ይመጸውቱ፡ ብዙኃ፡ ወይበፅዑ፡ ለሰማዕት፡ ወለቅዱሳን

Canonical Story Title: The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ አሐዱ፡ ደብር፡ ዘአዕረፈ፡ ሊቁ። ወጥቀ፡ ውእቱ፡ ደብር፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ደብር፡ ዘቦቱ፡ ሊቅ፡ ወኮነ፡ ውስቴቱ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ክቡር፡ ዘይፈቅድ፡ ይሠየም፡ ህየንተ፡ ውእቱ፡ ዘሞተ

Canonical Story Title: The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐዱ፡ ሀገር፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘተመዝበረት፡ ወፈቀዱ፡ ከመ፡ ይሕንጽዋ። ወአንበሩ፡ ውስተ፡ ኆኅታ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ከመ፡ ኵሉ፡ ዘየኃልፍ፡ ውስተ፡ ፍኖት፡ የሀብ፡ ምጽዋተ፡ በእንተ፡ ሥዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ሐመር፡ ዘተሐውር፡ ማእከለ፡ ባሕር፡ ወእንዘ፡ ተሐውር፡ ውስተ፡ ባሕር፡ ጸልመ፡ ላዕሌሃ፡ መዓልት፡ ወጸንዐ፡ ነፋስ፡ ወተቈጠ፡ ባሕር

Canonical Story Title: The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ፈረሳዊ፡ ዘይትለአካ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ በኵሉ፡ ወኮነ፡ ወትረ፡ ይሳለማ፡ በፍርሃተ፡ ልብ። ወባሕቱ፡ አኃዘ፡ ውእቱ፡ ፈረሳዊ፡ ይዝሩ፡ ንዋቶ፡ በከንቱ፡ ወእምዝ፡ ኃልቀ፡ ንዋዩ

Canonical Story Title: The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
Some of the deceased great Fathers of the Desert appear to the monks of Scete.
An abbot in Scete sees first a multitude of demons, then a multitude of saints.
The woman from Cairo whose children all died.
The girl who was going to be stoned after she was caught committing fornication.
The monastic community that was supplied with provisions by Saint Mary.
Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): Satan urges Herod to pursue the Holy Family.
The church built on the tomb of Saint Mary that will turn into a ship.
Some of the deceased great Fathers of the Desert appear to the monks of Scete.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
A stream runs uphill after his neighbor had diverted it.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
Saint Mary appears to an official who kidnapped a girl that had made a vow of virginity.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
Saint Mary appears to an official who kidnapped a girl that had made a vow of virginity.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The cupbearer of the king of France.
The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The wife of Joseph from Mǝneta Diyāqon, who had no male children.
Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon intercedes for an angel who had disobeyed the command of God.
The church of Saint Mary that moved by itself to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea.
Qommos Raphael from Däbrä ʾƎnṣǝnā and the sacrament of confession.
An Arab who has contempt for Saint Mary’s icon at Däbrä Qaləmon is punished.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ኄር፡ ዘስሙ፡ ይስሐቅ፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወእምንእሱ፡ ነበረ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ደብር፡ በመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለአባ፡ ገብርኤል

Canonical Story Title: The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ኄር፡ ዘስሙ፡ ይስሐቅ፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወእምንእሱ፡ ነበረ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ደብር፡ በመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለአባ፡ ገብርኤል

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ, together with Saint Mary and the angels, appears to the Apostles and asks them to build churches in his name and hers throughout the world.
Christ makes Saint Peter head of the Church.
Mareqos, King of Romeya, abandons his throne secretly to become a monk.
The people of Romeya appeal to Patriarch Dionysius to find King Mareqos.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The monk who saved the church of Saint Mary in Atrib by his prayers when its destruction had been ordered by the Caliph.
Saint Mary shows those assembled at Däbrä Metmaq a vision of Mohammad in Hell.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ኄር፡ ዘስሙ፡ ይስሐቅ፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወእምንእሱ፡ ነበረ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ደብር፡ በመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለአባ፡ ገብርኤል

Canonical Story Title: The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
Saint John Chrysostom defends a woman whom Nestorius had told the people to spit upon.
A child and his mother see the icon of Saint Mary weeping for the sins of the world.
The monk whose only good work was observing the fast of Saint Mary.
Saint Mary appears to a monk and saves him from being deceived by Satan.
The monastic community that was supplied with provisions by Saint Mary.
The Jewish cowherd who was baptized by his Christian companions.
The mighty Goliath threatens to destroy the monastery of Saint Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The young man who was ready to serve Satan, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
A knight tries to seduce the wife of a friend, but she is saved by a vision.
The pious rich man whom Satan served in hopes of destroying him.
The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The two brothers from Rome, Peter, a deacon, and Stephen, an avaricious magistrate.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a rich sinner who had repented and was planning to build a monastery and become a monk.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The avaricious priest who visited a dying man who loved bribes.
The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
The shepherd near the church of Saint Paul in Rome who was possessed by a demon.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
The bankrupt merchant to whom Satan offered two pearls if he would deny Christ and Saint Mary.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The robber whom a bishop was commanded to bury after he was executed.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The woman whose baby daughter was carried off by a hyena.
An official who used to rob the poor is converted when a monk reveals that Satan was acting as his counsellor.
Bishop Hildephonsus sees the icon of Saint Mary sweating; she asks him to raise a girl from the dead.
The woman who was falsely accused of killing the child she was nursing and was condemned to death.
The story of the penitent harlot, Mary of Egypt.
Mary, Conception of cycle: The descent of the holy seed from Adam to Saint Mary.
A man who speaks blasphemously of Saint Mary has his arms and legs cut off.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: Saint Mary heals the daughter of Arsaban while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the rich man who refused to give him a tablet [saleda] for an icon of Saint Mary.
The healing of the Egyptian King Soforon (or Safron).
The reopening of the church in Harat Zuwayla.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The people of Romeya appeal to Patriarch Dionysius to find King Mareqos.
The priest, Zacharias, who was about to hang himself so as not to see his son die.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ካህን፡ ዘካርያስ፡ የዋህ፡ ወትሑት፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወይገብር፡ ተዝካራ፡ በኵሉ፡ መዋዕለ፡ ሕይወቱ። ወቦቱ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወልድ፡ ዘፈጸመ፡ መዝሙረ፡ ዳዊት፡ ወተምሕረ፡ መጻሕፍተ፡ እምንእሱ

Canonical Story Title: The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
Saint Mary turns water over which her anaphora was recited by Abba Samuˀel of Wali into miraculous bread.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ አበዊነ፡ ወአኃዊነ፡ በብሩህ፡ ልብ፡ ከመ፡ ንንግርክሙ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ወበአሐዱ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ ገዳም፡ ቀደሰ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ቅዳሴሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ አንቢሮ፡ ማየ፡ ቅድሜሁ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary brings gifts to Abba Samuˀel of Wali.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ጻድቅ፡ ወንጹሕ፡ ዘይነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ገዳም፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዋሊ፡ ወይሰመይ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ወውእቱ፡ ያነብብ፡ ወትረ፡ ውዳሴሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ በዓንብዕ፡ ወበገዓር፡ ብዙኅ

Canonical Story Title: Satan tries to prevent Abba Samuˀel of Wali from praying by seizing his prayer book.
Incipit: ወእንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ አቡነ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ያነብብ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ጸሎታ፡ ለማርያም፡ ወፈጺሞ፡ መዝሙረ፡ ዳዊት፡ እስመ፡ ከማሁ፡ ልማዱ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ መጽአ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ወመሰጣ፡ ለይእቲ፡ መጽሐፍ

Canonical Story Title: The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወይነብር፡ ውስተ፡ አሐዱ፡ መካን፡ ዘያፈቅሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይጼሊ፡ ዘንተ፡ ጸሎተ፡ እንተ፡ ውስቴታ፡ አእኵቶታ፡ ወወድሶታ፡ ለማርያም

Canonical Story Title: Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
The son of the Muslim ruler of Egypt blasphemes the icon of Saint Mary.
Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
Alexander, a Jew from Jerusalem, is delivered three days after he was swallowed up by a dragon.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The church built on the tomb of Saint Mary that will turn into a ship.
The story of Saint Alexius [Abdo l a-Masih], son of Emperor Theodosius.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
The monks of Saint Anthony celebrate Holy Week at Däbrä QWesqWam.
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
Praise of Saint Mary's greatness.
Incipit: እከሥት፡ በምሳሌ፡ አፉየ፡ ወእነግር፡ አምሳለ፡ ዘርእያ፡ አዕይንቲየ፡ ወቃለ፡ ዘሰምዓ፡ አዕዛንየ

Canonical Story Title: Malka Sedeq learns from a vision how Zärˀa Yaˁəqob was chosen to reign.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ አኀውየ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ወጊዜ፡ መንፈቀ፡ ሌሊት፡ እንዘ፡ ሀለውኩ፡ በንዋም፡ ወሶቤሃ፡ ሰማዕኩ፡ ቃለ፡ ወደንገፅኩ፡ ወይቤለኒ፡ ነጽር፡ ወኢትፍራህ። ወአርአየኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ብሩህ፡ ማዕተበ፡ መስቀል፡ ዘውስተ፡ እዴሁ

Canonical Story Title: A paralytic is cured at the church of Makana Iyyasus; he establishes a monastery at the tomb of Abba Anbass and lives there.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መፃጕዕ፡ ድዉይ፡ ወእሱር፡ ኵለንታሁ፡ ወርእሱ፡ ውዱድ፡ ምስለ፡ ብረኪሁ፡ ወኢርእየ፡ በአዕይንቲሁ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary informs Malka Sedeq in a vision that he will receive favor from Emperor Zärˀa Yaˁəqob.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ካህን፡ ወድንግል፡ ወመነኮስ፡ እምንእሱ፡ ወትሑተ፡ ልብ፡ ወየዋህ፡ ዘአልቦ፡ ጽልሑተ፡ ወምሁረ፡ መጻሕፍት፡ ወፈካሬ፡ ሐዲስ፡ ወብሉይ

Canonical Story Title: The Stephanites are revealed among the damned in a vision of the blessed and the damned.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ ኦሕዝበ፡ መሀይምናን፡ እለ፡ በክርስቶስ፡ ምእምናን፡ ዘትገብር፡ መንክራተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ለእለ፡ ያፈቅርዋ፡ ወትጸግዎሙ፡ ሠናያተ፡ ኀበ፡ ዝዓለም፡ ወበዘይመጽእ

Canonical Story Title: The miraculous icon in a monastery: when the Body of Christ falls to the ground unnoticed during the distribution of Communion, Saint Mary orders Saint Michael to pick it up.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በአሐዱ፡ ደብር፡ ዘመነኮሳት፡ ወሀሎ፡ ህየ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ወሥዕለ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወገብርኤል፡ ኅቡረ፡ በላዕለ፡ ምጽዋዕ

Canonical Story Title: A Christian of Täˀkä Maryam, Tanseˀa Krəstos, tries to convert a Muslim.
Incipit: ወእንዘ፡ ጉቡኣን፡ አኃው፡ በሲራ፡ ዘይብልዎ፡ ኖበ፡ ቀዳሚ፡ ስማ፡ ወካዕበ፡ ተሰይመት፡ ታእከ፡ ማርያም፡ ወሀለዉ፡ ህየ፡ ብዙኃን፡ መነኮሳት፡ ወየአክሉ፡ ፻፡ ወ፴፡ ወሕዝብሰ፡ ብዙኃን

Canonical Story Title: The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
Saint Mary appears to a pious woman and asks her to go to a certain town and teach the people the observance of her five feast days, from the 21st to the 25th of Genbot.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ዘታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ በተአምኖ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ አስተርአየታ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ለይእቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ወትቤላ፡ ተንሥኢ፡ እምህየ፡ ወሑሪ፡ ምሕዋረ፡ አሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ወዜነዊ፡ ለሰብአ፡ ሀገር፡ ዘእነግረኪ፡ አነ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary rescues a wonder-working monk from another monastery who was living with the monks of Däbrä Maryam, when Satan comes to him in disguise and tries to throttle him.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ እንጦንስ፡ ዘመጽአ፡ እምድኅረ፡ እምብሔረ፡ ባዕድ፡ ወበጽሐ፡ ምድረ፡ በዶ። ወበህየ፡ ሀለዉ፡ መነኮሳት፡ ዘደብረ፡ ማርያም፡ ቀደምት፡ እለ፡ ይነብሩ፡ በቀኖና፡ ደቂቀ፡ እንድርያስ

Canonical Story Title: A man prays for his sick son before the icon of Saint Mary; she sends Saint Qirqos, then comes herself with Saint George to cure him.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሕሙም፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገር፡ ወጸለየ፡ ቅድመ፡ ሥዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ በውዑይ፡ ልብ፡ ወበብዙኅ፡ ብካይ

Canonical Story Title: The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation
A man prays for his sick son before the icon of Saint Mary; she sends Saint Qirqos, then comes herself with Saint George to cure him.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሕሙም፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገር፡ ወጸለየ፡ ቅድመ፡ ሥዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ በውዑይ፡ ልብ፡ ወበብዙኅ፡ ብካይ

Canonical Story Title: The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
A man prays for his sick son before the icon of Saint Mary; she sends Saint Qirqos, then comes herself with Saint George to cure him.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሕሙም፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገር፡ ወጸለየ፡ ቅድመ፡ ሥዕላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ በውዑይ፡ ልብ፡ ወበብዙኅ፡ ብካይ

The shepherd near the church of Saint Paul in Rome who was possessed by a demon.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.

The apparitions of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq (continued): The people toss their caps and kerchiefs into the air before the apparition of Saint Mary; occasionally she reaches out and takes one of them.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በካልእ፡ ዓም፡ ዘበዓል፡ ተጋብኡ፡ እምግብፅ፡ ወኢትዮጵያ፡ ወሶርያ፡ ወአርማንያ፡ ወእዝክንድርያ፡ ወማሮን፡ ወኵርዝ፡ ወአፍርንጊ፡ ወሮመ፡ ወፋርስ፡ ወጽርዕ፡ እምምሥራቅ፡ ወእምምዕራብ፡ ይመጽኡ፡ ወይበጽሑ፡ ኀበ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ምኔት፡ ወይኔጽሩ፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ወመድምመ፡ ዘትገብር፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወእንዘ፡ ጉቡኣን፡ እሙንቱ፡ ያወርዱ፡ አክሊላቲሆሙ፡ ወይዌግሩ፡ ላዕለ፡ ኀበ፡ ኀለወት፡ ትነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ቀመራ፡ ለቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን

Canonical Story Title: Synaxary entry for the 21st of Genbot: the Holy Family enters Egypt.
Incipit: በዛቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ቡርክት፡ አመ፡ ፳ወ፩፡ ለግንቦት፡ መጽአ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ሎቱ፡ ስብሐት፡ ምስለ፡ ወላዲቱ፡ ኀበ፡ ምድረ፡ ግብጽ፡ ወውእቱ፡ ሕፃን፡ እንዘ፡ መዋዕሊሁ፡ ዘ፪፡ ዓመት፡ በከመ፡ ይቤ፡ በወንጌል፡ ቅዱስ

Canonical Story Title: The apparitions of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq (continued): People from other faiths come to see the annual apparition of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ይመጽኡ፡ እምሕዝብ፡ ነኪራን፡ ወተንባላት፡ ወካልዓንሂ፡ ወይበጽሑ፡ ኀበ፡ ደብር፡ ቅዱስ፡ አመ፡ ፳፡ ወ፩፡ ለወርኃ፡ ግንቦት፡ ወይነብሩ፡ እስከ፡ ፳፡ ወ፭፡ እምኔሁ፡ እስመ፡ በዝንቱ፡ ዕለት፡ ዘአቅደምነ፡ ነጊረ፡ ኢይጸራዕ፡ አስተርእዮታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
Mary, Annunciation of cycle: The Annunciation.
The Dormition and Transitus of Saint Mary.
Saint Thomas arrives for the funeral of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወበጽሐ፡ ቶማስ፡ ኀበ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ በይእቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ሀገረ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ወይቤልዎ፡ እንዘ፡ ይበክዩ፡ ሞተት፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን። ወይቤሎሙ፡ ቶማስ፡ ማዕዘ፡ ሞተት። ወይቤልዎ፡ አመ፡ ፳ወ፩፡ ለጥር

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Thomas relates how he was taken to Heaven and saw the body of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወይቤ፡ ቶማስ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎኩ፡ አወጽእ፡ አጋንንተ፡ ውስተ፡ ህንደኪ፡ ይቤለኒ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዛቲ፡ ዕለት፡ አምሳለ፡ ፋሲካ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John tells Prochorus how he and the other Apostles were brought together on the 15th of Naṣase.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Assumption as narrated by Saint John to Prochorus.
Narration of the consecration of the first church; when the patriarchs are commemorated, they rise from the dead and are baptized.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The nominal Christian from Sidon who encountered a dragon.
A column falls and breaks the leg of the son of an official when Muslims destroy a church of Saint Mary in Homs.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘተሐንጸት፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በሀገረ፡ ሕምስ፡ እምአድያመ፡ ሻም፡ ወኮነ፡ ትገበር፡ በውስቴታ፡ ተአምራት፡ ወመንክራት። ወሶበ፡ ርእዩ፡ ተንበላት፡ ዘንተ፡ ቀንኡ፡ ላዕለ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወአምጽኡ፡ ምክንያተ፡ ወአንሀልዋ

Canonical Story Title: The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The nominal Christian from Sidon who encountered a dragon.
Alexander, a Jew from Jerusalem, is delivered three days after he was swallowed up by a dragon.
The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
The cupbearer of the king of France.
Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The paralytic who was healed on the 16th of Nahase.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. አመ፡ ፲፡ ወ፮፡ ለነሐሴ። ወነበረ፡ አሐዱ፡ መፃጕዕ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ወአስተርአየቶ፡ በሕልም

Canonical Story Title: A priest becomes insane after his entire family dies of the plague.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ወኀልቁ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ወደቂቁ

Canonical Story Title: A stream runs uphill after his neighbor had diverted it.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
Mary, Childhood of cycle: Saint Mary stays in the Temple.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ንነግረክሙ፡ አኃዊነ፡ ኂሩታ፡ ወንጽሕናሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወዘከመ፡ ነበረት፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ። ጸሎታ፡…. ወነበረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ፡ እንዘ፡ ትትለአክ፡ በንጽሕ፡ ወበሕድአት፡ ወበትሕትና፡ ወኵሎሙ፡ ካህናት፡ ያስተበፅዕዋ፡ ወይባርክዋ፡ ወፈድፋደሰ፡ ስምዖን፡ አረጋዊ፡ ወዘካርያስ፡ ዘመዳ

Canonical Story Title: The woman from Cairo whose children all died.
The faded icon of Saint Mary that the mother-in-law wanted to discard.
Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.
Some of the deceased great Fathers of the Desert appear to the monks of Scete.
Mary, Conception of cycle: The conception and nativity of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ንነግረክሙ፡ አበዊነ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ወአኀዊነ፡ ፍቁራን፡ ውሉደ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይባርክሙ፡ ወያበርህ፡ አዕይንተ፡ አልባቢክሙ፡ ለሰሚዐ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘያስተፌሥሕ፡ አልባበ፡ ወይመርህ፡ ውስተ፡ መንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት። ሚመጠነ፡ ተአምረ፡ ገብረት፡ በእደዊሆሙ፡ ለአበው፡ ቀደምት፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ዘአልቦ፡ ኍልቈ። መቅድመ፡ ኵሉ፡ ንነግረክሙ፡ ሕይወታ፡ ወንጽሕናሃ፡ እስመ፡ ኀረያ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ እምቀዳሚ። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ እምዘመደ፡ ካህናት፡ ዘይሰመይ፡ ኢያቄም፡ ወአውሰበ፡ ብእሲተ፡ እምአዋልደ፡ ይሁዳ፡ ወትሰመይ፡ ሐና

Canonical Story Title: The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary appears to an official who kidnapped a girl that had made a vow of virginity.
An abbot in Scete sees first a multitude of demons, then a multitude of saints.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The knight who wanted to seduce the daughter of the cobbler.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
Incipit: ወኮና፡ ክልኤ፡ አንስት፡ እንዘ፡ ይሐውራ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያና፡ ለማርያም፡ ወእንዘ፡ የሐውራ፡ በፍኖት፡ ተንሥኡ፡ ላዕሌሆን፡ ፈያት

Canonical Story Title: The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
A child, while attending a hermit's Mass near Jerusalem, is seized by Satan, but is delivered by Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልድ፡ ይነግር፡ ኂሩታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ጊዜ፡ ወኮኑ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ እለ፡ ይሰምዕዎ፡ ይሴብሕዎ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ልዑል፡ ወአእኰተዋ፡ ለቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡…. ጸሎታ፡….

Canonical Story Title: The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
The two brothers from Rome, Peter, a deacon, and Stephen, an avaricious magistrate.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a rich sinner who had repented and was planning to build a monastery and become a monk.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The avaricious priest who visited a dying man who loved bribes.
The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
The bankrupt merchant to whom Satan offered two pearls if he would deny Christ and Saint Mary.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The robber whom a bishop was commanded to bury after he was executed.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
A stream runs uphill after his neighbor had diverted it.
The woman from Cairo whose children all died.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
Saint Mary visits Calvary.
Incipit: ወሖረት፡ መካነ፡ ቀራንዮ፡ ከመ፡ ትርአይ፡ ሕማማተ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ርእየት፡ አክሊለ፡ ሦክ፡ ዘአስተቀዘልዎ፡ ወደመ፡ ርእሱ፡ ዘቈስለ፡ በአክሊለ፡ ሦክ

Canonical Story Title: Homily on the greatness of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ አበውየ፡ ወአኀውየ፡ ሕዝበ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘከመ፡ ተዓቢ፡ እምመላእክት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. መላእክትኒ፡ ያከብርዋ፡ እፎኬ፡ ኢያከብርዋ፡ መላእክት፡ ለማርያም፡ ፈድፋደ፡ እምሰብእ፡ ለወላዲተ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ

Canonical Story Title: Bishop Hildephonsus sees the icon of Saint Mary sweating; she asks him to raise a girl from the dead.
The woman whose baby daughter was carried off by a hyena.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
Saint Mary appears to the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis, in prison.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.

Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary, together with Saints Irene and Sophia, appears to Saint Basil and tells him where her icon is buried.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil finds the buried icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary tells Saint Basil to take two pillars from a pagan temple.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary sets up the pillars in the church and makes a miraculous spring flow out at their base.
Emperor Arcadius and the golden statue of Saint Mary; he asks Saint John Chrysostom to expound on Matthew 1: 25.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees Christ kissing Saint Mary's burial cloth.

A container of oil remains suspended in mid air in a church of Saint Mary when the cord by which it was suspended breaks.
Saint Mary turns water over which her anaphora was recited by Abba Samuˀel of Wali into miraculous bread.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ለውእቱ፡ ብእሴ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. አመ፡ ፳፡ ወ፩፡ በሰኔ፡ እንተ፡ ይእቲ፡ በዓላ፡ ወሶበ፡ ፈጸመ፡ ጸሎቶ፡ እንዘ፡ የዓጥን፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. እመ፡ መለኮት፡ በአንብዕ፡ ወበገዓር፡ ብዙኅ። ወእምድኅረ፡ ፈጸመ፡ ጸሎቶ፡ አስተጋብኦ፡ ለማይ፡ ነሢኦ፡ በእደዊሁ፡ ፈቂዶ፡ ከመ፡ ይስተዮ። ወሶበ፡ ተመጠወ፡ ኮነት፡ ይእቲ፡ ማይ፡ ፀዓዳ፡ ኅብስተ፡ በውስተ፡ እዴሁ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary gives a cup of the water of life to an Ethiopian monk in Jerusalem.
Oz, the Byzantine monk, is shown a vision of Hell by Saint Urael.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the rich man who refused to give him a tablet [saleda] for an icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Mary heals a servant girl from a magic spell.
Incipit: ወከመ፡ ኆፀ፡ ባሕር፡ ኍላቋሁ፡ ከማሁ፡ ኢይትረከብ፡ ኍልቈ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ርኁቅ፡ ውእቱ፡ እምልበ፡ መዋቲ፡ ኢይትረከብ፡ በኃሢሥ፡ ወኢይትሌለይ፡ በጥንቃቄ፡ በልሳነ፡ መዋቲ፡ ነባቢ፡ ኢይክል፡ ፍጻሜሁ። ወይእዜኒ፡ እንግርክሙ፡ በከመ፡ ሰማዕኩ፡ ቀዲሙ፡ በዕዝንየ፡ ወከማሁ፡ ርኢኩ፡ በአዕይንትየ፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ተአምር፡ ወእዜኑ፡ ንስቲተ፡ እምተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እንዘ፡ ያሌብወኒ፡ መንፈሰ፡ ወልዳ፡ ገባሬ፡ ዓለም፡ በጥበቢሁ፡ ሰጊድ፡ ይደሉ፡ ለስመ፡ ዚአሁ፡ ይእዜኒ፡ ወዘልፈኒ፡ ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ዓመት፡ በቤተ፡ አጋዕዝታ፡ ወሶበ፡ ሖሩ፡ አጋዕዝቲሃ፡ ኀዲጎሙ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤቶሙ፡ ወሠወረ፡ ሶቤሃ፡ ፀሐይ፡ ብርሃኖ

Canonical Story Title: Daniel from Constantinople, who wanted to go to church to receive Communion even when there was fighting in the streets.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ቍስጥንጥንየ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዳንኤል፡ ዘይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ዘኵሎ፡ ይእኅዝ፡ በጸንዓ፡ ኃይሉ፡ ዘያርዕድ፡ ለሰማይ፡ ወያድለቅልቃ፡ ለምድር፡ በምጽአቱ

Canonical Story Title: The story of Julius Aqfahasi.
The story of King Tarses of Fars, who loved to kill Christians.
Mary, Childhood of cycle: Saint Mary stays in the Temple.
The Jew from Rome who wanted to kill Christians, but was seized by the priests of the church of Saint Mary.
Archbishop Tilas, who was seized by Jews while carrying a golden chalice.
Elias from Elkesus, who was falsely accused and was suspended by the abbot.
King Yasay of Egypt, who became a monk in Däbrä Rom.
A dragon that had swallowed up Efrem, a monk of Däbrä Timona, is compelled to vomit him up alive ten days later.
Saint Mary heals the wounds of Ermeyis of Sidon with a drop of her milk.
Patriarch Tewoqritos of Jerusalem rebukes King Akratis of Egypt for not fasting or praying.
Deganna, the church builder, who was asked by King Aktab to build a temple for his pagan gods.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሳም፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዴገና፡ ሐናፄ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘይጸርብ፡ ዕፀወ፡ ወይወቅር፡ ዕብነ

Canonical Story Title: Sara from Mesot, who became insane and went about naked.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ በሀገረ፡ ምሶት፡ ዘስማ፡ ሳራ፡ ዘታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወባቲ፡ ደዌ፡ ዕፁበ፡ ወአኃዛ፡ ለዘኳንና፡ ነገርጓር

Canonical Story Title: The story of Astaqaˀos, the European potter who was buried alive.
King Bartaqu of Greece, who became a monk.
Mary, Engagement of cycle: Saint Mary is espoused to Saint Joseph.
Barnabas from Sandafa, who used to venerate Saint Mary's icon.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሰንደፋ፡ ዘስሙ፡ በርናባስ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ጸሎት፡ ወጾም፡ ወገያሴ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘኮነ፡ ያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይተግህ፡ መዓልተ፡ ወሌሊተ፡ እንበለ፡ አጽርዖ፡ አንብቦ፡ ውዳሴሃ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary incenses Thecla (continuation).
The vision of Gregory the Seer [ra'eya hebu'at].
The story of Awr, the son of the princess and the magician, Abrasit.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: How the Virgin Mary gave birth (see no. 299)
Paraleya from Iyyoram, who was beaten by her husband because she was childless.
Qawestos, the husband of Akroseya, becomes a disciple of Saint Clement.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ በሀገረ፡ ቃህራ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይትቀነይ፡ ላቲ፡ ወይገብር፡ በዓለ፡ ፍልሰተ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ወብእሲቱ፡ ሰናይት፡ ወፈራሂተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወትከብር፡ በዓላ፡ ወሰንበታተ፡ ቦሙ፡ ፪፡ ውሉድ፡ እምድኅረ፡ ኮኑ፡ መካን፡ ዘወሀበቶሙ፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The story of Saint Menas and his brother.
The temptations that Akroseya, the wife of Qawestos, overcame.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria.
When Pariqos of Fesa confesses his sins to the bishop, the latter, refusing him absolution, tells him to go to Abba Yaceqob (Santiago).
The conversion of a Muslim merchant who had been imprisoned in Naples.
The magistrate whom the king accused of embezzlement.
The hunter who caught a gassa kalb in his net.
Saint Mary appears to a priest of Däbrä Maryam in Sire.
Saint Alexius lives for fifteen years near a church of Saint Mary in Armenia.
Holy Family journey cycle: The hunter who discovered the Holy Family in flight is turned into a dog when he violates his oath not to reveal them.
The thieves who stole the furnishings of a church of Saint Mary and refused to restore them when she appeared to them.
The new tabot of Saint Mary that was found outside the box in which it had been placed.
The Ethiopian general who went off to fight the Muslims without the consent of the king.
The punishment of an Ethiopian woman who swore falsely that she had not committed adultery with another woman's husband.
Batergela Maryam is accused of treason and is imprisoned.
When the destruction of Däbrä Metmaq is reported in Ethiopia, the king orders the construction of a new monastery to take its place.
The Muslims who spent the night at the ruins of Däbrä Metmaq.
The untrustworthy camel driver of Däbrä Metmaq.
The rich persons who stored their wealth in a church.
A Christian community is attacked by a neighboring Muslim community.
A Jew is led to baptism by a dream about a lion and a monk; afterwards he curses a Jew at the latter's request.
A monk, while guarding a church, has a nocturnal emission and finds himself suddenly outside the courtyard of the church.
The blind teacher whom his pupils wanted to push over a cliff while they were on their way to a feast being given in honor of the Assumption.
When a couple tries to marry their son whom they had dedicated to Saint Mary, he falls sick to the point of death.
The monasteries summon King (Dawit) of Ethiopia to abdicate.
The pious monk who drowned while crossing a river on his way to a feast that was being given by a rich man in honor of the Assumption.
Thieves try to steal from a church of Saint Mary in Syria but are unable to bring what they have stolen out of the church.
The brother of Emperor Constantine who wanted to marry the empress while Constantine was on pilgrimage to Jerusalem.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ቍስጠንጢኖስ፡ ወስመ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ብራቲላ፡ ወታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወተካየደ፡ ውእቱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ምስለ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ከመ፡ ይሑር፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ኀበ፡ ተሰቅለ

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family visits the king of the Semites.
Homily on the miracles of Saint Mary.
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation.
Incipit: በእንተ፡ ስብከተ፡ ጌና፡ ወበእንተ፡ ማርያም፡ ወኤልሳቤጥ፡ ወበእንተ፡ ወልደ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዝውእቱ፡ ቃል፡ ዘኢይትነገር። ሀበኒ፡ ቃለ፡ ዘይዜምር፡ ስብሐቲከ፡ ባዕል፡ ኅቡዕ፡ ዘሠምረ፡ ይትከሠት

Canonical Story Title: Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): The Miraculous Conception of Saint John the Baptist.
Incipit: ወናሁ፡ ኤልሳቤጥኒ፡ ፀንሰት፡ እንዘ፡ መካን፡ ይእቲ፡ እስመ፡ መንክር፡ ይእቲ፡ በመንክር፡ ተወክፈቶ

Canonical Story Title: Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): The Visitation of Saint Mary to St. Elizabeth.
Incipit: ወሖረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ትርአየ፡ ለዓረጊት፡ ወእንተ፡ በልየት፡ ፀንሰት፡ እስመ፡ አምነት፡ ቃለ፡ ዘሰምዓት

Canonical Story Title: Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Gabriel the Archangel.
Incipit: ወፈነወ፡ በአፈ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፡ ኀበ፡ ወለተ፡ ዳዊት፡ ወተምህረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ምስጢረ፡ ኅቡዓ፡ ባሕቲታ፡ ወከሠተት፡ ለሰብእ፡ ዘታነገራ፡ መልአክ

Canonical Story Title: Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Holy Spirit.
Incipit: ወኤልሳቤጥኒ፡ እንዘ፡ ዓዲ፡ እስመ፡ ምልዕተ፡ መንፈስ፡ ይእቲ፡ አዕመረት፡ አንፈርዕፆቶ፡ ለሕፃን፡ ወቀፀበቶ፡ ለአቡሁ

Canonical Story Title: Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Home of Saint Mary
Incipit: ወተመይጠት፡ ትግባዕ፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወእምድኅረ፡ ዝንቱ፡ እስመ፡ በጽሐ፡ ጊዜሃ፡ ትለድ፡ ወሌዋዊ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ ተወክፈ፡ ወአዕመረ፡ ከመ፡ ፀንሰት፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Mysteries.
Incipit: ምስጢር፡ ኅቡዕ፡ ዘተነግረ፡ እምኀበ፡ አብ፡ አምላክከ፡ ይዕቀብዎ፡ ከመ፡ ኢትክሥቱ፡ ለዘአፍአ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Saint Theodore the Anatolian.
Emperor Honorius, who lived like a monk.
A column falls and breaks the leg of the son of an official when Muslims destroy a church of Saint Mary in Homs.
The prodigal son of a man who used, when he was alive, to feed two persons; Saint Mary promises him riches, but he finds only two grains of gold.
The monk who was expelled from school when he could not pay his teacher.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family uses stones instead of a boat to cross the Nile.
Holy Family journey cycle: The people of an Egyptian town set fierce dogs on the Holy Family.
The mourning of Saint John the Baptist for his mother.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ መጥምቅ፡ እንዘ፡ ገዳመ፡ አጐየየቶ፡ እሙ፡ ኤልሳቤጥ፡ ውስተ፡ ገዳም፡ አመ፡ ቀተሎሙ፡ ሄሮድስ፡ ለሕፃናት

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to the gabaz of her church in Waybela and tells him about the fall of Badlay.
The chastisement of the heretic, Nestorius.
In a vision Saint Mary is shown the Paradise of the Just.
Incipit: ወትቤ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወአውሥአኒ፡ ወይቤለኒ፡ ወልድየ፡ ንዒ፡ ኀቤየ፡ ኦእምየ፡ ናንሶሱ፡ ኀበ፡ ገነተ፡ ጻድቃን

Canonical Story Title: A Roman official is prevented from approaching the Holy Sepulcher.
Saint Mary's promises to those who are devoted to her.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ እንግርክሙ፡ ውሉደ፡ ጥምቀት፡ ዘትቤ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ዕድ፡ ወአንስት፡ አዕሩግ፡ ወሕፃናት፡ ቀሳውስት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ እለ፡ ትቀውሙ፡ ዝየ፡ ለሰሚዓ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ክቡር፡ ወልዑል፡ ወሥሙር፡ ወታስምዐነ፡ ቃለ፡ ፍሥሐ፡ ወሐሴት፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን። ወትቤ፡ ለኒ፡ በዝዓለም፡ አዓቅበክሙ፡ እምዕለት፡ እኪት፡ ወእምሰዓታተ፡ መንሱት

Canonical Story Title: The Egyptian woman who lost a silver plate while bathing in a miraculous spring.
Holy Family journey cycle: The inhabitants of an Egyptian town who plot to hand Jesus over to King Herod are turned into animals.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Assumption as narrated by Saint John to Prochorus.
Incipit: ዜና፡ ፍልሰታ። ወይእዜኒ፡ አብሮኮሮስ፡ አነ፡ አንከርኩ፡ እምዕበየ፡ ስብሐት፡ ዘተውህበ፡ ለእምነ፡ ወለእግዝእትነ፡…. ብፅዕት፡ ከርሥ፡ ዘወለደታ፡ ውስተ፡ ዓለም

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John tells Prochorus how he and the other Apostles were brought together on the 15th of Naṣase.
Incipit: ዜና፡ ፍልሰታ። ወአመ፡ ተጋብኡ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ አነ፡ ምስሌሆሙ፡ በከመ፡ ትሬእዩኒ፡ በአዕይንቲከ፡ ኦወልድየ፡ አብሮኮሮስ፡ ወተጋባዕነ፡ በበይናቲነ፡ ውስተ፡ ገነተ፡ ተድላ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Plato is present at the Transitus of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አፍላጦን፡ ወመጽአ፡ ኀበ፡ ፍልሰተ፡ ሥጋሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. መሐከ፡ ኵሎ፡ መካነ፡ እምኵሎሙ፡ መካን

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Thomas relates how he was taken to Heaven and saw the body of Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Anonymous homily against the report that the Apostles abandoned the body of Saint Mary when they were attacked by the Jews during her funeral procession.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary narrates to Saint John a revelation made to her by Christ on Golgotha.
Incipit: በእንተ፡ ዕበያ፡ ወክብራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ይቤ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ፡ ንጕድጓድ፡ ዘያፈቅሮ፡ እግዚእ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ በእንተ፡ ዕበየ፡ ንጽሕናሁ፡ ወእግዝእትነ፡…. ታፈቅሮ፡ ፈድፋደ፡ በከመ፡ ያፈቅሮ፡ ወልዳ፡ ወአውሥአቶ፡ ቡርክት፡ ወትቤሎ፡ ስማዕ፡ ኦዮሐንስ፡ እንግርከ፡ ኅቡዓ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ grants Saint Mary a vision of the sufferings of those in Hell.
Incipit: ወትቤ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. አውሣእክዎ፡ ለወልድየ፡ ወእቤሎ፡ አርእየኒ፡ ሶበ፡ ትወጽእ፡ ነፍሰ፡ ኃጥኣን፡ እምሥጋሃ

Canonical Story Title: Christ, Nativity of cycle: The magi and their chief, Balaam, see the star of Christ's birth.
Incipit: ዘኮነ፡ እምቅድመ፡ ልደታ፡ ለቅድስት፡ ሐና፡ ፲፻ወ፭፻ወ፳፡ ዓመት። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በብሔረ፡ ምሥራቅ፡ ዘስሙ፡ በለዓለም፡ ዘየአምር፡ መጸእያተ፡ በሕገ፡ መሰግላን

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary narrates to Saint John a revelation made to her by Christ on Golgotha (continuation).
Incipit: ወይቤለኒ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልድየ፡ እንዘ፡ ይብል፡ ኦወላዲትየ፡ ርኢ፡ ኀበ፡ መትሕት፡ ወነጸሪ። ወአንሰ፡ ሶበ፡ ሰማዕኩ፡ እምኔሁ፡ ዘንተ፡ ሐወጽኩ፡ ወርኢኩ

Canonical Story Title: Narration of the consecration of the first church; when the patriarchs are commemorated, they rise from the dead and are baptized.
Incipit: ወእንዘ፡ ሀሎነ፡ በምድረ፡ ይሁዳ፡ አመ፡ ፷፡ ለኅዳር፡ ናሁ፡ ደመና፡ ብሩህ፡ ፆረነ፡ ምስሌሁ፡ ወምስለ፡ አርዳኢሁ፡ ወምስለ፡ ማርያም፡ መግደላዊት፡ ወአብጽሐነ፡ ኀበ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ቤት

Canonical Story Title: Emperor Zeno builds churches in Scete.
Ark of Zion cycle: The beginning of the history of the Ark of Zion in the giving of the Ten Commandments.
Incipit: ስምዑኒ፡ እንግርክሙ፡ ጥንተ፡ ሙላዳ፡ ለጽዮን፡ ፀወንነ፡ አመ፡ ጾመ፡ ፵፡ መዓልተ፡ ወ፵፡ ሌሊተ፡ በደብረ፡ ሲና፡ ወወሀቦ፡ ጽላተ፡ ዘዕብን፡ ዘውስቴቱ፡ ጽሑፍ፡ ፲፡ ቃላት

Canonical Story Title: Ark of Zion cycle: The miracles of the Ark of Zion in the days of Joshua.
Incipit: ወሶበ፡ ሞተ፡ ሙሴ፡ ተመጠወ፡ ኢየሱ፡ ለጽዮን፡ እንተ፡ ይእቲ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወሖረ፡ ኀበ፡ ገባዖን፡ ወበጽሐ፡ ኀበ፡ ዮርዳኖስ፡ ወተክፍለ፡ ፲፪፡ ከመ፡ ይኩን፡ ትእምርተ፡ ለዘይመጽእ

Canonical Story Title: Ark of Zion cycle: The history of the Ark of Zion during the reigns of David and Solomon; Menelik takes the Ark toward Axum; when they reach the Red Sea, it parts before them.
Incipit: ወእምዝ፡ ነግሠ፡ ዳዊት፡ ንጉሠ፡ እስራኤል፡ ወፄወውዋ፡ ኤሎፍላውያን፡ ለታቦተ፡ ጽዮን፡ ወወሰድዋ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገሮሙ። ወበህየ፡ አውረደት፡ ሎሙ፡ መቅሠፍተ፡ ብዙኃ

Canonical Story Title: Ark of Zion cycle: The Ark of Zion is installed in Axum; the coming there of Abba Salama, who explains to the priests attending the Ark its true significance.
Incipit: ወእምዝ፡ ተጋብአት፡ ዛቲ፡ ባሕር፡ ከመ፡ ቀዳሚ። ወሶቤሃ፡ በጽሑ፡ ሠራዊተ፡ ሰሎሞን፡ ወሶበ፡ ነደ፡ አማዑቶሙ፡ ወውዕየ፡ ልቦሙ፡ ወድቁ፡ በገጾሙ፡ ወአንገርገሩ፡ ዲበ፡ ምድር

Canonical Story Title: The three pious priests and monks who wore fine clothes.
Patriarch Abraham and the interpretation of the parable of the mustard seed.
A Muslim, Katib, tries to extort money from the monks of Saint Anthony.
The Ethiopian pilgrim who was expelled from the Church (of the Resurrection) in Jerusalem during the Easter services.
Synaxary entry for the 16th of Yakkatit: Saint Mary receives the Pact of Mercy (kidan mehret).
The icon of Saint Mary in the church of the "Romans" that rebuked the Ethiopians for approaching with their shoes on.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The flight into Egypt.
The priest who left the keys of the church locked up inside.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The life of Saint Mary to the birth of Christ.
Ark of Zion cycle: Homily on the giving of the Law and the fashioning of the Tabernacle.
Incipit: እኬልሕ፡ ወአነክር፡ እሴብሕ፡ ወእዜምር፡ ለክብረ፡ በዓላ፡ ለተቋመ፡ ማኅቶት፡ ዘወርቅ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ወብርህት፡ ጽዮን፡ ሰማያዊት፡ ታቦተ፡ ሕግ፡ ዘበአማን

Canonical Story Title: Ark of Zion cycle: Continuation of the preceding Exhortation: The Ark of Zion crossing of the Jordan and the conquest of Palestine.
Ark of Zion cycle: When Israel Sins against the Law, the Philistines defeat them and carry off the Ark of Zion, which then chastizes them.
Ark of Zion cycle: The havoc wrought among the Philistines by the Ark of Zion.
Ark of Zion cycle: King David and all Israel bring back the Ark of Zion.
The fate of the monk, Giyorgis, who followed the teachings of Za-Mika'el.
Ark of Zion cycle: The Temple that King Solomon built for the Ark of Zion.
Ark of Zion cycle: The Ark of Zion is brought into the Temple of Zion.
Incipit: ንትመየጥኬ፡ ኀበ፡ ዜና፡ ነገር፡ ዘጽኑሕ፡ ለነ፡ በእንተ፡ መቅደስ፡ ዘሐነጸ፡ ሰሎሞን፡ ወልደ፡ ዳዊት፡ ይረድኦ፡ ኪራም፡ ወልደ፡ መበለት

Canonical Story Title: Ark of Zion cycle:  God appears to King Solomon in a dream after the dedication of the Temple.
Incipit: ንትመየጥኬ፡ ኀበ፡ ዜና፡ ነገር፡ ዘጽኑሕ፡ ለነ፡ በእንተ፡ መቅደስ፡ ዘሐነጸ፡ ሰሎሞን፡ ወልደ፡ ዳዊት፡ ይረድኦ፡ ኪራም፡ ወልደ፡ መበለት

Canonical Story Title: Ark of Zion cycle: After the destruction of the Temple by Nebuchadnezzar, the Ark of Zion is hidden; the prophecy of Ezra concering it.
Ark of Zion cycle: The precious stones used in building the Temple.
Ark of Zion cycle: The vision of Zechariah concerning the Ark of Zion.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ስምዑኒ፡ እንግርክሙ፡ ዘይቤ፡ ዘካርያስ፡ ነቢይ፡ በእንተ፡ ዜናሃ፡ ለቅድስት፡ ጽዮን፡ ሰማያዊት፡ በካልእ፡ ወርኅ፡ ዓመተ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ለዳርዮስ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ኮነ፡ ቃለ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ኀቤየ

Canonical Story Title: Holy Family journey cycle: The places in Egypt visited by the Holy Family.
Tekta, who is childless, has a dream about ten generations ending with the moon and the sun.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ እምውሉደ፡ እስራኤል፡ ጻድቅ፡ ወፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ውእቱ፡ በኵሉ። ወይቤላ፡ ለብእሲቱ፡ ቴክታ፡ ብነ፡ ወርቅ፡ ወብሩር፡ ወአልባስ፡ ቀጠንት፡ ዘአልቦ፡ ኍልቍ

Canonical Story Title: The story of the sorcerers Taludar, who was possessed by a demon.
The infidel who stole the lumber from the church at Däbrä QwesqWam.
The miracle concerning the golden ink during the reign of King Dawit.
The church of Saint Mary in Spain to which she used to bring Christian captives.
Amnut, the custodian of a church in Egypt, quarrels with his bishop.
The rich man who left the church because the priest was saying the Anaphora of Saint Mary, Gwasca, on a big feast day.
The son of Emperor Tiberius is raised from the dead.
Bishop Hildephonsus sees the icon of Saint Mary sweating; she asks him to raise a girl from the dead.
John the Evangelist paints an icon of the Crucifixion for Emperor Tiberius.
Mary, Conception of cycle: The conception and nativity of Saint Mary.
Eulogius, the stonemason of Scete, Egypt, who used to give hospitality to strangers.
The merchant from Senfewat who struck the icon of Saint Mary.
The old woman from Sembat who gave the offering for Saint Mary to Saint George.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob is given a sign of Badlay's fall.
An angel drives away the custodian of a church of Saint Mary when he was about to enter after sinning with a woman.
The European who tried to steal the icon of Saint Mary from Däbrä Sedeneya.
The Dormition and Transitus of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ነገር፡ ዘበእንተ፡ ዕርገታ። ወሶበ፡ ሞተት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. አኮ፡ ውስተ፡ ምድር፡ አላ፡ መሠጣ፡ መልአክ፡ እምዓራታ፡ ዘቦቱ፡ ይጸውርዋ፡ ምስለ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ፍቁረ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ወአብጽሐ፡ ውስተ፡ ገነት

Canonical Story Title: A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
Oz, the Byzantine monk, is shown a vision of Hell by Saint Urael.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ሮማዊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዖፅ፡ በደብረ፡ ኩራዛ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወበአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ አዘዘቶ፡ ለኡራኤል፡ መልአክ፡ ከመ፡ ያርእዮ፡ ማኅደረ፡ ኃጥኣን፡ ጠዋያን

Canonical Story Title: The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
The rich man from Colosse who was wounded in the eye while fighting the Qwez.
The church of Saint Mary that moved by itself to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea.
The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
Elizabeth, the blind daughter of Abraham and Gera Anest of Baderman.
The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
The two brothers who copied the Miracles of Mary and fell into the doing of a sin.
Saint Mary appears to the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis, in prison.
Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
Bishop Mercurius, whom the patriarch wanted to remove because of leprosy.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The monk of Däbrä Qaləmon who did not fast.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
The daughter of the rich man from Caesarea who could not deliver her baby.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The virgin who sinned with many lovers.
The faded icon of Saint Mary that the mother-in-law wanted to discard.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The woman from Cairo whose children all died.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
Alexander, a Jew from Jerusalem, is delivered three days after he was swallowed up by a dragon.
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
Saint Mary appears as a winged maiden to John, a monk of Saint Macarius.
Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon intercedes for an angel who had disobeyed the command of God.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
An Egyptian woman comes to Saint Mary in Bethlehem and is healed of her fever.
Mareqos, King of Romeya, abandons his throne secretly to become a monk.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.

Incipit: ይቤ፡ ዕዝራ፡ ከመዝ፡ ህላዌሃ፡ ለጽዮን፡ እንተ፡  እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡…. ወግብረታኒ፡ በአርአያ፡ ሰማይ፡ ወመሠረታቲሃ፡ በዕንቈ፡ ሰንፔር

Canonical Story Title: Homily on the silver bird with gilded wings (Ps. 67,14).
Incipit: ስምዑኬ፡ ደቂቀ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ መአንዝረ፡ ቃላቲሁ፡ ለቅዱሰ፡ እስራኤል፡ አዕዋፈ፡ ወንጌሉ፡ ለዘተወልደ፡ እምርግብ፡ በብሩር፡ ወግቡር፡ አክናፊሃ፡ ወገበዋቲሃ፡ በሐመልማለ፡ ወርቅ፡ ወትሰመይ፡ በአክናፍ፡ እምመንፈስ፡ ለተጋብኦ፡ ውስተ፡ አፀደ፡ ሃይማኖት

Canonical Story Title: The acts of Saint Paul in Wariqon, as narrated by Saint Peter.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ አመ፡ ገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በሀገረ፡ ዋሪቆን፡ በላዕለ፡ ዕደ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ ጳውሎስ። ይቤ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ርእሶሙ፡ ለሐዋርያት፡ አመ፡ ሖረ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ጳውሎስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ቅጥራግና፡ ረከበኒ፡ ሊተ፡ ጴጥሮስ

Canonical Story Title: When the Jews try to seize Saint Mary and the Apostles in Bethlehem, they are taken by the Spirit to the Temple, the house being left empty.
Incipit: ወበይእቲ፡ ዕለት፡ መኳንንት፡ ዘቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ ጸውእዎሙ፡ ለእሙንቱ፡ ዕደው፡ እለ፡ ተፈወሱ፡ እምደዌሆሙ፡ ኀበ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ተስዕልዎሙ፡ ወይቤሎሙ፡ ንግሩነ፡ ዘገብረት፡ መንክረ፡ ለክሙ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም

Canonical Story Title: The governor believes in Christ and rebukes the Jews (continuation of the preceding miracle).
Incipit: ወበሳኒታ፡ ለአከ፡ መኰንን፡ ያስተጋብኦሙ፡ ለካህናት፡ ወለኵሎሙ፡ ሰብአ፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ፡ ወይቤሎሙ፡ እኩያን፡ ሕዝብ፡ እለ፡ ሰቀልክምዎ፡ ለክርስቶስ፡ ዘወረደ፡ እምሰማያት

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary heals a servant girl from a magic spell.
Daniel from Constantinople, who wanted to go to church to receive Communion even when there was fighting in the streets.
Elias from Elkesus, who was falsely accused and was suspended by the abbot.
Deganna, the church builder, who was asked by King Aktab to build a temple for his pagan gods.
Barnabas from Sandafa, who used to venerate Saint Mary's icon.
Paraleya from Iyyoram, who was beaten by her husband because she was childless.
A young monk is horrified when he has a sexual dream.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Assumption as narrated by Saint John to Prochorus.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John tells Prochorus how he and the other Apostles were brought together on the 15th of Naṣase.
Christ gives Saint Mary the Pact of Mercy.
The Spirit tells the Apostles to take Saint Mary from the Temple.

Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): The Miraculous Conception of Saint John the Baptist.
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): The Visitation of Saint Mary to St. Elizabeth.
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Gabriel the Archangel.
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Holy Spirit.
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Home of Saint Mary
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Mysteries.
Homily on the Annunciation and the Incarnation (continuation): Saint Elizabeth.

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Annuciation of cycle: Homily on the Annunciation, preceded by the gospel text.
Incipit: ወበሳድስ፡ ወርኅ፡ ተፈነወ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፡ እምኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ሀገረ፡ ገሊላ፡…. እንዘ፡ ኢየአምር፡ ብእሴ። ኦቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ እንተ፡ አውሥአቶ፡ ለመልአክ፡ በግህደት፡ ንጽሕት፡ ድንግልናሃ

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Annuciation of cycle: Homily on the Annunciation (continuation).
Incipit: ኀደረ፡ እግዚእ፡ ውስተ፡ ከርሠ፡ ድንግል፡ ፱፡ አውራኃ፡ ወ፭፡ ዕለተ፡ ከመ፡ ሰብእ፡ ልህቀ፡ ውስተ፡ ማኅፀን

Canonical Story Title: Mary, Assumption of cycle: Plato is present at the Transitus of Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Thomas relates how he was taken to Heaven and saw the body of Saint Mary.
Homily on the Assumption and on the reason for the trials and labors of the Apostles.
Incipit: ነገር፡ በእንተ፡ ፍልሰታ። ወአበዊነሰ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ በእንተ፡ መኑ፡ ኮኑ፡ በውስተ፡ ዓለም፡ ከመ፡ ኳሄላት፡ በከመ፡ ይቤ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ጳውሎስ፡ ልሳነ፡ ዕፍረት፡ በእንተ፡ መኑ፡ ሞቀሕዎሙ

Canonical Story Title: An angel drives away the custodian of a church of Saint Mary when he was about to enter after sinning with a woman.
An angel drives away the custodian of a church of Saint Mary when he was about to enter after sinning with a woman.
The Ethiopian general who went off to fight the Muslims without the consent of the king.
Tiras, who did not observe holy days, becomes deaf and dumb, but he is healed when his master prays to Saint Mary.
Mary, Childhood of cycle: When she is three years old, Saint Mary is taken to the Temple.
Narration of the consecration of the first church; when the patriarchs are commemorated, they rise from the dead and are baptized.
Ark of Zion cycle: The vision of Zechariah concerning the Ark of Zion.
Ark of Zion cycle: The beginning of the history of the Ark of Zion in the giving of the Ten Commandments.
Ark of Zion cycle: The miracles of the Ark of Zion in the days of Joshua.
The vision of Saint John in the Apocalypse.
Incipit: ይቤ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ፡ ነጕድጓድ፡ ርኢኩ፡ ወአስተርአየ፡ ተአምር፡ ዐቢይ፡ በውስተ፡ ሰማይ፡ ብእሲት፡ እንተ፡ ትለብስ፡ ፀሐየ፡ ወወርኃ፡ ታሕተ፡ እገሪሃ፡ ወውስተ፡ ርእሳ፡ አክሊል፡ ዘ፲፡ ወ፪፡ ከዋክብት። ዝውእቱ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ዘርእዮ፡ ለእግዚእ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ምስለ፡ ማርያም። ወይቤላ፡ ለእሙ፡ ነዋ፡ ወልድኪ። ወይቤሎ፡ ለረድኡ፡ በዲበ፡ ዕፀ፡ መስቀል፡ ነያ፡ እምከ

Canonical Story Title: Homily on the vision of Saint John the Evangelist.
Incipit: ኦፍቁራን፡ ደቂቀ፡ ወንጌል፡ እለ፡ ዕቁባን፡ በስመ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወእለ፡ ትትሜክሑ፡ በንጽሐ፡ ድንግልናሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ርኢክሙኒ፡ ዘየዐቢ፡ እምዝንቱ፡ ነገር፡ ዘርእየ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ፡ ነጕድጓድ፡ ርዓይ፡ ኅቡአት፡ ዘረፈቀ፡ ውስተ፡ ሕፅነ፡ ነድ

Canonical Story Title: Continuation of the preceding homily on the vision of the Apocalypse.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ላቲ፡ ለይእቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ አክናፍ፡ ዐበይት፡ መንፈሳውያን፡ በዘትሠርር፡ ቦሙ፡ ለበጺሐ፡ ኵሉ፡ ዓለም

Canonical Story Title: Continuation of the preceding homily on the vision of the Apocalypse.
Incipit: አልቦ፡ እምሰብእ፡ ዘይትረከብ፡ እምአዳም፡ አቡነ፡ ወሔዋን፡ እምነ፡ ዘኢአበሰ፡ በሕሊናሁ፡ እመኒ፡ በፍጥወተ፡ ንዋይ፡ ዘዝንቱ፡ ዓለም፡ ዘተሰምየ፡ ዝሙተ፡ በከመ፡ ጸሐፉ፡ ሐዋርያት

Canonical Story Title: Conclusion of the preceding homily on the vision of the Apocalypse.
Incipit: ይቤሉ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ በሲኖዶሶሙ፡ ውእቱ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘተወልደ፡ እምማርያም፡ እምቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ ዘንጽሕት፡ እምትዝብሕት፡ ወርኰስት፡ ወኵሉ፡ ክርስቲያናዊ፡ ዘቦ፡ ላዕሌሁ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ይሜህር፡ ንጽሐ፡ ድንግልናሃ

Canonical Story Title: Tekta, who is childless, has a dream about ten generations ending with the moon and the sun.
Saint Mary asks Christ to bless those who honor her and pray for her help.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ጸለየት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወትቤሎ፡ ኦእግዚእየ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወልደ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ልዑል፡ እስእለከ፡ ወአስተበቍዓከ፡ በእንተ፡ ኵሉ፡ ዘገብሩ፡ ሊተ፡ ፈቃድየ፡ በሰማይ፡ ወበምድር። ወትቤሎ፡ ባርክ፡ እግዚኦ፡ ኀበ፡ ዘይገብር፡ ማኅሌተ፡ በስምየ

Canonical Story Title: A monk, while guarding a church, has a nocturnal emission and finds himself suddenly outside the courtyard of the church.
Ark of Zion cycle: The vision of Zechariah concerning the Ark of Zion.
When Pariqos of Fesa confesses his sins to the bishop, the latter, refusing him absolution, tells him to go to Abba Yaceqob (Santiago).
Incipit: ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ጥእምተ፡ ስም፡ ንግሥተ፡ አርያም፡ መድኃኒተ፡ ኵሉ፡ ዓለም። ወእንዘ፡ ይነብር፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ አሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ መጽአ፡ ኀቤሁ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወተአምነ፡ ኀጢአቶ፡ ወኢተወክፎ፡ ውእቱ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ

Canonical Story Title: A column falls and breaks the leg of the son of an official when Muslims destroy a church of Saint Mary in Homs.
The three pious priests and monks who wore fine clothes.
The punishment of an Ethiopian woman who swore falsely that she had not committed adultery with another woman's husband.
The monk who was expelled from school when he could not pay his teacher.
The new tabot of Saint Mary that was found outside the box in which it had been placed.
A monk, while guarding a church, has a nocturnal emission and finds himself suddenly outside the courtyard of the church.
The thieves who stole the furnishings of a church of Saint Mary and refused to restore them when she appeared to them.
A young monk is horrified when he has a sexual dream.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The virgin who sinned with many lovers.
The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
The man who was possessed by a spirit of epilepsy [nagargar] for 47 years.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
The brigands who killed each other at the miraculous spring.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The knight who wanted to seduce the daughter of the cobbler.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
The two brothers from Rome, Peter, a deacon, and Stephen, an avaricious magistrate.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a rich sinner who had repented and was planning to build a monastery and become a monk.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The avaricious priest who visited a dying man who loved bribes.
The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
The shepherd near the church of Saint Paul in Rome who was possessed by a demon.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
The bankrupt merchant to whom Satan offered two pearls if he would deny Christ and Saint Mary.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The Jewish cowherd who was baptized by his Christian companions.
The mighty Goliath threatens to destroy the monastery of Saint Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The young man who was ready to serve Satan, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
A knight tries to seduce the wife of a friend, but she is saved by a vision.
The pious rich man whom Satan served in hopes of destroying him.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
Saint Mary appears to Yohannes Kama.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ካማ፡ ዘኀሠሠ፡ እምንእሱ፡ አፍቅሮቶ፡ ለክርስቶስ፡ በዐቢይ፡ ገድል፡ ወአመ፡ ልህቀ፡ ፈኀሩ፡ ሎቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ድንግለ

Canonical Story Title: The vinedresser of Manfalut who gave his earnings to the builders of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘይትጌበር፡ አዕጻዳተ፡ ወይን፡ በሀገር፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ መንፈሉጥ፡ ወኮነ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ይነሥእ፡ ዓስቦ፡ እምቈጽለ፡ ገነት

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears as a winged maiden to John, a monk of Saint Macarius.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ቀሲስ፡ በደብረ፡ አባ፡ መቃርስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወዘልፈ፡ ታስተርእዮ፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The infidel who stole the lumber from the church at Däbrä QwesqWam.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ከሐዲ፡ ወየኀድር፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ ቁስያ፡ ወባዕል፡ ጥቀ፡ በንዋይ፡ ወይጸልእ፡ ዘመደ፡ ክርስቲያን

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis, in prison.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መስተጋድል፡ ፈድፋደ፡ በከዊነ፡ ስምዕ፡ በእንተ፡ ስመ፡ እግዝእነ፡ ወአምላክነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ሐዲስ

Canonical Story Title: Mareqos, King of Romeya, abandons his throne secretly to become a monk.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ዘነግሠ፡ በሮምያ፡ እምድኅረ፡ ሞተ፡ አቡሁ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ገብረ፡ ኢየሱስ

Canonical Story Title: The people of Romeya appeal to Patriarch Dionysius to find King Mareqos.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዲዮናስዮስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮምያ፡ ወሶበ፡ ኃጥእዎ፡ ሕዝብ፡ ለብፁዕ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ሖሩ፡ ኀበ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት

Canonical Story Title: When Sefengeya, wife of King Masfeyanos of Romeya, prays to have a child before the icon of Saint Mary, the icon inclines its head; Sefengeya then conceives Yeshaq (Abba Garima).
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ መስፍያኖስ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ሮምያ፡ ወስመ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ስፍንግያ፡ እስመ፡ መካን፡ ይእቲ

Canonical Story Title: Entawos, a pagan from Qarays, becomes a Christian after being struck by miraculous arrows.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ አሞራዊ፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ቀራይስ፡ ወአረማዊ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወኢየአምር፡ ለእግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: A man who speaks blasphemously of Saint Mary has his arms and legs cut off.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዕቡይ፡ ዘአንበረ፡ ውስተ፡ ሰማይ፡ አፉሁ፡ ወአንሶሰወ፡ ውስተ፡ ምድር፡ ልሳኑ

Canonical Story Title: The wife of a pagan official who wished to pray at the Holy Sepulcher is prevented until she is baptized.
Incipit: ኦኵልክሙ፡ ማኅበረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ክሥቱ፡ አእዛነ፡ አልባቢክሙ፡ ለሰሚዐ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወሰሚዐክሙ፡ ከመ፡ አድኃነቶሙ፡ ለኃጥኣን፡ እምስሕተቶሙ፡ በትንብልናሃ፡ በልዋ፡ ኦድንግል፡ አፍጥኒ

Canonical Story Title: The son of Emperor Tiberius is raised from the dead.
Incipit: ተአምር፡ ወውዳሴ፡ ክቡር፡ ዘገብረ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ላዕለ፡ እሙ፡ ድንግል። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጢባርዮስ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ሮሜ፡ ዘበመዋዕሊሁ፡ ተሰቅለ፡ እግዚእነ

Canonical Story Title: John the Evangelist paints an icon of the Crucifixion for Emperor Tiberius.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ ሶበ፡ ሖረ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ኀበ፡ ጢባርዮስ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ በከመ፡ ይቤሎ፡ እግዚእነ

Canonical Story Title: Petros Bawares has a vision of the Trinity.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ በዋርስ፡ ወሐነጸ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም። ወነበረ፡ ያስተበቍዕ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ ከመ፡ ትስአል፡ ሎቱ፡ ኀበ፡ ወልዳ፡ ያርኢዮ፡ ምስጢረ፡ ሥላሴሁ

Canonical Story Title: The conversion of the Muslim, Rewh, who is renamed Entons Haddis.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ አረማዊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ርውኅ፡ ወአመ፡ ሜጦ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ኀበ፡ አሚነ፡ ሥላሴ፡ በጸሎታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ተሰምየ፡ እንጦንስሃ፡ ሐዲሰ

Canonical Story Title: The wife of Mark, a priest from Mallawi, is cured of her leprosy.
Incipit: ተአምር፡ ዘተከሥተት፡ በእደ፡ አቡነ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ አባ፡ ማቴዎስ። ወሀሎ፡ ቀሲስ፡ እምሰብአ፡ መላዊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ወቦቱ፡ ብእሲት፡ ወመጽአ፡ ላዕሌሃ፡ ለምጽ፡ ዲበ፡ ሕንብርታ

Canonical Story Title: The monks of Saint Anthony celebrate Holy Week at Däbrä QWesqWam.
Incipit: ወበዓመት፡ ፲፻ወ፩፻፡ ፲ወ፪፡ ለሰማዕታት፡ በጽሑ፡ መነኮሳት፡ እምደብረ፡ አቡነ፡ እንጦንዮስ፡ ከመ፡ ይግበሩ፡ ሰሙነ፡ ሕማማት፡ በደብረ፡ ቍስቋም

Canonical Story Title: A Muslim, Katib, tries to extort money from the monks of Saint Anthony.
Incipit: ወበዐመት፡ ፲፻፴፡ ወ፰፡ ሖረ፡ ኀበ፡ አቡነ፡ ቆሞስ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አበ፡ ምኔት፡ ዘደብረ፡ አቡነ፡ እንጦንዮስ፡ ወእሙር፡ ውእቱ፡ በቅድስና፡ ወበንጽሕ

Canonical Story Title: Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ በሀገር፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ እልክሱስ፡ ብእሲ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ከጢር፡ ወአረጋዊ፡ ብእሲሁ፡ ወይነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወይሴሰይ፡ እምምጽዋተ፡ ሰብእ

Canonical Story Title: The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
Incipit: ወሀለዉ፡ ፪፡ አኃው፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገር፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ ደልጋ፡ የአልሉ፡ አልባሰ፡ በቀለመ፡ ኒል፡ ወአሐዱ፡ እምኔሆሙ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ታግ

Canonical Story Title: Homily of John Chrysostom on the visit of Saint Mary and her Son to John the Baptist.
Incipit: ይቤ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አፈ፡ ወርቅ፡ እንዘ፡ ይዜኑ፡ ዘከመ፡ ኃውጸቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ መጥምቅ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ገዳመ

Canonical Story Title: The story of Pifamon, the martyr from Awsim.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ፒፋሞን፡ በሀገረ፡ አውሴም፡ ክቡረ፡ ዘመድ፡ ወአቡሁ፡ መኰንነ፡ ሀገር

Canonical Story Title: The story of John, the martyr from Senhut.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ስንሑት፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ እምንእሱ፡ ዘአሥመሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ በሠናይ፡ ገድል

Canonical Story Title: The Jews plot to burn the body of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ ሶበ፡ ጥዕመት፡ ሞተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ አመ፡ ፳ወ፩፡ ለጥር፡ ተማከሩ፡ አይሁድ፡ እንዝ፡ ይብሉ፡ ሚንገብር፡ ሐዘነ፡ ሞት፡ ወረደ፡ ላዕሌነ፡ በእንተ፡ ኢየሱስ

Canonical Story Title: A Roman official is prevented from approaching the Holy Sepulcher.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ እምመስፍንተ፡ ሮሜ፡ ወመጽአ፡ ከመ፡ ይጸሊ፡ ኀበ፡ መቃብረ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ
