Canonical Story Title: Emperor Zeno builds churches in Scete.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ ሶበ፡ አንገሦ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ለንጉሥ፡ ዘይኑን፡ ዲበ፡ ሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ ወቍስጥንጥንያ፡ ወአድያመ፡ ግብጽ፡ ወተዘከረ፡ በልቡ፡ ወይቤ

Canonical Story Title: A priest is warned by an angel not to rush when incensing the icon of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ እንዘ፡ የዐውድ፡ ካህን፡ ወእንዘ፡ የዐጥን፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ ወበጽሐ፡ ኀበ፡ ሀለወ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary blesses Scete, which Saint Macarius chooses for his monastery.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ ሶበ፡ ኀደረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ውስተ፡ ደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ምስለ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ ወሰሎሜ፡ ወባረኮ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ለውእቱ፡ መካን

Canonical Story Title: The story of Michael, the scribe who converted to Islam when he was beaten.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘስሙ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ እምንእሱ፡ ወጸሓፊ፡ ውእቱ

Canonical Story Title: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob is given a sign of Badlay's fall.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ በምድረ፡ አጐባ፡ ፈነወ፡ ዓላዊ፡ ሰራዊተ፡ ብዙኃነ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እንዘ፡ ኢየአምር፡ ንጉሥ

Canonical Story Title: The story of the Muslim who lived near the churches of Saints Mark and Shenute.
A hermit in Jerusalem is saved from the temptations of Satan.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ባሕታዊ፡ በኢየሩሳሌም፡ እምመነኮሳት፡ ቀደምት፡ ወይትቀነይ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ በጾም፡ ወበጸሎት

Canonical Story Title: A monk, Abraham, drinks poisonous water while on a journey to visit the patriarch and dies, but is then raised from the dead.
Incipit: ወሀለዉ፡ ፪፡ መነኮሳት፡ ስሙ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ አብርሃም፡ ወስሙ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ ይስሐቅ፡ ወፈቀዱ፡ ይሖሩ፡ ኀበ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘእለ፡ እስክንድርያ

Canonical Story Title: Zärˀa Yaˁəqob and the invasion of Badlay.
Incipit: ተአምር፡ ዘገብረት፡ ሎቱ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ለዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ዘተሰምየ፡ ቍስጠንጢኖስ፡ ኢኮነ፡ በጸሙ፡ ወኢበጸሎቱ፡ ወኢበንጽሑ፡ ወኢበምጽዋቱ፡ ወኢበምህልላሁ፡ ኢበቀዊሞቱ፡ ወኢበአንብዑ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to the gabaz of her church in Waybela and tells him about the fall of Badlay.
The story of Absadi, gardener of the monastery of St. Shenute, who used to give away vegetables from the garden.
Incipit: ተአምር፡ ዘከሠተት፡ እመ፡ መለኮት፡ በውስተ፡ ደብረ፡ አባ፡ ሲኖዳ፡ አበ፡ መነኮሳት፡ ዓምደ፡ ግብጽ፡ ላዕላይ። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ እምደቂቁ፡ ዘያዓቅብ፡ አትክልተ፡ በቍላት፡ ዘአኃው

Canonical Story Title: The wrath of Saint Mary against the prefect of a church who tried to stop the priests from making a procession while singing hymns to her.
Incipit: ወሀለዉ፡ ፪፡ ፍቁራን፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወአሐዱ፡ እምኔሆሙ፡ ይመልክ፡ ይእተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን

Canonical Story Title: Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
Incipit: ጸጋ፡ ወኃይል፡ ዘገብረት፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በደወለ፡ ምስር፡ ዘምኵናነ፡ ግብጽ። ወሀለዉ፡ ዕደው፡ ዝሁራነ፡ ልብ፡ ወዕቡያነ፡ ዐይን፡ ወፈቀዱ፡ ያሥዕሉ፡ ሎሙ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ አበዊነ፡ ወአኃዊነ፡ ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ በብሔረ፡ ፋርስ። ወገብአት፡ ብሔረ፡ አፍርንጊ፡ ወረከበት፡ ፩፡ ብእሴ፡ ዘእብን፡ እግሩ

Canonical Story Title: A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The robber whom a bishop was commanded to bury after he was executed.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): Satan urges Herod to pursue the Holy Family.
Incipit: በእንተ፡ ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለቴዎፍሎስ፡…. እምድካመ፡ ፍኖት፡…. ወእንዘ፡ ከመዝ፡ አስተርአዮ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ለሄሮድስ፡ ቃለ፡ በቃል

Canonical Story Title: The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
Saint Mary appears to Sawla, the wife of the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis.
The history ot Däbrä Mahew near Jerusalem and its miraculous spring.
Saint Mary cures the son of a Roman official in Bethlehem.
Saint Mary heals a woman possessed by evil spirits.
An Egyptian woman comes to Saint Mary in Bethlehem and is healed of her fever.
A woman whose right eye had been blinded by a demon is healed by Saint Mary.
Saint Mary appears to Timothy, Patriarch of Alexandria, in the church of Saint Pachomius in Alexandria.
Saint Mary appears to Anthony, a monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Saint Mary appears to Anthony of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam (continued).
Saint Mary anoints sick animals and heals them at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Message of Saint Mary to Anthony, monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Anthony, the monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam, asks about the anointing of the animals.
Saint Mary gives a thirsty dog water to drink from her shoe.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family receives hospitality from a shepherd.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Christ Child grants Saint Mary a vision of his future glory.
The chastisement of the heretic, Nestorius.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family returns from Egypt.
Incipit: በእንተ፡ ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለቴዎፍሎስ፡…. እምድካመ፡ ፍኖት፡…. ወእንዘ፡ ይነውም፡ ዮሴፍ፡ በሌሊት፡ አስተርአዮ፡ መልአከ፡ እግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
The Frenchman whose wife was unable to have children.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ አፍርንጊ፡ እምአድያመ፡ አፍራንሳ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እምንእሱ፡ ወይትለአካ፡ በኵሉ፡ ኀይሉ። ወሶበ፡ በጽሐ፡ አምጣነ፡ አውስቦ፡ አስተዋሰብዎ፡ አበዊሁ፡ ወለተ፡ እምአውላደ፡ አፍርንጊ

Canonical Story Title: During the famine of 1120 MM [likely 1404 CE], the Arabs try to plunder the monasteries of Egypt.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በ፲፻፡ ወ፻፡ ወ፳፡ ዓመተ፡ ሰማዕታት፡ ንጹሓን፡ በመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለአብ፡ እግዚእ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ አባ፡ ማቴዎስ፡ ወኮነ፡ በሀገረ፡ ምስር፡ ረሓብ፡ ዐቢይ

Canonical Story Title: The monk of Däbrä Qaləmon who did not fast.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ በደብረ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዐቢይ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘቀልሞን፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ሠናይት፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወኮነ፡ ውስተ፡ ዛቲ፡ ቅድስት፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ሥዕል፡ ዐቢይ፡ ወመንክር

Canonical Story Title: The monks of Däbrä Qaləmon who were despoiled by Berbers.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በአሐዱ፡ እምመዋዕል፡ ሖሩ፡ ሰብእ፡ መነኮሳት፡ እምደብረ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘቀልሞን፡ ለፈጽሞ፡ መፍቅደ፡ ደብር

Canonical Story Title: An Arab steals the scissors of the tailor of Däbrä Qaləmon.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ በዝንቱ፡ ደብረ፡ ቀልሞን፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘይሰመይ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ሐፂር፡ ዘአድኀነቶ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. እምማእሰረ፡ ዐረብ

Canonical Story Title: Qommos Raphael from Däbrä ʾƎnṣǝnā and the sacrament of confession.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ስዒድ፡ በደብረ፡ እንጽና፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወእስከ፡ ይእዜ፡ ሀሎ፡ ወኵሉ፡ አሐዱ፡ አሐዱ፡ የአምሮ፡ ወይሰመይ፡ ምኔተ፡ አቡ፡ ንዕናእ

Canonical Story Title: An Arab who has contempt for Saint Mary’s icon at Däbrä Qaləmon is punished.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ እግዚእ፡ ክቡር፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ አባ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ሰማንያ፡ ወሰመንቱ፡ እምሊቃነ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘእለእስክንድርያ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሊቅ፡ በደብረ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዐቢይ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘቀልሞን፡ ዘስሙ፡ ሰሎሞን

Canonical Story Title: The composition of the Maṣḥafa ḥawi by Patriarch Gabriel Ibn Tarīk.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ አብ፡ ክቡር፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ አባ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ወልደ፡ ተሪክ፡ ወበጽሖ፡ ለዝንቱ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ በአስ፡ ወጸልእ፡ ምስለ፡ ሕዝቡ

Canonical Story Title: Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በደብረ፡ ቀልሞን፡ ወሶበ፡ በዝኀ፡ ተአምሪ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘታስተርኢ፡ ውስተ፡ ሥዕል፡ ዘሀለወት፡ በደብረ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አባ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ዘቀልሞን፡ ወፈድፋደሰ፡ ለዐረብ፡ እለ፡ ሀለዉ፡ ዐውዳ

Canonical Story Title: Nəkʷal, the deacon from Margawkim, who spent his master’s money on the poor.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ብእሲ፡ ክርስቲያናዊ፡ ዲያቆን፡ እምሰብአ፡ መርግ፡ ወኬም፡ ወስሙ፡ ንኳል

Canonical Story Title: The priest from Nārdin who was accused because he kept a nun in his house.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ናርዲን፡ ወተሠይመ፡ ቀሲሰ፡ በላዕለ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ድንግል፡ ዘይእቲ፡ ሀገር

Canonical Story Title: The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
The Arab woman who suffered from an issue of blood for many years.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ እምአንስተ፡ ዐረብ፡ ወባቲ፡ ውሕዘተ፡ ደም፡ እምብዙኅ፡ ዓመታት

Canonical Story Title: Yoḥannǝs finds a copy of the acts of Saints Juliana and Barbara that he had lost.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ በቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ወብፅዕት፡ ንጽሕት፡ ወልዕልት፡ እምሰማዕታት፡ በርባራ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘይሰመይ፡ ዮሐንስ

Canonical Story Title: The lamp before the icon of Saint Mary that the priest tipped over.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወዓዲ፡ ሥዕል፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. በገቦ፡ ንድቅ፡ ዘየማን

Canonical Story Title: The two blessed monks, Sadaqā and ʾƎstifānos, from the monastery of Saint Victor.
Incipit: ወሀለዉ፡ ክልኤቱ፡ መነኮሳት፡ ቡሩካን፡ እምድብረ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ማር፡ ፊቅጦር፡ በማኅፈደ፡ ናርቆን

Canonical Story Title: The Christians gathered for a feast of Saint Mary are saved from the Arabs.
ʾƎmma Yoḥannǝs and the Ethiopian monk who was on pilgrimage to Jerusalem.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ ብእሲት፡ መሃይምንት፡ ቅድስት፡ ወቡርክት፡ ወተኀድር፡ በአሐዱ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉራተ፡ ታሕታይ፡ ግብጽ፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ ስምባጥ

Canonical Story Title: The European who wanted to steal the bars of the door to the Manger at Bethlehem.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በበዐላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. አመ፡ ፲፡ ወ፮፡ ለወርኀ፡ ነሐሴ፡ ዕርገተ፡ ሥጋሃ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ውስተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ወይትገበር፡ ባቲ፡ በዐል፡ ዐቢይ፡ በቤተ፡ ልሔም

Canonical Story Title: Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ አበውየ፡ ወአኃውየ፡ ዘንተ፡ ነገረ፡ ዘኮነ፡ በእንተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡… እመ፡ ምሕረት፡ በአማን፡ መሐሪት፡ ወመስተፍሥሒት፡ ወመናዝዚት፡ ለዘሰአለ፡ ኀቤሃ፡ በጥቡዕ፡ ልብ፡ ወበጽኑዕ፡ ሃይማኖት። ወኮነ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎኩ፡ አነ፡ ነዳይ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ እስቁፍ፡ በገዳመ፡ አስቄጥስ፡ ነገሩኒ፡ ሰብእ፡ መሃይምናን፡ ኄራን፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ሀገሩሰ፡ ድፍራ

Canonical Story Title: The devout Muslim who became a Christian when Saint Mary appeared to him.
Incipit: ወሀለዉ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ሰብእ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወርሕቅት፡ እምኔሆሙ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. መጠነ፡ መሕዋረ፡ ፫፡ ሰዓት

Canonical Story Title: The apparitions of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq.
Incipit: ኦአኃው፡ ፍቁራን፡ ጽልዉ፡ አእዛኒክሙ፡ ወአስተጋብኡ፡ ሕሊናክሙ፡ ከመ፡ ንንግርክሙ፡ ዘንተ፡ ነገረ፡ መድምመ፡ ዘኢይበጽሖ፡ ሕሊና፡ መዋቲ

Canonical Story Title: The untrustworthy camel driver of Däbrä Metmaq.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ በዝንቱ፡ ደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡…. ብእሲ፡ ክርስቲያናዊ፡ ጸዐኔ፡ አግማል፡ ለመፍቅደ፡ ደብር

Canonical Story Title: Yeshaq, prior of Däbrä Metmaq, who fled to Scete, Egypt, to escape the burden of his office.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ በዝንቱ፡ ደብር፡ ዘዝኩር፡ ብእሲ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ዘይሰመይ፡ ይስሐቅ፡ ወውእቱ፡ ሊቀ፡ ምኔት፡ ወለለ፡ ዓመት፡ በገቢረ፡ በዐል፡ ይፃሙ፡ ብዙኀ

Canonical Story Title: Bishop Michael sends Deacon John to help the monks of Däbrä Metmaq celebrate Passion Week.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ ሢመቱ፡ ለአብ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ አባ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ዘደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ መጽኡ፡ ኀቤሁ፡ መነኮሳተ፡ ደብር፡ ሶበ፡ ቀርበ፡ በዐለ፡ ፋሲካ

Canonical Story Title: The cistern at Däbrä Metmaq is filled miraculously.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ደብር፡ ቅዱስ፡ ደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘሕንጽት፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ዔላ፡ ዘውእቱ፡ ምዕላደ፡ ማይ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ አበውየ፡ ወአኃውየ፡ ዘንተ፡ ነገረ፡ ዘኮነ፡ በእንተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. እመ፡ ምሕረት፡ ሰማዒት፡ ለዘሰአላ፡ ወመስተፍሥሒት፡ ለሕዙናን፡ በአማን፡ ተወካፊት፡ ለዘሰአላ፡ በጥቡዕ፡ ልብ፡ ወበጽኑዕ፡ ሃይማኖት። ወእንዘ፡ ሀሎኩ፡ አነ፡ ነዳይ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ እስቁፍ፡ ዘገዳመ፡ አስቄጥስ፡ በደብረ፡ ነጋድያን፡ አዘዘኒ፡ መምህር፡ ከመ፡ እትለአኮሙ፡ ለሕሙማን

Canonical Story Title: Some of the deceased great Fathers of the Desert appear to the monks of Scete.
Incipit: ወሀለዉ፡ በገዳመ፡ አስቄጥስ፡ ብዙኃን፡ ሕሙማን፡ እምአበው፡ ቅዱሳን

Canonical Story Title: An abbot in Scete sees first a multitude of demons, then a multitude of saints.
Incipit: ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ወፅአ፡ መምህር፡ ዘአስቄጥስ፡ ገዳመ፡ ወርእየ፡ ብዙኀ፡ መናፍስት፡ ወአጋንንት፡ ዘአልቦ፡ ኍልቈ፡ ወደንገፀ፡ ወጐየ

Canonical Story Title: The lamp of the Christian from Mǝneta Diyāqon that was blown out by the wind.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ክርስቲያናዊ፡ ይነብር፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ጊዛ፡ ዘይሰመይ፡ ምኔተ፡ ዲያቆን፡ በገቦሃ፡ ለምስር

Canonical Story Title: The wife of Joseph from Mǝneta Diyāqon, who had no male children.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በዛቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ካዕበ፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ ምኔተ፡ ዲያቆን፡ ወሀሎ፡ ብእሲ፡ ክርስቲያናዊ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ ወቦቱ፡ ብእሲተ፡ ሠናይተ፡ ላሕይ፡ ጥቀ

Canonical Story Title: The poor man from Aragon [Spain] who was buried alive in a gold mine.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ አረጎን፡ እምአድያመ፡ ቀጰዶቅያ፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ፈድፋደ፡ ወይገብር፡ በዐላ፡ ለለ፡ ኵሉ፡ ዕለት

Canonical Story Title: The cupbearer of the king of France.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡… ሊቀ፡ ጸውርተ፡ ሜስ፡ ዘንጉሠ፡ አፍራንሳ፡ እስመ፡ ልማዶሙ፡ ውእቱ፡ አሐዱ፡ ዘየማን፡ ወአሐዱ፡ ዘፀጋም

Canonical Story Title: The husband who denied Christ when he became poor.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ፈድፋደ፡ ወይገብር፡ በዐላ፡ ፳፡ ወ፩፡ በበ፡ ኵሉ፡ ወርኅ፡ ወብእሲቱ፡ ሠናይት፡ ወብዑላን፡ ጥቀ፡ በንዋይ

Canonical Story Title: The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሠዐሊ፡ ወአልቦ፡ ዘይትማሰሎ፡ በውእቱ፡ አዝማን፡ በገቢረ፡ ሥዕል

Canonical Story Title: The composition of the Wǝddāse Maryam by the Syrian potter.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ አበውየ፡ ወአኀውየ፡ ከመ፡ ንንግርክሙ፡ ተአምረ፡ ዐባየ፡ ዘኮነ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘነገሩ፡ አበው፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ሰማዕትየ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ከመ፡ ኢይዌስክ፡ ወኢያነትግ። ይቤሉነ፡ ነበረ፡ በምድረ፡ ሶርያ፡ ብእሲ፡ ለብሓዊ፡ ፈራሄ፡ እግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: Amnut, the custodian of a church in Egypt, quarrels with his bishop.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ጽዒድ፡ እምሢመተ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶሳት፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወሀሎ፡ በዛቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ብእሲ፡ አምኑት፡ ዘውእቱ፡ ዐቃቤ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን

Canonical Story Title: The old woman from Sembat who gave the offering for Saint Mary to Saint George.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ አራጊት፡ እንተ፡ ስማ፡ ስምባት፡ ወፈራሂተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይእቲ፡ ወታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ....

Canonical Story Title: The church built on the tomb of Saint Mary that will turn into a ship.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ አበውየ፡ ወአኃውየ፡ ዘንተ፡ ምሥጢረ፡ መንክረ፡ ወመድምመ፡ ዘነገሩነ፡ አበዊነ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ዘረከብዎ፡ ጽሑፈ፡ ውስተ፡ መጻሕፍት፡ ቅዱሳት። ወይቤሉ፡ አመ፡ ይመጽእ፡ እግዚእነ፡ በዳግም፡ ምጽኣቱ

Canonical Story Title: The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በሀገረ፡ ምስር፡ በስመ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ፑሉፓዴር፡ መርቆሬዎስ፡ ብእሲ፡ መነኮስ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ በከንሲ

Canonical Story Title: The priest, Rizqallah, recovers things stolen from pilgrims.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ በቅሩበ፡ ምስር፡ ምኔት፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ዘይሰመይ፡ ደብረ፡ አደውያ፡ ወያብዕሉ፡ በውስቴታ፡ በዐለ፡ ዐቢየ፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The church of Saint Mary that moved by itself to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea.
Incipit: ተአምሪሃ፡ ዘኮነ፡ በሀገረ፡ ጽርዕ። ወሀሎ፡ ደብር፡ በጽንፈ፡ ኢያሪኮ፡ ወኑኁ፡ መጠነ፡ መንፈቀ፡ ምዕራፍ

Canonical Story Title: The conversion of a Muslim merchant who had been imprisoned in Naples.
The rich man from Colosse who was wounded in the eye while fighting the Qwez.
Incipit: ዘኮነ፡ በደሴተ፡ ቆላሲስ። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ባዕል፡ ጥቀ፡ ወሖረ፡ ሀገረ፡ ትርኵ፡ ከመ፡ ይፅብኦሙ፡ ለቍዝ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears during Mass in the church at Meneta Sard.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ በቅሩበ፡ ዓይነ፡ ማይ፡ ዘአንቅዐ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ መጠርያ፡  በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወይብልዋ፡ ለይእቲ፡ ደወል፡ ምኔተ፡ ሰርድ

Canonical Story Title: Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon intercedes for an angel who had disobeyed the command of God.
Incipit: ዘገብረቶ፡ ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ዘእምርት፡ ገባሪታ፡ ተአምራት፡ ወመንክራት፡ ዘደብረ፡ ቀልሞን። ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ተምዐ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ላዕለ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ በእንተ፡ እከዮሙ፡ ወኀጢአቶሙ፡ ለሰብእ፡ እለ፡ ይነብሩ፡ ውስቴታ

Canonical Story Title: The story of the martyr, Saint Victor, and his mother, Martha.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ፈራሂተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወመፍቀሪተ፡ ነዳያን፡ ወመፍቀሪተ፡ ጽድቅ፡ ወምጽዋት፡ ወሥርጉት፡ በኵሉ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ በጾም፡ ወበጸሎት፡ ዘስማ፡ ማርታ

Canonical Story Title: Elizabeth, the blind daughter of Abraham and Gera Anest of Baderman.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ጽዒድ፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ በድርማን፡ ወይነብር፡ ውስቴታ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አብርሃም፡ ወስመ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ጌራ፡ አንስት

Canonical Story Title: The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ ብእሲት፡ ነዳይት፡ ወሞተ፡ ምታ፡ ወኀደገ፡ አዋልደ፡ ለአሐቲ፡ ስማ፡ ማርያም፡ ወለካልእት፡ ስማ፡ ማርታ፡ ወለሣልሲት፡ ስማ፡ የዋሂት

Canonical Story Title: The Arab woman who entrusted her jewels to a Christian for safekeeping.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በሀገረ፡ ጽዒድ፡ ፀብእ፡ ምስለ፡ ዐረብ፡ በበይናቲሆሙ። ወአሐቲ፡ እምአንስተ፡ ዐረብ፡ ነሥአት፡ ሥርጓ፡ ዘወርቅ፡ ወዘብሩር፡ ወአዕቀበቶሙ፡ ኀበ፡ ብእሲት፡ ክርስቲያናዊት

Canonical Story Title: The two brothers who copied the Miracles of Mary and fell into the doing of a sin.
Incipit: ወሀለዉ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ፪፡ አኃው፡ ፍቁራን፡ ወጽፉቀ፡ ይትፋቀሩ፡ በበይናቲሆሙ፡ ወየአምሩ፡ ግብረ፡ እድ፡ ወግብረ፡ እዶሙሰ፡ ጽሒፍ

Canonical Story Title: The abbot who did not allow the Miracles of Mary to be read in his monastery.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወሀገሩሰ፡ ዐቢይ፡ ይእቲ፡ ወሰብአ፡ ዚአሃ፡ ነገሥታቲሃ፡ ወጳጳሳቲሃ፡ ወኵሉ፡ ሕዝባ፡ እድ፡ ወአንስት፡ ያፈቅርዋ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: A man killed during the construction of the church of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam is raised from the dead.
Incipit: ወእንዘ፡ የሐንጹ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በደብረ፡ ቍስቋም፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ሶበ፡ አዘዞ፡ ንጉሥ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ እግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: The story of the sorcerers Taludar, who was possessed by a demon.
Incipit: ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡… እንተ፡ ገብረቶ፡ በላዕለ፡ መሠርይት፡ ጣውሉዳር፡ ወጣማር፡ መርዓታ፡ ለድምሳሴሆን፡ በጽንዐ፡ መዝራዕታ። ነገረ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ዘነገረቶ፡ ለጢሞቴዎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘእለስክንድርያ፡ ወልደ፡ ዲዮስቆሮስ፡ ወትቤ፡ ስማዕ፡ እንግርከ፡ ዘረከበነ፡ አመ፡ ናንሶሱ፡ ውስተ፡ ምድረ፡ ግብጽ

Canonical Story Title: The son of the Muslim ruler of Egypt blasphemes the icon of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ምስለ፡ ወልዱ፡ በሀገረ፡ ምስር፡ ወውእቱ፡ ተንባላታይ፡ ዕልው፡ በመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለአባ፡ እልስክንድሮስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት

Canonical Story Title: Eulogius, the stonemason of Scete, Egypt, who used to give hospitality to strangers.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አውሎጊስ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ወብእሲ፡ ነዳይ፡ ወፀራቤ፡ እብን፡ ውእቱ

Canonical Story Title: Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria.
Incipit: በእንተ፡ ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየቶ፡ ለቴዎፍሎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ወዘከመ፡ ተናገረቶ፡ ወአጽነዐቶ፡ እምደካመ፡ ፍኖት። ይቤ፡ ቴዎፍሎስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ስምዑ፡ አበውየ፡ ወአኀውየ፡ ዘእነግረክሙ፡ በፍርሃት፡ ወበረዓድ፡ ወበሃይማኖት፡ ርትዕት

Canonical Story Title: The pious rich man whom Satan served in hopes of destroying him.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
The two brothers from Rome, Peter, a deacon, and Stephen, an avaricious magistrate.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a rich sinner who had repented and was planning to build a monastery and become a monk.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The avaricious priest who visited a dying man who loved bribes.
The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The poor man from Aragon [Spain] who was buried alive in a gold mine.
The cupbearer of the king of France.
The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ሠናይት፡ ወሶበ፡ ፈጸሙ፡ ሕኒጾታ፡ መጽአ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሴ፡ መሥዕል፡ ወቦአ፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወገብረ፡ ዐራተ

Canonical Story Title: The husband who denied Christ when he became poor.
Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The virgin who sinned with many lovers.
The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
The man who was possessed by a spirit of epilepsy [nagargar] for 47 years.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
The brigands who killed each other at the miraculous spring.
A priest becomes insane after his entire family dies of the plague.
A stream runs uphill after his neighbor had diverted it.
The paralytic who was healed on the 16th of Nahase.
The church of Saint Mary that moved by itself to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea.
Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.
Some of the deceased great Fathers of the Desert appear to the monks of Scete.
An abbot in Scete sees first a multitude of demons, then a multitude of saints.
The conversion of a Muslim merchant who had been imprisoned in Naples.
The rich man from Colosse who was wounded in the eye while fighting the Qwez.
The woman from Cairo whose children all died.
The girl who was going to be stoned after she was caught committing fornication.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ወለት፡ ዘማዊት፡ ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ረከብዋ፡ እንዘ፡ ትዜሙ፡ በሥጋሃ፡ ወአኃዝዋ፡ ከመ፡ ይውግርዋ፡ በእብን

Canonical Story Title: The monastic community that was supplied with provisions by Saint Mary.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ረድኦሙ፡ ለቅዱሳን፡ ወየኀዝን፡ ለሲሳዮሙ፡ ለለ፡ ዕለቱ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ሶበ፡ ኀልቀ፡ ሲሳዮሙ፡ ለቅዱሳን፡ ወተንሥአ፡ ይስአላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to a monk and saves him from being deceived by Satan.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ሕሊናሁ፡ ወኢአበሰ፡ እምንእሱ፡ እስከ፡ ርስአኑ፡ ተመካሒ፡ በአምላኩ። ወዘንተ፡ ብሂሎ፡ ሰይጣን፡ መጽአ፡ ኀቤሁ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary gives a garment to a poor monk.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ነዳይ፡ ወአልቦቱ፡ አልባሰ፡ ወአራዘ፡ ወሲሳየ፡ ወይትአምና፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይቤለ፡ አዝዚ፡ ዘእለብስ፡ ወዘእበልዕ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary heals a poor man from skin disease whom people had refused to carry to church.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ በእንተ፡ አሐዱ፡ ነዳይ፡ ዘይጸውርዎ፡ በዓራት፡ ወኵለንታሁ፡ አበቅ፡ ወዝልጉስ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ፈተወ፡ ይንሣእ፡ ቍርባነ፡ አመ፡ ፲፡ ወ፮፡ ለነሐሴ

Canonical Story Title: The pious priest to whom Satan came for confession.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ካህን፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወይመጽኡ፡ ኀቤሁ፡ ኵሉ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወይትናዘዝዎ፡ ወይነሥእ፡ ዓስቦ፡ ዕጣነ፡ ንጹሐ፡ ወመሥዋዕተ፡ ወመባአ፡ በእንተ፡ ዘነጽሑ

Canonical Story Title: The king's washerman who was attacked by a lion.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ሕሊናሁ፡ ወየሐጽብ፡ ልብሶ፡ ለንጉሥ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ እንዘ፡ ያሐጽብ፡ ደኒኖ፡ ወመጽአ፡ አንበሳ፡ ወአኀዘ፡ ክሳዶ

Canonical Story Title: A young man whom his mother had vowed to the service of Saint Mary becomes impotent when his parents try to wed him.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ እስመ፡ መካን፡ ይእቲ፡ ወነበረት፡ ብዙኃ፡ መዋዕል፡ እንዘ፡ ትብል፡ ኀበ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ሀብኒ፡ ውሉደ

Canonical Story Title: The magistrate whom the king accused of embezzlement.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ ፈታሔ፡ በርትዕ፡ ወመፍቀሬ፡ በዓላተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ያበልዕ፡ ርኁባነ፡ ወያለብስ፡ ዕሩቃነ፡ ወያስተፌሥሕ፡ ነዳያነ፡ በበዓላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The couple that were guided by the wife's dream to find buried money with which to build a shrine to Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ነዳይ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይብል፡ ኦእመ፡ ብርሃን፡ እስእለኪ፡ ስምዒ፡ ስእለትየ። ወሀለየ፡ በልቡ፡ እንዘ፡ ይብል፡ ወያስተበፅዕ፡ ወይብል፡ መኑ፡ ይረድአኒ፡ ከመ፡ እሕንጽ፡ መርጡላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡….

Canonical Story Title: The hunter who caught a gassa kalb in his net.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ነዓዌ፡ አራዊት፡ ወይትአምና፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. እምሥርወ፡ ልቡ፡ በኵሉ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ገብረ፡ መሥገርተ፡ ወተእኅዘ፡ ገጸ፡ ከልብ

Canonical Story Title: A child and his mother see the icon of Saint Mary weeping for the sins of the world.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ ሕፃን፡ ንዑስ፡ ዘያፈቅር፡ ጸሎተ፡ እምንእሱ። ወይቤላ፡ ለእሙ፡ ኦእምየ፡ ንዒ፡ ንሖር፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ ጸሎት፡ ወንግበር፡ ንስቲተ፡ ጸሎተ

Canonical Story Title: The man who wanted to give a banquet on Saint Mary's feast but was unable because of a famine.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይገብር፡ ተዝካራ፡ በኵሉ፡ በዓላተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወበጽሐ፡ ዐባር፡ ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ በበዓለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. አልቦ፡ ዘይሁቦሙ፡ ኅብስተ፡ ወአጽዋዐ፡ ወኢምንተኒ

Canonical Story Title: The sinner whom Saint Mary healed after his relatives had spent all his money on physicians.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዓላዌ፡ ሕገ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወአልቦቱ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ። ወአሐተ፡ ዕለተ፡ ሖረ፡ ውስተ፡ ፍኖት፡ ወአኀዞ፡ ደዌ፡ ወኮነ፡ ድኩመ። ወይቤልዎ፡ አዝማዲሁ፡ ሀበነ፡ እምንዋይከ፡ ኀበ፡ ዐቃቤ፡ ሥራይ

Canonical Story Title: The pious abbot who was falsely accused by his monks of sinning with a woman.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ አበ፡ ምኔት፡ ወመፍቀሬ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወተሰለቅዎ፡ ወሐመይዎ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ቅዱሳን

Canonical Story Title: The thief who was caught stealing from the church of Saint Mary and was released by his captors when he prayed to her.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ በእንተ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ቀሳጤ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ኵሎ፡ አሚረ፡ ነበረ፡ እንዘ፡ ይቀስጥ፡ እኩየ፡ ልማዶ፡ ወይጸንሕዎ፡ ኵሉ፡ ሰብእ

Canonical Story Title: The fisherman who was eaten up by a dragon but was found alive when the dragon's belly was cut open.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ዓሥጋሬ፡ ዓሣ፡ ወኢይአምር፡ ካልአ፡ ግብረ፡ ወበውእቱ፡ ዓሣ፡ ይገብር፡ ተዝካራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወትረ፡ ለለ፡ ዓመት

Canonical Story Title: The monk whose only good work was observing the fast of Saint Mary.
A sinner is saved from damnation because he had built a shrine in the name of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ዘያፈድፍድ፡ ፍቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወሐነጸ፡ መርጡላ፡ ወያበውእ፡ ዕጣነ፡ ወምሥዋዕተ። ወኀጢአቱ፡ ፍድፉድ፡ ወፍዱል

Canonical Story Title: The hungry man whom Saint Mary used to feed.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ርኁብ፡ ዘያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይሳእላ፡ ለከርሡ፡ መብልአ፡ ወትረ፡ ወይእቲኒ፡ ትሁቦ፡ ኅብስተ፡ ሠናየ

Canonical Story Title: Christ, Nativity of cycle: A soldier redeems the Child Jesus from another soldier who was thinking of handing him over to King Herod.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ በእንተ፡ ወለት፡ ዘወለደት፡ በድንግልናሃ፡ እሳተ፡ መለኮት፡ በላዒ፡ አንበሳ፡ ግሩመ፡ በከርሣ፡ ዘጾረት፡ ዘኢለከፋ፡ ደነስ፡ ከናፍሪሃ

Canonical Story Title: The man who would not eat before receiving Holy Communion.
Thecla is taken to Alexandria to see her brother, Abba Esi, in a boat guided by the Archangels Gabriel and Sureyal.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The shepherd near the church of Saint Paul in Rome who was possessed by a demon.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
The bankrupt merchant to whom Satan offered two pearls if he would deny Christ and Saint Mary.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The Jewish cowherd who was baptized by his Christian companions.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The young man who was ready to serve Satan, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
A knight tries to seduce the wife of a friend, but she is saved by a vision.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation
The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
The composition of the Maṣḥafa ḥawi by Patriarch Gabriel Ibn Tarīk.
Yoḥannǝs finds a copy of the acts of Saints Juliana and Barbara that he had lost.
The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ዲያቆን፡ ዘይትአመና፡ ለማርያም፡ በጥቡዕ፡ ልብ፡ ወይበኪ፡ መዐልተ፡ ወሌሊተ፡ ወይብል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ አፍትን፡ ርእስየ፡ ለካህን፡ ኢትንእሠኒ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to an official who kidnapped a girl that had made a vow of virginity.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ድንግል፡ እንተ፡ በፅዓት፡ ድንግልናሃ፡ ለማርያም፡ ወትትአመን፡ ብዙኀ፡ ወትብል፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ አልብየ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወባሕቱ፡ ዕቀቢ፡ ድንግልናየ፡ ከመ፡ ኢይትኃፈር፡ በቅድሜኪ

Canonical Story Title: The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ በስመ፡ ማርያም፡ ወህየ፡ ሀሎ፡ ሥዕለ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘሥዑል፡ በልብስ። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘሠናይ፡ ግዕዙ፡ ወይትአመና፡ ለማርያም፡ በጥቡዕ፡ ልብ፡ ወይነሥእ፡ ፶፡ ጽጌ፡ ረዳ

Canonical Story Title: The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ በስመ፡ ማርያም፡ ወህየ፡ ሀሎ፡ ሥዕለ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘሥዑል፡ በልብስ። ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘሠናይ፡ ግዕዙ፡ ወይትአመና፡ ለማርያም፡ በጥቡዕ፡ ልብ፡ ወይነሥእ፡ ፶፡ ጽጌ፡ ረዳ

Canonical Story Title: The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ሠናይት፡ ዘትነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡…. ወታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ልባ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ክሂሎታ፡ ወኮነት፡ ታስተበፅዓ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወትቤላ፡ ብፁዕ፡ አንቲ፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ ማሪሃም። እፎ፡ ወለድኪዮ፡ ለወልድኪ፡ ዋሕድ፡ ቃለ፡ እግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወሬዛ፡ ዘሠናይ፡ አርአያሁ፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወይትለአካ፡ በኵሉ፡ ክሂሎቱ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀለወ፡ ውስተ፡ ዓለም፡ እምቅድመ፡ ይመንኵስ። ወእምዝ፡ ሖረ፡ ውስተ፡ ደብር፡ አመከረ፡ ርእሶ፡ አሐተ፡ ዓመተ

Canonical Story Title: The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መስፍን፡ በውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ዘሠናይ፡ ግዕዙ፡ ወያፈቅሮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ክሂሎቱ፡ ወበእንተዝ፡ ጸገዎ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዐቢየ፡ ጸጋ፡ ወወሀቦ፡ ሠናያተ፡ ብዙኃተ። ወቀንኡ፡ ላዕሌሁ፡ እኩያን፡ ሰብእ፡ ወሖሩ፡ ኀበ፡ ንጉሥ

Canonical Story Title: The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ እመ፡ ምኔት፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ደብር፡ እምነ፡ አድባራት፡ ወሀለዋ፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ደብር፡ ብዙኃን፡ ደናግል፡ ወይትኤዘዛ፡ ላቲ። ወኮነት፡ ይእቲ፡ እመ፡ ምኔት፡ ዘሠናይ፡ ግዕዛ

Canonical Story Title: A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ደሴት፡ መንገለ፡ ባሕረ፡ ኢያሪኮ፡ ወሀለዋ፡ ህየ፡ ብዙኃት፡ መነኮሳይያት። ወእምኔሆን፡ አሐቲ፡ መበለት፡ ፈራሂተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወትትቀነይ፡ ለቤተ፡ ክርስቲያነ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወትትለአክ፡ በእንተ፡ ምጽዋት፡ ወቍርባን፡ ወወይን፡ ወዕጣን፡ ወጽንሓሕ

Canonical Story Title: The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ እፍልንድር፡ ወኮነ፡ ይፈቅድ፡ ከመ፡ ይኩን፡ ሎቱ፡ መዐረ፡ ወስምዓ፡ ብዙኃ፡ ፈድፋደ፡ እምኵሉ፡ አግዋሪሁ

Canonical Story Title: The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ውስተ፡ ደብር፡ እምነ፡ አድባራተ፡ እስክንድርያ፡ ወኮነ፡ ያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወሶበ፡ ይዜክሩ፡ ስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወኮነ፡ ይገርር፡ ላቲ፡ ወከማሁ፡ ውእቱኒ፡ ሶበ፡ ይዜክር፡ ስማ፡ ኮነ፡ ይደንን፡ በገጹ

Canonical Story Title: The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መነኮስ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐዱ፡ ደብር፡ እምነ፡ አድባራት፡ ወኮነ፡ ያፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወይትለአካ፡ በኵሉ፡ ክሂሎቱ፡ ወያስተጣዕም፡ ጸሎታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወሶበ፡ ይዜክር፡ ስማ፡ ይትፌሣሕ፡ ወይትሐሠይ። ወኮነ፡ ውእቱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ጸሐፌ፡ መጻሕፍት፡ ዘደብር

Canonical Story Title: The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮሜ፡ ወኮነ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሠናየ፡ ወጻድቀ፡ ወይፈርሆ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ልዑል፡ ወየዐቅብ፡ ነፍሶ፡ እምኵሉ፡ ሕሊናት፡ ርኩሳት

Canonical Story Title: A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ሠናይት፡ ፈራሂተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወታፈቅራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. በኵሉ፡ ልባ። ወአስተዋደይዋ፡ ሰብእ፡ እኩያን፡ ለይእቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ኀበ፡ ብልካርያ፡ ንግሥት፡ ርኩስት፡ ወአምቅሕዋ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ሞቅሕ

Canonical Story Title: The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ኃጥእት፡ ወትገብር፡ ኃጢአተ፡ በኵሉ፡ ጊዜ። ወኮነ፡ ትትመነደብ፡ በገቢረ፡ ኃጢአተ፡ እስመ፡ ይእቲ፡ ኮነት፡ ትኔስሕ፡ ወትትመየጥ፡ ውስተ፡ ገቢረ፡ ኃጢአት

Canonical Story Title: The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
Incipit: ወሀለወ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ጠቢብ፡ ወመነኮስ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐዱ፡ ደብር፡ ወፈተወ፡ ከመ፡ ይንብር፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ደብር፡ ወይሜግብ፡ ነፍሶ፡ በጥበበ፡ ዚአሁ። ወተሐረመ፡ ከመ፡ ኢይብላዕ፡ እምመባልዕት፡ ዘይበልዑ፡ መነኮሳት

Canonical Story Title: The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ በእንተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ከመ፡ ይእቲ፡ በፅዓት፡ ነፍሳ፡ ከመ፡ ትጹም፡ ጾመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወሶበ፡ ጾመት፡ አእመረ፡ ምታ፡ ከመ፡ ይእቲ፡ ትጸውም፡ ሐዘነ፡ ላዕሌሃ፡ ወከልኣ፡ እምጾም

Canonical Story Title: The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ክብርት፡ እምዘመደ፡ ክቡራን፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ በጽንፈ፡ ባሕር፡ ዘየዐቢ፡ ወዘመዳ፡ ለይእቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ይከብሩ፡ እምሰብአ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ወባቲ፡ ምታ፡ እምክቡራነ፡ ሰብእ፡ ወሊቃውንት፡ ዐበይት

Canonical Story Title: The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀለወ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ባዕል፡ ዘቦቱ፡ ብእሲተ፡ ክብርተ፡ ወሠናይተ፡ ወበጽሑ፡ ክልኤሆሙ፡ እስከ፡ ርሥእና፡ ተካየዱ፡ በበይናቲሆሙ፡ ከመ፡ ይዕቀቡ፡ ሥጋሆሙ፡ በንጽሕና

Canonical Story Title: The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ በውስተ፡ ሀገረ፡ ቍስጥንጥንያ፡ ብእሲ፡ ባዕል፡ ወኮነ፡ ሎቱ፡ ዐርካ፡ ክቡር፡ መስፍን፡ እምዐበይተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ደብር፡ ወኮነ፡ ይትለአካ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. መስተምሕርት፡ ወመስተሣህልት፡ ወያፈቅራ፡ በኵሉ፡ ልቡ። ወበአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ እምዕለታት፡ ሰትየ፡ ውእቱ፡ መነኮስ፡ ወይነ፡ ወሰክረ

Canonical Story Title: A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡፡ ከመ፡፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መስተቃሕው፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ ወበአሐቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ተቀሐወ፡ ምስለ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወተመውአ፡ ውእቱ፡ አይሁዳዊ፡ ወፈደየ፡ ንዋየ፡ ብዙኃ፡ ለውእቱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘተቀሐወ፡ ምስሌሁ

Canonical Story Title: The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The pious rich man whom Satan served in hopes of destroying him.
The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The two brothers from Rome, Peter, a deacon, and Stephen, an avaricious magistrate.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a rich sinner who had repented and was planning to build a monastery and become a monk.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ፈረሳዊ፡ ክቡር፡ ወባዕል፡ ዘቦቱ፡ ንዋያተ፡ ወአእጻዳተ፡ ወኢይገብር፡ ወኢምንተኒ፡ እምሠናያት፡ ወኮነ፡ ይጸልእ፡ አብያተ፡ ክርስቲያናት፡ ወነዳያነ፡ ወምስኪናነ፡ ወያፈቅር፡ ተውኔተ፡ ወማኅሌተ፡ ወትፍግዕተ

Canonical Story Title: Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The avaricious priest who visited a dying man who loved bribes.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወኮነ፡ ሥሡዐ፡ ወመፍቀሬ፡ ንዋይ፡ ወጽኑሰ፡ ወኢይገብር፡ ሠናየ። ወሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ብእሲ፡ ባዕል፡ ዘይሁብ፡ ንዋዮ፡ በርዳ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary appears to Theocleia and prepares her for martyrdom.
The icon of Saint Mary in the church of the "Romans" that rebuked the Ethiopians for approaching with their shoes on.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family uses stones instead of a boat to cross the Nile.
Synaxary entry for the 16th of Yakkatit: Saint Mary receives the Pact of Mercy (kidan mehret).
The Annunciation.
The Ethiopian pilgrim who was expelled from the Church (of the Resurrection) in Jerusalem during the Easter services.
The rich man who left the church because the priest was saying the Anaphora of Saint Mary, Gwasca, on a big feast day.
The rich persons who stored their wealth in a church.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The general of King (Dawit) of Ethiopia who defected to the enemy.
The icon of Saint Mary in the church of the "Romans" that rebuked the Ethiopians for approaching with their shoes on.
The Ethiopian pilgrim who was expelled from the Church (of the Resurrection) in Jerusalem during the Easter services.
The rich man who left the church because the priest was saying the Anaphora of Saint Mary, Gwasca, on a big feast day.
The rich persons who stored their wealth in a church.
The man who lost a slave that he was about to sell in Barara.
The monasteries summon King (Dawit) of Ethiopia to abdicate.
The carpenter who asked for a copy of the Gadla samaˁtat as a reward for his services in building a church.
Saint Mary appears to a priest of Däbrä Maryam in Sire.
The pilgrim who was journeying to Jerusalem through Hamda.
The icon of Saint Mary in a church of Alexandria that some Europeans tried to steal.
The punishment of a custodian of a church who did not obey the bishop.
The pious monk who drowned while crossing a river on his way to a feast that was being given by a rich man in honor of the Assumption.
The blind teacher whom his pupils wanted to push over a cliff while they were on their way to a feast being given in honor of the Assumption.
Saint Mary appears to Theocleia and prepares her for martyrdom.
The abbot who rejected the horologium and other works of Abba Giyorgis.
Saint Mary cuts short her visit to a pious monk when she hears her name invoked according to the horologium of Abba Giyorgis.
The three pious priests and monks who wore fine clothes.
The Muslims who stole the furnishings of a church of Saint Mary located near the western boundary of Ethiopia and were struck by lightning.
The punishment of an Ethiopian woman who swore falsely that she had not committed adultery with another woman's husband.
The monk who was expelled from school when he could not pay his teacher.
The new tabot of Saint Mary that was found outside the box in which it had been placed.
A monk, while guarding a church, has a nocturnal emission and finds himself suddenly outside the courtyard of the church.
An angel drives away the custodian of a church of Saint Mary when he was about to enter after sinning with a woman.
The Ethiopian general who went off to fight the Muslims without the consent of the king.
The two retainers of a pious ruler who swore not to fight with one another.
A monk obtains from Saint Mary food for a visitor.
The king who ordered his retainers to bury him in the church of Saint Mary that he had built.
The man who out of jealousy burned down the house of a former wife who had abandoned him.
The man who suspected a former wife of having burned down his house.
The thieves who stole the furnishings of a church of Saint Mary and refused to restore them when she appeared to them.
The man who borrowed for a wedding a silken garment from the church of Saint Mary.
The Muslim who was unable to open the church he was intending to plunder.
A goat comes miraculously to be slaughtered.
The robbers who took from a monk his clothes and the cover of an icon of Saint Mary that he was carrying.
A young monk is horrified when he has a sexual dream.
When a couple tries to marry their son whom they had dedicated to Saint Mary, he falls sick to the point of death.
The monk from a monstery on an island who could not find his boat when he wanted to return.
Saint Alexius lives for fifteen years near a church of Saint Mary in Armenia.
The history of Abba Bula/Abib.
The king who invited Abba Abreham to come and discuss spiritual matters.
A bishop asks a man for the prayer that saved him from Satan.
The dogs of the hunter praise Saint Mary.
Sara from Mesot, who became insane and went about naked.
The Annunciation.
Saint Mary is found to be pregnant.
Holy Family journey cycle: The hunter who discovered the Holy Family in flight is turned into a dog when he violates his oath not to reveal them.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family visits the king of the Semites.
Holy Family journey cycle: The Holy Family uses stones instead of a boat to cross the Nile.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The nativity of Christ
The milk of Saint Mary that was poured on the ground in Egypt.
Tiras, who did not observe holy days, becomes deaf and dumb, but he is healed when his master prays to Saint Mary.
Saint Mary makes a covenant with King Dawit of Ethiopia.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
The sinful woman who despaired when she kept on sinning and swallowed a scorpion.
The woman who was prevented from fasting by her husband.
The prudent monk who suspected that the food that the monks were eating was harmful, but then saw Saint Mary making it tasty for them.
The noblewoman who was persuaded by her spiritual father to give away her fine clothes.
The rich merchant from Constantinople who lost all his money and made the icon of Saint Mary his guarantor when he borrowed money from a usurer.
Saint Mary saves from a lion a pious monk who had drunk too much wine.
The husband who broke his vow that he would live celibately with his wife.
The merchant who distributed as alms the money that had been loaned him by a friend.
The two brothers from Rome, Peter, a deacon, and Stephen, an avaricious magistrate.
Saint Mary saves the soul of a rich sinner who had repented and was planning to build a monastery and become a monk.
Pachomius, the avaricious patriarch of Rome, who sold the chrism of the church.
The avaricious priest who visited a dying man who loved bribes.
The nun who was dissuaded from eloping with a knight by a vision of Hell.
The shepherd near the church of Saint Paul in Rome who was possessed by a demon.
The monk who has carried by the bretheren to church when he became too sick to walk.
The rich knight who was advised by an abbot to pray to Saint Mary to win the heart of the woman with whom he was in love.
The monk custodian of the church who prayed to see Saint Mary.
The bankrupt merchant to whom Satan offered two pearls if he would deny Christ and Saint Mary.
A herdsman saves his beasts in a storm by praying to Saint Mary.
The pious mower of hay to whom the gatekeeper gave his daughter in marriage.
The rich woman who went with the monks to the manbalis for prayer and there saw a vision of Saint Mary.
The peasant who complained to Saint Mary because she did not reply to his Hail Mary.
The Muslim whom Saint Mary told to receive baptism. Later, as Bishop of Rome, he cut off his hand because of a carnal thought.
The Jewish cowherd who was baptized by his Christian companions.
The mighty Goliath threatens to destroy the monastery of Saint Mary.
The Muslim who found an icon of Saint Mary in his house.
The only son of a king who dedicated himself to Saint Mary.
The young man who was ready to serve Satan, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
A knight tries to seduce the wife of a friend, but she is saved by a vision.
The pious rich man whom Satan served in hopes of destroying him.
The peasant who became rich from other people's goods.
The hypocritical superior of a monastery who pretended to be religious.
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): Satan urges Herod to pursue the Holy Family.
The Jew of Constantinople who threw an icon of Saint Mary into the latrine.
The woman from Rome who killed the baby she bore after sleeping with her son
The monk who got himself appointed abbot of another monastery by the king, without the consent of the monks.
The young man who offered the ring he had received from his girlfriend to the icon of Saint Mary.
A ship that was about to founder is saved when they pray to Saint Mary.
The Jew who attacked the icon of Saint Mary when he failed to obtain by litigation someone else's property.
The knight who denied Christ at the bidding of Satan, in order to have fine clothes for a reception, but refused to deny Saint Mary.
The monk who was custodian of a church near a river and drowned while trying to cross to visit his lover.
The nun who used to pray for the dead, but lost her virginity and died before completing her penance.
The nun whom Saint Mary admonished to recite the Hail Mary more attentively.
The monk who saved the church of Saint Mary in Atrib by his prayers when its destruction had been ordered by the Caliph.
Abba Mardari, who overheard twelve angels talking about going to Constantinople to hear Saint John Chrysostom praise Saint Mary.
The wealthy man to whom Saint Mary appeared in the form of a bird to save the countryside from pestilence.
Thecla is taken to Alexandria to see her brother, Abba Esi, in a boat guided by the Archangels Gabriel and Sureyal.
Saint Mary incenses Thecla (continuation).
Abba Esi and Thecla are saved from the torture ordered by the judge (continuation of the preceding).
Saint Paul is taken to the third heaven and there sees Saint Mary.
Abba Behor has a vision of Saint Mary.
The vision of Gregory the Seer [ra'eya hebu'at].
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family returns from Egypt.
Saint Mary appears to Sawla, the wife of the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis.
The history ot Däbrä Mahew near Jerusalem and its miraculous spring.
The story of Awr, the son of the princess and the magician, Abrasit.
Saint Mary cures the son of a Roman official in Bethlehem.
Saint Mary heals a woman possessed by evil spirits.
An Egyptian woman comes to Saint Mary in Bethlehem and is healed of her fever.
A woman whose right eye had been blinded by a demon is healed by Saint Mary.
Saint Mary appears to Timothy, Patriarch of Alexandria, in the church of Saint Pachomius in Alexandria.
Saint Mary appears to Anthony, a monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Saint Mary appears to Anthony of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam (continued).
Saint Mary anoints sick animals and heals them at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Message of Saint Mary to Anthony, monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Anthony, the monk of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam, asks about the anointing of the animals.
The blessing given to the animals at Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam by the anointing of Saint Mary.
The priest who left the keys of the church locked up inside.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The life of Saint Mary to the birth of Christ.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The flight into Egypt.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family receives hospitality from a shepherd.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family crosses the Nile at Asmunayn.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Christ Child grants Saint Mary a vision of his future glory.
Saint Mary gives a thirsty dog water to drink from her shoe.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): Ahrufas, the guardian angel of Egypt, comes to the Holy Family.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The experience of the Holy Family in the district of Asmunayn.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family encounters thieves.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The Holy Family arrives at Däbrä QWesqWam.
Saint Peter gives Saint John Chrysostom the keys of the kingdom and Saint John the Evangelist gives him the Gospels; then Saint Mary appears to him.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews try to burn down the house where Saint Mary is staying but are burned up instead.
The Holy Spirit recounts the salvific events that have occurred on Sunday.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays with the disciples.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays with the disciples (continuation).
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays for the release of the souls in judgment.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees a vision of Saint Mary in glory.
Deacon Michael, the grocer and the ring that was found in the fish.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ celebrates Mass for Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary asks Christ that the disciples preach her Transitus and Assumption.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary asks that Saint John be allowed to visit her dwelling place.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Prochorus reports Saint John's visit to Saint Mary's dwelling place.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary prays to be taken from this life.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: The Jews go to Bethlehem to seize Saint Mary but are blinded.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Christ, together with Saint Mary and the angels, appears to the Apostles and asks them to build churches in his name and hers throughout the world.
Christ makes Saint Peter head of the Church.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary, together with Saints Irene and Sophia, appears to Saint Basil and tells him where her icon is buried.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil finds the buried icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary tells Saint Basil to take two pillars from a pagan temple.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Mary sets up the pillars in the church and makes a miraculous spring flow out at their base.
Salome's hands are burned when she tries to verify Saint Mary's virginity, but they are healed when she takes the Christ Child into her arms.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint John the Evangelist sees Christ kissing Saint Mary's burial cloth.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Three virgins come to serve Saint Mary as she is about to give birth.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Saint Mary's soul descends from heaven in a tent of light.
Saint John Chrysostom defends a woman whom Nestorius had told the people to spit upon.
A woman who had poisoned her sister and married her husband is swallowed up by the earth when she anoints herself with the oil that flowed from Saint Mary's icon.
Saint Mary rescues the ship in which Mar Barsuma is travelling.
Saint Mary appears to the disciples of Mar Barsuma in the form of a dove.
Saint Mary appears to Saints Atrasis and Yona, virgins and martyrs.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Sarabamon, the future bishop of Nikiou and martyr.
The events that occurred during the captivity of Abbots Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon and John of Scete.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Nicholas and gives him priestly vestments.
Saint Mary appears to the brother of Saint Basil, Saint Gregory, bishop of "the Islands" (i.e. of Nyassa).
Saint Mary appears to Saint Paphnutius.
Saint Mary raises Andrew, a disciple of Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon, from the dead.
Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon instructs his disciples on his deathbed.
A nun in prison for her faith prays for two virgins.
Saint Mary appears to Saint Theodore the Anatolian.
The fate of the monk, Giyorgis, who followed the teachings of Za-Mika'el.
The vision of a certain saint about the fate of a priest who swore falsely.
Abbas sees a vision of Saint Mary blessing the monks who were chanting the Psalms.
The inhabitants of Damot who would not observe the feast days of Saint Mary are punished by a storm that brings down a mighty tree.
The Frenchman whose wife was unable to have children.
The judgment of the court of Zärˀa Yaˁəqob against the Stephanites.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Synaxary entry for 16 Nahase: The Apostles visit Saint Mary in heaven.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: Anonymous homily against the report that the Apostles abandoned the body of Saint Mary when they were attacked by the Jews during her funeral procession.
A Christian community is attacked by a neighboring Muslim community.
A renegade monk who had become a Jew is hunted down by the troops of the king.
A Jew is led to baptism by a dream about a lion and a monk; afterwards he curses a Jew at the latter's request.
The Magicians who tried to cast a spell on the Epiphany water.
The birth of the prince, Batergela Maryam.
Batergela Maryam is accused of treason and is imprisoned.
Batergela Maryam is protected from the plague; his calumniator is punished by the king.
When the destruction of Däbrä Metmaq is reported in Ethiopia, the king orders the construction of a new monastery to take its place.
When Satan destroys the oven of a monastery, he is compelled to serve the monks for twelve years in punishment.
Saint Mary shows those assembled at Däbrä Metmaq a vision of Mohammad in Hell.
The daughter of the rich man from Caesarea who could not deliver her baby.
The five sorrows of Saint Mary.
The sinner whom Saint Mary healed after his relatives had spent all his money on physicians.
Saint Mary gives a garment to a poor monk.
During the famine of 1120 MM [likely 1404 CE], the Arabs try to plunder the monasteries of Egypt.
The monk of Däbrä Qaləmon who did not fast.
The monks of Däbrä Qaləmon who were despoiled by Berbers.
An Arab steals the scissors of the tailor of Däbrä Qaləmon.
Qommos Raphael from Däbrä ʾƎnṣǝnā and the sacrament of confession.
An Arab who has contempt for Saint Mary’s icon at Däbrä Qaləmon is punished.
The composition of the Maṣḥafa ḥawi by Patriarch Gabriel Ibn Tarīk.
The composition of the Miracles of Mary by Bishop Hildephonsus of Toledo.
The composition of the Wǝddāse Maryam by the Syrian potter.
Amnut, the custodian of a church in Egypt, quarrels with his bishop.
Three Arabs who were journeying to the Rif on the Nile in Egypt.
Nəkʷal, the deacon from Margawkim, who spent his master’s money on the poor.
The priest from Nārdin who was accused because he kept a nun in his house.
The monk, Yǝsḥaq, who prayed for seven years that Saint Mary would appear to him.
The Arab woman who suffered from an issue of blood for many years.
Yoḥannǝs finds a copy of the acts of Saints Juliana and Barbara that he had lost.
The lamp before the icon of Saint Mary that the priest tipped over.
The two blessed monks, Sadaqā and ʾƎstifānos, from the monastery of Saint Victor.
The Christians gathered for a feast of Saint Mary are saved from the Arabs.
ʾƎmma Yoḥannǝs and the Ethiopian monk who was on pilgrimage to Jerusalem.
The European who wanted to steal the bars of the door to the Manger at Bethlehem.
Maryam from Dǝfrā, a child who wanted to receive Communion but was shut up in the house when her family went to church.
The lamp of the Christian from Mǝneta Diyāqon that was blown out by the wind.
The wife of Joseph from Mǝneta Diyāqon, who had no male children.
The poor man from Aragon [Spain] who was buried alive in a gold mine.
The cupbearer of the king of France.
The husband who denied Christ when he became poor.
The French artist who fell from the scaffolding while painting frescoes.
The devout Muslim who became a Christian when Saint Mary appeared to him.
The apparitions of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq.
The untrustworthy camel driver of Däbrä Metmaq.
Yeshaq, prior of Däbrä Metmaq, who fled to Scete, Egypt, to escape the burden of his office.
The son of the Muslim ruler of Egypt blasphemes the icon of Saint Mary.
Eulogius, the stonemason of Scete, Egypt, who used to give hospitality to strangers.
The miraculous spring of Mehzab.
A woman whose right eye had been blinded by a demon is healed by Saint Mary.
The old woman from Sembat who gave the offering for Saint Mary to Saint George.
The church built on the tomb of Saint Mary that will turn into a ship.
The story of the blind priest, Yohannes Bakansi.
The priest, Rizqallah, recovers things stolen from pilgrims.
The church of Saint Mary that moved by itself to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea.
The conversion of a Muslim merchant who had been imprisoned in Naples.
The rich man from Colosse who was wounded in the eye while fighting the Qwez.
Saint Mary appears during Mass in the church at Meneta Sard.
Abba Samuˀel of Däbrä Qaləmon intercedes for an angel who had disobeyed the command of God.
Mary, Pregnancy of cycle: Three virgins come to serve Saint Mary as she is about to give birth.
Bishop Michael sends Deacon John to help the monks of Däbrä Metmaq celebrate Passion Week.
The cistern at Däbrä Metmaq is filled miraculously.
Saint Mary carries a dying monk to Jerusalem.
Some of the deceased great Fathers of the Desert appear to the monks of Scete.
An abbot in Scete sees first a multitude of demons, then a multitude of saints.
The widow who could not find husbands for her three daughters.
The story of the martyr, Saint Victor, and his mother, Martha.
Elizabeth, the blind daughter of Abraham and Gera Anest of Baderman.
The Arab woman who entrusted her jewels to a Christian for safekeeping.
The two brothers who copied the Miracles of Mary and fell into the doing of a sin.
The abbot who did not allow the Miracles of Mary to be read in his monastery.
A man killed during the construction of the church of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam is raised from the dead.
The story of the sorcerers Taludar, who was possessed by a demon.
The vinedresser of Manfalut who gave his earnings to the builders of Däbrä Qʷəsqʷam.
Saint Mary appears as a winged maiden to John, a monk of Saint Macarius.
The infidel who stole the lumber from the church at Däbrä QwesqWam.
Saint Mary appears to the martyr, Giyorgis Haddis, in prison.
Mareqos, King of Romeya, abandons his throne secretly to become a monk.
The people of Romeya appeal to Patriarch Dionysius to find King Mareqos.
When Sefengeya, wife of King Masfeyanos of Romeya, prays to have a child before the icon of Saint Mary, the icon inclines its head; Sefengeya then conceives Yeshaq (Abba Garima).
Entawos, a pagan from Qarays, becomes a Christian after being struck by miraculous arrows.
A man who speaks blasphemously of Saint Mary has his arms and legs cut off.
The wife of a pagan official who wished to pray at the Holy Sepulcher is prevented until she is baptized.
The son of Emperor Tiberius is raised from the dead.
John the Evangelist paints an icon of the Crucifixion for Emperor Tiberius.
Petros Bawares has a vision of the Trinity.
The conversion of the Muslim, Rewh, who is renamed Entons Haddis.
The wife of Mark, a priest from Mallawi, is cured of her leprosy.
The monks of Saint Anthony celebrate Holy Week at Däbrä QWesqWam.
A Muslim, Katib, tries to extort money from the monks of Saint Anthony.
Katir, the old priest from Elkesus, who was about to be dismissed from the church.
The story of the two brothers from Dalga who were dyers.
Homily of John Chrysostom on the visit of Saint Mary and her Son to John the Baptist.
The story of Pifamon, the martyr from Awsim.
The story of John, the martyr from Senhut.
The Jews plot to burn the body of Saint Mary.
A Roman official is prevented from approaching the Holy Sepulcher.
Emperor Zeno builds churches in Scete.
A priest is warned by an angel not to rush when incensing the icon of Saint Mary.
Saint Mary blesses Scete, which Saint Macarius chooses for his monastery.
The story of Michael, the scribe who converted to Islam when he was beaten.
The story of the Muslim who lived near the churches of Saints Mark and Shenute.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ተንባላታይ፡ እምዘመደ፡ ተንባላት፡ በሀገረ፡ ምስር፡ በጎረ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ወቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ አባ፡ ሲኖዳ

Canonical Story Title: A hermit in Jerusalem is saved from the temptations of Satan.
A monk, Abraham, drinks poisonous water while on a journey to visit the patriarch and dies, but is then raised from the dead.
The story of Absadi, gardener of the monastery of St. Shenute, who used to give away vegetables from the garden.
The wrath of Saint Mary against the prefect of a church who tried to stop the priests from making a procession while singing hymns to her.
Saint Basil cycle: The proud men who wanted to have a splendid icon of Saint Mary made.
Mary, Nativity of cycle: Saint Mary heals the daughter of Arsaban while still in the womb of Saint Anne.
Mary, Conception of cycle: The descent of the holy seed from Adam to Saint Mary.
The stone-footed man (i. e., a man with gout) from France.
The daughter of the chief of the thieves is cured of her leprosy at the miraculous spring.
Incipit: ወኮነ፡ እንከ፡ እምድኅረ፡ ወለደቶ፡ ለፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀለወት፡ ምድረ፡ ቤተ፡ ልሔም፡ ወአዘዘ፡ ሄሮድስ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ከመ፡ ይቅትሉ፡ ኵሎ፡ ተባዕተ፡ ሕፃናተ

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary saves the soul of a thief who was slain by the miraculous spring.
Homily on the miracles of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ ማኅበረ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ እለ፡ መጻእክሙ፡ ከመ፡ ትስምዑ፡ ጣዕመ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለድንግል። ወእምድኅረ፡ ልደታ፡ በ፫፡ ዓመት፡ አብእዋ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ፡ ወበህየ፡ ነበረት፡ ፲ወ፪፡ ዓመት

Canonical Story Title: Bishop Mercurius, whom the patriarch wanted to remove because of leprosy.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ፩፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ዘካርያስ። ወበ፩፡ ዕለት፡ መጽአ፡ ኀቤሁ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ መርቆሬዎስ፡ ኵሉ፡ ሥጋሁ፡ ዘኮነ፡ ለምፀ

Canonical Story Title: The persecution of the Christians during the patriarchate of Cosmas II.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ ፩፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘሀገረ፡ እስክንድርያ፡ ዘስሙ፡ ቆዝሞስ፡ ውእቱ፡ አብ፡ ቅዱስ፡ እምኍልቈ፡ ሊቃነ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ፶ወ፬። ወለዝንቱ፡ ቅዱስ፡ በጽሐ፡ ላዕሌሁ፡ ኀዘን፡ ብዙኅ

Canonical Story Title: The withered olive tree at the gate of the church in Endules.
The rich man who threw dry bread to a beggar in the name of Saint Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ባዕል፡ ጥቀ፡ ወይገብር፡ ተዝካራ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወይትቄረብ፡ ቍርባነ፡ በበዓላ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወአልቦ፡ ካልዕ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ፡ ወኢበውሂበ፡ ምጽዋት፡ ወኢበኂሩት፡ ወኢምንተኒ፡ ምግባረ፡ ሠናይ

Canonical Story Title: The story of the penitent harlot, Mary of Egypt.
Patriarch Abraham and the interpretation of the parable of the mustard seed.
The daughter of the rich man from Caesarea who could not deliver her baby.
Emperor Arcadius and the golden statue of Saint Mary; he asks Saint John Chrysostom to expound on Matthew 1: 25.
The woman from Cairo who lived by the river and whose daughter became blind.
A poor woman with a broken leg is healed by the icon of Saint Mary in the church of Harat ar-Rum.
The virgin who sinned with many lovers.
The brigands who killed each other at the miraculous spring.
The son of a rich official of Cappadocia is raised from the dead.
The beggar at the church of Qirqos in Amhara from whose head a horn grew.
The Apostles gather for the funeral of Saint Mary.
The merchant from Senfewat who struck the icon of Saint Mary.
Mary, Assumption of cycle: When Tafoneya lays hands on the bier of Saint Mary, an angel cuts his arms off.
The reopening of the church in Harat Zuwayla.
The healing of the Egyptian King Soforon (or Safron).
Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria.
The miracle concerning the golden ink during the reign of King Dawit.
The chastisement of the heretic, Nestorius.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the rich man who refused to give him a tablet [saleda] for an icon of Saint Mary.
The story of the cannibal from Qemer.
The man who was possessed by a spirit of epilepsy [nagargar] for 47 years.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the Jewish merchant of Caesarea who stole a golden plate from the church, but later became a Christian.
The miraculous spring of Mehzab.
The story of Saint Menas and his brother.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ በሀገረ፡ ነቂዮስ፡ ወስሙ፡ አውዳክስዮስ፡ ወቦቱ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወልደ፡ ዘይሰመይ፡ ሚናስ

Canonical Story Title: The election of Patriarch Matthew I.
The story of Saint Alexius [Abdo l a-Masih], son of Emperor Theodosius.
The faded icon of Saint Mary that the mother-in-law wanted to discard.
The woman from Cairo whose children all died.
Holy Family journey cycle: The places in Egypt visited by the Holy Family.
The nominal Christian from Sidon who encountered a dragon.
The sinful deacon who was healed by a drop of Saint Mary's milk.
The thief whom the king's soldiers could not kill.
The Emperor of Rome who erected an altar in his palace.
Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.
The repentant knight who could pray only the Hail Mary.
The sinful deacon whom his enemies could not kill until he had confessed himself to a priest.
The bishop for whom Saint Mary tailored a new sackcloth sends a penitent to Santiago.
The deacon's prayer that contained five times "Rejoice!" [tafassehiyat].
Alexander, a Jew from Jerusalem, is delivered three days after he was swallowed up by a dragon.
The pilgrim to Santiago whom Satan persuaded to mutilate himself after falling into a sexual sin.
The priest who could only say the Mass of the Virgin Mary.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ካህን፡ ቀሲስ፡ በሀገረ፡ ቂሳርያ፡ ዘስሙ፡ እንድርያስ፡ ወሀሎ፡ በህየ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘተሐንጸ፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ወብዙኅ፡ ሰብእ፡ ካህናት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ ይትጋብኡ፡ ውስቴታ፡ ወይነግሩ፡ በእንተ፡ ዕበየ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ዘትገብር፡ እስመ፡ ውእቱ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ዘስሙ፡ እንድርያስ፡ ኢየአምር፡ ካልአ፡ ቅዳሴ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ቅዳሴሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም

Canonical Story Title: The Jewish boy who received Holy Communion with his Christian companions.
The pregnant woman who was caught by the tide while going to the church of Saint Michael (Mont Saint Michel)
A man who drowned when a pilgrim ship sank is resuscitated.
The divorced wife who prayed for revenge against her rival.
The woman from Rome whose daughter rose up on the anniversary of her death.
The widow who prayed to Saint Mary and saved her only son from death by hanging.
The young man who used to bring roses to the icon of Saint Mary.
The two women who were attacked by robbers on their way to church.
The sister of Emperor Constantine who prayed to know how Saint Mary bore the Word of God, but then failed to recognize her Son when he appeared to her in church.
The young novice whom Saint Mary encouraged to persevere in his vocation
The pious official who was accused of embezzlement and of having an affair with the wife of his lord.
The prioress who became pregnant after sinning with a servant.
A nun sacristan elopes with a priest, but afterwards they repent.
The bee keeper who consulted a sorceress to have more honey.
The pious monk (or: the Jew from Akhmim) whom Saint Mary made young.
The pious monk scribe who used to write Saint Mary's name in golden ink.
Emperor Arcadius and the golden statue of Saint Mary; he asks Saint John Chrysostom to expound on Matthew 1: 25.
A thief is hanged upside down with the objects he stole from the church of Saint Mary in Sebkahad.
The priest from Cyprus who brought a particle of the Eucharist to a Jew.
The conversion of the Muslim, Rewh, who is renamed Entons Haddis.
Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the Jewish merchant of Caesarea who stole a golden plate from the church, but later became a Christian.
The election of Patriarch Matthew I.
Saint Mary is found to be pregnant.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob and the invasion of Badlay.
The Stephanites in Egypt and Palestine.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ ዘኮነ፡ ተአምረ፡ ዐቢየ፡ በደወለ፡ ግብጽ፡ በመዋዕሊሁ፡ ለናዖድ፡ መሢሐ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ንጉሠ፡ ኢትዮጵያ። ወሀለዉ፡ መነኮሳት፡ እምደቂቀ፡ እስጢፋ፡ ርኩስ፡ እለ፡ ወረዱ፡ እምኢየሩሳሌም፡ እምኢትዮጵያ። ወሶበ፡ በጽሑ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም፡ ፈቀዱ፡ ይባኡ፡ ኀበ፡ መቃብሩ፡ ለእግዚእነ

Canonical Story Title: Eulogius, the stonemason of Scete, Egypt, who used to give hospitality to strangers.
Homily of John Chrysostom on the visit of Saint Mary and her Son to John the Baptist.
The story of John, the martyr from Senhut.
The persecution of the Christians during the patriarchate of Cosmas II.
Holy Family journey cycle: The king of Egypt asks Saint Mary to bless his land.
Holy Family journey cycle: The places in Egypt visited by the Holy Family.
Saint Mary appears to the gabaz of her church in Waybela and tells him about the fall of Badlay.
The merchant from Senfewat who struck the icon of Saint Mary.
The miracle concerning the golden ink during the reign of King Dawit.
Zärˀa Yaˁəqob is given a sign of Badlay's fall.
The priest from Nārdin who was accused because he kept a nun in his house.
Yoḥannǝs finds a copy of the acts of Saints Juliana and Barbara that he had lost.
The wife of Joseph from Mǝneta Diyāqon, who had no male children.
Amnut, the custodian of a church in Egypt, quarrels with his bishop.
The wife of Joseph from Mǝneta Diyāqon, who had no male children.
Emperor Zeno builds churches in Scete.
Saint Mary blesses Scete, which Saint Macarius chooses for his monastery.
The story of Michael, the scribe who converted to Islam when he was beaten.
When Pariqos of Fesa confesses his sins to the bishop, the latter, refusing him absolution, tells him to go to Abba Yaceqob (Santiago).
Christ, Nativity of cycle: How the Virgin Mary gave birth (see no. 299)
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The shepherds and the magi come to worship Christ.
The beggar at the church of Qirqos in Amhara from whose head a horn grew.
Saint Mary heals a servant girl from a magic spell.
Sara from Mesot, who became insane and went about naked.
The vision of Timothy of Alexandria (continued): The flight into Egypt.
A child whom his mother had vowed to Saint Mary is rescued from drowning.
A column falls and breaks the leg of the son of an official when Muslims destroy a church of Saint Mary in Homs.
The old woman from Sembat who gave the offering for Saint Mary to Saint George.
Saint Mary comes to a church in the form of a white dove to heal from smallpox a man whose only good work was celebrating her commemoration.
When Agabos from Dalga enters the church, the icon of Saint Mary weeps.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ በሀገረ፡ ደልጋ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አጋቦስ፡ ብእሲ፡ ጸዋግ፡ ገጹ፡ ከመ፡ በዓሌ፡ ሰብእ፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ቅምር

Canonical Story Title: Emperor Zärˀa Yaˁəqob institutes monthly feasts of Saint Mary.
Mary, Childhood of cycle: When she is three years old, Saint Mary is taken to the Temple.
Christ orders Abba Samu'el of Wali to celebrate Mass for the feast of Saint Mary.
Abba Samuˀel of Wali is lifted up while reciting the Wəddase Maryam.
The apparitions of Saint Mary at the consecration of Däbrä Metmaq (continued)
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየት፡ በድብረ፡ ምጥማቅ። ወበቀዳሚት፡ ዓመት፡ ፍጻሜ፡ ሕንጸታ፡ ወቅዳሴሃ፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. አመ፡ ፳፡ ወ፩፡ ለወርኃ፡ ግንቦት፡ ወእንዘ፡ ጉቡኣን፡ እሙንቱ፡ መነኮሳት፡ እምድኅረ፡ ፍጻሜ፡ ጸሎተ፡ ነግህ፡ ፈቀዱ፡ ይሑሩ፡ ከመ፡ ይትለአኩ፡ ኅብስተ፡ ቍርባን

Canonical Story Title: The apparitions of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq (continued): The bishop asks her to give her blessing.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየት፡ በድብረ፡ ምጥመቅ። ወበጽሐ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ህየ፡ በዓለ፡ መንበር፡ ዘይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ ወጸርሐ፡ በዐቢይ፡ ቃል፡ እንዘ፡ ይብል፡ ባርኪ፡ ላዕሌነ

Canonical Story Title: The apparitions of Saint Mary at Däbrä Metmaq (continued): The people start to beat a serving girl, in order to take from her the kerchief that she had received back from Saint Mary after tossing it to her.
Incipit: ዘከመ፡ አስተርአየት፡ በደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ። ወበአሐዱ፡ ዓመት፡ ዘበዓል፡ መጽአት፡ አመት፡ እምኍልቈ፡ ሰብእ፡ እለ፡ ተጋብኡ፡ ህየ፡ ወወገረት፡ መንዲላ፡ ላዕለ፡ ወአኃዘቶ፡ እግዝእትነ

Canonical Story Title: The son of a rich official of Cappadocia is raised from the dead.
Saint Mary appears during Mass in the church at Meneta Sard.
The three pious priests and monks who wore fine clothes.
The punishment of an Ethiopian woman who swore falsely that she had not committed adultery with another woman's husband.
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The nativity of Christ
The icon of Saint Mary in the church of the "Romans" that rebuked the Ethiopians for approaching with their shoes on.
The Ethiopian pilgrim who was expelled from the Church (of the Resurrection) in Jerusalem during the Easter services.
The rich man who left the church because the priest was saying the Anaphora of Saint Mary, Gwasca, on a big feast day.
The rich persons who stored their wealth in a church.
Ark of Zion cycle: When Israel Sins against the Law, the Philistines defeat them and carry off the Ark of Zion, which then chastizes them.
Ark of Zion cycle: The havoc wrought among the Philistines by the Ark of Zion.
Saint Mary is found to be pregnant.
Incipit: ወይእዜኒ፡ ንነግረክሙ፡ ከመ፡ ዘኮነ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ሶበ፡ ኃደረ፡ ውስቴታ፡ ቃለ፡ መለኮት፡ ወእንዘ፡ ትትፌሣሕ፡ ወትትሐሠይ፡ በጸጋ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መልዓ፡ ውስተ፡ ኵለ፡ አባላ። ወእምድኅሬሁ፡ ተዓውቀ፡ ፅንሳ፡ ወሰምዑ፡ ሕዝብ፡ ወሰብአ፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ፡ ወኃዘኑ፡ ወተከዙ

Canonical Story Title: Christ, Nativity of cycle: How the Virgin Mary gave birth (see no. 299)
Christ, Nativity of cycle: The shepherds and the magi come to worship Christ.
The birth of the prince, Batergela Maryam.
Batergela Maryam is protected from the plague; his calumniator is punished by the king.
A woman marries seven times, but each time her husband is killed by a demon.
Incipit: ወካዕበ፡ ንዜንወክሙ፡ ወናየድዓክሙ፡ ንስቲተ፡ መጠነ፡ ንክል፡ ነጊረ፡ ዘገብረት፡ ተአምረ፡ ወመንክረ፡ ለአሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ እንተ፡ ባቲ፡ ጋኔን፡ ወይቀትል፡ ውእቱ፡ መንፈስ፡ ርኵስ፡ ኵሎ፡ ዘአውሰባ፡ ለይእቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ወቀተለት፡ ፯፡ ዕደወ

Canonical Story Title: The Annunciation.
A history of Däbrä Metmaq, its construction, destruction and reconstruction.
Incipit: ስምዑ፡ ኦአኃውየ፡ ፍቁራን፡ ክርስቶሳውያን፡ ውሉዳ፡ ለቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ንንግርክሙ፡ ዜና፡ ነገር፡ ዘይከውን፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘሕንጽት፡ በስማ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡…. ስምዑ፡ በእዝነ፡ ልቡና፡ ንቤ፡ ንዜንወክሙ፡ ዜናሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ እለ፡ ታፈቅርዋ፡ ወአጽምዑ፡ በለብዎ። እስመ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ደብር፡ ማኅደረ፡ ስብሐቲሁ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር

Canonical Story Title: A monk falls in love with a nun at a monastery.
Incipit: ተብህለ፡ ከመ፡ ሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ድብር፡ ዘደናግ፡ ውስተ፡ አሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ወሀለወት፡ ውስተ፡ ውእቱ፡ ደብር፡ ብእሲት

Canonical Story Title: Saint Basil cycle: Saint Basil and the rich man who refused to give him a tablet [saleda] for an icon of Saint Mary.
Archbishop Tilas, who was seized by Jews while carrying a golden chalice.
The brother of Emperor Constantine who wanted to marry the empress while Constantine was on pilgrimage to Jerusalem.
The church of Saint Mary in Spain to which she used to bring Christian captives.

Canonical Story Title: Saint Mary commands a deacon to give Christian burial to a sinful deacon assassinated by his enemies; when they disinter him, a flower is found in his mouth.

When Satan destroys the oven of a monastery, he is compelled to serve the monks for twelve years in punishment.

The Arab woman who suffered from an issue of blood for many years.

Amnut, the custodian of a church in Egypt, quarrels with his bishop.

Incipit: ዘገብረት፡ በሀገረ፡ ፊንቄ፡ እንተ፡ ይብልዋ፡ ኅምስ፡ እምአድያመ፡ ሻም። ወሀለወት፡ አሐቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ሀገር፡ በስመ፡ እግዝእትነ፡…. ወነበረት፡ እምዘመነ፡ አበዊነ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ወበልየት፡ እምጽንዓ፡ አዝማናት። ወበአሐዱ፡ እምለያልይ፡ ኮነ፡ ዐቢይ፡ ድልቅልቅ፡ እስከ፡ ወድቀት፡ ይእቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን

Canonical Story Title: Job, a pupil of Barsuma, falls into a well.
Incipit: ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘስሙ፡ በርሱማ፡ መምህረ፡ ሕፃናት። ወአዘዞ፡ ለአሐዱ፡ እምሕፃናት፡ ዘስሙ፡ ኢዮብ፡ ይቅዳሕ፡ ማየ፡ ምስለ፡ አኃዊሁ፡ ሕፃናት። ሶበ፡ በጽሐ፡ ውስተ፡ ዓዘቅት፡ ገፍዖ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ለሕፃን፡ ኢዮብ፡ ውስተ፡ ዓዘቅት
